text: This is a great little device, it recharges my iPhone 6 from complete discharge in about an hour and a half, it will maintain power on a discharged iPad air. It doesnt seem to have enough juice to recharge an iPad but will keep it running for quite a while. Handy to keep in my glove compartment for those times when i need a quick charge.It will also effortlessley charge a Bluetooth headset quickly.Recharges form AC source in about an hour and a half.

This is a simple, high powered and compact pancake compressor, no nonsense, plug it in and use it, easy moisture drain in the tank, it is as noisy as my Porter Cable pancake but a little quieter and faster fill up from empty with a little larger tank and higher CFM capacity.The brad nailer is very nice, it replaced my Chicago Pneumatic brad nailer with no seperation anxiety at all. Complete and ready to go, hose, nailer, nails and tool oil,  just add wood!

Neat little device, as an over 50 male I find affirmation in the readings I have taken on myself (MQ 115-fat % 14.9) quite reassuring.If you are an iPad owner the Skulpt App is an essential tool to make this device work.In the app are instructions on how to use the device including instructions as to where to place the device for each muscle reading.Follow the instructions, take all of the measurements then sync with your iPad.You can easily track your fitness progress.It does what it says and appears to be fairly accurate/consistent. After a month the readings are within what I expected.I will skip the Pros as it is pretty self explanatory what and how it does what it does.Cons:First and foremost the charger is atrocious, there is no power indicator to tell you whether it is charging or not, you have to hit the power  button when it is seated precariously in the charger and look at the screen to tell. This is a necessary step as often it doesn't seat and doesn't charge. The fitment between the device and the charger isn't a positive thing it just sort of balances there. For the money they could have spent a little more and put a small extension on the charger to situate the device more firmly in it's seat.  And adding a simple LED indicator on the charger to show you whether or not it is charging is a no-brainer.Second the battery life during storage is very short, if you plan on taking it on a trip bring the charger. I fully charged it, put it in its nice little storage bag and a week later it was 95% discharged.Third if you have body hair the little water spray bottle wont last through one measuring session, in my case it takes 3 trips to the sink to complete one session.Forth, the App itself is buggy, I had to close it and open it several times due to it hanging up between screens.But all in alll it has potential, perhaps in its next revision the few bugs will be worked out and I would consider 5 stars.

I have used these one cup cubes for many many years and they are by far the best tasting boullion cubes. I have tried every other brand and they are not the same. Many are greasy and don't dilute well or they are just salty with not much flavor. These are the best by far, they are flavorful, they crumble and dilute easily and are not greasy. This is no longer available at my store which stinks but I was glad to find them on amazon.

I tried this product Hoping to lesson pre menopausal symptoms I was having. I am 51 soon to be 52 and I have been suffering with extreme joint pain that moves around during my cycle as well as horrible migraines, exhaustion and depression. I tried taking just one of the three teaspoons recommended and I got a headache and terrible indigestion right away. After a couple days I slightly increased to 1.5 t and after two hours felt like I was going to be sick. I raced home and barely made it to the bathroom. I experienced severe vomiting and diarrhea for three straight hours. I puked so hard I threw my back out and spent the next day in bed feeling like crap and got the worse migraine ever. This product is clearly not for everyone so be cautious and do your research, it is not FDA approved for whatever thats worth. Others have reported disturbing symptoms as well, see below link. From my personal experience, I can't recommend this, nothing good for you should make you that violently sick.http://herbs.lovetoknow.com/Maca_Root_Side_Effects

This lite is just OK. It is not very bright for most applications and the light color is very blue white which seems to make it harder to see then my other more white light LED lights. The sensor works good, it comes on from a good distance away aprox. 6 feet. The light tends to flicker which I also did not like. If you switch the auto setting off and go back to auto it takes a while for it to come on again, odd quark. This will not be enough light for a 10x10 pantry full of shelves but it is ok in small dark spaces. I think this is best used low to the ground like in a guest bathroom or dark hall so guests don't kill themselves at night and don't have to wake you up turning bright lights on, so it has it's purpose. Not sure how long the three batteries will last, In my experience with these kinds of lights and we have had many, the batteries don't last very long and never seem to get replaced. A rechargable one you could plug in to charge would be much better.

To me this necklace is way to fragile and thin for an adult, it is more like something a child would wear. The clasp is so teeny I couldn't even put it on. When I tried to clasp it in my hands and not on my neck it was still very hard to do and it did not quite line up, the clasp stayed a little open till I forced it all the way closed. The chain can't be more then 8 strands of hair thick, you can bareley see it on. The pendant is cute still feather light but sparkly and pretty and appears to be well made, not so thin to be bendable. Would be much nicer on a better chain with a normal size clasp. This is for a VERY petite Mom for sure.

For the selling price there isn't much more that could be expected out of this little grooming tool.Pros:LightweightWashable headsSingle batterySmall razor head effective for light touchup here and there it is obviously not meant for a full shave.Cons:LoudThe trimmer blade heads could use a couple,of,different options for hair length. For me it was either too long or too short, I gave my eyebrows a crew cut.....One other head option that should really have been included would have been and ear/nose hair trimmer.The motor seems a little weak compared to other trimmers I have used, (Mangroomer wins so far) I think the motor will have a short life but 30 days isn't really long enough to tell.At the price level for this item the addition of the different hair length trimmer heads and the ear/nose head would have pushed it into 5 star territory.A simple little unit but it is not a stand alone product.

Well Featured headset. I use BT daily in my profession. this headset works perfectly.iPhone 6Pros:Incoming call announce, uses names from your address book or incoming numberhandsfree answer/ignore. Simply say "Answer" to "Ignore" during an incoming call and it will either connect or go to voicemail.One button Siri access. Google, maps, etc. works flawlesslyOne button iMessage/texting. This is a great help. simply hit one button and say "Read Message/s" or "Send Message" and Siri will take over and send/receive without having to look at or touch the phone.Siri even does her best to describe Emojis when they are sent which can be pretty comical  "wink face with smile" LOL.Cons:This is the most uncomfortable headset I have had in years!  I can't get it to stay in without the over the ear clip. And when using that is pushes it into my ear hard enough I can only take about 2 hours and I have to swap ears, by the end of the 1st day it was out of my ear and back in my car.After a days attempt at using it My ears are actually bruised.There are many ear buds in the package but closer examination reveals there are really only 2 styles, some are black and some orange. Same design just different colors to go with? Wardrobe? Hair Color?I wish it fit better, but with the lack of a comfortable wearing option this one is going back.I am no novice to BT headsets and have been using them pretty much since they came out.I normally use the Motorola Command One but it is out of production and when I find them still on Amazon or the "bay I order 3 at a time and MIGHT get one that works.Still searching....

This was just OK to me. It is not cost effective because it is so watery. when you apply a liberal amount to a wash cloth it seems to disappear instantly and you have to keep using more and more to get any form of lather. The smell is just OK, not strong or lingering but too much pineapple, I'm just not crazy about it. It left my skin dry but it did not burn my eyes which was good but I would not buy this.

DEAD IN HER TRACKS By Kendra Elliot catches the attention of her readers on the very first page placing them next to her protagonists Solitude, Oregon’s Police Chief Zane Duncan and Officer Stevie Taylor.  They are investigating a murder of a young woman at a local motel on Christmas morning.  Zane and Stevie and the rest of the Taylor clan are still coming to terms with the murder of Bruce’s girlfriend and Bruce’s auto accident.  Zane looks for a connection between the murder of the young woman and the woman reported missing two months agoElliot's story takes an unexpected turn when Bob Fletcher, who murdered Bruce’s girlfriend, Amber, is found dead in his jail cell.  The whole town is on edge as the murders point towards the fact Zane and Stevie are looking for a serial killer.  The plot picks up a faster pace when Zane learns there two additional women missing from a neighboring town.  The author keeps her story moving forward giving readers backstory on events leading up to murder investigations in Solitude, Oregon.  Zane and Stevie are certain there is a connection between the three missing woman and murders of the woman in the motel and bar owner, Bob Fletcher.The author takes the time to add romance to the storyline with the engagement of Zane and Stevie.  At the same time, events unfold in the murder investigation, and Elliot adds a twist to the story causing readers to hold their breath.  Readers will be on the edge of their seats as Zane rushes to find answers.  It becomes a matter of life and death as Zane struggles to make the important connection between the missing woman and the murderers.  The unpredictable ending to DEAD IN HER TRACKS is skillfully written keeping readers in the dark until the last page.  Elliot’s story earns a 5-star ranking and a must-read recommendation.

TRACKS OF HER TEARS by Melinda Leigh returns readers to Solitude, Oregon.  Leigh introduces readers to the backstory of the Taylor family and adds additional facts as needed to keep readers aware of events as they unfold.  In Leigh’s Rogue Winter Novella, she features her male protagonist, Seth Harding, husband of Carly Taylor Harding.  Seth is a detective for the Sheriff’s department, and Carly is a social worker.  The storyline begins a few days before Christmas when Seth is called to investigate the murder of a young woman.  The pace of the story never stops building from the very first page when Seth finds the murdered young woman is the girlfriend of Bruce Taylor, Carly’s brother.The deceased woman is a single mother of a young girl. Seth calls Carly to take charge of the young toddler.  The intensity of the plot increases when Seth discovers Carly’s brother Bruce is missing.  Leigh grabs her readers’ interest by putting them next to Carly and Seth as the story develops.  The author masterfully keeps transitioning between Seth's actions and thoughts are and Carly’s actions and thoughts.  She keeps the story moving forward, always informing readers of what is taking place.  Readers meet members of the Taylor family who are supporting characters to the storyline and are given backstories of each as Leigh brings them into the plot.  Leigh introduces antagonists to the story providing their backstories as she introduces them to her readers.The plot is full of action with a murder investigation and unfolding events featuring the close-knit Taylor family who rally to support and care for each other.  Melinda Leigh’s TRACKS HER TEARS Rogue River Book 1 novella delivers is a must read and earns a 5-star ranking.

SUSPENSE SAMPLER is a collection of three mystery authors.  Three authors give readers three interesting main characters: Agent Jamie Dallas, an undercover FBI agent; Detective Laura Cardinal, a homicide investigator for Arizona Department of Public Safety; and Attorney Sabre Brown, a Juvenile Court attorney.  All three of these authors feature strong female protagonists pursuing justice and working against difficult odds.THE TRIGGER by LJ Sellers introduces Agent Jamie Dallas, a dedicated FBI undercover agent who is a loner in her personal life, but is assigned the job of infiltrating a “preppers” group, seeking to solve the mystery of a missing mother and child. Dallas’ assignment is to slip into a group led by the mother's husband to unravel the details of his wife and son’s disappearance.  Sellers grabs her readers attention, adding several subplots and interesting support characters. Her readers go behind the scenes with Agent Dallas and see the dangerous nature of undercover work. After following Dallas in her investigations, they look forward to additional adventures in The Target and The Trap.DARKNESS ON THE EDGE OF TOWN by J Carson Black takes readers to the state level of law enforcement, featuring Laura Cardinal, a homicide detective for the Arizona Department of Public Safety.  Black’s readers follow Laura as she goes to a small town to find out who murdered a 14-year-old girl. Readers follow Laura’s investigation through twists and turns as she discovers she is dealing with a sexual predator. Black exposes the dangers of modern technology and social media when in the hands of those who wish to harm to vulnerable young adults. The author provides her readers with details of Laura’s backstory explaining why her current investigation is bringing issues of her past to the surface. Readers follow Laura as she takes her search for answers from Arizona to Northern Florida to uncover new facts leading to finding the killer. Black’s story is a spellbinder.THE ADVOCATE by Teresa Burrell shares the life of Attorney Sabre Brown. Burrell’s protagonist, Sabre, works in the Juvenile Court System seeking to protect young children. The author’s story features the efforts of Sabre as she works to protect her nine-year-old client. Readers follow Sabre in her efforts to protect her client and also follow her outside the courtroom as she deals with the loss of her brother.  The author keeps readers on edge as Sabre discovers secrets and deals with the challenges of her search for answers.Readers will find the stories from each of these great authors rewarding. They will enjoy finding the similarities of each protagonist and learning how each uses their skills in their investigations. The Box Set – SUSPENSE SAMPLER is a great sample of three unique storylines.

BLESSED ARE THOSE WHO MOURN is a riveting and fast moving mystery thriller full of suspense and family issues.  Kristi Belcamino, pulls out all the stops,  delivering her promise to tie up some loose ends and as well as creating new hooks to keep readers involvement in Gabriella Giovanni’s life.  The author gives her readers a ride of a lifetime as Gabriella takes steps to protect those she loves as well as her new baby Grace  She continues to provide readers with Gabriella ‘s backstory giving details of her sister’s murder and explaining why she is so protective of Grace.  Belcamino’s fast moving story is difficult to put down.The storyline’s intensity never lets up as readers see through Gabriella’s eyes her interaction with existing support characters.  Belcamino updates each character’s history and explains their roles in the story.  She grabs her readers’ attention by involving them in the events and lives of each supporting character.  Readers see an increase in the momentum of the story and as events unfold they experience what Gabriella sees and feels.  Belcamino uses her knowledge of investigative reporting to add realism to her plot helping Gabriella and Donavan come to life jumping off the page.  BLESSED ARE THOSE WHO MOURN is a great story of mystery and adventure. The author skillfully weaves family issues and romance throughout the storyline.  She shows readers what makes Gabriella tick, and they see a complex person,  a reporter, a mother, lover, and a fighter.  Belcamino doesn’t disappoint her readers and earns a 5-star ranking.

SPECTRA BLACK is a riveting, fast-paced, intriguing story featuring J. Carson Black’s, protagonist Cyril Landry.  Black helps her readers understand Cyril’s loyalty to his friends.  Black’s protagonist, Jolie Burke, a homicide detective in Branch, NM, enters the story investigating a murder uncovering facts that puts her life in danger. Black places her readers inside Cyril’s head as he processes Jolie’s clues that she has left behind. Cyril responds to Jolie’s call for help, and after he finds Jolie they become involved in a complex investigation of corruption, murder, and illegal activities on a national level.Soon after Cyril finds Jolie, Black’s storyline’s pace jumps into high gear and never slows down until the last page.  Black builds reader interest as she unveils backstory details of illegal development of stealth technology.  The author introduces readers to support characters and their history, explaining each character's role as her story unfolds.  Black provides ongoing development of Cyril and Jolie’s connection to each other helping her story come to life.  The author skillfully creates scenes helping readers understand what makes Cyril tick.  She places her readers next to Cyril as he works with Jolie in the developing storyline of SPECTRE BLACK pricking her readers’ interest on every page.Readers see Cyril in action, they feel and see his unpredictable force care and protect those close to him.  Black changes the direction of SPECTRE BLACK’S story creating intense subplots. The author creates an urgency for Cyril to resolve the murders, end the corruption, and see unexpected actions leading to an unprecedented ending.  SPECTRE BLACK creates a mystery thriller full of fresh ideas that only Cyril Landry could pull off.  Black’s new story earns a five-star ranking.

SHADOW FALL takes Laura Griffin’s readers to small Texas town north of Houston. Griffin’s female protagonist, FBI Special Agent Tara Rushing arrives with her partner M.J. Martinez, to investigate a brutally murdered unidentified female. With the help of the Delphi Center forensic experts, they learn the victim’s identity. The victim, Catalina Reyes, is a business woman and former congressional candidate. Tara’s investigation uncovers Reyes has been receiving death threats and had hired Wolfe Security for protection. Griffin introduces her male protagonist, Liam Wolfe, founder of Wolfe Security. Her readers shadow Tara as she meets Liam to discuss Reyes’ death threats. Griffin provides her readers with backstories’ of her protagonists and adds information as the story’s momentum progresses.The author introduces support characters with backstories and the roles they play as she brings them into the storyline. Griffin introduces the Delphi Center’s forensic staff helping Tara’s investigation proceed. The Delphi Forensic experts uncover two similar unsolved murders. Tara’s boss places her in charge of a multi-agency task force investigating the murders. Tara draws on Liam’s expertise to help her investigation. Griffin adds twists and turns to her storyline showing Tara’s efforts to control her feelings towards Liam. Even though he has an alibi, Tara still keeps Liam on her list of suspects. The author put readers inside Tara’s head, helping them understand what she is experiencing and thinking with regards to Liam.Events begin to unfold when a fourth body is found. Griffin shows Tara’s vulnerabilities as she reacts to the new murder and turns to Liam for comfort. Tara and Liam develop a bond knowing they need each other. Tara uses Delphi Center testing results to help her focus on the serial killer’s identity. Readers see Tara and Liam react when they learn of M.J.’s kidnapping. Griffin increases intrigue adding action packed scenes helping her storyline come to life as If it were a full length feature film. Readers closely follow Tara and Liam as they work together to unravel the mystery. SHADOW FALL’s momentum delivers a fast moving storyline keeping readers turning the pages to find answers. Laura Griffin keeps readers on edge bringing her characters to life with her riveting mystery. A must read earning 5-stars.

AS DAY AS DARK AS NIGHT is a mystery/adventure fantasy featuring descendants of Merlin the magician and Dracula set in modern times.  JT Adeline introduces her male protagonists, Roam, Rove, and Rune, triplets whose grandfathers are Merlin and Dracula.  Adeline shares the back stories of the triplets and adds additional information as the story progresses.  Adeline adds a little romance to her story with her female protagonist, Maya Stewart. The triplets know they have unique talents and special powers that have nothing to do with the fact they are vampires.The storyline moves at lightning speed from the beginning and never slows down until the last page. Adeline skillfully takes her readers into the mythical worlds of Merlin and Dracula on an adventure as they sit on the shoulders of her protagonists.  Adeline’s antagonists, a group of rogue vampires, are out to steal the triplet’s powers.  The triplets, on their seventeenth birthday, stop by Maya Stewart’s home inviting her to join them.  Roam has special feeling for Maya but hasn’t told her how he feels not knowing that Maya has the same feelings for him.  The author adds twists and turns to the mythical adventure, keeping her readers on the edge of their seats wondering what is going to happen next.  The triplets seek to fulfill the prophecy of joining  an unknown fourth, whose powers will expand the triplets' powers linking Merlin and Dracula as one. Adeline builds her story adding humor, romance, and an adventure to defeat the evil rogue vampires.Adeline keeps her readers in the middle of the battle pitting good against evil.  Her battle scenes have several heart-stopping moments.  She surprises her readers at the end of the battle.  They will not be disappointed of Adeline’s mythical adventure of romance, humor and surprises on every page.  JT Adeline’s book stimulates the imagination of those who enjoy smiling.  A DAY AS DARK AS NIGHT is a must read earning 5-star ranking.

THE SUBSTITUE: WEDDING PACT #1 is the love story featuring Megan Vandemeer, Denise Grover Swank’s protagonist.  Swank introduces Megan to readers as she boards a flight home for her wedding.  Readers learn Megan broke her engagement after catching her fiancé with another woman. The author’s male protagonist, Josh McMillian, is flying to Kansas City to find and confront the person who stole his designs.  Josh is not sure how to prove the design theft so he decides to leave it up to fate.  Megan sits drinking a lot sitting next to Josh. He begins listening to her.  Swank’s story begins developing complications when Josh learns the man he is going to Kansas City to confront is Megan’s father.  The author adds humor to Megan getting drunk and Josh’s humorous reaction to Megan passing out and having to carry her off the plane.  Readers see Josh creating a plan to deliver Megan to her family and leave. Josh plans to confront Megan’s father the next day. The author throws a real twist to her story when Josh arrives carrying Megan over his shoulder and her father mistakenly thinking Josh is her fiancé.The author gives her readers and understanding of the wedding pact and the importance for Megan, Blair, and Libby to marry by their thirtieth birthdays.  Readers are aware Josh sees an opportunity to find proof Megan’s father knows about the design theft. Josh talks Megan into allowing her family to think he is her fiancé.  He convinces Megan she can save face with her family especially her mother by breaking up in front of everyone.  Readers see Josh struggling to convince himself it is alright to deceive Megan to save his company.  Swank shows tension building between Megan and Josh when they realize they are developing feelings each other.  With the Increasing the pace of the plot, unfolding events add to the complexity of her story, the author adds intrigue when Noah, Josh’s brother arrives to help find who stole the design plans from Josh.  Swank presents Blair as the practical, protective friend and Libby the romantic and willing to conspire to help Josh and Megan connect.THE Swank describes how those close to Megan and Josh misinterpret what is important to their futures.  Readers hold their breath to see if mistakes friends and relatives make can be corrected.  Swank shows she is a true romantic preparing her readers for an ending that will give them the chills.  A must read earning a 5 star ranking.

Lynne Raimondo delivers her third psychological thriller taking her readers on an adventure involving a murder investigation, examination of important social issues, and family betrayal.  DANTE’S DILEMMA features Raimondo’s protagonist Mark Angelotti, a psychiatrist who is gradually coming to terms with his sudden blindness. Mark is beginning to move forward with his life.  Raimondo provides readers with his back story dealing with issues at work, affairs of the heart, and challenges resulting with his divorce.  The author creates a storyline moving in many directions adding subplots touching on Mark’s loneliness and dealing with the social issue of spousal abuse.Readers see what Mark is thinking and feeling as he is pressured into being an expert witness for the prosecution in brutal murder of University of Chicago professor.  When Mark’s friend Hallie becomes the lead defense attorney in the same trail, readers see friction sparking between them.  Raimondo priceless painting stolen from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum provides support characters their back stories and as she introduces each character and explains the roles they will play in her plot.  Readers are kept in the dark as to the identity of the antagonist until the last moment.  The author adds direction changes in the storyline when Mark discovers a cover up of evidence in the slain professor’s murder.  Mark also uncovers a second murder.  Raimondo creates a unique twist to her story forcing Mark and Hallie to work together to find justice.DANTE’S DILEMMA is a riveting story of murder and betrayal involving Raimondo’s readers as they follow Mark trying to focus on work issues, the murder trial, and his fight for joint custody of his son.  The author skillfully weaves social issues relating to abusive treatment of women and children into the storyline.  She gives her readers a look at the dark side of how the system works relating to family issues.  Readers will find facts rapidly falling into place adding a surprising answer to ‘who done it.’  Raimondo creatively brings Mark’s personal issues to the surface and provides her readers with a realistic answer to Mark’s dilemma.  They will have to read DANTE’S DILEMMA to find the answers. Raimondo story is a must read and earns a five star ranking.

Polly Iyer’s INDISCRETION features bestselling author Zoe Swam whose success has given birth to her independence.  Taking advantage of her husband’s suggestion to separate, Zoe is living in their condo in Cherry Grove just north of Myrtle Beach.  Iyer places her readers next to Zoe as she enjoys her freedom to write, think, and meet new people.  Zoe exercising her freedom, accepts advances from an art history professor staying at a condo down the beach from hers.  Iyer gives her readers Zoe’s history and her reasons for separating from her husband.  The author introduces support characters including, but not limited to her estranged husband David and his brother Paul, sharing important details of their backstories and their roles in the storyline as it progresses.  The author builds momentum increasing at the turn of every page.While Zoe is walking on the beach she connects with her neighbor, an art history professor from Boston.  Accepting an invitation to dinner at his condo, Zoe arrives to finds him dead and his house ransacked.  Afterwards the local cop escorts Zoe home finding her condo ransacked.  While she waits with the local cop, she learns her lover is not an art history professor.  Zoe calls her estranged husband to come to Cherry Grove.  The author explains the FBI agents specialize in stolen art.  Soon after her estranged husband arrives, the action explodes. David reacts and ties up the FBI agents and escapes. David gets his brother Paul to help them.  They learn later someone has murdered the agents and they are looking for David.  Paul has all the right connections to help Zoe and David to safety. Iyer helps her readers understand the Swan family history and Paul’s difficult relationship with his brother David.Readers thinking Iyer’s storyline only deals with solving a murder and clearing Zoe’s name will find her mystery/thriller has a connection to events going back to the theft of priceless paintings stolen from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum more than twenty-five years ago.  The storyline becomes more complex with the turn of each page.  Paul, David, and Zoe decide they need to travel to Boston to see if they can unravel the mystery.  Zoe takes no guff from David and is gradually finding David is not who she thought he was.  The author continues to build intrigue and suspense developing a riveting story. A must read earning a 5-star ranking.

CLICK DATE REPEAT is a story focusing on young woman’s search for romance using of online dating.  Farnham story explains the advantages and disadvantages of online dating.  Farnham features a 25-year-old school teacher who is tired of the bar scene and decides to make use of an online dating service.  The author's storyline takes readers back to when online dating was in start-up stages. She introduces her main character Chloe and her backstory sharing details of her past relationships not being very satisfying.  She decides to find a better way to meet someone.  Readers see Chloe deals with her family and friends not being very supportive of her decision.  The author helps readers follow Chloe going through each of the steps to start the process.  Readers are inside Chloe’s head as she shares her thoughts and feeling as she creates her profile.  Readers then follow each of Chloe’s steps leading to one-on-one meetings.  Farnham skillfully shows her readers Chloe has found several men she would like to meet in person.The author keeps readers involved in Chloe’s life by introducing key friends as support characters giving each character’s backstory and their role in Chloe’s online dating experience.  Readers experience Chloe’s reaction to each new man she meets and feels good about some of her choices.  Chloe continues her social life with her friends, and both her closest friends encourage her to introduce each new man to the group of friends.  The author changes direction creating subplots not related Chloe’s online dating. Readers learn about Chloe’s lost opportunity due to indecision and poor communication.  Farnham explains additional events unfolding and details in the lives of Chloe’s friends and family.  She helps readers understand Chloe’s reasons for not continuing with two of her matches.  Farnham electronic search for romance keeps her readers guessing regarding Chloe’s success.  The author creates an interesting story that focuses on relationships, friendships, and modern technology.  CLICK REPEAT DATE repeat is good or vacation read.  Farnham earns a 5-star ranking.

THE ROYAL WE grabs readers attention on the first page introducing Rebecca Porter, (Bex), engaged to Prince Nickolas, (Nick), on the day before the Royal Wedding.  Heather Cocks and Jessica Morgan take readers on an adventure of every life experience imaginable.  The authors introduce Bex, an American exchange student at Oxford and Nickolas, heir to the British throne.  They provide backstories for Bex and Nick continuing their development from school to their engagement.  The royal storyline creates fast-moving story showing Bex and Nick each dealing with their set of challenges and emotions to make a royal romance work.  The authors’ colorful descriptions of royal estates and landmarks help readers embrace the storyline as events involving Bex and Nick’s love story comes to life.  The story describes Bex and Nick dealing with difficult issues such as the death of a loved one, breakups, sickness, and disappointments.The authors’ introduce support characters giving readers each character's backstory and their role in their story.  The direction of the story is constantly changing, keeping readers on the edge of their seats as actions take place.  Cocks and Morgan’s creative subplots introduce readers to Bex’s twin sister Lacey, Bex’s first hook up at Oxford, Clive, and Nick’s brother, Freddie.  Each subplot moves the storyline forward playing an important part in the main plot.Cocks and Morgan help readers understand that Bex’s thoughts and feelings are the driving force of THE ROYAL WE, describing her loneliness, loss of self-worth, family conflicts, conflict with her love for Nick with the overwhelming demands of the royal family.  The authors create a timeline from Bex and Nick first meeting to falling in love and making preparations for a royal wedding that might not happen, and observe changes in their lives.Authors Cocks and Morgan provide a wonderful reading experience with well-developed characters who seem real bringing THE ROYAL WE to life.  Readers are not going to want to put Cocks & Morgan book down until they find out how true love overcomes many obstacles.  THE ROYAL WE earns a 5-star ranking.

LITTLE PRETTY THINGS is a gripping story of life in a small town. The pace of the plot builds intensity and intrigue as readers turn each page.  Readers experience murder, betrayal, illegal activities, and manipulations of young women.  Lori Rader-Day introduces LITTLE PRETTY THINGS ‘main character, Juliet Townsend along with the demons she has been dealing with since graduating from high school ten years earlier.  The author places readers inside Townsend’s head so they know what she thinking and see her life in a small town through her eyes.  The author provides her readers with Townsend’s backstory and continues to provide additional information on her history as the story progresses.Readers are given each support characters backstory and their role in Rader-Day’s story.  The author skillfully provides her readers clues to the identity of the antagonists creating an intense interest to find the last clue as to who murdered Townsend’s classmate.  The author keepseveryone guessing as to what is going to happen next in this breathtaking thriller.Lori Rader-Day shows Townsend in a holding pattern for ten years, dealing low self-esteem and it takes the murder of her classmate to force her to decide it is time to take charge of her life.  Townsend takes advantage of her love of running to discover and uncover secrets of her painful past.  She has been beaten down by events of her past and it doesn’t surprise her when the police pursue her as a suspect in the murder of her classmate and one time close friend.  Then she discovers the painful details of events leading to the murder and decides she is going to prove the police wrong and find the real killer.  Readers find the social issues Rader-Day exposes in Townsend’s investigation are important .  Townsends unveils deadly actions and events leading up to an ending to rival all endings.  LITTLE PRETTY THINGS masterfully delivers a serious message within a gripping story. Rader-Day’s  book is  a must read and earn a five star ranking.

LOVE AT FIRST FLIGHT is a thought provoking story about relationships and communication and trust. Woods’ story is set in Australia introducing her main character Dr. Melissa Harding.  The author’s storyline quickly begins unfolding events turning Mel’s world upside down.  The author helps her readers see Mel's thoughts and experience her feeling as events unfold.  She gives Mel’s backstory and throughout the storyline provides additional information as needed.  Woods continues her story introducing key character Matthew Butler to her readers providing backstory and his role in Mel’s life.  Readers are given the details of the flirtatious conversation between Mel and Matt.  Woods places her readers inside Mel’s head sharing her reaction to the attraction.Readers are inside Mel’s head as Matt gives her reason to doubt her relationship with her husband.  The author helps her readers see and feel what is going through Mel and Matt’s minds by writing parallel thoughts transitioning back and forth between Mel and Matt.  Readers learn backstories of support characters and Woods explains their roles as they enter the storyline. Mel knows the decisions she is making could destroy both of their lives, families, and careers.  Mel never thought she would be considering relationship issues regarding her marriage of fourteen years with her husband, Adam.The author explores Matt’s attentions and there effects on Mel. She keeps her readers on top of Mel’s actions as her affair unfolds.  Woods shares Mel’s reaction to support character advice about Mel and Matt’s relationship cannot work.  Mel captivates Woods’ readers sharing her thoughts and feelings about her actions.  She feels she has misunderstood her husband’s actions and the importance of family hoping she hasn’t ruined her life and future.  Woods creates twists and turn on every page and creating her complex storyline.  The author increases the momentum of her storyline leading her readers towards an unpredictable ending.  Woods describes Mel’s capacity to take control of her destiny knowing her life will never be the same, and understands her decisions may have ruined everything dear to her. Readers may or may like Mel’s decisions, but they understand Mel has no regrets. Woods story is one of betrayal and misunderstanding, and dealing with trust issues and affairs of the heart.  LOVE AT FIRST FLIGHT earns a 5-star ranking.

WINK OF AN EYE is a fast moving mystery in Wink, Texas.  Willis introduces her protagonist, Michael “Gypsy” Moran a private investigator.  The author shares Gypsy’s backstory and why he returns to Wink.  She introduces her support characters and their backgrounds as each character enters the storyline.  Gypsy isn’t happy that his sister Rhonda is asking him to take on a case looking into the death of Sherriff’s deputy, Ryce McCallen.  Readers learn the story behind McCallen’s death labeled as a suicide, when his son Tatum convinces Gypsy to look for his father’s murderer.  Willis places readers next as Gypsy uncovers files Ryce McCallen left with his son.  The files had the names of eight families missing their daughters. All eight families were illegal and the author shares Gypsy’s investigation uncovering details showing no one at the sheriff’s department has any missing person reports of the missing eight illegal girls.Readers learn details leading to Gypsy’s decision to investigate the suspicious death. Wills shares  Gypsy’s investigation as he uncovers a connection of an old married girlfriend and attracts the attention of hostile sheriff’s deputies.  The author introduces an aggressive reporter who has agreed to help Gypsy with his investigation.  Willis keeps her readers up to date with the background of the characters as she increase the pace of her storyline.  She helps her readers understand actions of support characters helping Gypsy uncover clues leading to the death of Tatum’s father and also implicating someone close to Gypsy. WINK OF AN EYE storyline grabs readers’ attention as Gypsy continues his investigation.  Willis creates interesting details increasing intrigue and suspense to her complex mystery story.  Uncovering answers endangering Gypsy’s life also bring unusual situations to the surface that add to Willis dramatic ending.  WINK OF AN EYE is a must read that won’t disappoint readers earning a 5-star ranking.

Rae Matthews’ KELLY is her second book stand-alone mixed drink series. She gathers her story with a little humor, a little mystery, a little crime, a lot of romance, several steam scenes, and a sense of adventure mixing these all together serving her readers a perfect storyline.  Matthews introduces her main character Kelly, providing her backstory of growing up and seeing how a social worker helps her best friend Ashley..  The author continues to give details of Kelly’s history and how she chooses to be a social worker.  Readers follow Kelly as she deals difficult issues stemming from the loss of her job due to budget cuts.  They see Kelly getting into funny situations as she works at getting her life back in order.  Matthews keeps her storyline full of action dealing events unfolding in Kelly’s life.  She introduces several strong support characters and their history and the roles they play in her storyline as the story proceeds.  Readers are given updates to the character’s history as actions unfold.Readers follow Kelly as Matthews’ story develops several twists and turns involving events is Kelly’s social life and the interesting people she meets.  The author’s main plot has developing subplots dealing with illegal activities and undercover work.  Matthews’ storytelling skillfully introduces her readers to Jesse Cox.  She describes Kelly’s how actions involve is Jesse’s assignment  Kelly finds herself in the middle of dangerous situations requiring Jesse to come to her aid.  Events unfold quickly changing the direction of the story keeping readers on edge.  The story’s many support characters continue the fast pace of the story building suspense and intrigue around Kelly’s going undercover to help Jesse in his investigation of the shady activities going on at the strip club.  Matthews maintains a common thread of the importance of friends helping each other.  She also delivers a great dose of fun, frolic, and romance.  KELLY is a fun read and earns a 5-star ranking.

FLIGHT 12 FINALE featuring Ponzo’s main character FBI Agent Nick Bracco, opens with the passengers boarding for departure. Ponzo helps his readers understand why Nick is on the Flight 12 sitting next to Taboo Journalist, Jess Kimball. In the course of the conversation between them Nick asks Jess to help him learn the backgrounds of the passengers boarding.  Nick thanks Jess and even gives her a new pen to use to write her notes.  Ponzo introduces his readers to several of the support characters, some shady and some good providing backstories and their roles in the author’s storyline.  He keeps readers up to date of his characters’ backgrounds as the story unfolds.Ponzo keeps readers on edge as he builds the suspense and intrigue.  During the flight he explains the intense actions taking place on board including the pilot secretly changing course.  The author gives his readers background details of the terrorist’s plot to hijack Flight 12.  Nick is caught off guard when he learns who is on the terrorist’s leader’s team.  Readers are given an inside look at the terrorist leader’s plans but are kept in the dark as to whom or if anyone on the flight will survive.  They are given an inside look as what the FAA and FBI’s Terrorist Teams know about Flight 12, learning there is no proof Flight 12 has been hijacked other than an air traffic controller supervisor’s feelings.  Gary Ponzo skillfully keeps his readers involvement in his story giving them a hint as to what might happen to the passengers.  Flight 12’s ending comes out of left field surprising everyone.  Flight 12 – A Nick Bracco Thriller is well written and earns a 5-star ranking.

Rae Matthews’ SASHA is a story dealing with the challenges facing one of Matthews’ main characters, Sasha Michaels. Readers learn of Sasha’s struggles with issues the heart, trust, loyalty, blended family issues, and issues dealing with finding her niche in life.  Matthews places her readers inside Sasha‘s head so they can know what she is thinking and feeling.  Readers see things through Sasha’s eyes when she meets Matthews’ other main character, Bash Edwards.  She gives readers Sasha and Bash’s history and as adds additional information as the story progresses.  The author introduces strong support characters and their roles and backstories as they enter her storyline.Readers will see how Sasha deals with how to trust and understand the importance of being there for someone you love.  Matthews skillfully keeps her readers on edge as they see Sasha having feelings she hasn’t had before.  She places her readers in the middle of a family tragedy and shows how all of Sasha’s friends help her make the right decisions.  SASHA is a story of a young woman’s growth and how she embraces what she wants in her future.  Rae Matthews shows her readers the value of learning to laugh and enjoy a steamy look at life.  SASHA’s is a great romantic comedy on life earning a 5-star ranking.

Sarah Andre’s LOCKED, LOADED, & LYING is a fast moving mystery thriller with a great deal of intrigue and suspense on every page.  Her story has three main charactesr, Locklen Roane, Jordan Sinclair, and Leo Richie.  The author skillfully tells her story giving readers her main characters’ perspective on events occurring in the past, the present, and the future.  Readers are given the backstories of Locklen, known as Lock, Jordan, and Leo.  They also meet the support characters, good and bad and learn their backstories and their roles as Andre brings them into her story.  Events including a ten-month-old unsolved murder,  an attempted, and a blizzard, place Lock, Jordan, and Leo stuck together in Leo’s cabin in Hidden Valley, Colorado.  Readers feel they are part of a major motion picture as each character comes to life, interacting in the investigation of the murder leading up to the murder trial.The storyline’s pace continues to build with Andre transitioning informing readers details about Lock's murder trial for and the importance of Jordan’s assignment to write an exposé of Lock’s life leading up to the murder.  Readers are inside Jordan’s mind as she investigates Lock and the influential people and celebrity citizens of Aspen.  Andre is constantly updating details of all the characters helping readers understand her complex plot.  She shares secrets involving betrayal, international sports, family issues, drug doping, and manipulation.  The author creates strong subplots around the developments of finding the truth of what has been going on in the lives of Lock, Leo, and Jordan.  Readers will not be able to put LOCKED, LOADED, & LYING down as they pursue the twists and turns of Andre’s story.  Andre's story a must read and earns a thumb up.

Melinda Leigh takes her readers back to Scarlet Falls, NY, by way of Las Vegas.  Leigh’s  protagonist, Hannah Barrett is a corporate attorney who is in Vegas for business.  Leaving for the airport Hannah witnesses a kidnapping of a young woman.  She tries to help the woman and fails, ending up in the hospital with a head injury.  The author gives her readers the Barrett family backstory.  Reluctantly Hannah returns to Scarlet Falls, NY.  to recovery from her head injury.  The pace and suspense of Leigh’s story increases when readers learn the young women’s kidnappers are in Scarlet Falls.The author introduces her male protagonist Detective Brody McNamara to her readers and his role in the storyline.  Leigh builds on the connection between Brody and Hannah, establishing the strong feelings they have for each other.  The author skillfully brings MINUTES TO KILL’s support characters, both good and bad, into the storyline.  She shares the backstory of the key players and their roles in the plot.  Leigh keeps adding details to Hannah’s history, helping her readers understand her physical and mental toughness in dealing with the danger building in Scarlet Falls.  Hannah’s goal is to find the missing woman kidnapped in Vegas and help Brody stop the serial killers in Scarlet Falls.Readers find themselves moving through Leigh’s MINUTES TO KILL at warp speed experiencing what Hannah or Brody encounter. They shadow both protagonists’ feelings regarding the danger behind the killer’s actions.  Leigh exposes her readers to the dark underbelly of illegal drugs and human trafficking and throws them a curve ball they never see coming.  Every direction change increases the reader’s anxiety for Hannah and Brody’s safety.  The unknown results of a confrontation with antagonists who have no conscious puts readers on edge.  Leigh keeps adding thrills and suspense to each action filled scene moving towards an unexpected ending.  This visit to Scarlet Falls is breathtaking and earns a 5 star ranking.

COLD FEAR Book #4 in Anderson’s COLD JUSTICE series is a gripping murder mystery. Anderson introduces her two protagonists, FBI Special Agent Frazier and ER physician, Isadore (Izzy) Campbell. Both Frazier and Campbell are dealing with demons of their past that will affect their futures. The author shares the details of Frazier learning of the bodies of two young people found on the Outer Banks Crane Island somehow connect to an old case of a serial killer. Anderson introduces her support characters and their backstories and roles they play in her story.The author skillfully develops scenes full of suspense and surprises readers with changes in her storyline. Readers see building tension in the community with each new murder. The author places her readers at Frazier’s side as he uncovers clues, creating an uneasy feeling as he is searching for a serial killer who may have been killing undetected for years. Readers see Frazier pull away from any personal relationship that interferes with his investigations. Lack of progress gives Frazier reason to ignore his feelings towards Dr. Campbell as she is all business and commits to ignoring the building interest in Frazier. Izzy is sure anyone close to her will not understand the events in her past; her future focuses on keeping her sister safe. Anderson shows her readers how the walls Frazier and Izzy are building between each other could cost lives.Anderson increases the intrigue and drama when Frazier learns the identity of the body and the connection to his old case. The storyline changes direction when the FBI’s investigation of new a murder scene finds evidence that could identify the killer. The COLD FEAR plot continues to change the focus of the investigation as new clues unfold. Readers are on edge as danger increases for missing women including Izzy. Frazier’s investigation changes direction at every turn. Readers will find themselves sitting on Frazier’s shoulder as he takes steps to close the case. The unforgettable actions of everyone create an ending that is indescribable. Toni Anderson’s COLD FEAR is a must read earningfive stars

K.J. Farnham’s, DON’T CALL ME KIT KAT story immediately involves her readers in her protagonist’s, Katie Mills’ life.  The author brings her story to life helping readers experience and feel each challenge. Readers see everything through Katie’s eyes as she prepares to start her journey going to middle Junior High.  K.J.’s story is fast moving, taking readers through Katie’s final year of life in Junior High. Readers see Katie dealing with wanting to fit in at school and learn how the turmoil her personal life and issues surround her parent’s divorces affect her decisions.The pace of DON’T CALL ME KIT KAT increases at the turn of each page and the author updates her readers with additional information of Katie Mills’ life.  The story deals with the stigma of teenage drinking and eating disorders.  Readers learn eating disorders don’t just happen overnight and don’t have economic boundaries.  When each of the support characters, both good and bad, enters the story, K.J. explains their role in the storyline and their history.  Young adult readers see events unfold from Katie’s point of view, learning how friendships are fragile and how reputations good or bad don’t go away.  Katie learns several life lessons regarding what does and doesn’t matter.Social issues are not sugarcoated and the author skillfully shows how Katie’s lack of control of her issues quickly affects her life at home, at school, socially, and her health.  DON’T CALL ME KIT KAT’S story focuses on Katie Mills’ struggle as her denial of her disorder becomes life threatening.  Readers watch through Katie Mills’ eyes and experience the decisions her family is forced to make.  Farnham keeps her readers on edge as they see how Katie is self-destructs.  The author describes to her readers how Katie deals with an heart breaking event that changes her life forever.  This gripping story delivers believable characters dealing with real issues and an unforgettable ending.  Farnham’s story is a must read earning a 5 star ranking.

RUN, by Andrew Grant is A mystery thriller involving readers in fast moving action of his storyline. The author’s protagonist, Marc Bowman is a computer consultant and software designer who has a reputation of being the best of the best in the IT industry.  Readers learn Marc’s secrets. One everyone in the IT industry knows including his wife.  He learns quickly how little he knows about survival.Grant works several support characters into the storyline keeping his readers guessing whether are Marc’s friends or enemies.  Someone is trying to eliminate him, as well as all of his design work. The author takes readers behind the scenes of the tech world showing them vulnerability everyone faces with regards to existing information on the internet.  Everyone around Marc seems to be working against him.Readers stay at Marc’s side watching him work to understand what is going on and how to resolve the problem.  Grant throws Marc into chase scenes from mystery thugs, Department of Homeland Security, and local law enforcement.  The pace of the storyline never slows down and readers have pay attention to decide who is working for whom and if anyone is looking out for Marc.  Grant creates enough confusion in Marc’s thoughts he is not sure there are any good guys.  The mysterious pursuit of the data Marc may or may not be aware of convinces him the data must contain a secret affecting national security.  Grant keeps readers on pins and needles following Marc, in his efforts to clear his name and rebuild his marriage. RUN, delivers readers one surprise after another to the plot leading them to the frightening answers Marc implements.  Grant’s story opens his reader’s eyes to the interesting and dangerous world of IT.  A must read and earns a thumbs up.

WELDON WEXFORD & MURKLE MONSTER By David Ezra Spinner is a story featuring Weldon Wexford, a young wizard with a vivid imagination.  Colorful illustrations support Spinner’s story and bring it to life and stimulate a reader’s imagination. Weldon looks for a new adventure, deciding it would be fund to raise a pet monster.  The author reinforces the importance for Weldon to understand the responsibilities of taking care of a pet monster.  Weldon’s adventure describes the challenges he faces as he prepares to bring his pet monster home.The vivid graphics help readers see Weldon learning each step of pet care.  Spinner helps readers see the importance of accepting responsibilities. The author delivers a message with his storyline enhanced by the colorful images on each page.  WELDON WEXFORD & MURKLE MONSTER adventures jump off the page to the enjoyment of Spinner’s readers.  Spinner tells his story of a child learning to take responsibilities and have fun at the same time.  The author introduces a magic-tastically adventure of wizards, pet-monsters, and stimulation of a child’s imagination.  This story is grandchild approved and is a must read earning a 5 star ranking.

BLOODY LESSONS is a mystery suspense story set in San Francisco in the early 1880’s.  M. Lousia Locke focuses on the life of her protagonist, Annie Fuller. She accepts Laura Dawson, Nate’s sister, as a boarder.  Laura Dawson is moving to San Francisco to accept a teaching job.  Readers learn Laura’s secrets relating to her first teaching job.  Nate Dawson, Annie’s beau, asks Annie to help investigate anonymous letters making accusations of impropriety in hiring practices and questionable morals.  The issue becomes personal when Laura’s best friend dies under suspicious circumstances.Locke continues to develop characters from earlier stories and adds additional support characters as her story progresses.  Readers see events unfold through Annie’s eyes and her thoughts.  The issues affecting the lives of teachers in the era of Victorian San Francisco are part of Locke’s storyline. The author creates suspense and intrigue in her story when Annie goes undercover as a teacher of accounting in the San Francisco schools.  Laura is upset with the death of her friend and she refuses to accept her death was an accident.  Additional subplots develop, focusing on secrets of two of Annie’s boarders and an attack on Laura as she is walking home from her school.The turn of events occur so fast readers have trouble catching their breath.  Locke keeps building up the momentum of the plot as she changes direction of the action, unveiling each new twist adding suspense and mystery to BLOODY LESSONS plot.  Readers see how Annie’s boarders are like her family as she takes steps to insure everyone is safe.  M. Lousia Locke’s storyline keeps intensity high as Annie and Nate deal with uncovering the murderer, Laura’s attacker, and catch a kidnapper.  Only fast action of one of Annie’s friends’ saves her and her boarders lives.  The unusual turn of events delivers a surprise ending.  Locke does a great job bring Victorian San Francisco to life is this must read 5 star story.

FALSE TRUTH #11 – A JORDAN FOX MYSTERY, FALSE TRUTH #11 is the conclusion to Diane Capri and Beth Dexter’s mystery serial.  The author’s storyline features the main protagonist Jordan Fox, an intern at Channel 12 news and her efforts to land a permanent position in the news department.  Readers are given her backstory and the authors continue to add details as needed.  Jordan’s real goal IS to work at Channel 12 and use their archives to investigate the unsolved murder of her mother.  The fast moving storyline keeps readers on their toes as the authors throw twists and turns on every page.  The storyline describes Jordan’s efforts to find answers to her mother’s murder and at the same time perform her job.  She keeps getting sidetracked from the stories she is assigned and is always finding herself and those around her in danger.The story never slows down from the first page of FALSE TRUTH #11 A JORDAN FOX MYSTERY as readers find action on every page.  Capri and Dexter create a totally unpredictable ending that surprises their readers.  Readers will embrace the author’s ongoing development of Jordan and her efforts to find her answers.  The support characters and their role in the storyline help Jordan in her pursuit for justice.  Jordan’s adventures involve her as she covers interesting stories on a broad range of topics.  Readers are kept informed as to what is happening in the plot through Jordan’s point of view.  Capri and Dexter’s suspense thriller serial story takes readers and Jordan along a path of adventure and life experiences.  The authors provide interesting twists and turns and unforgettable ending to their Jordan Fox thriller.  A must read earning a 5 star ranking.

DEADLY PROOF is murder mystery thriller set in 1870 Victorian San Francisco.  M. Lousia Locke delivers a fast moving action paced murder mystery to her readers.  Victorian San Francisco life in the 1870’s  is the backdrop of Locke’s thrilling suspense investigation of the murder of a successful business owner of a printing company.  Each of Locke’s books in this series focuses on how women fair in industries of the time.  Readers are shadows to the key characters in DEADLY PROOF as they experience Florence Sullivan’s shock when she finds her boss’s dead body. The owner’s widow accuses Florence of her husband’s murder.  The author’s male protagonists, Nate Dawson agrees to defend Florence.  Locke’s female protagonists, Annie Fuller, joins her finance, Nate helping him investigate the murder.Readers are given backstories of Annie and Nate and are given new details as the story develops. Locke places readers close to main characters as she brings her storyline to life.  She continues ongoing development of each support character from earlier stories adding additional details as events unfold.  The author skillfully introduces new characters and their role in DEADLY PROOF’s storyline.  Readers find surprises and problems surfacing, changing direction as they turn the page. The side stories create life experiences that develop challenges for each character. Readers see development of Nate’s sister, Laura, as she copes with relationships at work and in her personal life.  Following Annie’s example, Laura works to help Nate investigate his client’s murder.Annie never hesitates to involve herself in helping those around her, even when she has to put her wedding plans on hold.  DEADLY PROOF focuses on women’s rights issues of the 1870’s showing similarities to issues of today. She creates characters readers embraces and enjoy learning how they deal with problems as they arise.  The author brings her storyline to life on the streets of San Francisco and events unfold so fast it is hard for readers to catch their breath.  M. Lousia Locke’s DEADLY PROOF delivers an unexpected ending.  Locke’s story ends so fast readers might have to read her book again to confirm the ending.  The author’s murder mystery thriller is a must read earning a 5 star ranking.

RUNAWAY SECRET story moves at lightening speed as Regan Black’s female protagonists, Marissa Richland’s present life collides with her past. Regan Black tells her readers about Marissa’s past life as a DEA agent where she severely wounded at a bust of a major drug lord. When the DEA arrest the drug lord he vows to kill Marissa.  Marissa wakes up finding her life in turmoil.  She is recovering from her wounds and is from home, and pregnant.  The DEA creates a new life for her. They set her up,  relocating her and her daughter Erin, to Taylor Point, South Carolina.  Six years later Marissa has rebuilt her life, still in law enforcement as a Forensic Analysis for a small  drug task force in Taylor Point, South Carolina.Black introduces her support characters to readers as the RUNAWAY SECRET storyline progresses.  Marissa’s new life crashes into her old life when a drug bust has a connection to the drug cartel run by Raymond Santiago who has threatened her life.  Her team finds a connection to the drug lord’s cartel at the same time as Santiago is being transported to his court date in Florida. The DEA learns of the drug bust in Taylor Point and sends two senior DEA agents to investigate. The DEA Agents Collin Matthews & Sean Grady are former team members of Marissa’s old DEA team.  Neither agent knows she is alive until they show up at the Taylor Point Police Station.For six years Marissa has kept the secret from her old friends and suddenly everything turns upside down.  When they uncover the secret and before any conversation can take place between Marissa and Sean Grady, things go from bad to worse when they learn Marissa’s daughter’s school bus has been hijacked.  Marissa automatically knows the drug lord has her daughter and intends to kill her. Black adds to the momentum by inserting a subplot to find out who leaked Marissa’s location.  RUNAWAY SECRET’S storyline brings Marissa’s past secrets center stage. Even though Sean Grady is angry with Marissa for not telling him she was still alive, he forces himself to help find Marissa’s daughter and eliminate or stop the drug load.  The tension is high as everyone is sure the drug lord is going to take his vengeance on all 21 missing children.  The intrigue and suspense is breathtaking as Black’s storyline gains momentum adding one surprise after another and delivering an ending readers don’t expect.  This is a must read and earns a 5 star ranking.

John Kurtze Review of ZIG AND THE MAGIC UMBRELLA By Sylvie KantorovittzOn the first page ZIG AND THE MAGIC UMBRELLA readers experience the author’s creative abstract pictures using vivid colors to express mood or an emotion.  It is obvious the focus of Kantorovitz’s story is to stimulate the imagination of the reader as he or she reads to a young child.Readers join a blue Zig stuck inside his tree house on a rainy day.  Kantorovitz’s illustrations express Zig’s changing emotions as to involve readers in his adventure. The story’s words offer sound effects and describe movement. Kantorovitz uses vivid colors in her illustrations showing action method of travel.  The author adds  more of Zig’s dialogue with colorful illustrations to expand what Zig has said.The story flows easily to visualize the action taking place.  ZIG AND THE MAGIC UMBRELLA is a great example of a picture being worth a thousand words.  The author’s abstact pictures and use of colors provide create a story appealing to all ages. Readers will experience a range of emotions portrayed in ZIG AND THE MAGIC UMBRELLA coming to life via Sylvie Kantorovitz’s vivid colorful illustrations earning a 5 star ranking.

MAIDS OF MISFORTUNE is a mystery with intrigue and suspense featuring Annie Fuller, Locke’s female protagonist.  The entire story is set in the 1870’s in San Francisco.  The author’s story will capture anyone who loves a good mystery without all the bells and whistles of today’s high tech detectives. Annie Fuller owns a Victorian home inherited from her aunt.  Locke introduces her support characters and their backstories and the roles they play as they enter the storyline.Annie adds to her income from the boarding house by giving investment advice in a very unusual way.  When Annie learns of the death of one her first clients, she is upset when the authorities are convinced he took his own life because of financial worries.  Knowing her client was not insolvent, Annie believes he was murdered.  Joining forces with her client’s lawyer Nate Dawson, Locke’s male protagonist they set out to prove to the police they should be looking for a murderer.  As MAIDS OF MISFORTUNE’s plot progress, the author adds the backstory of the all the characters.  Locke increases the intrigue for her readers, making them Annie’s shadows as she takes control of the investigation.  The author shows readers Annie’s plan to learn the truth. In this Victorian era a smart woman from the upper class wasn’t supposed to be aggressive, let alone undertake going undercover investigating a murder.Locke’s readers see the day to day behavior of the class society of the 1870’s.  The author uses the class system seeing events through Annie’s eyes. The plot’s pace increases as information surfaces leading to answers to Annie and Nate’s questions.  The key characters take action, speeding towards the unpredictable ending.  Locke creates character interaction and lots of direction changes, helping readers understand the storyline of MAIDS OF MISFORTUNE’S with mystery, romance and suspense.  Locke earns a 5 star ranking.

THE GANGSTER’S WOMAN a fast moving romantic suspense story that picks up after liquor is no longer illegal.  The G-men are fighting crime and chasing bank robbers. Ring’s male protagonist, G-man Michael Flynn is investigating the last known location of gangster John Dillinger and also searching for Eryn O’Malley, sister of his close friend.  Flynn is hoping she is still alive follows any rumor or clue regarding her.  Even though Flynn has only seen her picture he is in love with her.  Ring provides her readers with Flynn’s backstory and O’Malley’s backstory transitioning back and forth between their similar paths.  When the author share Eryn’s secrets, readers learn why she has been hiding, moving from town to town and an unknown connection to her brother’s past.  Once Ring shares Eryn’s secret, readers won’t stop reading until they find out what Flynn is going to do.Flynn travels to Wisconsin looking for clues of Eryn O’Malley’s whereabouts.  THE GANGSTER’S WOMAN storyline places readers close to Flynn as he follows clues leading him to a small Wisconsin town.  Flynn checks into the town’s only motel and while attending the local county fair he stumbles upon Eryn O’Malley.  Eryn has been doing any job, legal or illegal, to pay for her existence doesn’t trust Flynn. Readers learn the important roles support characters play in the storyline as Ring introduces the residents of this small town and the role they play in Eryn’s life.  Flynn quickly learns why so many people care about Eryn.  The author continues to build each of her characters backgrounds as the pace of the story speeds up.  Flynn learns too late the dangerous actions Eryn takes to protect those she loves.THE GANGSTER’S WOMAN lives ups to the title and keeps readers on edge for the entire story.  Ring never lets up on the excitement and never does anything that is predictable.  Readers participate in a suspense filled story where characters come to life helping readers understand the dangers lurking in the unknown world of gangsters. The author keeps her readers in suspense as they deal with events affecting two people in love doing what they need to do to create a future for their family.  Ginger Ring shares the character’s struggles and the obstacles they face.  The author adds a unique solution to her story adding a great ending to THE GANGSTER’S WOMAN.  A must read and earns a 5 star ranking.

John Kurtze Review of COMPULSION By Allison BrennanWhen readers start reading COMPULSION, they are immediately aware they are going to be a shadow to Maxine Revere as that will be the only way they will be able to keep up with her thinking and her activities.  Allison Brennan brings her mystery story to life describing how an investigative reporter  pursues answers and follows leads in pursuit of truth.  The author gives her readers the backstory of Maxine, her female protagonist and continues to provide additional information on Maxine as the story progresses.  Readers see and feel everything Maxine is experiencing.  Maxine never stops seeking the truth even when no one agrees with her theory.  Readers learn how an investigative reporter works through the process of information gathering.  Maxine doesn’t like not being in controlBrennan skillfully helps her readers understand Maxine’s ability to irritate those around her.  Brennan introduces key co-workers David, her bodyguard, Ben, her producer, Reilly, her rookie assistant,  FBI Agent Marco, and Nick, her current boyfriend who  lives in California.  All these friends are close but none of them understand her secrets.  Brennan builds suspense around how someone is using Maxine’s secrets to put her life and her friends lives in danger. Maxine wants to dig deeper as she has an uneasy feeling that things are not what they seem.  Brennan shares more of Maxine’s past experiences helping readers understand more of Maxine’s instincts.  The author creates fast moving events putting Maxine in danger, as well as members of her staff, when she sees the danger it is too late.It is Maxine’s COMPULSION to pursue justice but she fails to see she may be following predictable leads.  Brennan creates intrigue and mystic to a high pitch level of danger.  Maxine walks down the path following clues and with each step she is closer to the person who wants to kill her.  Everything starts falling into place as she sees the betrayal, the unknown sociopath, and the unpredictable motive.  The storyline is full of twists and turns and change of directions.  Brennan describes Maxine’s passion for truth and justice and readers understand why she has a COMPULSION to investigate.  A must read earning a 5 star ranking.

Kristi Belcamino delivers a gripping story as she brings Gabriella Giovanni to life on the pages of BLESSED ARE THOSE WHO WEEP.  She gives her main character the instincts of a seasoned newspaper reporter and also shows personal feelings regarding work, love and family.  The drama of Belcamino’s story unfolds when Gabriella arrives for an interview and finds 5 dead bodies and a small child.  Belcamino shares Gabriella’s history and explains how her past affects. The author delves into her main character life as a reporter and her personal life.  Gabriella’s obsession to find the murderer is interfering  with her role as a reporter.  All of her actions are upsetting her boss, police, her family, and her lover.On top of horrible murders, the author’s BLESSED ARE THOSE WHO WEEP is a story dealing with betrayal, manipulation, political cover-up, and depression.  As each support character enter the storyline, the author shares their history and how each will affect the story.  She also helps her readers understand some of the personal issues Gabriella is dealing with and how her actions are affecting those she loves.The action in Belcamino’s BLESSED ARE THOSE WHO WEEP never slows down.  The author places her  readers at Gabriella’s side as she follows clues that uncover corrupt cops, connection to drugs, and secret journals.  She also helps readers understand the importance of the surviving child and why Gabriella is sure she has the answers.  BLESSED AT THOSE WHO WEEP demonstrates the importance of family and how the willingness to forgive others and oneself is important.  Belcamino’s story provides thought provoking lessons to readers.  How the case is solved and how Gabriella deals with personal issues will require readers to read the entire story.  BLESSED ARE THOSE WHO WEEP is a must read and earns a 5 star ranking.

John Kurtze Review of TEXAS TWO STEP By Jody VitekTEXAS TWO STEP by Jody Vitek is a fast moving story full of suspense, intrigue, kidnapping, conspiracy, and romance.  Chole Atwood, one of the main characters is from an influential family working as the development director for a women’s shelter in Dallas, Texas.  Chad Rogers, the other main character, is also from Dallas, but years earlier he leaves town for reasons only he knows and refuses to come back - not even for love.  Readers are given the backstory of both Chole and Chad and how they met when Chole was visiting a friend in Florida.  Vitek creates support characters both good and bad and provides the backstory on each as they enter the fast moving  story.The author builds intrigue when she put the reader inside Chole’s head so they can see and feel her experiences.  Vitek builds action and suspense and increases the momentum of the plot.  Dramatic action unfolds  at the shelter.  An estranged husband enters the shelter demanding his wife leave with him.  Chole is visiting Linda, the director of the center, and tries to stop the man from leaving with his wife.  In the struggle the estranged husband pulls a gun, Linda the director pushes Chole to the ground to keep her from being shot.  The director takes a bullet.  Chad’s  sister calls and tells him their mother has been shot and is in the hospital.Readers are in the middle of all the action.  Nothing has been able to bring Chad back to Dallas until his mother has been shot.  When he returns to see his mother, he runs into the one person he did not want to see, Chole Atwood.  He is still in love with her.  Fate brings  them together again.Chole’s family is pushing her to change her career and are not supportive of her decisions.  Her fiancé is acting strangely and becoming possessive.  She is also upset that Chad has come back Dallas the day before her engagement party.  Chole senses she still has feelings for Chad.  Vitek keeps her readers on the edge of their seats as they wait to see how events unfold.  The story is a great mix of intrigue, suspense and people getting a second chance.  A good read.

J. A. Jance’s COLD BETRAYAL is a mystery thriller written around her main character Ali Reynolds.  Jance creates support characters and their importance to the story as she introduces them.  Readers become Reynolds’ shadow seeing her use her investigative skills and using the cyber-sleuthing skills of her husband’s company.  The author writes two stories running side by side but neither story is connected.  Reynolds is focusing on solving family in-law issues and she helps Sister Anselm protect a young woman.  Circumstances are not what they seem to be. First Ali Reynolds and Sister Anselm investigate details surrounding a young mother afraid for her safety.  The other plot features Reynolds answering a cry for help from her daughter-in-law Anthena.  Her elderly grandmother fears someone is trying to kill her.  Both plots have a fast moving pace keeping readers on their toes to follow the turn of events.Reynolds and Sister Anselm come to terms with what the young woman is facing.  Jance gives her readers the history the polygamous community and the feeling of all women are property.  Reynolds and Anselm find proof of corruption, manipulation, kidnapping, bondage, and human trafficking.  Each of the plots of  COLD BETRAYAL change directions swirling around Reynolds on a personal level as she helps her daughter-in-law deal with family members betrayal and Reynolds helps her friend Sister Anselm unveil deal with betrayal  the young woman are experiencing.  Jance throws twists and turns at her readers making sure she continues to inform them of what is going to happens.Readers  will find themselves holding their breath as Jance delivers the action packed events in BETRAYAL , moving at warp speed between events in Flagstaff, Arizona and Bemidji, Minnesota.  Ali Reynolds and Sister Anselm use political clout, Interpol, FBI, and state law enforcement agencies to bring those responsible to justice.  After reading the last page of COLD BETRAYAL, Jance’s readers  are be left thinking about the social issues she has exposed.  This story is a must read and earns a five star ranking.

THE GUILTY is a fast moving mystery thriller with suspense throughout the storyline.  Zandri introduces the main character, Private Investigator Jack Marconi giving readers his history and as well as the backstory of the storyline.  Marconi is investigating the brutal attack of a young divorced woman.  Marconi is trying to find out if the woman’s fiancé tried to kill her or if her injuries are from an accident. The author builds intrigue around the circumstance of the victim’s injuries.  Readers see the case through the eyes of Marconi, sharing how the investigator is willing to break a few rules to find answers to his case.  Zandri create greats support characters who help Marconi find and pursue clues and he gives readers a look at the antagonists in the story.Readers learn the backstory each of the support characters  in Zandri’s  THE GUILTY.  The plot has several twists and turns keeping the action moving towards an unique ending.
