5:32 Mins The classic Devil May Cry 4 game originally released on PS3 and Xbox 360 back in 2008 has returned for the Special Edition by Capcom.  It brings everything we can expect from an HD version with improved graphics and a few new features.  But is it worth picking up an old re-released game for new fans or even for the hardcore Devil May Cry Fans?  Let's find out in the Devil May Cry 4: Special Edition Review.We're going to focus primarily on the new additions to the game as I'm sure there's already a lot of reviews on the original Devil May Cry 4.  The clearest improvement in the Special Edition is the graphics upgrade.  It runs in 1080p 60 frames per second on Xbox One and PS4.  The PC version has no frame rate cap and you can definitely crank up the graphics.  It looks crisp, clear, and smooth.  There's still evidence that it's a last gen game from the textures, to the models, and the level design.  But it's definitely a big improvement and it's a necessity for a modern HD remaster.The biggest draw of the Special Edition are the new playable characters.  You can play as Nero and Dante who were in the original version.  But now you can play as Vergil, Trish, and Lady who all have different weapons, handling, and special abilities.  Devil May Cry is all about the playstyle and how you handle the combos.  So playing as different characters definitely adds a new dimension to the game.Players are really excited to play as Vergil who is based on his rendition from Devil May Cry 3 Special Edition, combined with elements of his playstyle from DmC.  He has two different swords and special huge fist weapons.  His special abilites has him transform.  He moves fast and his sword play is really precise.  He's really a blast to play as.Then there's Lady and Trish.  Lady specializes in long range firearm based combat.  Her signature weapon is the Kalina Ann which is a huge rocket launcher.  She has a grappling hook which lets her control enemies and also rappel up in certain platforming sections.  She handles much differently from Dante and Nero.  She's more of a ranged weapons character.  Her melee attacks are very slow but deal a decent amount of damage.  Trish utilizes a Sparada Sword and her pistols.Each of the three new characters also receive their own story cutscenes which makes it feel like playing a different character has meaning and it's not just a re-skin.  However Lady can only play on Nero's missions and Trish can only play on Dante's missions.  Vergil can play on any mission.  That's a little confusing, but it keeps the storylines distinct and adds replayability.  For those who really love replaying the levels and grinding for high score, it's definitely a great value to be able to play the different characters.For the really hardcore, there's Legendary Dark Knight mode.  Which is an extremely high difficulty challenge.  They multiply the amount of enemies and also bring in tougher enemies even early in the game.  You can see here side by side the difference in enemy count is huge.  And they are much more aggressive.  You definitely don't want to go in to Legendary Dark Knight Mode without experience and without all of the upgrades.  I couldn't get far in Legendary Dark Knight mode, but I can see how it would be a lot of fun for someone very experienced and it's actually easier to rack up combos since the enemy count is higher.The one downside is the additional DLC.  You're already re-buying an old game and then they want you to spend more money just to unlock new modes and costumes.  This is so unnecessary, these things should really be included with the game.  The whole reason someone would buy this game is to replay levels with new characters and challenges and they put a barrier to that by placing some of that content in the DLC.  And although the game is a pretty good package it's really just an excuse to get this game out on the new consoles.  And to get it out on Steam a second time.  It's kind of ridiculous that the old one is there just five dollars cheaper than the original.Despite those few quarrels I think the game is a good package and Devil May Cry 4 is a fun game that rewards skill.  If you're a hardcore player, the extra characters and legendary dark knight mode add a new dimension of depth.  If you're a new player this could be an easy way to check out the series seeing as it's only about a $25 package depending on whether or not you can justify also purchasing the DLC.  They made right decision keeping the price low and not overcharging for an HD remaster.  So you may want to give Devil May Cry 4 Special Edition a shot.  For more game reviews, subscribe to the skilled youtube channel: http://bit.ly/SkilledSubscribe

7:12 Mins Batman Arkham Knight has been highly anticipated both by Batman fans and people who just love open world action games.  The last game, Batman Arkham Origins, wasn't as good as people expected and actually had a different developer which played a big role in the game's outcome.  Rocksteady has returned to create the final Batman game in the Arkham series, but does it bring any new improvements and does it make open world gaming fans happy?  Let's find out in the Batman Arkham Knight review.StoryThe Arkham Knight game takes place one year after events from Arkham City where Batman still struggles after his battle with the Joker.  Unfortunately Scarecrow teams up with a new villain, the Arkham Knight, and brings terror back to Gotham with a wave of Fear Gas forcing an evacuation of the city's six million civilians. It's now a city full of criminals and the police force can't stop it.  It's not just Scarecrow and Arkham Knight, they bring in the Penguin, Two-Face, Harley Quinn, Firefly, Poison Ivy, and the Riddler to destroy the Dark Knight permanently.  It's not easy being Batman.The Arkham Knight villain is a new rival to Batman who's dedication to killing Batman is incredibly erie.  He's vengeful, but patient and calculating.  Much different from the Joker.New FeaturesThe Arkham Knight game manages to bring a lot of incremental improvements.  The world is significantly bigger.  Rocksteady has claimed that it's actually five times the scale and you can see the difference both on a macro level and on a micro level.  Viewing the game from maps and flying around the city, there's much more to explore.  And then when you're actually running around or driving there's tons of little detailed niche areas.  It's perfect for the new vehicle addition.  You know what vehicle I'm talking about...Yeah! The Batmobile.  I can't believe we went three Arkham games without a Batmobile.  Driving is incredibly fun and offers a different variety of transportation compared to gliding around the city.  It's a great dynamic between speeding on the ground versus flying overhead.  Of course we've all seen it transform from a transportation vehicle into a tank for combat which adds even more variety to the gameplay.  The only big negative that everyone seems to be complaining about are the jumping puzzles involving the Batmobile.  Jumping puzzles are rarely fun and this really seems like filler and a way to add more Batmobile related content to the game.  It's very contradictory.  Although it's nice that the Batmobile has diverse moves, the purpose is to drive fast and blow stuff up.  Adding puzzles takes you out of the core gameplay.CombatIf there's one thing the Arkham series is known for, it's the combat.  The same tactical and methodical combat returns with a few new tweaks and gadgets.  There's surprise multi takedowns for when you want to sneak up on enemies.  You can chain combos across multiple enemies.  The variety of enemies are also improved as some are harder to kill such as the medics.  And you get a performance report after every event which always encourages you to play just a little bit better.A lot of the same atmospheric elements are also still present.  The criminals with casual banter while you lurk in the shadows, radio communication with Batman's team, Batman's exposition statements, and plenty of detective work.GraphicsLet's not forget that this is the first next gen Arkham game and it doesn't disappoint in the graphics department.  When Rocksteady upped the scale of the city, they also upped the detail.  Environments and especially weather effects are really good and keep the immersion factor high.  Another great detail that the series was already known for are the faces.  During cutscenes facial detail and motion are highly believable which, along with the great voice acting, keeps the cinematic feel.  You can easily forget that you are playing a game.  And of course the Batmobile looks glorious.  They nailed the movements and transformations.  The way the suspension and drifting handle make the Batmobile appear like a fast technologically advanced vehicle.  The sense of speed you get is reminiscent of a Need For Speed game, but with much more control over maneuvering.Voice ActingThe voice acting is fantastic, but it's also the same voice actors we loved from the previous Arkham games.  Kevin Conroy returns as Batman and he's played Batman for years now, so he really has the role down well.  And John Noble is menacing as The Scarecrow.They really tried to pack in as much as possible for this Arkham game.  There's so many villains and each of them get their time in the spotlight.  But Batman's not alone because there are plenty of sidekicks.  Robin, Nightwing, and Catwoman fight alongside you and it's great to see them fighting side by side.  There's even team takedowns which are more for fun than practicality.Replay ValueAs with any open world game.  Arkham Knight will keep you busy with plenty of replayability.  There's tons of side missions and even a New Game Plus.  The main story will take you about 12 hours to beat and then there's probably about 40 hours of total gameplay for completionists.ConclusionArkham Knight is a solid game and I don't think anyone had doubts leading up to the release.  It has action, fun, drama, and don't forget the batmobile.  For those who played the previous games and aren't sure if you want to jump back in, there's plenty of new experiences to keep you busy.  Let us know if you think Arkham Knight was a good game and if you think there's potential for a possible new series of superhero games from developer Rocksteady.  Subscribe to my Youtube channel for more gaming video reviews: http://bit.ly/SkilledSubscribePositives:Bigger WorldSidekicksHigh Replay ValueClassic AtmosphereNegatives:Batmobile Jumping Puzzles

4:55 Mins The Witcher 3 is one of the most highly anticipated games of 2015.  And by this point we already know that CD Projekt Red knows how to deliver on their RPGs.  The Witcher is a huge game that takes about 37 hours to beat the main story and over 150 hours to 100% complete the game.  We're going over the highlights.  Let's take a closer look at the Witcher 3 and how this game stands out from the crowd in this quick review.The Witcher 3 is a very in depth RPG that's easy to pick up and hard to master.  The tutorial is very step by step and explains all of the complex mechanics that allow you to play the game properly.  But at the same time, it's intuitive.  Even during the first few moments, the game flows well.  From the first hour of the game the story teaches you basic combat and introduces you to the open world.  Objectives are very directed and easy to get to on your horse.  All of these features make the game seamless and that's what makes the Witcher 3 so amazing.  It never takes you out of the gameplay.  You rarely find yourself stuck whether it's due to the lack of directive, the story, or the challenge.  That's why it's one of the game that you can't put down.The story and the world of Witcher is continually pushing the boundaries of immersion.  The Witcher's story is complex, ongoing, and properly woven into the gameplay.  Each cutscene and each mission is very specifically directed and evokes emotion.  The way people react to your character, Geralt,  gets you lost in the story.  You really feel for Geralt and his troubles as being a Witcher.  It's the battle of every hero.  He's got great power, but a lot of responsibility.  People demand him to do dirty work for them, but see him as an outcast and a killer.  And of course Geralt has always been a ladies man, and his romance scenes are a story of their own.  Even conversation trees keep you on your toes and expose the true emotions of the characters.  It's not the type of game where you put your controller down during a cutscene.The graphics in Witcher 3, especially on the PC version, are really top notch.  And it's not just about how many effects it's pushing.  It's the way it's used.  The day/night cycle is the most detailed out of any game.  It literally tells you the time and weather condition in the upper right corner.  And the weather gradually changes from cloudy to rainy to sunny again.  Looking up at the sky, you get lost in how attractive it looks.  Traveling through the world, it really feels alive.  Not just in towns, but even between towns.  On the roads there are small homes, traveling soldiers, and many areas to explore.  It contributes to the seamless nature of The Witcher 3.  Nothing feels like filler.The combat in Witcher 3 is straight up fun.  Who doesn't like swinging a big sword in melee combat?  You engage in close quarter melee combat as well as fighting huge creatures.  You also have spells and potions to modify your attributes.CD Projekt Red is also one of the most honest game devs.  The PC version has no DRM if you purchase on GOG.com.  And they are one of the few publisher who will release a high amount of free DLC.The Witcher 3 is a massive game with high ambitions and it gets almost all of them right.  It's beautiful to look at, it's fun to play and it's accessible to almost anyone.  Unless you are highly averse to RPGs, you definitely want to pick up the Witcher 3 and start slayin!  Subscribe to the skilled youtube channel for more game reviews http://bit.ly/SkilledSubscribe

1:33 Mins Today, we're unboxing the Hometek humidifer.  For anyone who doesn't use a humidifer, it increases moisture in the air which is good for dry air problems such as nose bleeds, dry coughing, dry skin, nasal congestion, sinus irritation, and flu symptoms.  It's a must have if you live in a dry desert area like Arizona or if you have really harsh winters where you have to use a lot of dry indoor heat.  It makes a huge difference for most people and greatly improve quality of life.What I like about the humidifer from Hometek is that it's really simple.  It has a small AC adapter that's removeable, a very lightweight base, the water tank, and the mist funnel.  The base is very lightweight and there's not that many parts involved so it's easy to move between rooms within your home.  The tank holds up to 1.6 liters of water which should last an entire day unless you are running it on max.  And it claims to humidify rooms up to 600 square feet.  It outputs cool mist which is great for those dry weather issues I mentioned earlier.  I also like that there are no filters to deal with, cleanup and refilling the tank is simple.  It also doesn't make much noise, you wouldn't notice it unless you put your ear right up to the device.This particular humidifer has an analog control so you can adjust the humidity levels as you see necessary.  It has a nice tall and long swan shape tank with a funnel at the top so it will easily disperse the mist in your room.  And you can point it in any direction.I can highly recommend this humidifer from Hometek because I think humidifers are a home essential and Hometek provides a great affordable solution.-2.2 Litre Tank-Analog Dial-Adjustable Funnel

5:13 Mins LEGO Jurassic World was announced in January 2015 which was only months prior to the release of the game which coincides with the new Jurassic World movie.  This game adapts the plot of all four Jurassic Park films and provides a huge world to explore.  Let's take a look at LEGO Jurassic World and see if it's worth it for fans of both LEGO and Jurassic World series.LEGO Jurassic World follows all of the same LEGO mechanics.  Similar art style, same construction, swapping characters to advance, and a few surprising action scenes.  There's plenty of puzzles and it's an open world, but the game guides you through in a linear story.  I tend to compare this game to LEGO Marvel Heroes and LEGO Batman because they were my favorite and two of the most popular games in the series.  Jurassic World definitely stands out.  Mixing all four Jurassic Park movies is very ambitious, but I would say that they manage to get the story and the world right.The action is significantly different in my experience.  There isn't a ton of combat like in the LEGO Marvel games.  It's more about action and platforming segmented with action sequences.  The action is reserved for certain sequences where characters must escape from dinosaurs or perform a daring rescue.  And you do actually get to control some dinosaurs to overcome obstacles.It's a very comprehensive game and it captures the essence of all the different characters, with one exception.  They use the original audio from some of the older movies which on the one hand is nostalgic and on the other hand it seems out of place.  The problem comes from the fact that the audio quality is significantly dated and it seems like they are working with the mixed down version.  In other words, you hear too much background noise from the original movie.  It's not a deal breaker, but it definitely took me out of the moment during some cutscenes.The graphics are surprisingly good for a LEGO game.  The character models look the same as the previous games, but the environments are much more dynamic.  The way they hand,led the various swamps and jungles of the island goes beyond the last few LEGO games.  The environment looks more realistic than the characters, but it's still balanced.The cutscenes and some of the action sequences are really cool and reminiscent of the movies.  There's the crazy chase scenes, the small groups of dinosaurs, and you really get the sense of people discovering the world of dinosaurs.The humor is also a little more mature for a LEGO game.  There's plenty of comedy, but the game let's the world and the characters provide the humor rather than pushing numerous puns in every single cutscene.Of course with any LEGO game it has a few extensive features.  The game is a collect-athon with a million different things to capture for replayability in free play mode.  You could easily spend 40 hours chasing after every last widget if you want.  And the game is very accessible.  It's on previous gen and last gen consoles, PC, and even the handhelds - the Vita and 3DS.LEGO Jurassic World can provide some enjoyment if you don't want such an intensive game or you really want to engross yourself in the revitalization of Jurassic World.  So you may as well Try It.  For the hardcore players out there, this game has been released in between Witcher 3 and Arkham Knight so you may want to reserve your cash for a bigger game.  If you played LEGO Jurassic World or you just have a lot of interest in it, let us know in the comments.  Subscribe to the skilled youtube channel at http://bit.ly/SkilledSubscribe because we're covering the latest game reviews all the time.NegativesOld Movie DialogueLess ActionPositivesAll 4 Jurassic MoviesCool Action SequencesEasily Accessible

This book started off really good. You see what Righteous’ life has been like. She’s in the principal’s office for throwing soda on another girl. You sense right then and there that Righteous has been in the hot seat before and isn’t intimidated by the principal. When she goes home, her mother’s boyfriend is roughing up her mom. So when she tries to get him to leave her mother alone and to leave the trailer, he attacks her instead. Well, of course when the cops show up, the mother doesn’t want to press charges and claims it was all her fault the altercation even happened. That is our introduction into Righteous' life.Righteous likes to be left alone. Don’t get her confused for someone who wants friends but is the odd kid out. Not only does the new kid try to converse with Righteous, but there is another girl at school who apparently asks her just about every day if she wants to eat lunch with her; Righteous blows her off every time. However, there is one person in her life that she can count on and that’s Magda. An old lady with dementia whom she met while walking through the park. Apparently Magda got out of her nursing home and Righteous helped her find her way back. They’ve been friends ever since. In fact Magda is Righteous’ only friend.The entire book is written in Righteous’ point of view and at times it was rough for me to get through. There is a lot of internal dialog. A lot. Which I suppose makes sense because she pushes everyone away and has no other friends except for Magda. There were times where her ramblings about the “Pops” or “Popsicles” (popular kids), her musings about her dead end life, her negligent mother who cared more about men than her, and the new kid who is following her around wanting to be her friend, became a little exhausting.I liked that the author gave Righteous struggles. None of it was really over the top. There are people out there who struggle like Righteous and her mother did. My huge gripe though is what happens towards the end. It left me wondering why the author flipped course like that. The story was enjoyable up until that point. Then I just felt like I was reading an entirely different book all together. As if maybe I have fallen into Righteous’ parallel universe or something.

In Nobody’s Hero we pick up right where Nobody’s Angel left off. (No you can’t just jump into this book, you have to go in order)I really enjoyed their story. I found it to be a bit long and drawn out in some places which really took away from the story for me but as a whole, but I really enjoyed the story itself and am looking forward to the rest of the series. There is a good amount of backbone to this erotica. It’s not just all sex, but I’m not going to lie, the sex is good. I liked that you got a feel for the characters and the story didn’t just revolve around the two main characters but also included a mix of others as well as various points of interest between the two MCs. For instance, Adam not only has to deal with Karla but his late wife and his childhood past. Meanwhile, things happen with the other characters of Master At Arms and Adam and Karla find themselves helping out their friends and family. So even though a lot of the story is about Karla trying to get Adam to open up to her, there is a lot of other things that take place as well. Like I said, I will definitely be keeping up with this series.

This was a really enjoyable book to read. It had just what I was looking for in a book at the time. I needed adventure with a hint of romance and I got that. There’s even a little bit or magic/fantasy/paranormal stuff going on as well. I will definitely be picking up the second book to see what is in store for Celaena. She’s an interesting character and I’m curious to see what life has in store for her.Celaena is a well-known assassin. She was the best one out there until she was caught and sent to the mines to serve out her sentence. Now, you may be thinking the that the mines don’t seem like that big of a deal but it’s pretty much a death sentence. People don’t last more than a month in the mines and woman barely see half that time. Unfortunately, woman are brutalized down there by the overseers. Although Celaena was never raped, thanks to the fear she caused in everyone, she was mistreated. She was starved, beaten, and whipped on a regular basis. When the Captain of the Guard (Chaol) comes to escort her out of the mines, her state of health if not overlooked. She’s frail, pale, brittle dull hair, covered in blood, dirt, and grime, and has tattered clothes that are falling off of her body. She has no idea why the Captain of the Guard has shown up. She assumes it’s her execution day. However, it’s actually the start of a new beginning. The King is in need of a Champion. Someone who will get their hands bloody and do his dirty work for him. He has issued a competition where his council can select a champion of their choosing and they will all battle it out until only one remains. That champion will serve their time under his rule and then will be let free. The prince has chosen Celaena as his champion for the competition.

I saw this at the store the other day and decided to give it a try. I liked the idea of an all organic toner that wasn't tested on animals. Plus, the orange smell was really nice. However, after washing my face and applying the toner I realized it was not for me. After about 5 minutes or so my face started to heat up. Sort of like after a workout or when you're out in the sun too long. I started to sweat and something told me to look in the mirror. What I saw were red splotches all over my face. I quickly rinsed it off and after a while the redness went away but it's definitely not something I want to happen again. This toner was the only change in my regimen. I've read a lot of raving reviews and my face is usually never sensitive but it did not react well with this product.

For being a short story, I thought it was good. However, I had a little bit of a problem with Tess and the reasoning behind why she left her husband in the first place. I guess with me being a military wife, I expect long nights and days where my husband doesn’t come home. It is part of the job. So for Tess to leave Nat because he was spending too much time at work just didn’t seem like a good enough reason for me. With that being said though, I did find that the story was entertaining for being as short as it was. There wasn’t a lot of information dumping, just short recaps of what went wrong.The only characters that were in this book are Tess and Nat. The story starts off with them in the airport and goes straight to them landing on a deserted island. The entire book is about Nate trying to win back his ex-wife. I liked Nat and his persistence, no matter how many times she pushed him away he always came back trying harder. Even though I didn’t feel like the marriage falling apart was his fault, he really manned up and took responsibility and tried to show her that he was a changed man.

Michelle's grandfather looked after her growing up because her mother was clearly not capable of doing so. She either doesn't show up at all or shows up high out of her mind. So, Michelle's grandfather has raised her and looked after her. However, when Michelle is 14 her loving grandfather passes away and her unloving mother kicks her out of the house. With only $80 on her, Michelle gets on a bus to New York. A place where a friend of hers from school claimed to be moving to. Pretty soon, Michelle finds herself broke, with nowhere and no one to turn to, other than the nice man who bought her food at the bus station. He takes her home where she meets two other girls. One in her late teens, and another only 12. Michelle has no idea what she's gotten into until it's too late. Pretty soon she's one of them and they are all calling her Little Peach."I wonder if Grandpa can see me. If maybe he sent Devon to make sure I could get away."This was one of those stories that was gut-wrenching to read. The story jumps between Peach in the hospital and the events leading up to her trip to the hospital. The story is written in Peach's perspective. So with that being said, the story is choppy, shallow, and not that well written. However, this is from a 14 year old girl's perspective. So it would stand to reason that she wouldn't be able to articulate herself like an adult would and may have jumbled memories and thoughts. So when you look at it that way, the story was written perfectly.During the day, Peach, Kat, Baby, and Daddy (Devon) hang out at the apartment watching T.V. They are like a normal make-shift family. However, at night, Daddy loads the kids up and takes them to a hotel where each girl gets her own room. While there the girls wait in their room for the customers to show up while the Daddy's stay outside and run the business. Thankfully, the author doesn't go into explicit detail in what happens in those rooms but they are some horribly disturbing scenes nonetheless. Devon gives the girls a false sense of security. He's checks in on Peach after her shift is over, coddles them, and pretends to be their father or older brother. He's there for them if any of the customers get too rough. However, Peach has no idea what lurks beneath until it's too late. She has no idea that the moment his name was tattooed on her chest that she belonged not only to him but a whole gang of people, and not in a good way.This is one of those books that should be read. Everyone should open their eyes to what goes on in our own country, our own city, our own neighborhood. This isn't something that happens in movies, on T.V., or in some foreign country. This is happening in our own backyards and it needs to be stopped. This book will get your right in the heart. You will mourn for the loss of their childhood, for the things that they have to endure to survive, and the hope that has been scared out of them.

Maybe because I read the prequel, Shadows, I wasn't surprised by anything that happened in this book. I knew Daemon was a Luxen and I understood his hatred and down right rudeness towards Katy. After all, it was a female human who was the cause of his brother's death. So when Katy rolls into town, actually right next door, and makes friends with Daemon's sister Dee, he is livid. He doesn't want his sister getting close to Katy for fear that there will be repercussions. However, it's Daemon who ends up getting too close to Katy which poses the hugest problem of all. He's lead the Amun's right to their door.Like I said, the book didn't have any mystery for me since I read Shadows. However, I still really enjoyed the story. I really liked Katy's character. I rarely say this about a character but I saw a lot of myself in Katy. The fact that she gets creeped out by kids, her sassiness and the fact that she's not above proving a point... even if it is a bad choice on her point. Oh and of course every blogger is going to point this out but c'mon, she's a book blogger for goodness sake! She talks about posting her Waiting on Wednesday post and her weekly wrap up of books that she got for the week. So of course Katy is going to connect with book bloggers universally on that aspect. I just really liked her character. That's not saying that I didn't like the other characters but I just really liked Katy.Again, I'm a fan of the author's writing style. She knows how to connect with the younger crowd. She doesn't use outdated words or phrases that people were saying back in the 90's. Which by the way is my hugest pet peeve about YA novels. The author always writes the characters the way they think they should behave as apposed to the way teenagers act now a days. There is drinking in this novel, hot and heavy make out sessions, and mention of sex. And to me, keeping real to the way teens truly are, always wins major bonus points!

Keelin’s parents have always hovered over her and never allowed her any breathing room. Then she was forced into protective hibernation only to wake up and realize that her parents were still hibernating. She sets off and tries to find the independence she’s been craving. The only problem is, there’s an Alpha dragon who has been sniffing around her and seems to think she’s his mate. No matter how many times she gives him the cold shoulder, he doesn’t seem to take the hint. And now he’s shown up at her new location.This was a great story that revolved around Keelin and Bran. Granted, we meet the two of them in the previous book (The male MC is Keelin’s long lost brother), the author still adds a lot of history that takes place after the last book that helps bring you up to speed about these two characters relationship. Sure, you can read these books by themselves but all the characters from the previous two books are always buzzing around in this one. So with reading the previous two, it’s like a cozy dragon family reunion.The author wrote this book in a handful of character’s perspectives. However, unlike the last book, I was never lost. You follow the two main characters, the villain, and two of the secondary characters which I’m sure will be seeing their own book very soon. We have met Bo previously since his club had been in the previous books but we got to know him a little bit more with the few chapters that were written in his point of view. Not to mention his love interest who is an innocent employee of his. A female who is definitely “other” but no one is quite sure what exactly she is. Of course, it’s revealed in this story but I’m not about to give away any spoilers. With their stories mixed in, and the fact that they have some drama going on that will more than likely come back to bite them in the behind… I’m confident their story will be next. And I cannot wait.Back to the main characters though. Bran and Keelin were interesting characters to read from. Sure Bran is your typical Alpha. He’s powerful, full of himself, and is uber protective of his female. However, he was born with a deformity that has left him viewing life reminiscent of the Beast from Beauty and the Beast. He was born blind in one eye. That same eye is cloudy and looks different from the other. With the fact that dragons are known to be a “beautiful” species, his ruggedness isn’t something that’s normally sought after. So he has some insecurities about his deformity. I think that little nugget was what set Bran apart from other Alpha’s for me. He wasn’t winy or “woah is me”, but he definitely felt hurt when he thought Keelin didn’t want him because of his disability.Keelin was one of those characters that wants to be free. She’s been sheltered all her life and she’s ready to get out and live a little. The only problem is that when she sets out to establish her independence a dominant male comes charging in threatening it. I like that even though her dragon was clawing at her to mate with Bran, she didn’t cave on what she wanted. She wanted to have a little fun and live a little. Granted, she got a little more than she bargained for but she stuck with what she wanted. She didn’t fully push Bran away though, she lays it all out on the table, they can hook up and fool around but she does not want to be mated. I really respected her for standing up for what she wanted and not backing down.This was a great addition to the series. Not only were the main characters a pleasure to read but I liked seeing all the other characters coming back into the mix. It was nice seeing everyone again. I think this will be one of those series that I keep up with. It’s got dragons, romance, and suspenseful fight scenes. I mean, what more could a paranormal romance junkie ask for?

Five years ago their father left to start a new life with a new family. Five years ago their mother checked out on them. Five years ago Maya and Lochan grew up beyond their years and took over the house. They fed their three younger siblings, changed their diapers, dropped them off to school, picked them up, and took care of them. They became the parents, the guardians.My thoughts are thoroughly conflicted over this book. I’m not sure I will be able to write a coherent review but I’m going to try. It was such a compelling story that I couldn’t put it down, no matter how uncomfortable it made me. You see, it’s not just about two siblings falling in love. There is a lot of build up to that. They start off as normal siblings. However, when Maya goes on a date, Lochan loses his cool and realizes that his feelings for his sister run deeper than that of a brother. He tries everything he can to push her away and to get his head screwed on right. He researches incest to see if they are the only ones out there who fell in love. He is so conflicted over how he feels. Their romance didn’t just start, you could see it building, and the turmoil it caused within them.“I am a person coming undone. I am so disgusted with myself that I want to crawl out of my own skin. My mind keeps pulling me back to that dance. Maya, her face, her touch, that feeling. I keep telling myself these things happen – I’m sure they are not all that uncommon. After all, I’m a seventeen-year-old guy – anything can set us off. Just because it happened while I was dancing with Maya doesn’t mean a thing. But the words do little to reassure me.”Lochan was by far the most interesting character out of the two. He has this speech phobia. He just cannot seem to talk to other people other than his family. He’s extremely smart and does well in school, but when it comes to answering questions or giving oral presentations, he can’t do it. His teachers are all well aware of this and have made sure to leave him be and not call on him during class. The kids at school have already come to terms with the weird boy who doesn’t speak. There were a couple scenes in the book where he does actually speak to others but it’s so painful to watch. You can just feel how uncomfortable he is and no one knows why he’s like that.“I see myself configured in their eyes: the guy who always buries himself at the very back of every class, who never speaks, always sits alone in one of the outdoor stairwells during break, hunched over a book. The guy who doesn’t know how to talk to people, who shakes his head when picked on in class, who is absent whenever there is some kind of presentation to do. Over the years they have learned just to let me be.”The story isn’t told in just Lochan’s POV though. We also follow Maya during this time as well. I must say, she was definitely the aggressor when it came to the relationship blossoming. She sees Lochan’s turmoil, knows why he’s pulling away from her and she confronts him about it. She doesn’t understand why two people who are in love can’t be together, regardless of the circumstances. She pushes the envelope with Lochan little by little. However, she is also conflicted with the whole thing. She tries to figure out why she feels this way for her brother. How it happened. Why it happened. She even goes out with another guy in the hopes of snapping herself out of it.“Why, then – why is it so different with Lochan? But the answer is simple: because Lochan has never felt like a brother. Neither an annoying younger one nor a bossy older one. He and I have always been equals. We’ve been best friends since we were toddlers. We’ve shared a bond closer than friendship all our lives. Together we’ve brought up Kit, Tiffin, and Willa. We’ve cried together and comforted each other. We’ve each seen the other at our most vulnerable. We’ve shared a burden inexplicable to the outside world. We’ve been there for each other – as friends, as partners.”Like I said before, this was such a conflicting book. I mean, I cannot wrap my head around it. It made me feel so many emotions. I was sickened, sad, hopeful, outraged, confused, and in the end heartbroken. This story had me crying at the end. I mean, these two teenagers go through a lot of crap. I’m not talking about the whole, “Whoa is me” crap that a lot of teen characters are going through in books. I think the one thing I loved and hated about this story was the ending. I’m still reeling from the way the author ended the story. So much love, so much heartache. Gah!

It doesn't have any scent to it which is nice. However, I have a spastic cat and a cat who started peeing outside of the litter box in one particular spot. I took them both to the vet, had tests run, and the results came back normal. So the vet recommended I get not only the spray but the diffuser as well. I sprayed around the litter box, the spot outside of the litter box that my one kept peeing at, and all areas that they spend the majority of their time. It didn't do anything for either of them. My one is still a spaz and my other cat continued to pee in that one spot until the day she passed away. It was worth a try though. This is one of those things that may work for some but not all cats. Just so happened that it didn't work for my two girls.

Assembly was easy. The directions were clear. Unfortunately the figure does not stay together. Just trying to pose the figure often caused limbs to pop off. This is a consequence of the "mashable"  feature, which isn't even very useful unless you buy more stuff.The x-wing looks good, and it's big. But it's not big enough for the oversized figure which looks stupid sitting in the open cockpit.

I like that it is machine washable and I have put it through the laundry twice to test it (normal cycle wash and permanent press drying). It held up well with no noticeable shrinkage, but some slight edge curling.It is not very soft, but it is very absorbent. If it gets very wet, it takes days to dry if left on the floor. I recommend tossing it in the dryer or hanging it over the shower rod (both work fine). The top side is bumpy and provides a foot massage. The floor side is smoother. It is not rubberized and tends to slip quite a bit.

This is a well made toy. It's made primarily of plywood. The edges are smooth and mostly even. It comes with two wooden cars.The size is just right. Small enough to be portable for on-the-go fun, but just big enough for two children to play with it at the same time. It is about half the size of the traditional classic Fisher Price Garage (#930), the gold standard of garage toys. It has a useful carrying handle.A lot of fun activities have been built into it - garage doors (behind which you can store the cars), an elevator, a gas pump, a ramp with a gate, rooftop parking spaces, and a car wash with a movable plate to push the cars through.Well made and lots of fun.

This 200 page hardcover book is broken down into 5 sections (outer space, modern metropolis, the Wild West, fantasy land, and the real world). Through examples of models, often utilizing special building techniques, the book provides building plans for specific models, inspiration for ideas, and teaches advanced building techniques.The photos, printing, and binding are all very high quality. The book is fun to read and also is a useful reference.Some of the bricks needed to actually build the models are uncommon, but the pointers and techniques can be adapted and applied in other ways.I didn't like the lenticular 3D cover. The 3D effect was not very good, I don't like the way it feels when I'm holding the book, and it has already become scratched.
I like the short length. It's great for traveling.The cable works fine. It is recognized by my iPhone and iPad as an Apple certified cable. Syncing and charging are fast and reliable.

The non slip surface is fine and it looks nice, but so much is wrong with this product.First and foremost is the stink. Everyone says the same thing, it smells like skunk. It really does. The odor is quite foul.The suction cups don't stick well. The water does not drain past the mat.The size and nearly square shape make it the wrong mat for most bathtubs, but it would be fine for a shower stall. Make sure you pay attention to the size and dimensions and measure the surface you plan to use it on.

This review is easy. These are great!The taste is wonderful, especially the dark chocolate caramels.Inside the tin are individually wrapped candies. The milk and dark chocolates are clearly marked. They are very fresh. The caramel is soft and easily chewed.The packaging and tin are attractive. This would make a nice gift. The tin is very sturdy and can easily be reused for other purposes.

In reviewing this shaver I compared it head-to-head with the Panasonic ES-LV81 and the Braun CoolTec CT5. Both have been previously reviewed by me.The Panasonic ES-LV81 remains my favorite shaver, but in one way, the ES-RT97-S wins out – the cartridge-less and tank-less cleaning system.The ES-RT97 provides a very close shave. It is better than the Braun and just as good as the ES-LV-81, which surprised me since the ES-LV-81 has 5 cutting surfaces compared to the ES-RT97’s 3 cutting surfaces. The ES-RT97 caused more irritation, and the handle vibrates more than I like.The main advantage is the cartridge-less cleaning system. I like not having to store bulky replacement cartridges. You are advised to purchase OEM cleaning solution pouches, which end up costing the same as cartridges. I also have had a lot of difficulty cleaning the crud (mostly congealed detergent) out of the tank of the ES-LV-81. Doing so is almost impossible. The ES-RT97 has a tank-less as well as cartridge-less system, which means the innards can be easily maintained.Pros1. Provides a good, close shave with moderate irritation.2. The entire system can be cleaned easily including the water storage tank3. Light weight and portable (without the cleaning station)4. Can be charged in the cleaning station or by directly connecting the handle to the transformer5. Good ergonomics6. No cleaning cartridges.Cons1. You can’t operate it while the handle is attached to the transformer. You must charge it and use it cordless.2. OEM packets of cleaning solution seem over priced ($11 for 3)3. Shaving head only pivots side to side (but this may actually improve control of the shaving head).4. Cryptic status lights5. Too much handle vibration.6. When removing the comb attachment, the foil head seems to also come off as well.7. Filling reservoir and installing it can be very messy.In conclusion, the ES-RT97 will not l replace my ES-LV-81. The irritation would have to be less and the handle vibration is annoying. But the cleaning system is superior.

I'm an electric toothbrush skeptic. I just thought I would get that out of the way. My wife, however, is a true believer and assisted in reviewing this item.It does seem to provide a good cleaning. The handle is reasonably comfortable. The brushed metal design looks modern. The brush heads go on and come off easily. The induction charger works well and battery life is good. It comes with 2 brush heads (one of which seems to be a child size).The quadrant brushing timer (lets you know when to move from top right, to top left, etc) is a nice feature. The pressure sensor didn't seem necessary, but maybe some people need this feature. The "clean vs. white vs. deep clean" setting seems to me to be a confusing gimmick. I can tell what the intensity (low, medium and high) settings do, but nowhere could I find how the 3 cleaning modes are actually different. They feel different, but I couldn't tell what was different. They seemed to just be another way to vary the intensity of the vibration.One other issue is the buttons on the handle. Although they have to be sealed for the device not to short out, there is a gap around each button into which gets toothpaste and water. This makes cleaning the handle unnecessarily annoying. Our other electric toothbrush set has sealed membrane buttons that make cleaning much easier. I'm worried this unit will eventually develop a mildew problem around the buttons.Finally, list price is $180. Wow! That's a lot of money for something that may not even be necessary.

This is a good value. There are better rollers, but this one does the job.Great for exercising, especially physical therapy homework for back pain.It is made out of dense polyethylene foam (think dense and durable styrofoam). It is a solid cast cylinder of black polyethylene. The coloring does not rub off even when in contact with sweat.It is very durable, water proof, cleans easily, and is inexpensive enough to be considered "replaceable" if not disposable.

In a crowded field of electronic talking toys, this one stands out for its excellent play value.It is very compact, and includes a lot of accessories. It is great for taking on the road.It is very interactive and has many more phrases, songs and sounds than other talking toys. My kids (ages 3 and 6) particularly like the frying pan sound. It seems to be very well made and has excellent battery life. I highly recommend it.

This puppet is adorable and very well made. It is very soft and snuggable. It is very easy to use. It looks great. My 6 year old son loves it. I continue to be impressed with all of the Folkmanis puppets.

If you like real margaritas, forget this. It is much too sweat, the flavors taste artificial (because they are), and the fluorescent green color just adds insult to injury. It made no difference what quality tequila I used ($50/ bottle vs $10/bottle), the taste of the mix brought it all down to mediocre.On the other hand, it you think TGIF makes great margaritas, this it for you.

I have been buying Folkmanis puppets for my children for 20 years (my kids range in age from 25 to 3). This is a wonderful addition to our extensive collection. I know from experience that they are very well made and can be handed down from child to child. This Snowy Owl seems just as well made as our older puppets.The owl is very soft and very realistic. It is quite large. The head rotates easily. It is attached to a stick that extends inside the hand cavity. The head is firmly attached. It can rotate 360 degrees. You can also flap the wings by inserting your fingers into them. It is difficult to operate the wings and the head at the same time.I feel that this puppet and all of the Folkmanis puppets are an excellent value.

A very sturdy and well made plastic toy truck. Rolls well. Able to withstand a lot of punishment from 2 small children. It has survived being stepped on several times. All of the edges are rounded. The removable little plastic driver was nice until he ran away. We haven't seen him in a while.My children like it a lot. I like that it is made from 100% recycled plastic.This is not our first Green Toys item, and it won't be our last.

Dora and her puppy interact. The robotic puppy responds to commands from Dora via an electrical cable in his leash. He performs a variety of tricks such as begging and sitting. An adorable and remarkable modern toy, but with limited play value. Think of the Dora doll as a wired remote control for the puppy.It is not difficult to master the commands and the response is reliable. The main disadvantage is you interact with the puppy though Dora, and that places a degree of separation between your child and the action (the puppy). The same toy, interacting directly with the child would have more play value. That being said, the toy is sturdy and well designed.The other issue is that when the puppy walks, he often knocks Dora down.

Adorable. Both my 3 year old and 6 year old like it. It jumps up and barks in response to touch and proximity. It also seems to randomly make noise to entice the children to come back and play some more.Almost one month out it still receives play time every few days. It is very easy to use, even for my 2-year old.  It is very stable and does not tip over easily when on all fours. It is less stable when standing up, but never falls over unless knocked. It has taken some abuse and is holding up well.This is "sort of" a plush toy. The rear end is weighted and contains the mechanics that allow the dog to do its tricks.

You can't rally do better than a well made cable, and this is one.Absolutely no problems syncing or charging. Recognized by my equipment as Apple certified.The cable connections seem very secure. It's very slightly stiffer than my other cables, but this is not an issue.

Easy to use. Great for camping. On the bright setting, I had no difficulty reading in a tent at night. The red light for protecting night vision is useful for astronomy, although it is a little too bright.The USB charging has plusses and minuses. In the end, I'd rather have it take replaceable batteries. Out in the field, I don't always have a way to charge via USB. It charges fastest when plugged into a wall outlet. Also, when it runs out of power, it would be nice to pop in a new battery and keep going rather than wait for it to recharge.The hanging clip is not very useful. The gap in the hook is too narrow to clip it onto anything thicker than a fabric loop or small carabiner.

They are fun to use with the Take-and-Play system, or on their own. They are mostly metal, with some plastic trim. They are well made (sturdy), colorful, and fairly accurate. They roll well. They are probably the closest you can get these days to the old Ertl die cast Thomas trains. These were the best, but unfortunately are no longer being made.

This is a well engineered mechanical toy that both my 3 year old daughter and 6 year old son like. It consists of a mechanical horse that walks. The most interesting feature is the doll's ability to mount the horse automatically. Her arm fits in a spring loaded mechanism and when you activate the horse, the spring flips her onto the horse. It works 9 out of ten times once you know how to set it up. My 6 year old eventually was able to get it to work. The doll is specifically made for the horse and is not much use separately due to the special hip joints. She does not stand on her own. The horse can be used on its own. The doll and horse have taken quite a bit of abuse and have not broken yet. The horse does not walk well on any type of carpet (it falls over).

A very simple retro-style game. Great for a deck or backyard, but you need something from which to hang the string with the ring.The wood plaque looks better in the photos on Amazon than it does in real life, and the plaque is actually unnecessary. You could play the same game with a few bucks worth of hardware (hook, ring, string - that's it).If you follow the directions, which are scant, the ring will not catch on the hook. You have to give it a little more slack, but not too much. Set up was a little tedious, diminishing the claim that it is portable.

This is a very nice medium sized backpack. Great for overnight and weekend treks,  but too small for longer-term backpacking.The pack looks great and seems very well made.The main compartment has a side access zipper and there is a secondary compartment that I like to use for clothes due to be washed. Lots of small pouches are scattered around the pack.The straps are fairly easy to adjust and once adjusted it is very comfortable. The adjustment instructions make it seem more complicated than it is. Once you put it on, finding the correct fit is fairly intuitive, especially if you are already familiar with internal frame packs.

This is a complete archery set with 2 bows, 8 suction cup "arrows," and a target. It is very easy to nock to arrows. Each arrow has two barbs that attach to bungee cords on the bow. The arrows release easily and fly straight, although not very far (about 30 ft). The light up feature on the arrows is nice, but underwhelming. A flashing option would have been better.Everything is well made and solid. The target can be hung or stood up using the included feet.The main problem is that the arrows don't stick well. Unless the strike head on, they won't stick even to the target. They stick poorly to other smooth surfaces. When they do stick (even to the target) they tend to fall off after less than one minute. This is the primary reason for the 3 star rating.

The unit moves a good amount of air, but on the highest setting it is a little loud. There are 4 fan speed setting and a timer function. The lowest 2 settings are fairly quiet. The unit also provides filter replacement reminders.I tested the unit in a basement family room  (20 x 10) that gets slightly musty and causes my eyes to itch. After 2 weeks of continuous use on the highest setting, the musty odor was only slightly decreased, but eye irritation stopped. I am impressed. The carbon filters have already picked up a noticeable amount of dust.Set up was easy; just pop in the filters. The unit is fairly large. It can be positioned to blow the clean air up, or to the side. The unit cannot be positioned to lie flat (with the intake pointed up) because this would crimp the power cord. Too bad. This would have been a nice option for tucking it out of the way.

Well done, Nature Valley.The taste is very nice. I taste mostly oats, with subtle honey and almonds. They are not too sweat. They are soft, a little chewy, and a little dry. Have a drink nearby.Each is a hearty bitesize, and the number of portions per bag is good. A serving of 3 gives you 7 g of protein and just 180 calories.

Didn't last long. Possible safety hazard.I thought it was cute and my daughter liked it. It is approximately 5 inches tall and is made out of a soft, rubbery material. The tilt activated light fits inside the rubber doll.The problem is my daughter was able to remove the entire light mechanism within 10 minutes. The mechanism was glued to the rubber doll, but not very well. She merely flexed the rubber material until she got the mechanism out. It will no longer stay attached. The mechanism contains the batteries, light bulb, wires, and the switch and once removed becomes a safety hazard.

First and foremost, the product works well. It very effectively kills insects on whatever plant I need to treat. Its effectiveness seems to last less than one day, so frequent reapplication is necessary. The sprayer works well, does't drip much, and can get the last fluid out with minimal difficulty.The active ingredient is pyrethrin. Although considered one of the safest insecticides, it should not be considered completely safe. Whether naturally extracted from chrysanthemum or synthetically produced, the benefits and risks are the same, as long as it is not mixed with another insecticide. This product uses only pyrethrin.It only treats insect infestation. It is not meant to address blight or other non-insect issues.

The piece measures 1.25 inches in diameter and seems to be a well made cast silver pendent. It is not real filigree. The Rhodium plating gives it a very mirrored surface. The chain is extremely flimsy, but with a nice solid clasp.It is marked 925, PAJ, and China.Weight  = 0.2 oz (with the chain).

The flavor is primarily mango, and it is too sweet. The orange taste is imperceptible.The drink is only 20% juice with water and sugar being the two main ingredients.220 calories per bottle (110 per serving with 2 servings).

These work well. No problems with leaks. My daughter appreciates the girl design. There is a wetness indicator on the front. As far as I can tell, the "cool alert" feature is merely a slight delay in absorbency. I was worried that  Huggies had implemented some type of endothermic chemical reaction and tested the diaper with warm water. Thankfully, there was nothing really new, just the same old reliable Huggies.

Sleek, modern designed and well made. It has a push-button pop-up lid. There are windows for measuring the water on both sides, but the power indicator is only on one side. The cord is very short (about 18 inches) which is probably a safety feature, but can be frustrating due to where my outlets are.It boiled 1 L of cold tap water in 4 min 29 sec (the time to auto shut off).

The vacuum is clearly "inspired" by the modern design of the Dysons, but doesn't have the underlying patented root cyclone technology. Honestly, I'm not sure it matters. I must confess, however, that I am a Dyson fan and own several different models. They are my comparisons for this Hoover.The vacuum did require a few assembly steps, and the handle attachment required a screwdriver.ProsExcellent suctionThe retracting cord mechanism works well and is convenientFairly easy to empty (not quite as easy as a Dyson)Comes with the usual tools and a motorized hand brush.All tools attach to the vacuum, including the motorized hand brush.Washable filtersBaglessA good value at $100ConsNot as well designed as a Dyson (placement of on/off switch, hose placements, etc.)Somewhat heavy and a little unstable/top-heavy.Not as well constructed as a Dyson (feels "cheaper," which of course it is)The beater brush is always onThe height adjustment knob feels looseThe motorized hand brush is turbine powered, not electric.; When suction decreases, it slows.When using the hand tools, the vacuums consistently is "sucked" towards you as the hose contracts.The attachment don't lock on. The motorized brush sometimes fell off.In summary, the choice probably comes down to how much you are willing to spend on a vacuum.

The phone fits in easily and stays secure. This is my first clear case and I actually appreciate being able to see the Apple design of my phone through the case, but the texture on the clear part detracts from this. The phone is suspended slightly in front of the pack panel by rubber spacers. I assume this adds some slight protection. There is access to all of the ports and buttons. They case provides minimal water protection. I found no difference in sound, with or without the case. The rubber edges seem flimsy, with some very thin sections that I worry will break over time. Otherwise, definitely a well designed case. If you like the style, this is a decent choice.

This could have been much better, and for $30-40 it should have been.Assembly was frustrating. Part of the problem was that there are creases in the cardboard so it could be folded up inside its own box, but these creases are not part of the final rocket and it kept bending at these creases during assembly. It does not stay together using just its tabs and slots, but some clear packing tape solved this problem nicely.The door started to rip during assembly and continued to rip with play. The bottom of the door frame ripped off after 45 minutes of play and unfortunately is important for stability.The concept is nice and my children love it. They like drawing on it and playing inside of it. It does not hold up well to two kids fighting over who goes inside and even less so when they both get inside.The markers are very nice. Each has two different points, one on each end. There are 6 different colors. They are somewhat washable. 90% came off of cotton pants in the washing machine. 50% came off of skin with soap and water. They do not wash off flat (porous) wall paint (be warned). My kids did all of this spontaneously.I would have liked it better if it were less expensive, since in my house, it won't; last long. Alternatively, a stronger material than cardboard would have been appreciated.

I have a bias against Mega Bloks; I'm a LEGO purist. Despite this, I am impressed by this set. The pieces are the perfect size for my 2 year old daughter. She loves the castle theme. Set up takes mere seconds. The play-table is sturdy and provides ample room to build. The pieces can be stored inside, the cover plates lock in place. and the legs fold up. This makes the play-table very portable. The stickers do not come pre-applied and did not end up where they were intended thanks to my 2 year old.The quality of the bricks is good, better than what I remembered from Mega Bloks, but still not up to LEGO standards.25 bricks is not enough.
The matching lid for the Rubbermaid Brute. Fits tightly, buts takes significant pressure to snap on. Raccoons have not been able to remove the lid.
Very sturdy. Spray paint (for my address) did not stick well and most of it washed off after the first rain. Lid sold separately.

My daughter appreciated the pastel colors. Assembly was of moderate difficulty level. The instructions were very good. It is well made, but not as well made as the classic Coupe (the one without eyes that is no longer being made).
A very nice booster seat. Moderately firm with a textured seat. One solid piece. Easy to clean. Large enough for a four year old to use.

I confess, I totally accidentally found this author simply because of the title of this book. I'm a Rockstar Romance junkie and I guessed by the title that I might find a rockstar inside. Well, it was my lucky day because I loved this book. Now that Riley Edgewood is on my radar, I'll be stalking her.The story is told from Cassidy's POV. She's a college student that is on summer break. She is home from college and goes to a concert with her best friend who has won VIP tickets. This venue is where she sees Gage for the first time. He's playing the guitar and singing on stage. Both girls determine that he is easy on the eyes and the ears. Due to circumstances beyond her control she ends up spending an extended period of time at the VIP bar, hanging with the staff, drinking and laughing and drooling over Gage.She shares, much more than she intended, with various people that night. Isn't that how it works when you get drunk? You lose your filter, and everything you think actually comes out of your mouth. Who knew that crazy night could end up bringing her a job offer? Who knew that letting out those feelings would make her realize that maybe she wanted something different? Too bad that drunk courage wasn't something that she could use when facing her father. There are so many students that would kill to have the opportunity being offered to her. She should be excited and grateful, right? Then why is she feeling sad instead?Cassidy has some very definite opinions about good music. She knows what she likes and what she doesn't. When her girlfriends go on and on and on about Luca, the international heartthrob, she just rolls her eyes. She tells everyone who will listen that she doesn't like his music, even him. Well, that is after she regains the use of her vocal chords. They kinda get frozen when he walks into the room and she sees him in person. She now totally understands what all the hype is about now. He's H-O-T!"His abs belong in the realm of ridiculous--and he knows it."Her summer was sweaty and hot--and not just the weather. She made some new friends, and some new enemies. She won some battles, and she lost some battles. She found love, and she lost it... She laughed, she cried, she screamed (in both anger and passion). She made some hard decisions, some good and some bad. Some of her choices led to heartache and pain, and others brought her a happiness that she was afraid to claim. In the end, it was definitely a summer to remember.

I'm a fan of this series and have been looking forward to Luc & Cam's story. I already knew about her crush on Z, and Luc's crush on her. And since Z didn't return her feelings, surely she would notice Luc eventually, right? Luc's been her best friend since she was 4 years old. He knows all her secrets and he's been there for her every step of the way, until now.The story is told in alternating POV, so I knew all along how each of the main characters felt about each other. Can I just say how frustrating that was when they didn't cooperate? I mean really, I have a lot of wisdom to impart and they totally ignored me. How rude! Every page I turned...I hoped...I anticipated...I waited. This was the longest, short book, ever. I was so anxious for what I wanted to happen, to happen. I was ready to throw them both off one of those snow mountains they are so fond of.But, truthfully, the anticipation was delicious. The times they did get together was H-O-T! Their friends are present and as crazy, fun, and supportive as ever. The excitement of the extreme sport and their constant struggle to surpass their previous accomplishments had me cheering from my recliner like a proud parent when their kids do well. The pages that covered their painful past and their insecurities regarding their future had me also feeling like a parent, wanting to give out hugs and a shoulder to cry on. The pages that covered the skinny dipping...um...had me feeling not so parental (wink-wink).

Who can resist a sweaty, sexy, muscled MMA cage fighter? Not me obviously cuz I grabbed this book after seeing the cover and reading the synopsis. Even though I knew what was coming, actually reading, in detail, that final fight that knocked Rory "Knockout" Kavanagh out was brutal. He had my sympathy and my support...for a while. When he started and continued to make bad choices I joined the Kavanagh clan in being worried that he was throwing his life away, stuck on stupid.Speaking of the Kavanaghs, you are gonna love them. They are a big Irish family that loves unconditionally and refuses to mind their own business. That is exactly what is needed, but not necessarily appreciated, at least initially. Just ask Quinn who seems to be constantly on the receiving end of a slap upside the back of his head. And Rory who is walking around, make that limping around, with a huge chip on his shoulder. He's still in pain and unable to resume his fighting career. He's got anger issues and he's avoiding his family because he doesn't want to face their disapproval and judgement regarding his coping mechanisms. He prefers to stay numb and alone. Well, let me clarify, "He didn't want a relationship--he just wanted to screw and move on."Clare is running. I knew that going in, but I didn't know what she was running from. Even though the author put me in her head, privy to her thoughts. Apparently she chose not to think about the things I wanted to know because I was anxiously flipping the pages of my kindle waiting for the answers to show up on my next swipe. So of course my imagination came up with all kinds of scenarios. I kept waiting for her past to catch up with her. I kept telling her to share her secrets with Rory. I kept telling her to kick her boss in the nuts because he deserved it. As usual, the characters in the book ignored my thoughtful suggestions. But that doesn't stop me, I'm eternally optimistic and confident that my advice is worth listening to.I especially enjoyed Casey, she's actually my favorite character and I hope she gets her own book. Other than the mother of the Kavanaghs, she is the only other female. And since the family owns Legends, the gym where the MMA cage fighting events are held, you can bet that she's feisty and not afraid to speak her mind. She knows she has the support of her very well respected, and sometimes feared, family. And did I mention that she teaches self-defense classes to women? That's how Clare and Casey meet, when she signs up for a class. Now it has you thinking too, huh? You are wondering what happened to Clare to make her so secretive, aren't you? You want to know why she needs to defend herself, right? You wanna know how many Kavanagh brothers there are and if they are all hot, huh? I'm not saying, but I will tell you that there are a set of twins. Hmm...are you curious yet?

Softer Than Steel was my introduction to Jessica Topper. Even though this is the second book in the Love & Steel Series, I read it as a standalone. I assumed that like most rockstar romance series that each band member would get their own book and I could catch up later. And I was right, it was a fully-fleshed-out story and I don't feel like I missed anything. Yes, there was an existing relationship that I'm aware came together in the first book, but if anything I learned just enough to make me intrigued for more details.While I enjoyed many things about this story it took some adjusting for my expectations to stop interrupting my reading experience. I'm a Texas girl who reads lots of rocker romance so I was mentally geared for sex, drugs, and rock n' roll with groupies and alcohol and explicit language. While not a bad thing, it took some getting used to, because it was written with a British formality, that kind of felt like a contradiction to the loud in-your-face rockstar lifestyle I'm used to. It still had all the music industry details I dig. There were concerts, song writing, recording, media issues, record label drama, and band bickering to keep my smiling. And one of my favorite things that not every author is talented enough to excel at, but this author aced, was meaningful song lyrics.The characters were believable and entertaining with witty banter and heartfelt expressiveness. I found the yoga aspect interesting, and informational (maybe a touch too much), but also therapeutic and very sensual.The story is told from multiple POV's and the author took me back in time on occasion, through the memories of the characters, to fill in some blanks. It helped me to understand Rick's (aka Riff's) pain and some of the tension between the band members. And even though I was reading from both POV's, the author kept a few secrets to make it interesting. She would drop subtle hints, put ideas in my head, making me wonder and guess as I anticipated a particular outcome. It was exciting to hope and to wait as the suspense built gradually. It takes a while to get there but let me reassure those readers that require an HEA that all the details will eventually come together and get tied up nicely...with a bright orange bow.

Chelle Bliss fans are gonna be in a one-click Frisco frenzy when this treasure is released. The story is told from his POV and I fell in love with him just by being inside his head. He's the real thing. All those good things that us women want in a man. He's cocky and confident, sexy and skilled, caveman and caring. He's got muscles and tattoos and…um…something special.Too bad all that deliciousness is being wasted on one-night-stands. He's a disillusioned mess and has no desire for a relationship. After seeing so much cheating in his job as a PI and through personal experience he doesn't have much hope for finding love. However; he can't help but notice what a treasure City has found in his Sunshine. All the ALFA PI guys love her. They find it very amusing that she retains her innocence after spending so much time in their presence. They tease her endlessly and find it very amusing if a cuss word ever passes her lips. But what are the chances of him ever finding someone like that?Being the sweetheart that she is, Sunshine wants everyone else to be happy too. So, of course she's gonna attempt matchmaking, right? Where else would you expect to find a sexy, too young bombshell, but at a little girls pink princess party? Can you imagine seeing a bartender in a pink tuxedo? *giggle-snort* Frisco has no intention of dating anyone, especially someone who is good friends with Suzy. I mean really, how could he kick her out in the morning and it not get back to Suzy…and then City… and then all of his friends. There would be no walking away from that without baggage, right? So that's a bad idea he plans to avoid at all costs. Good luck with that, right?Georgia is on his mind, like the song, running endlessly on repeat. He's determined that he's too old for her. He's not good enough for her. She's a good girl. He's a bad boy. He wants her, but he doesn't deserve her. And then he almost lost her…Look out, it gets even better. Get ready for some suspense as the PI's do their thing. Get ready for some laughter as the PI's do their thing. Get ready for friends and family to meddle, it's their thing. Get ready for some action, in and out of the bedroom. (wink-wink) Get ready to smile and sigh as your heart is touched and you become even more attached to this incredible series. Speaking of this incredible series, am I the only one in #CoverLust?

Being a music lover I couldn't resist giving this book a try after reading the synopsis. And yeah, I really wanted to meet Hank the hound too. It was a very short but interesting read. The characters had personality and the banter was witty. I found myself rooting for poor CeCe who had hit hard times in an explosive way. She wasn't eased into it, she landed hard. Fortunately, Holden and Thomas showed up in the nick of time to offer her and Hank Junior a ride to Nashville. There was just enough good stuff to keep me intrigued as I impatiently wait for the next installment to be released. I have questions...and fantasies that have yet to be fulfilled. Until next time...

I'm totally addicted to the Brothers by Blood MC and their women Harmony & Chelsea. After reading this latest book, there are even more characters that I'm drawn to and want to see more of. I agree that, "The loyalty and love you found within this group was unrivaled." They are a family that have each other's backs, and that includes the club girls. I found the idea of a MC Romance told from the POV of a club girl to be very intriguing. I was not disappointed, I was impressed. The stories are told in such a way that the reader is drawn in, becoming part of the drama taking place. It's a nail biting, page turning, brow raising experience that you don't want to miss.Chelsea came from foster care, a product of the system. She lost her parents at an early age and was passed from one bad foster home to the next until she finally reached legal age. Her mother told her to run, and she's been doing it ever since. While some might judge her for her choice to become a club girl, she doesn't care. She's found more love and acceptance from these big bossy bikers than she ever received growing up. She's a survivor, doing what has to be done to make it in hard times. She's determined to carve a better future for herself. She's following the rules, doing what she needs to do in exchange for protection and college tuition. The club is taking care of her, and she is taking care of them. But what she really wants, is to just take care of HIM...to be HIS. But, it's been years, and Optimus hasn't claimed her. She's almost got her degree and soon it will be time to move on.Optimus hasn't claimed Chelsea, but he favors her. Everyone knows that, except her. The other brothers are leaving her alone, because they know she is HIS. That's the problem though. He keeps her at arms length, knowing that being associated with him would put her in danger. She doesn't know that he does it for her protection. He can't let her know how he feels. Her safety is what's important, right? What if withholding his feelings, and pushing her away, sends her into the arms of another man? What if she runs again? How can he keep her safe if she's not with him?And then...it gets really good! Then there is action, suspense, betrayal, danger...and death. Who can she trust? Who is telling the truth? Who's gonna be next? Where's the popcorn? When will the next book be released and who's it gonna about? There are a few brothers that need a good woman...I'm predicting Wrench & Sugar will get together, at least I hope so. And then there's Blizzard & Rose...what do you think, maybe? I can't wait to find out!

This series is getting better with each book. I'm getting very attached to the characters which include the Savage Angels MC family, their family members, the local citizens that make up the small town of Tourmaline, and the band members that Dave manages. It's hard not to since the author writes in multiple POV, and she doesn't skimp with the multiples... Spending time inside the head of so many characters allowed me to see the relationships and events that took place from several different angles.Dane & Kat (my favorite couple) have been together for a while and are finally planning their big day. Due to Kat's fame and the their large circle of friends and family the event is gonna be spectacular and very, very, huge. The details are taking all of Kat's time and energy and the increased media attention means that she needs extra security. We all know what that means right? Yup, big muscled bossy bikers shadowing her every move.Dane, the president of the Savage Angels MC and the groom-to-be, is very protective of his fiancé.
