He doesn't even have to force his brothers to babysit Kat, they feel the same way. She has the MC members, the local citizens, and her fans wrapped around her little finger. They are falling all over themselves to make her wishes come true. They are probably just being over-cautious, but after her previous ordeal and the crazy behavior of some fans, the precaution seems necessary if only for Dane's peace of mind, right?Jonas, the Savage Angels VP, is also in charge of the club's garage. He just happens to be looking through the shop window when Carlos, the Sheriff, leans over and kisses Adelynn. His woman. But wait, she's not his anymore. He walked away without a word. What was he thinking? She's beautiful...she's perfect...she's gonna belong to someone else if he doesn't do something about it.Carlos has his heart set on Adelynn. He's been moving slow. Taking his time. Giving her time to heal. He knows that Jonas broke her heart. But he has a lot to offer and he's out to prove that she can depend on him to take care of her and her son, Ben.Adelynn's life is better now that her father is sober. She and her son live with him and together they run the local hotel. They are getting a lot of business lately because of the media attention revolving around the upcoming wedding. Everything should be perfect...but it's not. She should feel content with the success of the hotel and the attention of the sexy Sheriff, right? Can she let go of her feelings for Jonas and move on?As the big day approaches the plans are moving forward, everything is falling into place. The cake has been ordered and the venue has been reserved. What could go wrong? Isn't that when it always does? Of course, that's what makes an exciting suspenseful story. This we already know, cuz duh, this is the 3rd book in the series. I can almost hear the author's maniacal laugh in my head as the s*** starts to hit the fan. I knew it was coming, I expected something, I just didn't know what. But I did know it was gonna be twisted, cuz she's good like that. And it's not over. I'm happy to report that with so many characters involved there is plenty of behind the scenes drama that will be brought out later to keep us entertained as the series continues. But don't stress, there's not a big cliffy at the end, just some teases to keep us anticipating more.

I was so excited to go on the road with the Vagabonds after experiencing their evolution into a band. I had my concerns about what to expect, especially with the band members being underage. They were at the mercy of Peter who promised their parents that he would provide tutoring and security for their daughters. Let's just say that from my first introduction to his character he reminded me of a slimy car salesman. There was nothing concrete, but he just rubbed me the wrong way with his offensive name-calling. However; he did have skills in the talent scout area as proven by the successful creation and marketing of the Vagabonds.The story picks right up where book one left off, and it is written in Kyle's POV. Being inside her head, knowing what was really happening, rather than what was shared with the parents had me biting my nails with worry. I kept waiting for their rockstar lifestyle, complete with the sex and drugs to explode in the media. I kept waiting for Bald Barbie, because surely Kyle was gonna end up slinging her off the stage by her hair. Well, at least that was my fantasy. Yes, I was just as frustrated with B--- Barbie as she was.Truthfully, what I was really waiting for was Kyle's birthday. Y'all know why, right? Cuz sexy rocker, C.J., refused to take their flirting to the next level until she was 18 yrs old. They shared a passion for music and for each other. I was anxiously anticipating their...um...collaboration. I knew they would make beautiful music together and that it would be extra spicy because they had waited so long for it to happen. Don't deny it. Isn't that what you were waiting for too?What I got was not what I was expecting. It was a dark journey full of everything that could go wrong in the music industry. It's definitely not a fluffy version of rockstar falls in love and lives happily ever after. Nope, it was, "Harder, faster, longer, and louder", until it wasn't. It was not a book version of the X-Factor where Simon threw 5 girls together and they became Fifth Harmony. Although, I did kinda have a giggle-snort moment imagining Simon taking Peter's place. Especially when thinking about how he would deal with Barbie when "she was off in f---ing Barbie Land doing her usual self absorbed thing." Unfortunately, Peter was in charge and he was living in Peter Land. He's looking out for himself and his wallet. He's definitely not the nurturing parental road manager type. He was there to make sure they showed up at the venues, the radio stations, the meet-and-greets. He made sure the merchandise got promoted and sold. He made sure that they had just barely enough of what they needed, and too much of what they didn't need.I think the title of the next book says it all, On The Rocks. All their dreams of rockstar stardom are hanging by a thread. Will their artistic differences prevent them from recording another album? Will their journey to the dark side keep them from seeing the light? Will some bad choices in their past prevent them from having a future? Will C.J. and Kyle ever be more than FWB? Will the author share Kyle's song lyrics with us? This inquiring mind want to know!

I knew going in that it was gonna be gritty and unapologetic. Cuz, duh, I read Kick, and it kicked my butt...in a good way. I had already met Tank & Ivy, and determined that digging deeper into what caused them to become the current messed up version of themselves was a journey I was looking forward to. What can I say, I'm messed up too and I like to read that stuff.Ivy is the club whore that cried all the time and had daddy issues, remember? Am I the only one that forgets some of the details in between books? I sometimes have to go back and read the end of a the previous book again to catch up before I start the next one. So, Ivy was in love with Kick. She spent a lot of time with him...before she was replaced by Indie. He was the only one who could handle her tears. Actually, he got off on them...he's sick that way. Unfortunately the club lifestyle gave her easy access to drugs, her cure for unwanted memories. Her recently broken heart, added to her mysterious tragic past, made for a hot mess that no amount of glue could put back together again.I knew she was running from something. I knew who she was running from. But I didn't know the details of the events that brought her to the Savage Saints MC. Was she there for drugs? Was she there for sex? Was she there for protection? If so, how were they supposed to protect her if she wouldn't tell anyone what she was afraid of? If she wouldn't share details or names then the club couldn't remove the threat, right? She had a moment of clarity when she said, "Why do you think I've spent the better part of three years inside that clubhouse, Tank? I may be an addict, but I'm not an idiot."Tank had more patience with Ivy than I did. Surprising, huh? He's a very highly respected member of the MC. He is well-known by his brothers and his enemies as someone who takes care of business. They call him 'Death', but never to his face. He's huge (all over), muscled, commanding, and determined. Determined to save Ivy, from herself, in spite of herself. I guess being broken himself he recognizes the same trait in her. They are like magnets being pulled towards each other against their wills. For every step forward, for every inch he struggles toward reaching her, something happens to undo the progress.The story is told from both POV's with alternating past/present scenes to bring the readers up to speed. Get ready to have your heart ripped out and your boundaries invaded. Get ready for your jaw to hit the floor while your eyebrows are being raised. Get ready to gasp for air because you've not realized that you were holding your breath, shocked and afraid to turn the next page...but unable to stop yourself. Get ready for the ride of your life that you won't be forgetting anytime soon. Yeah, I doubt I'll be having to re-read this book to refresh my memory. I'll be lucky to turn off the images flashing through my brain as I try to sleep tonight.

This biker lovin' blogger has found a new author to fangirl over. Burning Ember rocked my world for days. Yes, it's a full-length novel that made me unavailable to the rest of the world until I turned the last page and sighed with satisfaction. Having read truck loads of books in the last few years I have a huge basis for comparison, so you can take it to the bank when I tell you this book is amazing. If you like MC Romance, you will love Burning Ember. I can't wait for more of the HOC series. I fell in love with so many characters that I can't wait to spend more time with.

I had a girl crush on Ember from the beginning. She is a survivor, refusing to let life win. She's been through hell but she's still fighting and sacrificing. She hasn't lost her ability to love and put others before herself. She's learned her lessons well and is determined to make different choices in the future. One of those decisions is regarding the type of men she allows a place in her life. She had good intentions, until him. He reminds her of the devil, so she secretly tags him Luce in her mind when she first sees him. He's a nasty piece of work, spewing insults, trying to push her away. It might have worked if she had other choices. But since she's all out of options, she must suffer through, taking whatever is dished out, biding her time until it's safe to leave. Taking her punishment for looking like the woman who turned Mav into the disillusioned, hateful man that resulted from her betrayal. Every time he looked at Ember, he saw HER.

Maverick has been wallowing for five long years. He is bitter and he uses his words as weapons, cutting Ember at every turn. He's determined to push her away. He hasn't looked at a woman for years, simply using a clubpiece for relief as needed. They know not to touch him. But she doesn't know what's raging in his soul. He feels the spark between them, even though they both fight it. He sees all the men softening towards her and he's afraid that they will want to keep her around. He can't risk having her around though, she makes him feel, she makes him remember. He prefers to stay numb. But when he sees her laughing, or touching one of his brothers, it effects him. What is that feeling? Surely it's not jealousy, right?

Just when things start to smooth out, chaos finds them. It's hard to revel in it when all those things that you didn't even know you needed is threatened. When Ember's past comes chasing after her the choice is taken out of her hands. It's no longer her decision whether she wants to stay or go. The question is, does Mav want her to stay or go? Will he fight to keep her? Can he ever trust her, especially when he finds out who she is? He is a saint and a sinner, light and dark, which side of him will decide?

Being a big fan of rockstar romance, that was was caught my attention and convinced me to read this book. I was also intrigued with the idea of a rocker being paired with a nerd. I must admit that being inside the head of Taylor was quite amusing at times. Especially when she was drooling over her instructor and thinking things like, "I wasn't even in the damn pool yet I was wet." I also found the book quite educational. I learned what "sapiosexual" was and yes, I even Googled "See you next Tuesday." I felt like I fool afterwards but had a good giggle at myself anyway.While the band, Goldenrod, is gradually getting more gigs, they are by no stretch considered rockstars yet. All the band members are still working other jobs to pay the bills. Taylor, who has been a 'runner' for most of her life finally felt safe enough to settle down. She has been practicing and playing with the band for about 6 months and is gradually starting to relax. Her chance meeting with 'Sexy Eyes Nerdy Glasses' opens a door for a job opportunity that might help her to stick around longer. She doesn't want to let her guys down, they really want the band to be a success.What I didn't expect when I started reading was the suspense. There were secrets, clues, danger and surprises thrown in to keep me turning the pages. Well, that's not the only reason I kept turning the pages, I kinda wanted to know if what they say about nerds in the bedroom was true. (wink-wink)

MC Romance lovers are gonna be in 'hog' heaven when they read Grit. It's dark and gritty, but also light and funny. Well, at the least the relationships are. The banter between the brothers of the Hunters MC is very entertaining. But it's the banter between Jaeger and Phoenix that will keep you giggle-snorting throughout.

Jaeger is the typical cocky, conceited, alpha, bossy biker who has no clue how to win over a woman. He's used to the women fighting over him, standing in line, always ready for any scrap of attention he is willing to give them. Of course the one woman who he wants to give attention to fights him at every turn. Her fiery personality certainly matches her fiery red hair. But don't make the mistake of calling her Red, that didn't work out too well for Jaeger. Actually, not many of his brilliant ideas went over too well. He's got to be the most clueless man to ever pursue a woman. He has no idea what it takes since he's always been on the receiving end. He's used to just giving orders and being obeyed by both the club members and the club whores. Being the Prez brings him respect and obedience from most, but not from her. He has a habit of describing in the filthiest way possible every thought that pops into his head and ever fantasy he's ever had about her. While it all makes perfect sense to him, and he thinks she should feel honored and take it as a compliment, it doesn't always turn out that way.

Since the book is written with both POV's I was privy to Nix's thoughts and feelings. So, I can vouch that while she was most definitely a ballbreaker, she was not totally unaffected by his bossy growly caveman shenanigans. While her mouth was telling him off, her body was melting from all of his sexy suggestions. And...um...so was mine. I really liked Phoenix and her sass was just what Jaeger needed. She brought out a side to the Prez that his brothers had never seen before. But she wasn't feeling the whole biker 'old lady' lifestyle idea. She's a country girl and she just wants to go home to her farm. She can't believe that her her father owed money to not one, but two MC's, and that they are claiming that her childhood home belongs to them.

That's when the action and suspense get going. There are more players than expected and it's hard to tell who is on their side. Brothers betray brothers and friends get caught in the crossfire. It's a nail biting, page turning, panty melting experience that you do not want to miss. I haven't seen any reference to this being a series, but I guarantee that if it is I'll be first in line, flexing my clicker, waiting for it to be released.

I've been hearing about this series for a long time. I was jealous of all my friends who were raving about the Gypsy Brothers, wishing I had time to read it but knowing that I had too many review commitments to take that much time for my own guilty pleasure. Well, guess what? I did it. I dived in and read all seven books in two days. I'm that kinda girl, all or nothing.And boy was I wrong about what I was getting into. I was fantasizing about 7 sexy biker brothers. I thought each book was gonna be focused on a different brother who would fall in love. Um...nope, this was NOT a typical MC Romance. And what a ride Lili St. Germain took me on. It was such a rush. I loved every second of it. I became a big fan and placed the author on auto-click status. Yup, if she writes it, I'll read it. I've joined the Gypsy Brothers Fan Club and will fight the crowds to scoop up anything released in that series. BTW, when I joined the fan club, it's the series not the brothers I'm fangirling over. There's only one brother that has my adoration, and yes, I would definitely hang his poster on my bedroom wall...sigh.

SEVEN SONS: Ready, set, GO!

I've been hearing the hype about this series for a while now and finally decided to find out for myself if it was as good as everyone says. Well, guess what? They were right, it's incredible. I was engrossed immediately and read the book from cover to cover without stopping.

I have a 'girl crush' on the female character. I'm not sure what name to call her, but I am in awe of her, no matter what she chooses to call herself. I'd love to stay and chat some more about this nail biting series, but I'm anxious to move on to the next book...see ya there.

SIX BROTHERS: The countdown continues...

This ain't no seven brides for seven brothers ladies. These brothers are bad news and their numbers are dwindling. Sammi is out for vengeance, rightly so, and she's not letting anything stand in her way. Not even her heart.

The more I get to know Dornan and his sons, the more worried I become. They are some sick puppies and she's playing with fire. I guess she felt like she had nothing to lose when she made her plans for revenge. But from this side of my kindle, I have to disagree. If she doesn't want Jase or Elliott, I'll take them...sigh. ❤️

FIVE MILES: There's an app for that...

It keeps getting better and better. Sammi is badass, remaining brave in spite of her fear. As the big event gets closer and closer, my nails get smaller and smaller. The suspense is excruciatingly delicious. The sparks are flying between her and Jase, and a few other places too. I'm hooked, ready for more, see ya there.

FOUR SCORE: Love will have to wait...

Secrets have been revealed. Hearts are broken. Lies are uncovered. Passion is present. Danger is calling. I'm afraid to turn the next page. I need to know, but what if it's bad and not good. Can I take it? Too late, I'm hooked, I'm going in...I'll see you on the other side.

THREE YEARS: There are things worse than death...so...much...worse

Consider this a courtesy warning, it's your mind bending alert. You should start practicing your what-the-hell look right now so you'll be ready when it happens Cuz it is gonna happen. It's too late to turn back now. If you've made it this far, you're already and addict. So make a fist and get ready for your reward. And then, move on with me to the next book in the series to get your next fix.

TWO ROADS: Poor little rich girl...The Gypsy Brothers series is a total mind-bending-experience, I love it! It really makes you think about things that you would never have come up with on your own. That's what makes good authors so worthy to be fangirled over, right? They have amazing things floating around in their mind and choose to share those thoughts and ideas with their readers. Thank you for the hours of entertainment and mental anxiety as I bite my nails and rail at the evil villains that were birthed in your mind. Thank you for the smiles and the tears. And thank you for the next book in the series, I'm not ready to let go of my addiction yet. I need to be weaned off gently. So keep them coming...

ONE LOVE: The price of vengeance...

I've been hearing about this series for a long time. I was jealous of all my friends who were raving about the Gypsy Brothers, wishing I had time to read it but knowing that I had too many review commitments to take that much time for my own guilty pleasure. Well, guess what? I did it. I dived in and read all seven books in two days. I'm that kinda girl, all or nothing.

And boy was I wrong about what I was getting into. I was fantasizing about 7 sexy biker brothers. I thought each book was gonna be focused on a different brother who would fall in love. Um...nope, this was NOT a typical MC Romance. And what a ride Lili St. Germain took me on. It was such a rush. I loved every second of it. I became a big fan and placed the author on auto-click status. Yup, if she writes it, I'll read it. I've joined the Gypsy Brothers Fan Club and will fight the crowds to scoop up anything released in that series. BTW, when I joined the fan club, it's the series not the brothers I'm fangirling over. There's only one brother that has my adoration, and yes, I would definitely hang his poster on my bedroom wall...sigh.

That's what makes good authors so worthy to be fangirled over, right? They have amazing things floating around in their mind and choose to share those thoughts and ideas with their readers. It keeps getting better and better. Sammi is tough, remaining brave in spite of her fear. As the big event gets closer and closer, my nails get smaller and smaller. The suspense is excruciatingly delicious. The sparks are flying between her and Jase, and a few other places too. I'm hooked, ready for more, see ya there.

This ain't no seven brides for seven brothers ladies. These brothers are bad news and their numbers are dwindling. Sammi is out for vengeance, rightly so, and she's not letting anything stand in her way. Not even her heart.

The more I get to know Dornan and his sons, the more worried I become. They are some sick puppies and she's playing with fire. I guess she felt like she had nothing to lose when she made her plans for revenge. But from this side of my kindle, I have to disagree. If she doesn't want Jase or Elliott, I'll take them...sigh. ❤️

I'm a fan of The Legal Brief series after falling in love with the incredible characters in Overruled. I couldn't wait to get my hands on Sustained, and Jake...sigh. He caught my attention with his unsmiling moodiness. I knew it would take a special woman to turn his frown upside down. And I must say that Chelsea is indeed very special.Being the womanizer that he was, Jake had his morning-after-scenario down to a system. It seemed to work for him just fine, until it didn't. After an eye-opening event caused him to reevaluate his lifestyle choices he attempted to make a change. Who knew that the change he needed could be found in the last place he ever expected to find himself?The surprising events leading up to his introduction to Chelsea and her clan were intriguing. I was drawn into the story a character at a time, unable to resist the broken and endearing siblings who pulled me into their unique situation. I wholeheartedly jumped in, encouraging Jake to let go of his fears and take a chance.One minute I was drooling over his strong, commanding presence and his ability to make things happen. And the next minute I was drooling over his strong muscles and his sexy tattoos. But before he closed the deal and convinced me that he was the total package, he messed up. Yup, I discovered he's not perfect. However; I still believed he was perfect for her, for them. Too bad he wasn't listening to me, or her, or them.He's the typical hard-headed lawyer who knows everything, especially what's best for everyone else. I was in full support of an intervention, regardless of what measures were needed. My heart was invested and I wouldn't settle for anything less than the outcome I had envisioned. I'm not sure what bargaining power I thought I had, but I bluffed my way through, threatening to throw my kindle against the wall if things didn't go my way. Am I the only one that does that? Fortunately the author knows what she's doing as she continues to prove by writing one successful novel after another. We keep coming back for more because she keeps working her magic, making us swoon, and laugh, and sigh.

I'm basking in the glow of a satisfying read. I'd be having a cigarette...if I smoked. And for the record, Cole & Sin, they passed smokin' and went to full-on inferno. I almost got scorched from touching my kindle, it was H-O-T! I'm kinda sad, knowing that this is the last book in the Bad Boys of Retribution MC series. I'm hoping that these incredible characters will crossover into another series from time to time. I'm not ready to let them go. I can't say enough good things about Rie Warren, she's one of my favorite authors. She always gives me everything I need in a good book. She touches my emotions...yes, I did shed a few tears in this one. She touches my funny bone...those 'bad boys' crack me up with their banter. She seems to know exactly the kind of men that appeal to me because her bad-boy bikers push all my buttons, especially Cole. He's a bossy biker with a filthy mouth and huge heart. If you read a lot of MC books you will probably find this series to be on the lighter side. These are good bad-boys, they are not 1% outlaws. There are cops, strippers, and tattoo artists who work hard and play harder. They have a strong sense of brotherhood and try to do what is right, but if anyone messes with their women they will take any measures necessary to protect them. They seem to attract trouble regardless of their good intentions about staying on the right side of the law. I really enjoy the good mix of sexy and suspenseful. I'm looking forward to whatever the next project is, I'm a fan.

I feel like reading a Ker Dukey book is a guilty pleasure. You know, like I'm kinda ashamed that I enjoy them so much. Like, maybe I'm disturbed, a little cray cray. Like, maybe nobody will ever know that about me unless I admit that I enjoy reading her books. But once they know...I'l be labeled...it'll be too late to deny it. Oh well, here goes. My name is Rosa, and I'm an addict. I know that when I read this stuff, it gets in my head and I can't quit thinking about it. It's like seeing a wreck on the freeway. You become a rubber-necker, staring at the mangled destruction, unable to look away. Once it's inside your head, it can't get out. So, am I trying to get it out? No, I've got an itchy clicker, waiting for the next book to be released so I can do it again.There is nothing I can tell you about this short novella other than it's about Ryan & Cereus. They have been together for 3 years. They travel from place to place and occasionally change their identities. You already know why if you've been reading this series. If not, well then you need to do that. I wish I could tell you that you will get all your answers to every question you ever had, but that's not the case. It's like a Hershey's Kiss. You don't get your fill. You still want more. But it's damn good...melts in your mouth...soothes your craving...temporarily.

This was a short prequel to Two Princes (Sons of Sanctuary MC). It is the back story that lets the readers know how there came to be two princes who were unaware of each other's existence. I enjoyed the story and I'm greedy for more, it was just enough for me to whet my whistle. I have sooo many questions now. I also have a strong opinion about a certain someone who failed my badass biker chick aptitude test. I'm looking forward to more Sons of Sanctuary and will be moving directly into Two Princes now.

Overruled is exactly what the doctor ordered to put a smile on my face. I literally laughed-out-loud at some of the witty banter and antics of the incredible characters that totally won me over. And I'm not just talking about Stanton and Jenny and Sofia. There were so many awesome friends and family members that I'm very excited to see again in future books in the series.The story is told in multiple POV's so the reader is privy to the thoughts, misconceptions, lust and love of whichever character's head we happen to be in at any given time. And dayum, it's H-O-T! You better have your fire extinguisher nearby, you might need to use it on your kindle. "It's scorching flames, licking at our limbs, pulling us together from a space deep inside--making us clash like magnets separated too far for too long."And then, when Stanton makes the trip back home, to Mississippi...it's a journey you do not want to miss. Yup, everyone needs to meet Nana and her shotgun...and if she can't settle the dispute, then there's always 'tractor racing'. It's never boring in the small town with only one hotel and one stop light. When things start to loosen up you can expect to witness some 'streakin' and some drunkin' logic, such as, "my truck knows the way."I'm most definitely a fan of the author and the series and I will be anxiously awaiting the next book in the series, Sustained. I've already had a little taste of the sexy man who will be burning up those pages and I can't wait!

Yup, it was that motorcycle on the cover that convinced me to read my first Jill Sorenson novel. I'm a biker romance junkie and the blurb intrigued me. It was a good decision and I enjoyed Riding Dirty and I'm looking forward to Ace's story in Shooting Dirty.This book is not a typical MC romance. I didn't even get to check out the clubhouse, if there is one. Shank's relationship with his club brothers is strained when he is released from prison. He's lost his officer standing and there are trust issues on both sides. So, rather than the usual brotherhood bonding and witty banter scenario I found myself suspicious of everyone and curious about the events that landed Shank in prison. Then, after meeting Mia, I was even more curious to learn about the players in her traumatic past.The book was a page turner, stringing me along as I waited to learn how Shank & Mia's relationship would unfold. Especially since they were both being watched so closely. How would they pull it off? And when they finally do more than lust for each other...it is H-O-T! But how could they ever hope for more than that when they are from such opposite worlds? He's an outlaw biker and she's a classy 'good girl'. They both have secrets that could get them killed if discovered. They both know they should run away, not toward each other. But, lets not forget who we're talking out, he didn't become an outlaw by following the rules, right? She's used to following the rules, but since he came into her life she's starting to feel again, and she doesn't want to go back to being numb. Can they find a way to overcome the many obstacles standing in the way of a possible future together? When the secrets are revealed, will they even want a future together?

Cocky Bastard was not what I was expecting. I was mentally prepared for an egotistical womanizer with a bad attitude and a smart mouth. However; what I got was a sweet, sexy, blue-eyed sports model with scruff, dimples, a wicked sense of humor and a smart mouth. And did I mention the Australian accent? Chance won me over immediately, his charm and wit were lethal. He had me giggle-snorting and sighing from the beginning and it didn't stop until the last page.What started out as a 'chance' meeting turned into a Thelma & Louise road trip. Well, kinda, except the passenger they picked up along the way was no Brad Pitt. I must admit, after spending days and miles with them, the sexual tension was so thick I felt it through my kindle. They were so obviously attracted to each other, but he wouldn't give in to it. Nope, we all suffered as we waited...wondering....when...if...and especially, why not?Of course I eventually found out, but I won't be making it that easy for you. You deserve to experience the unwinding mystery for yourself. It was an entertaining journey, and I agree that "Those who put up the biggest shields are those who are protecting the biggest hearts."

Yes, I admit it, the title intrigued me and the synopsis sold me. Bradley's Whistle is a lighthearted sexy romance that will have you alternating between blushing and giggle-snorting from beginning to end. I read it as a standalone, but must admit that I'm intrigued about Decker's Wood too. Those titles are works of art, right? As I'm sure most readers will agree, while Bradley & Whiska are very entertaining, it's Casey that steals the show. He is hilarious and so sweet, I would love to be added to his inner circle. I would totally be on board for glitter, feathers, mocktails and Fancy Dress Friday. I can't stop humming, "There were three in the bed, and the sexy one said, 'Roll over, roll over..."

Bella Jewel is one of my favorite authors. It doesn't matter what she chooses to write about, I know it's gonna be good. She's on my auto-click list and I get very excited every time a new book is released. This time she tackled bounty hunting, and to make it even more interesting, it's a female doing the hunting. Grace is tough. She can hold her own up against her male co-workers, if only they would give her a chance to prove it. They find it very amusing to give her the small cases, especially the ones with the crazies. She is determined to show them she has what it takes, she just needs that one opportunity and she'll surely make a name for herself.Wouldn't you know that her big chance is just that, BIG. Raide is massive. "He is six foot of solid, thick muscle." He has dark hair, amber eyes, and a light accent. How is she supposed to handle all that? Even if she could stop drooling long enough to tackle him, he probably wouldn't budge a inch. And speaking of inches, he guarantees that he has them. He's cocky and confident in his abilities in the bedroom and is sure that every women wants him. Even though that is probably true, and she does, of course she would never admit that to him, right? Remember, she is tough and cocky too. When he pushes, she pushes back. And that's what gets his attention. He's never had to work for female attention before. I swear, when her asked HER, "Care for me to show you how ungentlemanly I can be?", it was ME nodding at my kindle. Even though she denied it, the chemistry between them was immediate and scorching.I enjoyed every page from beginning to end and finished in one sitting, sad that it had to end. It was also a learning experience, for instance, did you know that "beer fixes everything?" And did you know that taking your BFF on a stakeout is a bad idea? I fell in love with quite a few characters that I look forward to seeing again in future installments, especially Benny...sigh.

I was already a fan of the Wind Dragons MC series before I started reading Tracker's End, so I already knew that Tracker & Lana had experienced 'lust at first sight'. However; for whatever reason, they were not acting on it.Tracker is a muscled, tattooed fearless biker with sexy long blonde hair. He knows he's hot and has the women drooling over his man bun, and his...um...jewelry. And yes, Lana is among them. She wants him, but she's not willing to stand in line for his attention. It's hell for her to have to watch him with other women, but it's not something she can avoid. Since her best friend, Anna, is Arrow's old lady and lives at the clubhouse she can't see her without seeing him.Tracker saw Lana as a gorgeous, sweet, timid, wholesome girl that he felt was not suited to his club lifestyle. But that didn't stop him from fantasizing about her in those sexy Librarian glasses. When she agrees to help out Sin & Faye, the club President and his old lady by being their nanny for the summer, it begins. She's there, on his turf, every day.Is there enough water in the world to put out the fire that their chemistry sparks? How long will she be able to hold out once he turns his attention to her? How long will it take him to give in to his feelings once she stops running?And something for you to look forward to...her big secret...it's so delicious. OMG!!! I loved it and couldn't stop smiling and giggling as I enjoyed it and anticipated the big reveal.There is no such thing as too much Wind Dragons MC. I am so addicted to this "family, not of blood but of choice." They are all so full of personality they keep me grinning at their witty banter and outrageous antics. Especially kinky Rake, he's the worst. I'm so ready to learn the story behind him and his ex, Bailey. I highly recommend this incredible series.

I have had many laptops and netbooks. I turned to netbooks because my previous laptops were too heavy to carry on my commute to work. My first netbooks were ok, I had all the Asus EEE models, 7", 9" and the 10" 1000, 1005 etc. Some had keyboards that were too small and screens that could not play HD movies. My last netbook was actually a netbook tablet called the acer w 500. It was very good at playing HD movies and the keyboard worked great. The tablet function was tough to type a long email, so I found myself using the keyboard most of the time. I believe the tablet phase will fade. So I read the fantastic reviews on this model and noticed it was using an upgraded APU processor So I found a refurbished model for $159 dollars less and I must tell you this is the best net book available!!  First it flys! It is to me almost as fast as the I3 processors with better battery life. I notice a major difference between the AMD C50 (my old Acer w500) and the AMD C60.I played a HD video 1280x720 at 56fps with out a glitch. This is a video I could not play on any previous netbook I owned.(except the Acer w 500) The included camera came  as a .3 meg model but when I clicked on the Acer crystal eye webcam it told me there is a free update and after it ran, it is now a 1.3 meg model. It went from 640x480 to 1280x1024 with increment settings down to 320x240. Very cool! Here are my pros and cons:Pros:Very light (feels lighter than 3 lbs)Only 1" thickComes with 4gb memoryThe dual core C60 w/ 1.3ghz boosted APU processor is a major+Battery Life is really nice (6+ hrs for me)Screen is bright with a 1366x768 resolutionPlays HD videos with out a glitch (Played a 1280x720 at 56fps)500GB hard drive (no space worries)1.3 camera with free Acer upgrade3 usb ports, 1 HDMI and 1 SD card slot.Cons:No bluetooth (will add small external)Keyboard has slight flex when you push down.With all items mentioned above. I am very happy with this machine!UPDATE: Installed the IOgear bluetooth USB adapter. Works great. A little tricky to install though. I found out the best way was to insert the adapter let windows 7 load its drivers then I ran the IO gear software and that installed the drivers and software over the windows 7 drivers and everything works mint! IOGear adapter is just $10 on Amazon.

Ok my first purchase was a foscam from foscam's website. My second purchase was a Wansview model 541 (this model) to save a few bucks. The Wansview took a while for me to figure out because the IP of the camera comes fixed at factory set 192.168.0.178. Why I have no idea. This IP was out of the range of my router so I had to figure out how to connect to it. If you have a Linksys router it should work fine. The foscam camera came with a automatic IP that will adjust to your router. Typically with these IP cameras you plug in the ethernet wire camera to router and next plug in the power cord in that order (imporant) wait for the connection and enter the IP in your browser the camera is using in your router and you will connect. NOT WITH THIS CAMERA! If the factory IP I listed doesn't fit in your router range you must insert the disc that came with the camera, run the BS search, select the B model and hit scan then check the automatic IP box and it will update and you will be set. The camera reset and came up in my router as 10.0.x.xx and I could connect fine! I double checked the alarm motion detection and its the same as the Foscam. Now to the pros and cons:PROS:Picture almost as good as a foscam but colors are washed up a little.Listening audio works fine (only on IE or my android ip cam viewer app)camera movement works fine but no presets (bummer)camera alarm works nice, it sends me emails with pictures and sensitivity can easily be adjusted. After double checking its the same as my Foscam.CONS:Night Vision IR will not shutoff (foscam does)Listening audio doesn't work on Chrome or Firefox (foscam does)NO presets (ptz) You can't set where the camera will point except with manual movement. My foscam can be set with presets that will automatically scan to that location (very handy) This function on my foscam works great on my android phone using IP Cam viewer. I wanted the preset function and was disappointed that the Wansview doesn't have it even though wansview lists it as a PTZ camera on their web site. I use firefox alot and I was also disappointed that there is no listening audio on that browser. The foscam uses a VLC plugin for audio on the firefox browser. I do use the android app IP Cam viewer pro which works great. So to finish, if an extra $25 dollars won't break you, get a FOSCAM.UPDATE: As I use both cameras and compare their functions, I updated over time and use. I have since (today 2/1/2012) purchased the latest fosccam model F18910W. Will review after I receive it !

Incredible camera. I have revised the setup to make it easier Here is the set up:To access from your PC when you are on your home network as a baby cam etc:1. Plug your camera into your router with the cable provided, plug it into the wall. The camera head will rotate. this is normal2. Run the IP Camera tool that is provided on the CD. It will find your camera and give an IP address. Enter this address into your browser. A login will popup. Enter Admin and you then click on live video and see your camera. You can now get into your camera and change settings or view and use as a baby cam or monitor from any home computerThats it! for a wired setup. Any changes you want to make can be made in the Device Management section after you login....Note: after you make a change, the camera will reset almost every time.NOW A WIRELESS SETUP!While connected to your camera in the Ethernet wired mode, click on the device management:1. click on wireless lan setup2. click scan and click on your wireless device that appears in the box (sometimes you have to scan multiple times)3. Most of the info will be automatically loaded. I just added my wifi sharekey code.4. Now Click the submit button, the camera will reset, you can now disconnect your cable. Wait a minute or two. If the wireless takes you will see the led in the back blinking very fast. If the led  is not blinking fast redo the setup again for the wireless. Wait a few minutes then Run IP camera tool and you should see the IP address of your camera. Enter it into your browser just like you did with the wired setup and you are all set! NOTE: if you constantly have problems connecting, reset your camera with a pin pushed into the reset button and hold for 20 seconds or so and repeat all the above starting with the wired mode. I had to do this on one camera only. Its rare but could happen.I found the camera to be fantastic, the IR mode in darkness is incredible, you have full control of the camera and the audio listening works great with IE and can work with firefox or Google Chrome after you load the free audio plugin VLC player. Good idea to click on device management and type your new password in user settings. I use firefox and while watching the live video, on the left you will see PT numbers. With these you can adjust your presets. Move the camera to point at a certain object, press the set to the left of the preset button and when ever you press  go to the right of the numbers, the camera will automatically move to that preset. Very Cool! In device management you can go to PTZ settings and set the PT speed to 1 for a faster speed.FYI, if you lose power the IP access code could change so I put my router on a UPS unit (a battery backup power supply). These are pretty cheap now a days. I also use it on my cable modem, so if I lose power I still have internet!Next how to set up port forwarding with a android app to access your camera on the phone.Go into your router. IF you do not know the access code google it. I needed to setup my daughters Verizon Router and I just googled it. Go to port forwarding in the router and enter the camera IP address and mac address and that's it. you can now put any of the iphone or android camera apps enter your camera Ip address and you can see your camera from anywhere. I use IP CAM PRO on my android smart phone. Good LuckI don't know why so many people have problems setting this up, when so many people in their reviews explain everything you need! The wired and the wireless have two different IP addresses and their MAC addresses are listed on the bottom of the camera! Plus you can google foscam, they have a easy do it yourself guide for windows and mac in their support page. ENJOY!

Read the reviews and purchased this heater from Amazon. The room I use it in has cathedral ceiling, it is approx 20x22ft with 4 large windows, a glass door and 1 very large window. It is our main TV den. Previously I was using a electric oil filled radiator type heater. The oil filled heater could not handle the room. As I type this, it is 34 degrees outside and I have this honeywell heater set for 73 degrees and when I first turned it on the room was 60 degrees despite my home thermostat being set at 68 degrees. That shows you why I need a heater and how all the windows do lower the temperature. Well it took about an hour, or a little less and the room is 74 degrees and the heater shutoff automatically as it should. This heater blows away the oil filled radiator. So far I am very pleased with this heater, it sits under the very large window, hardly noticeable at approx 9" high and 42" long. Very easy to set the thermostat which works perfectly, extremely quiet and this heater is keeping my main home gas heater from turning on as the heat from the main tv den now moves into the main living room where the thermostat is. This perfect for me since its just my wife and I and we spend most of our time in the large room. So now I'm anxious to see my electric bill. If its reasonable I will be a happy camper!  Will followup when I receive it!  Note the grill on this heater gets hot, so I would not recommend it for a young child's room.UPDATE: I received my electric bill from Nov 10th to Dec 10th 2011 for 1 month and my electric bill went up only $10 to $147 and I have not checked but I bet my gas bill on my central system is so much lower! So far I am a happy camper!UPDATE: 2-5-12My gas bill is 1/3 of what it was last year! The heat from this electric heater travels from our main den and keeps the living room thermostat from turning on as often. I live in NJ and this year has been a milder winter but we have had 1 snow day and many below freezing days and I notice a difference with this electric heater.

This adapter will convert the RV female generator connector on your generator to a regular 120VAC outlet. I have the Champion 4000 watt generator and it only came with 1 regular outlet. The additional RV connector on the Champion generator is a 25amp connector and this adapter converts it beautifully and now I have two outlets to connect to my home appliances. I tested it and it works perfectly !!

If you just purchased the Motorola Triumph or a similar phone this is a must have! Like one of the other reviewers said "this is a great product for the price". Everything worked. The case was just slightly snug , but a few minutes of stretch and pull and it fits perfectly, loose so it can easily come out. I like the magnetic cover on the pouch. I purchased this for the case only.  I already had the car adapter and AC charger but my wife needed it so this worked out perfectly. Nice products, very pleased!UPDATE:2-6-12After having these products now for awhile, I can tell you the case doesn't last. It is cheaply constructed. There are much better cases available all the other products that came with this bundle are working perfectly.

First I've been an Amazon reviewer reader and writer for many years! I use Amazon because I know the reviews are from real people like myself and I can tell from these reviews if a product is a problem. Now as a Virgin Mobile Samsung Intercept owner I wanted to upgrade and this large thin screen with a 1ghz processor seemed like a no brainer, so I read the reviews and what? There are many 5 star and many 1 star reviews....this confused me, but knowing that that is most always a 30 day money-back guarantee with the Virgin mobile phones I took my Amazon discounted Motorola Triumph page to my local Bestbuy electronics store and they matched the price! So if I may I would like to go into a quick past with my old Virgin mobile Samsung intercept for a second....I purchased the Samsung Intercept and had all sorts of problems, I upgraded the system operating system and with the correct apps made the Samsung a very stable smart phone but slow. I was pleased, but after a year and seeing that Virgin Mobile has a new DROID X phone called the Motorola Triumph I had to go for it. The Motorola phone size is thin, sturdy, beautiful screen and fast, in fact compared to the Samsung, super fast. The memory to run programs is about 1gb. This is just for programs!!! Everything works perfectly, Blue-tooth on my car, wifi, mp3 player,(I'm using power amp app which is fantastic)for videos I added the MX player app which is a must to play HD videos, speaking of HD videos/pictures the camera has a flash and takes perfect pictures and the camcorder can take 1280x 720 videos!  2x free app is a must for saving the battery draw. The 3G speed is about 3 times the Samsung Intercept, the screen is larger than an Iphone and super thin and the detail on the screen is just like my friends HTC fancy large android phone. I checked and my phone software ends in .39  Maybe if you check the one stars on this phone you will their software ends in .38  I don't know the difference and I don't care. I love this phone and I can tell you the reason people are complaining about the battery life is because this phone is so fast, so bright, so detailed and holds so many apps its hard to put it down and shut the screen off!!!!  In conclusion, I would like to point out that I did have a problem with the GPS starting time, so I did much reading and loaded the free GPS tester app on the phone (free on the market) and now I can run the tester if there is a problem and see the satellite signal etc and when I switch to the navigator GPS on the phone it shines!! This is the best Virgin Mobile Phone on the market! I'm one  still on the #25 dollar plan. BTW use superbox app, it does everything you need.PROS:Fast,runs every app I can throw at itVery bright screen and very detailedMemory for holding and running apps is 1gb (great)Memory for running the processor is 200mb or moreProcessor speed is 1gb  (fast)Pictures and Videos are fantastic taking and playing (set to high)Camera flash works wellCase is well designed with a rubber none slip feel and very thinCons:Battery life drains faster than I would like1. because the phone can not be put down!!!!2. Use the battery saver apps like 2x battery or others.IF you have a problem with the GPS starting,try running the free GPS tester app first.UPDATE:Everything above still stands. I also found the black Empire kit that Amazon sells with the pouch, car charger and AC charger to be a must. Also the phone comes with the side power button programmed to drop cellphone calls. You can unprogram this in settings. This is a must for me because I was cancelling my calls while taking the phone out of the pouch. I also downloaded the super keyboard app and it works better for emailing /texting on the screen. This phone is now my emailer, texter, mp3 player, camcorder, camera, flashlight, gaming device, newspaper reader, weather monitor, GPS (better than a garmin) my calculator, VM Minutes monitor, barcode reader,google voice search and much more anyone who gives this phone a one star is crazy, this is the best VM smartphone to date!UPDATE: April 2012 all above stands, except this phone does take a while to connect to the GPS signal and I now found that the fastest way to connect to GPS is to run the App GPS Status and toolbox. It is better than GPS tester and seems to help the phone connect to the GPS signal faster also I'm now using the GPS app Waze...wow Great GPS to Traveling...Try it!UPDATE: August 2012 all the above still stands. Love this phone. I noticed that Virgin mobile is now selling the HTC Evo 3d with 4G and a 1.2 ghz dual core processor. Then I looked at the PC mag reviews and the Amazon reviews and it appears that the HTC Evo 3g has problems receiving phone calls and texting. Too bad, I was ready to upgrade. PC Mag also says the Motorola Triumph is the best smartphone on virgin mobile to date. I agree!UPDATE: September 2012 Because I was frustrated that this phone took too long to connect to the gps satellites, I went to my local radio shack store and purchased the new Virgin Mobile HTC Evo 3D 4G phone. Radio Shack gives a 30 day money back guarantee, so how could I go wrong? It is noticeably faster than the Triumph but has a glich with texting. Glad I don't text much. My BW now has my Triumph and it works fine for her. See all the reviews on this unit!
I use this to charge my Virgin mobile Samsung Intercept and Virgin Mobile MIFI and anything else that needs a mini USB. Great device, very please, eliminates the long wire cord.

I purchased this generator after reading all the reviews. Amazon was selling it at $325 but I found a better price at Cabelas so shop around. Usually Amazon has a great price. The generator arrived by UPS with no damage to the box. I had previously gone to the Championpowerequipmentl.com and downloaded the manual. I opened the box installed the wheel kit and handle (very easy to install and a must have item) I then installed the spark arrester (two screws installs in seconds) and added 10-30 oil using a 16oz cup and the cool funnel that comes with the generator. (generator takes about 20oz) I added gas (the built-in gas gauge is very cool) Set the choke to on, Pulled the cord and nothing, pulled the cord again and nothing. Stupid me the red switch on the side was down in the off position. (I thought that switch was for the electric only it is not) Pushed the switch up and 1 pull and the generator started. I don't have a L5-30 connector yet, so I used the 20 amp standard outlet that comes with the generator. I hooked up 1 1500 watt heater and a 2HP  air compressor and it ran both with out a problem. This unit will easily handle my refrigerator, gas furnace and some extras which I will wire into my house breakers for an emergency. I ran the generator for 4-1/2 hours and changed the oil. The manual says 5hrs. The oil was black. Added new Oil and now it is ready for any upcoming emergency. Yes it is as loud as a lawnmower, but not disturbing to me. This is my first generator and I am very pleased with this product.

This USB device is perfect for my airpad as an external usb so I can easily move files from my computer to my airpad tablet. The Elago is white and matches the rim color, it sits flush on the pad rim and only sticks out a 1/4 of a inch. My micro sd card sits inside the USB tightly and cannot be seen. There is a little yellow micro tab that allows you to remove the card if needed. The unit also lights up with a little blue light to let you know when it is being used. Very Cool! It also comes with a well designed cord and a plastic cap that slips over the USB. The only con is the cap, if you install this on your keychain, I would not use the cap since it would probably fall off. I have read that the sd card can fall out, I find this hard to believe since the card is very light and fits tightly into the USB. Nice product, I am pleased with this device!

After a couple of years my previous micro sd usb device had broken and I knew it was time to get another. I had it on my key chain and it worked great. This model looked exactly like my old one so I purchased it. Hooked on my key chain and as soon as I needed it to install a file into my computer at work, the cord fell off!! I ended up slipping the cord back on and holding it with crazy glue. The problem is the weak piece of metal where the cord hooks can easily bend. Hey it was a cheap device for a cheap price. I will look again for a better unit.

First I am a true Amazon customer and have been for years. I always read the reviews on Amazon before I purchase. The reviews on this card were excellent so I jumped into a no name brand and got just want I deserved! I order this for my X10 tablet to replace my Sandisk 8gb micro SD card. I was so disappointed with the writing speed on this card 2.8 mb per second....are you kidding me? My old 8g Sandisk writes at 7.8mb per second. End of story. This is going back. Also when loading files from my windows computer I was getting errors and windows was telling me it wanted to scan and fix.???  No problem, its going back for a refund. This is the first refund to Amazon in a very very long time. I should point out the read speed on this card was excellent 8mb per second but the slow write speed and the errors are not going to cut it! I'm going back to Sandisk.

I have a brand new Toshiba 3D tv. I can watch Blu Ray 3D, Comcast on demand 3D movies, Side by Side or Top-Bottom with no problems, but this DVD did not work. It looked like a mess on the screen. Too bad because I wanted a copy because Comcast was showing this on their free on demand movie channel and the 3D was amazing. The Movie was not good, but the 3D had scenes where Walter Cronkite seems to pop out of the screen. You do not see many pop outs with todays movies in 3D. I'll keep searching.

Back in 2002 I purchased a top of the line Pioneer Plasma for $4.3k for my den and last year I purchase a 40inch LCD for the bedroom for 1.0k. Even thought its many years old, the Plasma holds its own, but I was due for a new den TV and when Amazon offered this deal to me, my wife told me to jump on it and I did. The screen is huge, the 2D picture is breathtaking with live HD. 3D is fun to watch and very enjoyable! I'm still learning all the features of this TV, I can say that I have not experienced any of the clouding/ backlighting issues that are mentioned in many reviews. I believe Toshiba took care of these with programing updates. So here are my Pros and Cons:Pros:2D HD picture is incredible actually breathtaking if its a live signal3D HD picture is thrilling and funConnected to our wireless network easilyRemote can handle all my devices (TV,Cable,BD Player, Stereo)Has builtin net tv,netflix,news,weather,facebook,widgets and more4 hdmi inputs ,2 usb, 1 sd card,RGB and audio inputsCONS:The Stand is tricky to assembleTry to watch 3D with a 2D signal looks terribleScreen has beautiful black mirror finish that could show a bright reflected light  not a problem for me but I could see it could be depending TV location)I can now really see the difference in programing. Can't wait for football season!! Amazon used a delivery company called pilot. They were great! They delivered the TV without any damage and even helped me assemble the stand. Netflix works super! I haven't tried all the other net channels. I read all the reviews on this TV and the mention about the blacks are cloudy, the 240hz must be off for the 3d to prevent jumpy screen. None of this has to be adjusted on my unit. I noticed when I put it on 3d the 240hz setting went off, the blacks are incredible! On the second day, the TV asked me if I would want to download the latest updates, which I did. I guess the only complaint and its a small complaint is while watching a 2D movie, if I press the 3D button and put the glasses on the screen is not watchable! Its distorted, but in watching a 3D movie from my player or cable company is great! Am I doing something wrong?UPDATE: Thanks to comments I wasn't doing anything wrong. This set will not convert 2D to 3D. No problem for me the other sets I have looked at that do convert 2D to 3D are not exciting anyway. Still love this TV, huge bright picture with deep black that I have not seen before and super colors. This sets blows away any other set I have owned and I've owned quite a few! 3D from my cable company is incredible! I had a problem with loosing my wireless connection to the tv and found if I shut off the enhanced N selection, it connects without a problem to my  N Linksys wireless router in G mode at 54mbps, and with this setting everything works, netflix, widgets and more!UPDATE:Like most new digital TV's this TV only has a digital audio output. If you have an old stereo like I do with only analog audio inputs, you will need a digital to analog converter. Amazon is selling the Fiio D3 digital to analog converter with cable for $24. You just connect the  cable to the tv then to the converter, run the analog audio cables from the converter to your stereo and you are all set! No noise! No delay! Now any hdmi input device will automatically connect to the stereo through the tv. Very cool!

The fan is beautiful, very well built super quiet. My wife had me take down a old fan in a bedroom and install this one. I am a master electrician and I have installed many fans. With this one the lamp wiring is very tight in the container and a connection came apart so I had to take apart the fan and reinstall the lamp. Other than that it works and looks great!

As a stylus it works perfectly as do many other products. As a pen it also works fine, but I wish the pen cap would fit over the stylus when writing and it doesn't so you could lose the cap. That's my only small complaint!

Before purchasing the Virgin Mobile 2200 mifi, I was using the Virgin Mobile Ovation 760 Broadband2Go Wireless USB stick. It worked ok, but I experienced dropped connections and both fast and slow performances. I just received a new tablet and I wanted to get internet on my laptop and/or tablet on the train while commuting to work from New Jersey to New York. So I purchased the Virgin mobile 2200 mifi and immediately I noticed a major improvement. I have not received 1 dropped connection, my tablet and my laptop connect perfectly and automatically to the Virgin Mobile mifi after my first initial setup. The unit has one button, turn it on and wait a very moments and you can connect up to 5 computers/tablets/net-books to this product! If you purchase it from Wally, you will get a special 1gb upgrade. This was a pleasant surprise! I can't believe all the negative reviews on this product. All I can say is before you purchase this, check the SPRINT coverage maps to make sure you can get a connection. (Virgin uses sprint towers) I am very happy with this product, the battery lasts hours and charges easily through a USB or from an AC outlet with the supplied power supply.UPDATE:Got clobbered from Hurricane Irene. No power, no tv, no internet from Comcast. So I turned on my Virgin Mobile MiFi and the whole family was connected for days!!! This product is fantastic, much better than the old USB 3G stick. I am shocked by all the negative reviews!! Maybe these people expect super speed!? I'm impressed with the speed, easy to surf the web, check emails etc. Maybe its the area? I am on the Jersey shore and it works at work in New York just as well.

I currently use a Acer W 500 windows machine as my portable computer. I wanted a smaller light android tablet to use around the house, on the train to listen to music, watch videos, check mail and surf the web. Read all the reviews on many 7 inch tablets and settled on this one. Wally is selling this at an incredible price, and I could not resist. I have a Android Phone (Samsung intercept)so I knew how to use this tablet from the start. Here are the pros and con:PROS:Touch screen works perfectly, better than many capacitive screensVery light weighs .8 lb also very thin .5 thickCame with a 8gb micro SD cardKindle for Android works great for reading EbooksWeb surfing is fast, the included browser works fine (no need to upgrade)Mail apps make it a breeze to check emailTablet comes with Docs to go (which is a great app)WiFi connects fast to my networkBluetooth music to my headphones works perfectlyPlenty of memory for the processor to function quickly (420mb)Built in FM radio  (I also use radio.com and pandora app for fm and am and music)Battery life is great (haven't run it past 40% despite using  it for hours)Operation is very fast, and there are many fantastic apps to download from the Android marketCons:Does not have 3G built inDoes not play all videos or flashNo HDMI output162mb app memory (wish it had more)No front facing camera only a rear camera (not really a con for me I use my Acer for skype)I'm liking this tablet more and more! This tablet allows me to connect without having to sign a contract with the big wireless cellphone companies. I ordered the Virgin Mobile MiFi 2200 which will convert the 3G signal to wifi which this tablet accepts easily. Will comment after I receive it. For my problem with some videos, I have downloaded many video players from the market and found the Mobo player to work the best.  All in all I am very happy with this unit, using it out by the pool, on the deck, in the house. Great unit!UPDATE: received  the Virgin Mobile MiFi 2200 and now I have 3G anywhere with this tablet!!!  No contract!!  Buy from Wally and you will get 1gb upgrade!! Additional points on this tablet. I have loaded quite a few great apps from the market, but I wish the app memory was larger than 160mb. The Processor memory is 420mb which really makes this tablet fly. You must download superbox so you can control your apps and cache. Superbox can also load all your apps on your SD card to give you room for more apps. The apps I recommend are, yahoo mail (if you use yahoo), kindle for android, us newspapers, power amp, mobo player, tunein radio, angry birds (if you like games), textplus if you want to send text messages, software data cable will allow you to send files wirelessly to any computer using your wifi.TIP: Screen is so sensitive when scrolling through many items, I turn my finger around and use my nail. Works great to avoid selection. Try it.

Before you read my review, I'd like to point out that you may see Acer pictures on Amazon that make it look like different machines with different prices. They are not. There are two models available the W500 (this model) has Windows home premium and W500P, has windows professional. Now on to my review of the W500:Received my Acer Iconia 32gb windows 7 W500 Tablet/ netbook from Amazon yesterday and immediately I unwrapped and fired it up mounted in the keyboard. After starting, I removed Adobe reader 9.1, Acer games, Ebay world, Skype4.1, and reloaded Skype 5.3, added Firefox with the grab and drag add on for easy tablet use, added sumatra pdf (takes no space compared to adobe9.1,  removed live essentials and more. My previous computer was a Asus T91mt tablet/netbook, right away I noticed the following about this Acer, screen is much brighter and more detailed, audio is louder especially on earphones, installed my 32gb SD card from my old computer with all my files and I could easily transfer to various folders on the computer. I adjusted the stick mouse and found it easy to operate. (But I am a old IBM user so you may want to use a USB mouse while in the keyboard mount) I have read reviews that the screen is top heavy and could fall out of the keyboard. Not so. Although the screen is heavier than the keyboard, I found it sits attached to the keyboard very nicely, I even leaned the screen and keyboard way back and it still would not tip and in fact I'm typing this review on my lap now!!! (Leaning the screen forward toward you while in the keyboard it could come out since that's how you remove the screen) Haven't experimented with the tablet yet, but I can see it is well built! Very well built! As a test, I played a 1080 blu-ray movie (the Mask) from my SD Card on this unit and it played with out a glitch. This is a movie that would not play on any of my previous netbooks and I've owned 4 of them. I have read in other reviews that this computer handles everything thrown at it. I also read the match up of the INTEL dual core 550N against this AMD C-50 CPU/GPU and the AMD blew away the intel. It took AMD 5 years to develop this special processor, a blend of a Processor and a graphics chip on one die! Very Incredible. AMD calls it a APU. Goodbye CPU! I can do everything on this machine that I do on my desktop, connected to my home wireless N in seconds, connected to my wireless HP network printer in seconds.  More to come! So far very happy! This unit blows away my former Asus T91mt tablet/netbook! I am so glad that I didn't get sucked into the hype of all the latest tablets with honeycomb 3. I'll keep my android software on my phone where it belongs! I must mention there is a review by Sticky on the other listed Acer W500 on Amazon that was very passionate and convinced me to purchase this computer and he was right on with his review!UPDATE:It has only been a few days later. I can't stop playing with this unit!!  I skyped with my grand daughter 50 miles away and the incoming picture and  audio was perfect. I was told my audio was noisy (I later found the microphone setting in windows was boosted to 30+) I adjusted that. I can't think of one item I don't like about this computer. Its so quiet! Tablet is bright, very detailed and easy to surf the web etc. The tablet has a nice  border, which makes the unit easy to hold so you are not putting your fingers on the glass. Bought a Targus capacitive stylus. Perfect for drawing and writing and browsing on the tablet. This is a must have, especially if you use the Microsoft journal that comes with the netbook for writing or printing notes directly on he screen. (Plus it keeps the glass clean) Tablet is fantastic, it came from the factory with a clear very thin plastic screen cover. You can use the screen with the cover on or take it off. I peeled mine off, but I didn't notice a difference in response. Screen is very responsive. I haven't read all the gestures that can be performed, I know if you hold your finger or stylus on the screen it will act like a mouse right click. I like the windows button (which lights blue), which allows you to access the task bar and start menu with ease. My old Asus tablet had a problem accessing the task bar especially if you set it to hide position. Not with this unit! Still experimenting!UPDATE: (a week later)Love this machine. Purchased the Targus TSM148US mini bag. It is in my opinion the perfect bag for this machine, holds the keyboard and screen with plenty of room for your power supply and earphones , capacitive stylus and more etc. I also purchased the tablet holder by Arkon, it is a folding tablet stand and this solves the problem for people that complained that the screen doesn't fold while attached to the keyboard. Works like it was built for this tablet!  I am also using my android phone with PdaNet app to get internet on the train via blue-tooth. Very cool! I'm easily getting 6 hrs of battery life browsing the web, even more with the wifi off and reading my Ebooks using kindle, my skype sessions with my grand daughter are incredible! The video and audio are perfect! Also I like Internet explorer 9 as a touch browser. This Acer is better than any previous netbook I have owned. This  machine is a keeper. Brightest screen I have owned in a netbook, great screen detail, with windows 7 I can do everything I need in a computer! I could go on and on.UPDATE (1 month later)All the above still stands, this is to date the best netbook/pc I have ever owned. It is super quiet, bright screen and nice clean resolution. There is a new bios update at the Acer site. I ran it and upgraded my bios to 1.08 This is truly a very well built tablet and after a month of use, I'm enjoying it more and more. I just played a HD Movie file that was 1920 x 1080 with not even a glitch. My dual-core 2.5ghz desktop at work can't play this file with out glitches/pauses. This machine is incredible! One last point, I don't remember if I mentioned it in the past but this computer has been reported to accept SDXC cards. Why is this important? SDXC are the newest SD cards and they can go up to 2 terabytes!!  Of course at this time a 2 terabyte card would cost you 5k, but you can purchase a 64gb sdxc card for about $115 dollars and this means this computer unlike many other tablets will always have the room for your future programs!UPDATE (2 months later)Everything above still stands. In fact, my main laptop was a HP 14 inch dual core machine. I gave it to my brother, this Acer is my main laptop, Netbook, Tablet, what ever you wish to call it. Bright screen and very quiet. BTW, I stopped using pdanet and switched to the virgin mobile 2200 mifi to get internet on the train. It is a fantastic product. No contract, buy from wally and you will get a free 1gb upgrade of data per month.UPDATE (January 2013)For those that will question a use of a windows tablet. There is no doubt that if you want a tablet, a windows tablet has many more functions then a android tablet and windows 8 is perfect to install on this unit. For the year 2011 this was a nice tablet/laptop but now its 2013 and OMG there are so many choices out there with windows 8 already installed. There is the HP surface, the Lenovo ideapad, the Lenovo twist and much more. All these mentioned are now better than this machine. Technology gets better every year. So I too have moved on, Presently I am using the Acer Aspire one 722 netbook with the C60 processor but I am looking at one of these models mentioned above. For those who still have their Acer w 500 I bet you installed windows 8 on it to improve touch screen functionality! Right now its the only way to go!

Received my Acer Iconia 32gb windows 7 W500 Tablet/ netbook from Amazon today and immediately I unwrapped and fired it up mounted in the keyboard. After starting, I removed Adobe reader 9.1, Acer games, Ebay world, Skype4.1, and more. My previous computer was a Asus T91mt tablet/netbook, right away I noticed the following about this Acer, screen is brighter and more detailed, audio is louder especially on earphones, installed my 32gb SD card from my old computer with all my files and I could easily transfer to various folders on the computer. I adjusted  the stick mouse and found it easy to operate. (But I am a old IBM user so you may want to use a mouse while in the keyboard mount) I have read reviews that the screen is top heavy and could fall out of the keyboard. Not so. New from B2MP is a loving restoration for Golden Agers: a limited-edition Blu-Ray of THE PUPPETOON MOVIE (79 mins., 1987), Arnold Leibovit’s compilation of classic George Pal shorts framed by new footage of Gumby and friends learning about the work of the late fantasy film pioneer.Similar to Warner Bros.’ various animated films comprised of classic Looney Tunes cartoons, “The Puppetoon Movie” offers a number of Pal’s most memorable shorts in a breezy, fast-moving production fans and casual viewers will both enjoy. Its fine high-def mastering is reason enough for celebration – but B2MP’s marvelous 2-disc Special Edition goes above and beyond with a package that pays tribute to Pal’s legacy altogether.In addition to the film’s 1080p transfer, there are no less than seven Puppetoon shorts making their home video debut in spectacular HD (“And To Think I Saw It On Mulberry Street,” “500 Hats of Bartholomew Cubbins,” “The Sky Princess,” “Rhapsody in Wood,” “Date With Duke,” Jasper and the Beanstalk,” and “Rhythm in the Ranks”), as well as an HD presentation of the Jimmy Durante-Terry Moore B&W feature “The Great Rupert,” and a handful of full-length Puppetoon shorts in standard def (“What Ho She Bumps,” “Mr. Strauss Takes a Walk,” “Olio for Jasper,” “Philips Cavalcade,” “Jasper’s Derby,” “Hoola Boola,” “Ether Symphony,” “Aladdin and the Magic Lamp,” “The Magic Atlas,” “Jasper and the Haunted House,” “The Philips Broadcast of 1938,” and “The Ship of the Ether”).Extended interviews with greats like Ray Harryhausen, Ray Bradbury, Gene Roddenberry, Walt Disney, Wah Chang, Duke Goldstone and Russ Tamblyn are also present. If all of that – and a commentary from Leibovit and animation authority Jerry Beck – wasn’t enough, there’s also Leibovit’s wonderful 1985 documentary “The Fantasy Film Worlds of George Pal.” Presented in standard-def, this loving production offers clips from all of Pal’s classics with fond remembrances from their respective cast members. I first watched the program on a local PBS station in the late ‘80s and it immediately generated my interest in tracking down all of Pal’s productions back in the heyday of VHS and laserdisc.This 3000-copy limited edition is an essential purchase for Pal aficionados, lovers of classic animation and film fantasy alike. Highly recommended!

Though I don't classify it as the funniest film ever made, IT'S A MAD, MAD, MAD, MAD WORLD is undoubtedly one of the biggest cinematic comedies ever mounted in terms of scale - offering a veritable who's who of classic Golden Age comedians in a picture that has long generated a love/hate relationship among viewers. While the movie's artistic merits are debatable, there's no denying that Criterion has produced one of the most praiseworthy restorations we've seen on home video in years with their new Blu-Ray/DVD edition of Stanley Kramer's gargantuan 1963 release.The screenplay by William Rose and his wife, Tania (who had previously written the British car rally comedy "Genevieve"), opens with a group of motorists watching in awe as Smiler Grogan (Jimmy Durante) speeds off a highway overpass, crashing into a ravine where he reveals (prior to literally kicking the bucket) that a treasure is buried under a "Big W" in Palm Springs, California. With this hot tip, the motorists stage a frantic mad dash for the coast, splitting up into different groups and getting into every kind of predicament imaginable. Their progress is tracked by Captain T.G. Culpeper (Spencer Tracy), ready for retirement after spending years as an honest cop, wanting only to bring the situation to a close in order to round out his distinguished career.The crazies he's after include J. Russell Finch (Milton Berle), his wife Emmeline (Dorothy Provine), her mother (Ethel Merman) and, eventually, brother (a funny Dick Shawn); Melville Crump (Sid Caesar) and his wife (Edie Adams); botanist J. Algernon Hawthorne (Terry-Thomas); Ding Bell (Mickey Rooney) and Benjy Benjamin (Buddy Hackett); and the irascible Lennie Pike (Jonathan Winters). However, if that wasn't enough, Kramer filled his supporting roles a wealth of talented and formidable performers, many of whom had already achieved fame or would later to go onto find it - names like Jim Backus, Joe E. Brown, William Demarest, Andy Devine, Selma Diamond, Peter Falk, Norman Fell, Stan Freberg, Sterling Holloway, Don Knotts, and Carl Reiner, plus cameos from Jerry Lewis, Jack Benny, Buster Keaton and the Three Stooges for good measure.Having not lived through its era, "It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" is a tough nut to crack. The movie means a good deal more to nostalgic viewers than anyone else, especially since its comedy is seldom more than gently amusing. The big laughs one would expect from the assembled cast seldom materialize throughout the course of its three hours, and yet as I've come to find out over the years, the movie grows on you. It's not hilarious, but it's likeable, and serves as a time capsule of its day - and where else in the history of cinema have so many legends come together for one motion picture? Even if the film is less than the sum of its parts, seeing these performers working together alone is worthwhile, and Kramer's use of the wide scope frame also makes his comic odyssey visually stimulating.
