I have used Stanley bottles for years.  This is another winner.

This is an interesting product.  We won't use them all the time, but sometimes you really need some soap for a cleanup.  These contain dawn, and it activates when you wet them.  Then you scrub up the counter or whatever and then dry it off with a regular paper towel.  These work well and are very handy.  It's a good idea.  They seem plenty strong as well.

These are pleasant to use and do a good job of getting your hands clean.  The container fits in a vehicle cup holder, which is great, because that's where I need them. At home I prefer to just wash my hands.  The scent is mild.  Very handy.

I like other Pure Protein bars, and these are also good.  Flavor is personal, and these are not the typical protein bars.  They are fruity and sweet, without the common chocolate and peanut butter flavors.  They are a bit sticky in the hand, but I commonly hold bars by the wrapper, so that wasn't an issue.  Filling enough to make a meal and light to carry, these are a good trail food.  No chocolate to melt!

These little blocks light easily and worked well to start our campfires.  I haven't tried them with charcoal.  They burn long enough - several minutes - to get the wood going.  They worked even though the wood was damp.

We have an 8-month old yorkie/schnauzer mixed breed who weighs just under 10 pounds.  She is a bundle of energy and would eat treats all day long if we let her.  These treats are a bit smaller than the chewy treats by the same company (therefore the name bites!) and they have a strong smell of BBQ.  I wasn’t sure if our puppy would like them but not only does the smell attract her attention they are kind of like a BBQ flavored gummi and she loves them.  I do like having a variety of treats for rewards so she doesn’t get bored and will still “work for treats”.  I will get these again.

We have an 8-month old yorkie/schnauzer mixed breed who weighs just under 10 pounds.  She is a bundle of energy and would eat treats all day long if we let her.  We have been looking for treats with different textures, both for variety and so that they will last longer than it takes for her to inhale them.  These treats do indeed have a chewy texture that she really likes.  She loves the peanut butter flavor and it is less messy than giving her real peanut butter.  I can’t say that last any longer than the crumbly ones but they are a nice change of pace for her and she loves them.

I am so sorry to say that all three of these taste horrible, have a gritty consistency and a yucky, lingering aftertaste. The aftertaste took hours to go away, even after mouthwash and bread slices. With so many ways to use up my quota of junk food calories, it seems unnecessary to waste them on this high fat, high calorie mixture. Very very sorry to be so negative, but ewwww.

Gene Kelly was once asked why musicals were no longer a staple of modern movies and he said something to the effect that “no one knows how to make them anymore.” (This was a short time after he appeared in Xanadu. Today, only a precious few know how to do it: the producers and director of Into the Woods.This is as close as any contemporary movie has come to making a musical that most audiences can see—the caveat being that Into the Woods is a mature twist on fairy tale characters and not for the purist or the very young. Disney toned down the sequences with Red Riding Hood and the Wolf as well as the Baker’s Wife and Prince Charming to the point that things are very obtuse.That all said, Into the Woods has a lot of comedy, one of Sondheim’s most melodic scores and a brisk pace (kudos to director Rob Marshall for that). And to be fair to the subject matter, one can watch the network series Once Upon a Time and see the evil Queen pulling hearts out of her victims and a naked-under-the-sheets Show White and Prince Charming interrupted in the middle of, as my dad used to call it, “spoo-ja-doo,” only to exuberantly resume after their company leaves.A lot of attention has been awarded to the biggest stars of the film, so let’s focus on others who also deliver remarkable performances—no mean feat in a musical film, especially one with the challenging music and lyric structure of Sondheim.James Corden is the emotional center of the film and the character with whom the audience most connects; Christine Baranski makes every syllable and gesture count as always as one of the big screen’s best evil Stepmothers and Tracey Ullmann brings superb comic timing to a somewhat thankless role (she and Baranski could have played any number of roles in this musical). As one of the stepsisters, the astonishing Tammy Blanchard makes one forget she also played Karen Carpenter and Judy Garland. Even Hagrid’s girlfriend turns up as the Giant’s Wife.Once again, a modestly-budgeted movie proves that less money and tight time frames (and less indulegence) can result in fine, profitable films. The art direction and costuming has a painterly quality, very much as if it came from an Arthur Rackham book.What Into the Woods is not is cozy and comfy. Yes, there are songs like “No One is Alone” that offer solace and reassurance, it’s almost an anti-fairy tale in the familiar sense (the original fairy tales were quite dark). Many, many messages flow out of the lyrics: “Life can be unpleasant you should know,” “I’m not good, I’m not nice, I’m just right” and “Nice doesn’t always mean good.”The Blu-ray contains an audio commentary (thank you!) and several interesting behind-the-scenes vignettes, making this a fine package, especially when combined with the deluxe edition of the soundtrack (with all the songs and music).

This watch has a nice gold tone round face with numbers you can clearly read. The band is fabric, kind of like grosgrain ribbon. It is ivory in color and designed to be reversible so that it is plain on one side and has gold metallic dots on the other. The beauty of this band is how easy it is to take off and put on. It is easy to clean with mild soap and water. The watch also has the normal pin type band fasteners if you prefer a different type of watch band. This watch is functional and attractive and has the added bonus that you don't have to pull your phone out of your pocket to check the time! Remember those days?

Right off the bat I need to say that the box art for this game is very misleading. The picture on the box shows real cupcakes with real candles on them and the tagline "A Game For Fans of Checkers…and Cupcakes!” It looks like a children’s baking set or that you actually play checkers with real cupcakes. Admittedly, the back of the box shows the actual playing pieces but that is not what you see at first and some parents might back off from it thinking it involves baking and playing with real cupcakes, yikes!The game definitely would appeal more the girls than boys due to the cupcake theme (especially the pink frosting). That being said, the game is pretty much a straight forward checkers game with the exception of the popping dice. There are three dice in the popper with an image of either a chocolate candle or a strawberry (pink) candle. When it is your turn, you pop the dice and you get three moves based on the color of the candles revealed. What this means is that you can move the other person’s cupcakes. The controller of the popper controls the entire board for their turn and therefore can move the other player’s cupcakes backward of otherwise make the board more favorable to them. If you do ever manage to get your cupcakes to the opposite side of the board they are “kinged” with a foam candle and can no longer be moved by the other player.There are two disadvantages to this from my perspective. The first is that it can make the game take much longer to play which is an issue for me as a parent. The second (and this is subjective based on your child and your child rearing philosophy), the negative aspect of moving and 8 year-old’s (this is the minimum age recommended for players) cupcake back can be problematic. Of course, the objective of checkers is to jump and take all of your opponent’s pieces to win the game and playing games is one of the earliest ways to teach kids to be gracious losers, I get that. My issue is that frustration is not usually one of kids’ easiest things to learn to cope with and constantly having your piece moved back to where it came from. It is obviously an individual call on this. Personally I see these cupcakes being repurposed for a very cute tea party and that would be fine by me.

I chose this primarily for my son because we always buy Pocky when we can find it. (They sell it at Epcot.) My daughter found the cream taste a little too much like white chocolate, but we enjoy the buttercream taste just fine.Pockys can be habit forming, and there is the danger of grabbing a fistful and stuffing it into one's mouth. But in these health-conscious days, a single Pocky once in a while is a nice way to indulge without overdoing it.

I wasn't sure about this hose at first but after using it I am a big fan. It is very thin and flexible and because of it's light weight it is easy to get to all the places in the yard that need watering. I initially thought it was not all that kink resistant until I realized it was how I was handling it that was the problem. Now even if it does kink it is very simple to give the hose a little "flick" to unkink it easily. I especially enjoy how it is not stiff like some hoses which makes it easier for me to put away.

This seems to be a serviceable gaming mouse.  It has kind of a weird shape that takes some getting used to and it seems to be geared towards first person shooter games based on it's configuration but it works well for all types of games that I have played with it.  I have not experienced any problems using it.  Some people might want to have more buttons than the three on this mouse but that is not an issue for me.

We were very exciting to set this up and see how our puppy liked it, as she loves being in cubbyholes and under blankets. Assembly was hard at first, because the instructions did not make it clear that you have to slide the poles through the corner openings and then fasten them across with the top bar. i spent a while trying to get the side bars to stay up and there was no room, until I realizes that the legs had to go through the openings. But maybe that's me.Puppy was hesitant at first, so we put some toys and a blanket inside. She peered around it, checking the quality of the construction no doubt, and ventured inside. Then she took the toys out and played with them. She has since gotten used to the house and enjoys playing in it. We tried to put it out in the garden or in the patio but she was very upset. She does not cope well with change -- but clearly she has declared this house her own. Now that I know how to assemble it, we can easily travel with it, though seeing it somewhere else might upset our crazy little puppy.
The Blender was well packaged and appears as a quality product. The online videos help on the applications and it has plenty of power. Great pricing, delivery and performance.
Great assortment of tags for a great price including the holder.

Purchased as a spare - this Massager arrived as promised and worked perfectly. I appreciate the many modes but it would be useful if there was a discussion on what each mode offers. The chart shows where it could be used but not what or how it helps. Great pricing. Battery lasts through many uses.

The Breville Smart oven arrived as scheduled and was well packaged. The oven was as described online and has the functionality and modes that I was looking for. One of the trays was damaged (must have been packed that way) and customer service was prolite and quickly sent me a replacement. I have used the oven several times and it functions perfectly and toasts my bagel-like rolls perfectly. Appears to be a quality product and the rack ejection works well. The completion bell is easily heard. Overall a great purchase experience.
Tried for a different view - still experimenting.
Another Echo manual, good price only partially useful.
Arrived as promised and was well packaged. Useful for the flameless heat gun for refills. Great price, delivery and product.
The flamless heat gun was as advertised and arrived when promised. The product will work as a portable heat gun for heat shrink, espocially with the adapter. Good price and function.

The tubing was as advertised - but is so still it is difficult to use with the smaller low pressure adapters. Originally a more flexible hose was used but apparently they cannot make any more - this will have to do.

The handle was as advertised but doesn't meet my intended application without some work - which I expected - I needed to widden the gap for a larger shaft. Unfortunately, no one else this type of handle.

The delivery was spot on and the product was just as described online. The ladder is a light as advertised but not stated. Opening and closing was not difficult and oviously storage is not a problem. Great use for intermediate heights.
Just what my Raindrip system needs, full cirlce & adjustable. Pricing was great and also delivery, pricing.
Perfect 1/2" coupling for raindrip - love it.

Needed a socket for replacing assembly in outdoor LED low voltage light. This works with MR16 bulb and is just what I needed. Great pricing, item configuration and fittings worked. Very satisfying online purchase.
Just the the ethernet cable and length I needed. Pricing, delivery and cable quality were great. Beats what is offered at local shops.
Just the replacement batteries I needed - great pricing, delivery and factory packaging.

Great product although documentation minimal - had to "try things" and buy additional user material. Quality, fidelity and voice were great. Still experimenting. Great erite up  in our newspaper. Fun to use and get current local weather.
Just what I needed for my grease gun. High quality and quick delivery.
Delivery was great but usefulness questionable. May not work for everyone. Regular application not what I was looking for.
I wanted brighter LED and this was just what I wanted. Fast deliver and bulbs worked perfectly. Great service nd pricing.

I recently started learning how to surf.  I originally went out in a sports bra - it was medium blue...it didn't occur to me that when wet it was a sheer medium blue.  So I went ahead & decided to try & find a bikini top.  The reason I originally went with a sports bra is because they're a tighter fit - they're designed to be that way...meaning it's a lot harder for the ocean to take your top off when you get hit by a wave (since when you're learning how to surf you will inevitably have quite a few wipe outs).  Ultimately - this has served its purpose.  I've worn it out I think 3-4x now & it's done pretty well.  The main reason I bought it was the price - it was $9 (for the one I bought at least).  So for $9 - I'm pretty happy.  But I'll admit - anything more & I wouldn't be giving it 4 stars.  There have been I think 3-4x when I had to readjust it after a wave took me out...but overall it's stood up surprisingly well.The fit seems right - I'm a 36B & the 8 fits me pretty well.  It is a lot smaller than I expected for some reason...but again - I was coming from a sports bra (which definitely provides more coverage than this).  The adjustable straps are great too.

I love these skirts.  The fabric is super soft & flowy but best of all is the length...I'm pretty picky when it comes to long skirts - if they aren't touching the ground or within " at most - it's not long enough. I'm 5'7" & normally wear jeans that have at least a 33" inseam (anything shorter is too short).  So finding a skirt that touches the ground can be a bit of a pain sometimes.  But these are awesome. I bought a ton of skirts from Amazon & had to return the vast majority of them - the ones that I didnt were either from this brand or Frumos.  I haven't measured it but I'm guessing the length is probably about 41-42"Also, I got the size Large...I could probably fit the Medium but I didn't know if the large would be longer (they sometimes are) - so I went with that.  It fits fine (I wear a 29"/8 normally).

I'm actually returning these jeans - they're a bit too flared for me (like serious major flare going on here).  But the description provided is accurate, so that's my own fault.  What I will say though is the material is **amazing** - they're like jeans that you've owned for decades & are beyond broken in & comfortable...but they're brand new.  I'm the type who changes into my pajamas the minute I get home - I can't stand not being comfortable or being in restrictive pants...and I think I could easily sleep in these.  I wish all jeans were made of material like this.  So if you're looking for a super huge flare & unreal comfort - these are definitely for you.  I'm hoping I can find some with a bit smaller of a flare but the same material...it really is amazing!!

These are awesome board shorts.  I have never surfed...but as of today I can at least say I have tried.  I went out today with a friend who attempted to teach me how to surf.  We went out last week with body boards & I quickly learned that swim bottoms vs very rough waters - the water wins...so I searched for a pair of board shorts that would actually stay on before we went back out again.  There's a hurricane off shore right now - so honestly the conditions were far from ideal to learn this (which is why I did not in fact surf much...I crouched on the board once...but that's about it) - but I did fight the waves like mad & paddle a whole bunch - and these shorts were amazing for that.  I was super comfy the whole time & despite getting knocked off my feet quite a few times at no point did I feel like my shorts were about to get taken away too :)The sizing seems about right.  i'm 5'7" 140lbs, the sz 8 works for me with a good bit of room to spare (if I drop anymore weight I have a feeling the sz 6 will be the better fit).

This would be a great light if not for the battery.  After just 2 months the battery no longer holds a charge for more than 20 minutes.  It's immediately red when I plug it into the light (the button to turn the light on is either red or green - green implies it has a good charge, red implies it's running low).The light itself is great - brighter than anything else I've seen.  But the battery is pretty essential to it working...so I guess I'll breakdown & buy one of the super expensive ones since obviously there's a reason this is priced so low.

I love these tops.  Their super light & not tight at all - very airy & breathable.  I wear them to bike in (I bike 10+ miles a day).  I also love that the straps are so thin - I bike during the day & live in Florida meaning I'm pretty tan at this point (well my arms are at least).  So this helps keep the tan lines from getting any funkier.They seem to run a bit bigger than some other adidas tops - but I think that's b/c of the loose fit.  I normally wear a medium & the medium fits me pretty well (I could probably fit into a small with this top, but not comfortably).  I'm 5'7" 140lbs 36B.The part I was most excited about was the price - at least on some of the colors.  Couldn't believe they were less than $8!!
Great blanket for the price.  It's pretty thin - certainly nothing that will keep anyone too warm - and somewhat small.  But it has Ninja Turtles & didn't cost a fortune...so I can't complain.

This is an awesome comforter...I'm not a huge comforter person but this thing is amazing.  It's crazy soft (much softer than I expected...I had to convince my boyfriend that sheets actually were a necessity in my bed & that just b/c the blanket was so soft does not mean we're not using a top sheet).  And the color is awesome - it's a rich deep teal color...love it.  The weight is just right for Florida (I keep my house kinda cold though, ~73° at night).

I really like these skirts.  They're super long & the fabric is solid - not at all sheer or see through (it's pretty thick & super stretchy - it's almost like the athletic wear type fabric, the wicking quickdry stuff - but heavier).  The only thing that bugs me is that it's kinda narrow at the bottom, meaning I can't take a full stride (I have a pretty big stride though).  So if I'm in a hurry (& I'm rarely patient enough to shorten my stride when walking) I have to hike it up a bit in order to not trip or something.  But I can live with that.  It's definitely on the longer side -  it's 43" before folding the waist, didn't measure it but I'm super picky about length when it comes to skirts (& the site where I bought it lists the length).  I'm ~5'7" (140lbs) & the medium (8/10) fits me great - the length puts it so it just barely touches the ground (which is how I like my skirts).  I liked it enough that I bought it in both colors.Also - the sizing listing on amazon isn't entirely accurate.  This is actually sized by S/M/L (I bought mine from 6pm, which amazon technically owns since they own Zappos).  The 8/10 is the size Medium.

I bought a bunch of long skirts on amazon recently (a BUNCH...like 10).  Of those I only kept 3 due to the length - I like my skirts long, very long.  They either have to be touching the ground or less than ¼" from it.  I'm ~5'7" & I often find maxi skirts to not be long enough to meet this requirement. While I would love it if these were just ½" longer - they are still long enough to do the trick.  For anyone wondering, the other brands I tried were Azules, 82 Days & Frumos; the only other brand that had a skirt I kept was the Frumos brand - the Azules were hands down the shortest (way too short - like a solid 6" off the ground) & the 82 days were just barely too short.The sizing is definitely smaller than what I'm used to - but the information provided in the description is accurate.  I normally wear a Medium these days (140lbs, as already mentioned - ~5'7"), but I got the large - mainly due to the extra length (the sizing says the Large is 43" long compared to 42.5" for the medium) - and I'm glad I did.  The length is not only what I was hoping for but i have a strong feeling the Medium would've been a bit too tight on me.Overall I really like this skirt (got it in 2 styles, considering a 3rd) & would definitely recommend it.  I'm glad that this was one of the skirts I was able to keep since I really love the design

At first I thought I had gotten really lucky & the small gap that was mentioned in other reviews had been fixed by the time I got my case.  It didn't seem to be a problem at all - certainly nothing noticeable when I put my phone into the case...sadly I was wrong.  The gap isn't so much as a gap - but it's caused by the cover over the home button.  Since the home button is now also a finger-print-reader otterbox had to come up with a new type of cover for that one area so the button can still read your fingerprint - meaning the material used for the main cover on the phone is different than what's used over just the home button...meaning there is a seam.  And that seam is the problem.  So the gap is only detectable towards to the bottom of the screen - and only when trying to type or something like that...specifically the space bar when typing seems to be a problem...damn near everything comes out as one massive runon.  Seeing asI've had otterbox cases for going on 4yrs now - they're amazing cases...and I'm totally bummed that I finally have to find a new brand since the protection these cases offer is far beyond anything I've ever found before.  But the beauty of their previous cases was that it never impeded with the use of the phone (once you got past the extra bulk it added to the phone of course - which was a small price to pay for making it toddler- & 15'-lloft-proof).  Much like one of the top reviews for this case I too thought the gap wasn't that big of a deal.  End of day 1 - it's a serious pain.

These are being used to store a massive Nat Geo collection.  I can fit 4 years in each box (with the leather cases).  They end up weighing around 50lbs each. With the previous boxes file boxes I used I had to secure the bottom with duct tape as they simply weren't strong enough to hold all that.The assembly is also a lot quicker than the ones I've used in the past since the bottom is almost fully assembled (you just kinda pop it open & slide down one flap & the bottom is done - you then put down 4 more flaps for the sides).  The lid flap that tucks into the handles is also a great feature.

I actually bought this as a gift for my dad - we coincidentally ended up buying the same Hampton Forge set last year & since my set turned out to be total crap I knew his was just as bad - so I thought he coudl use this.  Well turns out he already got a new set...so instead of returning I kept it.  And I'm really glad he got a new set - becuase I love these knives!! Our old set was Chicago Cutlery - they lasted 8-10 years of some major abuse (like being left for days in standing water) before the handles finally started splitting.  Why on earth I didn't buy another set from them originally is beyond me - but I'm glad I corrected that mistake now.Aside from their awesome cutting quality I think my favorite part about this set is the size - all the other sets I've seen with this many knives has a knife block that's huge.  This block is just barely bigger than the block we had for our 13pc set.  With limited counter space that's a huge plus.The handles do seem just a bit shorter than what I'm used to (they're about 1/2" shorter than our old set which had the standard black riveted handles).  But I was concerned they might feel a bit slippery - which they thankfully don't.The one thing missing is the kitchen shears - but I'm guessing that would add considerably to the block size (& we still have the pair from the old chicago set we got rid of a year ago).  I personally have no use for the stick thing (since I don't even know what it would be used for) - but I assume others do since they seem to come with all the kitchen sets.  My son likes to use them as swords - but we have since found him a much safer foam one...so this one will sit unused in our block until I figure out what it is.

These are technically not 1/8" - they're extremely close - but they're not.  I wish the description would simply have the primary description of these be 3mm - because that's exactly what they are.  And 1/8" actually equals 3.175mm (so almost 3.2mm).  Yes I realize how small of a difference that is - but when you're dealing with something this small to begin with - believe me, it's noticeable.I bought these b/c they were described as 1/8" magnets.  I didn't know which of the measurements it gave were being rounded.  I have tons of these but somehow managed to need more.  These arrived & they seemed ever so slightly smaller than my other 1/8" magnets.  So I managed to find some (in fact i found an unopened brand new tube of 50 that I misplaced, of course they show up now) - and they are indeed smaller than the other 1/8" magnets I have.I also have a slide gauge ruler (used for measuring beads) - so I decided to measure these.  These measure at exactly 3mm. The other ones I have measure at exactly 1/8".  So for anyone wondering - the measurement that's being rounded is the inches - these are exactly 3mm in diameter (for the ones described as 1/8").

So close to being an awesome toy...all it would need to be great is just one more riser for stability.  The lack of that 3rd riser makes this thing a royal pain.  You have to be very delicate with it...and toddlers are anything but delicate with anything.  It does not work with the other risers (like the Brio stacking risers which are awesome)  - otherwise it would be just fine - those things stabilize any raised track.  If it just added one more little wooden block to the set - it would be great (it would still be pretty unstable - but not to the point where I have to stand it back up every 10 minutes).  Most of the trains we have fit - the Chuggington ones don't - but they don't fit much (they're huge).

Great concept, but the vast majority of the boxes were just too small for me.  I imagine many would be able to make use of most of the boxes - but the super small ones I can't see as being useful to anyone (although I do give them credit for making use of literally every inch inside the main box).  Ultimately - the only boxes that I was able to use were the Large Long boxes - which are actually too big for my needs.  I was trying to store 8/0 & 6/0 seed beads - just under 1oz of different colors & styles (they're currently in 16x130mm test tubes, filled to the top).  The large boxes could not fit these, they overflowed & left quite a good bit that wouldn't fit - same with the Medium Long boxes.  The Large Long boxes are double the size of the large boxes - and that left a ton of space.  So obviously this wasn't working in terms of the box sizes for me.But the one thing I think would be a problem for everyone was lids - they were a bit tight to open & unless you're super careful I could see lots of beads spilling in the process of opening some of these boxes.  The large long boxes were the easiest to open - I imagine this is b/c of the long front where the lid hooks (the length gives that front panel a bit more flexibility allowing it to open a bit easier - the shorter front panel in the regular Large boxes makes that much more rigid).  The Medium Long boxes were probably the most spillable when it came to opening them - they're super shallow & while they have the long front the shallowness still means they're tricky to open - and since they're so shallow the contents can easily be spilled all over the place.And ultimately, replacing the boxes is not too cheap - the cheapest I've found the replacements (or refills as they call them) is JoAnns when they're having a sale - you can get a set of 2 Large Long boxes for as little as $1.50 then (otherwise they're $3 a set) - but the only size JoAnns has is the LL box.  The amazon price for these refills currently starts at $4.44 for a 2pk of the LL - that's the lowest price; the ML - $5.84/4pk, Large - $6.19/4pk; XL - $5.13/each.  So as you can see if you wanted to replace a lot of the boxes in this the price would go up pretty quickly.

I have a thing for clocks & this is my 3rd clock from Infinity Instruments, so I had faith I would like this clock, but I honestly wasn't expecting to absolutely love this clock...it's awesome!! First - let me say that my other 2 clocks from Infinity are going on 5yrs old & have been through some major abuse during some moves - but they're both still perfectly on time & absolutely silent - so I know this brand makes some quality products.I initially bought this to put in my sons room - he just turned 3 & we wanted a clock to use to start teaching him time - it had to have a second hand & minute markings & had to be silent (since all clocks in my house must be silent or they will be destroyed).  The fact that it was red was a bonus as that's his favorite color.  But what I didn't think of was how solid this clock would be - the case is made of steel & it's 3" deep (all of this info is in the listing - I just didn't really think about that).  We're hoping to hang this around eye level for him meaning he will be able to get it off the wall if given the chance to & this clock is so solid that if he were to get to it & then drop it or test it's flying capabilities (which is always possible with a toddler, although accidentally dropping it is much more likely) he could do some damage.  So I think I'll be looking for a much crappier clock for his room...but I'm thrilled I made the mistake as this means I can now keep this clock for myself.It's a smaller clock - 8.5" (most wall clocks start around 9-9.5" & while that may not seem like a huge difference when it comes to diameter it actually is).  And it does sit quite a ways off the wall - the picture really doesn't give you a good idea of the depth of this clock - but it's deep.  It's perfect for a smaller room or a bathroom - which is where I plan to hang it.  I hope I can find another clock for my son.  We have a ton of clocks including some from other brands like Bai & Decomates - but the Infinity clocks are the only ones that have lasted so long while remaining absolutely silent (in fact my Bai clock started ticking after just a few months; the Decomates one still runs great - but it's starting to develop a slight tick).  I think I'll be looking for a desktop clock for my son instead - something that's designed to be picked up if need be (& something that won't put a dent in our hardwoods if dropped - or hurt the daylights out of his toes).  But again - still very happy I didn't think of this till after getting this clock - since I think this is now my favorite one in the house!!

I bought this b/c the photo shows real chips (like the solid, nice ones that have some weight to them - not the super cheap thin plastic chips).  Unfortunately this does not work with those too well.  The chips do fit in all the slots - but about 1/3rd are too narrow for the chips to slide - I have to wedge them in (& 1 I have to essentially force them in..so I'm not using that slot too much).  It's a great design - love the idea - it's like a compact carousel (without the carousel bit...), but the execution was just barely off.  This works just fine with the plastic cheap chips (I have an old set of those I tested out & those all fit no problem at all) - but the nicer chips just don't all fit in there.As for the rest of it - the plastic is very solid & the card slots are just fine.  The price is also fantastic.  The shipping was decent enough.  If the slots were just the tiniest bit wider I'd be giving this 5 stars...but unfortunately that tiny bit makes this a bit of a pain to use.  I've been using a tray instead for the nice chips (and this will be donated with the old plastic chip set I have).

I am shocked that some reviews say that these are "durable & well made" - they're complete & total crap, for lack of a better word.  This is a classic example of a crappy piece of plastic having a well known logo slapped onto it &  sold as if it's actually a quality product.  It's not.  These are made of thin crappy plastic..totally disappointed!!! My son still loves them - but they're such lightweight plastic I don't see them lasting more than a few months (less if we take them to the sandbox or beach - as I had hoped to be able to do).

This was a great can opener while it lasted....we got ours 2 years ago & it stopped working about 3-4 months ago.  So I was bummed about that as we don't often use a can opener.  Something happened to the bade though - whenever we try to lock it into place the blade pops up.  So I'm replacing it now with a different one (that will hopefully make it more than 2 years of our light infrequent use).

This is a great mat.  It adds some much needed cushioning to our thin (but beautiful) rug that we use.  My son is much happier playing on the carpet now that it's not basically a piece of fabric on top of hardwood floors.  The one thing I will say though - it's definitely not non-skid (at least not on our floors) - it's not as bad as the slick rug backing - i doubt you'll end up ice skating like you can with rugs on hardwoods sometimes - but it will definitely move around a bit on some hardwoods.  I had a feeling that would be the case & also bought one of the rubbery non-skid things - so we have 3 layers now - the rubbery non skid pad, then this thick piece of felt, then our carpet.  I will say that it's not the most aesthetic thing (it's literally the exact same size our rug - so it's hard not to notice it when looking at the floor) - but the comfort it provides is worth it (& it's not like it's sticking out the sides).  I haven't tried cutting it - but I don't think it would be too hard to do if needed - provided you had some quality sheers to work with.

These are great toys - my son is obsessed with them (all the planes from either of the planes movies - and basically any other small diecast airplane).  The quality on most of these is decent enough - this specific model included (we had problems with one of the props for Bulldog - it keeps sticking & won't spin...but at least my son makes the most of it with a dramatic fiery crash into the playroom floor).  However I will say unlike some of the Disney Cars toys which are generally much more solid than the hot wheels or matchbox cars - these tend to be on the same level as the Matchbox & Hotwheels planes we have - in fact the hot wheels ones are actually better for the most part (but smaller).  What really deserves the 5 stars is the price - at least right now - it's priced at just $2.19 as an add on & there are a few other planes characters also under $3!  I thought there must me a mistake with this - but apparently not!  maybe it's b/c of the holidays - I don't know - but I haven't seen them priced anything below $3.50 elsewhere (we thought they were a steal at a department store for $3.99!).  We already own almost all of them at this point - but I couldn't resist taking advantage of the low prices - so I bought a bunch more & am taking them to the womens shelter as holiday presents for the kids there.

I was hoping these would work for my seed bead collection - but unfortunately they're far too small.  The lids don't help this as they're inserted into the tube (meaning you can't fill these to the rim - you have to leave some solid space at the top for the lid).  They're good quality tubes - and if you're looking to use these with 10/0 or 11/0 beads they might work - I'd say they can probably hold about 2 strands of 11/0 or 10/0 beads (maybe more) - but they're definitely not for larger collections or people trying to store larger amounts for use.I've tried a bunch of alternatives, but the one I've found to work best so far is coin tubes.  Not only are they super cheap (you can get them as low as $0.25/tube depending on the size & where you're looking) - but they're available in a variety of sizes & have screw-on lids.  The closest size compatible to this would be for dimes - but the size I've found to work best for 6/0 beads is definitely the penny or the nickel sizes.  The penny tube can hold about 1oz of 6/0 beads perfectly.  The only problem I'm having with these is finding some way to then store the tubes (like a test tube rack or something)...but I'm sure i'll work something out.  I'm also trying out some actual test tubes today (since those too are also very cheap & they have racks!).Overall - while these are quality tubes they're just too small for me.  I would've given them 5-stars regardless of this (since the dimensions are in the description - not their fault they're not big enough for me) - but the inset caps are a no-go for something marketed for bead storage use in my opinion.

I just used this for the first time to make banana bread mini loaves (more like banana bread brownie-sized loaves).  It worked beautifully - my banana bread turned out great - and the best part was the removal..l let it cool & I was able to literally lift them straight out...I was shocked (I thought I'd at least have to peel away the mold, but no!).However I do have one complaint, it's too flimsy - I thankfully suspected it would be beforehand & filled it with a mesh grate underneath it.  I tried lifting it & the middle row just bowed in - so I just put it in the oven along with the grate (which is actually what we use for cooking pizza).  I have another silicone mold used for candy or ice cubes (so it's very very small, about 6x8 I'd say) - it's of little lego figures - and in between the molds on the bottom side there are bars connecting each mold (so when looking at this mold in the photos shown there would be bars in between each cup) - I didn't get why they were there till I filled it up with juice to make some mini juice pops for my son - the mold stayed perfectly flat as I put it in the freezer.  Something like this would do wonders for this product.
These are a much higher quality than I expected.  The lids screw on very smoothly & the plastic is quite thick.

I don't think I understood what the description of this meant - they're called Rainbow Opaque Mix Multi Assorted - I was thinking this was a 1oz bag of 6/0 basic opaque beads & the "mix multi" was referring to the color.  I was wrong.  The "mix multi" is actually referring to the finish and the color.  So this is a bag of opaque beads with varying finishes...so some are just basic opaque beads & others have a very shiny finish.  Ultimately they are very pretty beads & I can still use them - but I will admit that this wasn't what I expected.

I've had this in my bathroom less tan 6mths.  It's up a bit high (since the bathroom is totally crammed & we had to put it up high so as not to smack our heads on it when getting on or off the can).  I went to put something on the top shelf the other day & realized the entire top shelf is coated in rust...it's terrible...I bought this because I was under the impression it was designed to tolerate humidity...obviously that's not the case.  Total waste of money...thankfully it wasn't much.

I've had this clock for about 4yrs now - maybe more...it still keeps time wonderfully & best of all - it's still silent.  I even left this sitting face down for about 6-7mths at one point after moving into a new place - anytime I've ever done that with another clock it ends up no longer working (no idea why) - not with this one...still kept time wonderfully that whole time.  Highly recommend this clock...

Totally overpriced for what this is...it's largely my fault for not paying attention.  I bought 2 items from this seller & thought the shipping would include a discount or maybe even be combined (since $5 for shipping some beads is high enough).  Well I realized after they arrived I forgot to actually check this...and the shipping wasn't combined...I paid $10 for what cost less than $2 in shipping.  And the beads (both this set & the other one) - they're barely worth $3.  Honestly - don't make the same mistake I did...look elsewhere...disappointed in myself for not paying enough attention & this seller in ripping people off.

These are basically just string lights with little plastic car covers over each light (which is really how all of these novelty string lights work).  Problem is the car covers are a bit loose on these - one slid right off as I took them out of their packaging.  Not a major issue - now that they're having up they're just fine - but would nice if it wasn't an issue at all.

I've always loved wrap arounds - especially ones that aren't full length, but they're so hard to find it seems - so I was thrilled to find this one, especially since I love the colors.  This is a beautiful skirt & it fits great.  It falls just below my knees which I love & is very breezy given the flare style (I live at the beach so that's always nice).

I wear a size 10.5-11 in most shoes so I didn't know if these were fit.  I'm happy to say the size 11s fit just fine.  However they arrived with the material peeling away from the sole of the shoe on the outside of the boot.  Yes these are $30 boots - and if this started to happen after at least one wear I'd probably give them 4 stars - since I'm not expecting them to be the best boots out there.  But to arrive like that is definitely not something that should happen with any shoes (unless they're used).I imagine the packaging might be involved with this - these were in a shoebox, but the shoebox was mailed in just a poly mailer, not an actual shipping box.  I thought this was strange since almost everything I buy from Amazon comes in a box (heck - I've received an amazon shipping box inside of another amazon shipping box before!) - just today I had some fingerless gloves arrive in a poly mailer - that were inside a shipping box.  So as you can imagine the shoebox endured some major abuse before it even got to me - the lid was essentially a flat piece of cardboard on top of a mangled shoebox - not much protection there.Ultimatley I did end up keeping them - I'm not a shoe person or a fashion person & honestly I doubt i'll wear these much - certainly not enough to justify spending any more time on trying to find a different pair...but just know that this is not one of those products that will make you think you got some amazing deal...you will get what you pay for...

I just got these - so I admit, I can't speak to their durability - but they seem pretty well made.  I've tried them on & am very pleased - they fit wonderfully (both pieces are the same length) & I'm able to easily type while wearing them - yay!! I work online & I type at an insanely fast speed - but the tiniest things can throw me off & when that happens I become a snail & get very irritated & frustrated.  I tend to work on my patio & as the cold weather comes I wanted something to keep my hands warmer since the rest of me is just fine.  Gloves are no good as they'd need to basically be a second skin - even latex gloves throw me off - I have unusually long fingers (I'm sure if I spent the next year or so trying on every single pair I found I could find the right ones...but I don't have that time or interest), so fingerless was the way to go - and I'm very happy with these - especially the price!!

This is a very nice product - however the price here is much higher than elsewhere.  It's currently priced at $12.15 on amazon - I bought one section today at a big name hardware (HD) for $6.The height of the entire section is 16" - the spokes are 5" & the grate bit is 11" (measured to its highest point) - so the heigh when "installed" - or in the ground - it would be anywhere from 12-14" I'd guess, depending on how far you need/want to put the spokes in for your soil.This will be returned since it's not what I was looking for (we need it to be taller - trying to contain some small but feisty pups).  It's a very nice product - but I don't think I'd pay $12/each for this - especially knowing it was ½ that price elsewhere.

These are decent buttons.  The one main issue I had with the bag I received was the spread of colors.  I ended up with about 15 pink buttons & no more than 3 blue ones.  However I realize that this is a random mix - meaning it literally is random.The buttons each have a diameter of 2cm (just over 0.75").  The sizing is consistent however it looks like a few ended up getting bowed (kinda like a bowl) - but just a few.I really do want to have an issue with the price - it's hard to feel like 40  colored buttons is worth $5.50 - but while these aren't super high quality they also aren't bottom of the barrel - the holes are all consistently placed & the colors are solidly opaque - there is no issue with the paint consistency (which I'm very happy about).  And I looked quite a bit online to find a better price to no avail.  The only better price I found was if I ordered direct from China (which will take about 3-4 weeks - in which case I could find them as low was $4-5/100pk) - but if you don't have that time & don't need 100+ then that's really not very useful!I'll be using these in some crafts down the road but right now my almost 3yo son is having a blast with them.  I didn't realize he'd like them so much - he was getting fussy at the dinner table waiting for food & these were in reach so I chucked some onto a small tray & let him play with them - he's insisted on playing with them each night since!!  He already knows all of his colors but now we're onto things like patterns - so these are getting put to use with that (& thankfully he's fine with all the patterns having pink).  My son does not put things in his mouth (I still don't leave him out of sight with these, but I have no concern that he might try to eat them) - But please note - these are NOT suitable for kids who might put them in their mouth - they are definitely a choking hazard.  If you're looking for something suitable for that I suggest  REALLY BIG BUTTONS 60/PKG. - I got these when he was around 14mths & they were big enough for him to safely play with then (with supervision of course).  But for crafts I suggest these - the big buttons aren't as presentable as these.

Honestly - as an adult i found this rather dull...there was one funny moment in it for me, but that was about it.  But I didn't buy it for me - I bought it for my 3yo son...and it was quite a hit with him.  It's a bit slow to start up (which I thought was going to be an issue with him) but about midway through he loves it.Keep in mind this is a 5min film (less than that actually - probably 4min since it has credits) - which is why it gets 4 stars.  It should not be $2 for something that short - even if it is Disney.  No matter how much my kids loves it there is no justifying that price.  I bought it knowing this...but that doesn't change the fact that it's definitely overpriced for what it is.

These are absolutely awful.  When they first arrived they looked great & I thought the were so cute - the bulbs are super tiny (much smaller than the normal bubble pearl lights) & they appear to be just fine.  Then I plugged them in.  First - these are not pearly or frosted - they are transparent...and worse yet the coloring is incredibly uneven. I have WAY too many string lights from more brands than I care to count (I have a strange thing with lighting & frosted/diffused lighting is my favorite) and I have never seen lights this terrible!The blue & green ones are the worst.  The blue ones have tons of splotchy spots on them.  The green ones - the coloring for some reason highlights the seam in the middle of the plastic (where the two halves were joined) - it's clear that the  The only color that's kinda pearly are the red ones.It's clear that these use some sort of liquid coloring which has caused the unevenness and is why the seams are highlighted (since the liquid clung to those abnormalities in the plastic).  I have no idea what process is normally used to color the plastic for bubble string lights (have yet to see the How It's Made on those), but if I had to guess I would assume they're made of pre-colored plastic since that's probably easiest to get the semi-opaque finish & along with even color.  It's obvious that whatever the right process is - it's not what was used on these.  As cute as they are when they're turned off - they're useless once you actually try to use them....so they're going back.I did my best to show the problems these have in some photos, but you can only really see these issues once they're on (or being held up to light) - and it's always hard to get good photos of lit objects, so the photos really understate how terrible these are.

This is a great light set.  It took quite a while to arrive - but just about anything that's being shipped directly from China takes a bit of time.  The only thing I don't like is that you can't control the speed or anything really...they have two modes: on and off. The description says "Slow and fade color changing on each led" - honestly I have no idea what that means (I'm assuming there was a language issue involved with whoever wrote that sentence) - but the word slow led me to believe that indicated the speed of something...and unfortunately nothing about these is slow.  The speed of the color changing is very fast - much faster than I'd prefer (it seems like they'd go well with techno music - nothing against techno music - but I usually prefer a more mellow pace).  But ultimately, the price is pretty much unbeatable...and my son thinks they're pretty neat (he's 3 - so a he thinks that of a lot of things).  I like the frosted bulb look they have & they are pretty much exactly as shown in the image.

This is the best measuring tape I've ever used.  They retractibility aspect is awesome - makes it so much easier to quickly use without ending up with a wad of measuring tape somewhere - and the bit of space it gives you at the start of it makes a huge difference sometimes.  It has both standard & metric units.  It's just one of those well designed products - so glad i purchased one.  I've actually purchased two now since the first one has been missing for quite some time - and after using a regular measuring tape once I decided I'd rather just buy a second one than be forced to use the regular one again!!

These are great cushions.  I will admit - they're a bit on the thick side which makes them look just a bit odd on the chairs we're currently using them on - but after using one for about 2 days now it's not nearly as overly fluffy as it was when they arrived (but still comfy).  And honestly, I've always been one to prefer comfort over style - and these definitely provide a lot more comfort than the wooden slats I was sitting on.  The dimensions are correct as listed in the description (18.5"W x 15.5") & they fit our chairs well with regards to that (the chairs we're using them on right now are pretty much identical to these chairs:  Amazonia Teak London 2-Piece Teak Folding Chair - except the back slats go all the way down).I doubt they could handle true outdoor exposure - like being left in the rain or anything - but almost no cushions can (at least none that I've heard of - my dad has a set of crazy expensive cushions & he has to keep them in a storage bench when not in use).  These are being used on our screened-in patio so I'm not too concerned with that.  They seem like they'll handle humidity as well as most cushion, but I live in Florida, so it won't be long until I know for sure (our humidity levels average at least 85% each night...this morning it was 99% when I woke up - and the sun had already come up!) - and if anything arises I'll update this accordingly.If your looking for low budget cushions I would definitely recommend these.
I really like this curtain. I usually replace mine every year but I could use it longer if needed.
Our Yorkshire dog loved it, but broke it within a couple days
Much smaller than expected. If you try to fit an iphone 6 without a case you're going to have some trouble. It's useful to put some keys, a cereal bar or a small wallet and that's about it.

Item is small, convenient but the quality is not so great. It's hard to trim your beard evenly with this. I kept it just to take when I travel but I won't use it as my main trimmer on a regular basis.
Really nice, great for people with large faces like mine! (The bigger version)
Comfortable, nice color, true to size. My pants size is 34 and I got this in size L and XL. Tried both, XL was too big but L was perfect so I returned the XL.

Too bulky. I have other Amazon cables (lighting, printer cables) and the quality is great. In terms of reliability this cable is good as everything else made by Amazon. However, I find it to be too bulky so if you're going to carry it in your purse or bag it will take more room than a standard cable folded, not to mention it's more expensive than a standard one. Also, it's not very easy to retract/expand, so if you have it connected to your USB drive and try to expand it, it might come off.If you need something small to carry along with your spare battery I'd suggest the Amazon 4 inch cable which is tiny and convenient.
Easy installation, excellent black out coverage! You will definitely get a better sleep once you install these.. just make sure you have a sharp knife to cut it,

I ordered these in size 62mm in both Gunmetal/Dark green lenses and Gunmetal/Tortoise/Gradient brown lenses to choose the one that looks best. (Thanks Amazon for an amazing and free return policy!)First of all, these sunglasses are very stylish and in my opinion they look better than the standard RB3025 aviator. Also, size 62mm is perfect for people with large faces like me.At first I liked the brown color better because it goes well with my skin color, looks more natural and not as harsh as the green lenses which are almost black. Also, on this particular model the gradient brown lenses are dark which is good. (note that I purchased the gunmetal frame. Another reviewer mentioned that the brown lenses with the arista gold color wasn't dark enough)However, when I tried both of them this morning under a sunny 85 degree NYC sky, I noticed that the brown lenses are kinda reddish when exposed to the sun and I found it to be a little weird. The the dark green lenses, on the other hand, kept their original color and offered a little more so I opted to keep the dark green and return the brown one even though brown/tortoise seem to be my favorite sunglasses color.I hope it helps!
I love this movie!!!! I have watched multiple times and it's a great and funny romantic comedy!

Similar to what a lot of reviewers said, it works fine for a couple of months and then it just stops charging. When when it does, the battery won't last longer than 1 minute. I'll try contacting customer service to see if they can help. I have another Dirt devil vacuum (a smaller one) that works perfectly but it doesn't have a battery, it's corded. I'd suggest you go with another brand for a cordless vacuum! If there's something on Amazon with less than 4.5 stars you can definitely get suspicious about it!

Very lightweight, comfortable and true to size. I got the one in blue with lime green shoelaces and it looks really nice! It's true to size. For example I have an Adidas superstar, Puma Toori all in size 12 and this model is size 12 is about the same size. I'm not a runner but I walk a lot and also use it when going to the gym but I'm sure this would be comfortable for running too. Good job Under Armour!
Perfect, great detail! I have Heisenberg's and Saul's bobbleheads. One to get me in trouble and the other one to rescue me!Buy it, you won't get disappointed!

It does NOT run small like other reviewers said.. well at least mine, purchased from Amazon (ship and sold). I'm 6'3" / 210lbs and my t-shirt size is usually large unless it's muscle, fitted or slim fit (in this case it's X-Large). For this t-shirt I ordered extra large based on other reviews but the item is huge. So I suggest you order your regular size, do not go 1 size up. Besides that the material is very good, soft and lightweight an the logo is nice (not too big).

Pros:True to sizeSoft and good quality materialCons:The neck part is too big. I understand this is a turtleneck sweater but even if i fold the neck it still goes all the way up to my chin.(Note that it's not wide or loose.. it's just big)
Soft, warm, easy in and out and very comfortable. Perfect to use on a daily basis and also good when you have to remove snow from the car since leather is water proof and also dries fast.

Ripped near the finger area after the first use. And it was just light usage. So while the gloves are soft and comfortable they don't seem to be very resistant nor they're warm enough for weather under 30 degrees. I didn't even get to test whether it's water proof or not.
Gloves look good and seem to be durable and resistant. However, they're too thick so you won't have a lot of mobility with your hands. Also, size runs small, so I'd suggest ordering a size up.

As other reviewers have stated, while listening to songs on my iPhone it skips songs on its own, brings up Siri and voice control, changes the song speed and does some other weird stuff. I tried turning Siri off but it kept bring up voice control which cannot be turned off. Being that I don't have an issue with any other headphones (even tried another one with a mic) I have to blame these. I'm assuming that the microphone malfunctions and being that at least 6 other reviewers have reported the same problem I don't think I have a defective unit.I'm returning (thanks to Amazon's excellent and unbeatable return policy) and I'll get a regular headphone without Mic. I'm really disappointed with this product after seeing so many positive reviews. This will probably work with an iPod or another MP3 player but if you have an iPhone or anything voice activated I'd suggest you stay away!

Just great!! I had one of those X-Mini II speakers (the little ball) which is also great but this one is even better and a little smaller. Not to mention the bluetooth ability. Great to take to the pool, beach or just to listen at home. Get it, you won't regret!

This is a very good product, holds a lot of charge and I'm giving 4 stars because it has a few minor, very minor annoyances.Pros- Small. (The diameter is about the same of a nickel and the length is about 2 AA batteries stacked on top of each other. See my images)- Comes with a nice little bag that can hold the battery as well as a cable. (Note that it comes with a USB > Micro USB cable to charge the battery but you need to use your USB > X cable where X is the type of connector your phone or electronic device uses.- Different colors. If you have a silver iPhone for example, you can get the silver battery. Same thing with the gold phone.- Holds a decent amount of juice for its size. I had my iPhone 6 with 0 battery. I was able to charge it from 0 to 100% and the battery still had juice. I'll do more testing and update my review.Cons- The button to turn it on is hard to press, especially if you have your USB cable connected. It has its advantage because if you put it in a bag it won't accidentally turn on.. But it could be a little easier to press. So basically you need to turn the battery on and then plug the cable.- There is no indicator of how much juice you have left. The competitor (Jackery Mini Premium) has 4 lights to show the amount of battery left, but on the other hand it's square so it's harder to carry in your pocket and that's the reason I got the Anker®.- It's a little heavier than you would expect. Maybe because it's small. But this is not a major issue.See my images for more details:

Terrible, just terrible! The girl in the beginning... I'm so happy she died.. She can't act! The same applies to the other actors and actresses during the first 15 minutes.. I had to stop, couldn't go past 15 mins. I'm not sure where all these positive reviews come from.. probably from the movie cast and their relatives

I will update this review once I actually use this item on a trip next month but I just wanted to warn you that the item is a little bigger than expected which, for me, is actually good. For example, a 1 litter bottle of Fireball whiskey fits perfectly. (as you might know Fireball bottles are not regular shaped, they're somewhat flat). If you're planning to use this with a regular wine bottle you will need some extra cushion or the bottle will be loose inside the bag.

It does the job very well. Fits my Acura Tsx 2013 vent perfectly, does not move while I'm driving and it's small, so once I take my phone off I can just leave the adapter attached. Also, regarding phone size I tested with both an iPhone 4s and an iPhone 6 (both with slim cases) and it worked pretty well. I would guess an iPhone 6 Plus would fit without any issues.I'm taking off one star because this item is pricey (I paid $29.95.. unfortunately no Amazon discounts). I understand it's well designed but it's just plastic!

This is a very good item, small, easy to attach to the bike (fits most type of bikes), adjustable to most phone sizes. It can hold an iphone 3, 4, 5, 6, 6 Plus with case. (It's even better if you have a rubber or silicone case, better grip.)I'm taking off one star because the part of the mount that holds the phone is hard to adjust and the plastic doesn't seem to be very resistant. But the other parts of the mount seem to be strong. Overall this is a very good mount.
Very good.. a little annoying to wash though
This item is good, holds a lot of charge but it's big, that's why I prefer PowerGen® 5200mAh which is a little smaller. But both items are great!

This is my favorite battery. Compact size, holds a lot of charge.. but you need a powerful USB charger (I recommend the Powergen wall charger, the one that comes with 2 USB ports). If you don't have you you can charge through your computer.However as an alternative you should get a battery case, it's more practical.
Very good case, slim but at the same time protective. Fits like a glove! Make sure you purchase the correct size for your laptop.

This is not perfect to use with Bose or other soundocks but works better than the smaller square "Apple iPhone 5 Lightning 8 Pin to 30 Pin Adapter" because this one can be used with a case. Cord is very short though.
Good but a little small. It's smaller than what it looks in the photo.

This is good for occasional use. Just make sure you download their app so you can access the link and activate the data plan. Otherwise you'll just have voice but no data. Also, if you don't use your number after an X number of days you'll lose it.

I heard about these when I started eating grass fed beef, as that beef is often less fatty and can use a little help with tenderizing. It works fabulously!

This is exactly as described and is perfect for its intended purpose. It doesn't look cheap or tacky and blends right in with the rest of our furniture. My wife uses it next to her recliner and love it.
I take two of these every day, along with a 500mg magnesium complex from the same company. My chronic migraines are almost a thing of the past. Life-changing stuff!

I love this thing on a hot day. Yes, it's a little challenging to get set up and have the nozzles pointing in the best directions. And, yes, it does get my furniture wet.  Still like it, and still gonna use it.

not at all as photo shows it. this is very green, very green.  its not even styled like the photo!  unless you need a curly green skip this one. see my photos I am posting of the actual wig that comes out of this package, and how it looks on a person (not even close even when we used their zombies face in our photo-ok that was for fun but still.... )on the positive, it is a thicker wig than some products, but no zombie is this green. it will be put aside till St Pats day.

my rescue dog had ear mites. the vet charged $350 and took a brief look, updated her regular shots and said no problem with her ears. but the brown discharge came back each day. I bought this locally once I looked up what ear mites were.  the first thing I noticed was her ears smelled better! right away.  they had such a nasty funk before. its a bit more of a perfume smell than medicine.... but much better then funky dog ear smell. she did shake her head a lot after we cleaned and put the drops in but then sat back down for a nice ear rub. I am keeping up on the treatment and her ears are looking cleaner and the wounds she had from scratching are healing up.
