finally a show I can actually enjoy in the vein of FireFly.  I do wish that had a few more characters though, that's what made the Firefly show so much fun.  More than three lead actors.

You know, it wasn't half bad.  The werewolf was pretty fake looking, but the actors could at least act, including George Blagden of Vikings fame. Most of them were character actors you've seen before and the story was interesting enough to keep you engaged.  The only confusing part was with the indian girl, but considering the dredge Amazon usually reserves for Prime movies this one was good enough for a TV movie.

I smirked and grinned my way through the entire film, but never outright guffawed.  That pretty much sums it up.  It was enjoyable enough to consider watching again, something I very rarely do for any movie.  The preview does a good job of showing what to expect, a send up of every reality show you've ever seen and putting Vampires in the cast.  There are a few werewolves, witches and zombies too.

I will start off with my short review. Watch it if you enjoy action movies where no brain strain is required, and you can watch at least one car chase and a whole lot of guns and blood.  It is pretty much along the lines of any of the Taken movies with less budget.Now that I have that out of the way I am going to address a few issues I see with other reviews.First of all, those of you complaining that B.Willis and J. Cusack only had bit parts in the movie seem to have forgotten that J. Patric is a very good actor in his own right.  Of course the movie preview is going to hype up the biggest "action" action star that is in it. If you are watching a movie simply because you want to watch B. Willis do the same thing he does when HE is the main star then you have absolutely no right to complain that this movie has a plot that has been done so many times before.Secondly, B.Willis & J. Cusack have such short scenes that I think those of you complaining about "bad acting" are actually just peeved that you were mislead about the main character. Which I should point out if you take the time to read the cast or characters it is pretty obvious who is the main protagonist.Now 50 Cent CAN"T ACT and he has nearly half the amount of lines of the other two and I don't see anybody complaining about him or the actress who played the friend of the daughter. THAT is poor acting.The story was a rehash of many other similar movies, yes. What I liked about this one was that at least this guy knew he was a scumbag and held no illusions about redemption. In addition, they made no attempt to make the daughter out to be some angel in need of saving and in fact she was well on the way to killing herself.What I found to be a little stupid in the story was how the first few non-scumbag characters the father encountered had no interest in helping him find his daughter and acted put out that he was asking. Even the friend wasn't interested until later in the game when she refused to leave, which was implausible considering her initial behaviour.  Most people will offer help to find someone so I am always annoyed when movie plots make it seem otherwise.  The Prince is certainly not the only movie script to use that device to  show how badass the main character is.  It is pretty much required plot filler in action movies.Lastly, J. Cusacks hair. ouch. Who decided that was the look they needed for an aging rich criminal?

I am not sure why everyone always wants to pan on Nicholas Cage and Hayden Christianson's acting, to be truthful they weren't given a lot to do in the movie past fighting. It was the camera angles and the constant switching views is what nearly gave me a headache but I suppose if you don't have a large budget for action sequences you can pretend things are happening by "sorta" showing the fighting.  The foggy opium points of view and flashbacks were overused.N. Cage was really only more of a supporting actor and both actors were drug abusers (opium, alcohol) hoping to dull their many sins so one can reasonably expect them to behave the way they portrayed their characters, with halting speech patterns and wooden emotions.  If anything, the actors who portrayed the sibling prince and princess were the weak links in the acting department.I rented it for 99 cents and had waited a very long time to do so because of the bad reviews.  Which brings me to my biggest complaint about my fellow Amazon (and Google Play) reviewers: If you are going to take the time to write a review then for gawd's sake EXPLAIN why you rated it that way in complete sentences and more than one or two words. Otherwise your review is a complete waste of time.  You want your 2 hours back for watching a bad movie?  I can bet that you've spent more than that doing even worse things and using a cliche to rate a movie wastes a few minutes of your oh-so-precious time too.  Stop it.

I had a sample of this sitting in my drink mix box for the past year, I finally mixed it up and drank it and was very surprised at teh taste. No aftertaste and not even the cloying taste you get from Stevia.  I plan on ordering some more.  As far as the rest of the claims, I can't say yet.

yeesh. Prepare to fast forward through a lot of documentary style footage with voice narration over.  I don't know how any person over the age of 21 and not fascinated by naked breasts could watch the entire thing from end to end.

the price is right, you get enough variety to make you happy. If you like the books that have the repetitive detail pictures then you should like this one.  I personally am not a fan of what I have labelled "wallpaper" patterns that are just repeats of the same design over and over on a page.  These books are pretty reasonably priced so i am not disappointed in the purchase.

For the money, it is a good book and has enough variety so you won't get bored. It would of been a hit with me had they made the arms, legs and hands of the animals non-human in form.  As it is the pictures are just animal heads on human bodies.

It took me two days to watch the whole thing, and a good deal of it just felt like filler.  We really don't need to see another long montage of how hard SEAL school is for one. I am a Veteran, and I've known plenty of guys who were exactly as gun ho and rabidly patriotic as Kyle so I can understand his devotion to duty and the  movie did a good job of showcasing that.It was just too long, and in the end they glossed over him putting his entire team in danger in order to shoot the sniper.  I have no idea how true that part was, nor do I know what sort of aftermath came from a review of those actions.  The movie shows him calling his wife in the middle of this, another thing that I disagree with.  Did it really happen like that? I have no idea. I am speaking of what I saw in the movie.

most of the movie is spent watching the Heroine run up and over things. Oh, she rides a horse too and then later rides the horse with the native dude. She stops occasionally to strike a weird pose on top of something or to fight devil looking creatures or other humans who for some inexplicable reason wear strange headgear with masks and pieces of rope or hose on them to resemble tentacles. It is nice scenery though, a very pretty landscape where they filmed.I suppose if you want to watch a pretty girl in black spandex run all over the place and are used to the movie quality of the SciFi channel, you might enjoy this.  I did not.

I laughed and snorted a few times. Witty dialogue, actors having fun, and Jock the man servant. Someone said this was similar to Pink Panther, and although I haven't watched a Pink Panther movie in ages I would agree.  I would venture the opinion that the movie would appeal to those with the ability to appreciate an entertaining dialogue filled romp. If your conversational abilities are limited to texting and IMs with improper grammar and shorthand, then I suggest you look elsewhere.  But those people probably only read the first five lines of this review anyway.
Made my rosacea worse. MUCH worse. Tomato bumpy face.
Nice bright light, with an attachment for smaller eggs.  The price is nice as well, but the compromise is it is corded so you have to bring the eggs to the power socket.
didnt' work for me.

save your money and get generic Miralax.  My cat had terrible constipation, made worse from a new "grain-free" food and was crying in pain when he tried to poop.  I purchased this and just popped it into his mouth before he was given his food.  It helped a bit, but not nearly enough.  I even tried canned pumpkin.I was told by two friends who are Veterinarians, plus several other friends that Miralax is safe and recommended.  It works by drawing more water into the bowels to "ease the passage" so it is not a stimulant laxative, as neither is Vetasyl.  I found it easiest to give to my cat in pill form and right now I am opening the Vetasyl capsules and mixing the contents with generic Miralax, closing up the capsule and pilling my cat.He can poop now without pain, which means no more yowlign, growling and eliminating on me while I sleep. (thanks buddy, I didnt' know you were in that much pain).

Pleasantly surprised. Most Creative Haven books are repeats of patterns in what I call "wall paper" drawings, or worse..they are just reprinted drawings from the older Dover Press coloring books.  This  one has actual drawings like on the cover, and plenty of detail without getting crazy.  It does have some of the types of prints I just mentioned, but they are few interspaced between the greenhouse type scenes. It is printed on one side of the page, and the pages are perforated so you can take one out for fear of ripping or ruining the book.I have most  (if not all) of the garden themed adult coloring books, plus about 20-30 more books ranging from the old Dover Press coloring books to the newer books being printed nowadays for adult coloring. As a comparison:  Johanna Basford's books are filled with gorgeous art, but pages are porous and printed on two sides. I haven't started coloring them because of this.  Then there is another garden themed book called Enchanting English Garden, where the images are not as detailed and there is tremendous white space. For the price, this book is the better buy and I doubt you will be disappointed.

Fun movie, written with tongue firmly in cheek. The actors could actually act and the sidekick guy was pretty good at expressing horror and awe. The giant wolf penis in the beginning was hilarious as well as the face removal scene. As some one said, very reminiscent of the style of Shotgun Hobo.The only complaint I would have was the scene in the autobody shop was a bit too long.

Almost instant relief for my cat. He's been on fiber caps for a week but was still getting constipated and  in seere pain. After waking up this morning to a pee soaked bed and him hiding in a closet yowling, I used this and locked him in the bathroom with a water bowl and towels. He had a very large bowel movement in less than an hour and it was not diarrhea.  I am adding Miralax to his food on the advice of several vets, techs, and friends. Hopefully that will solve his problem. But I'm ordering a few more of these to have on hand just in case.

Has some nice scenes, but also some of the same repetitive patterns you see in all the coloring books for adults these days. This is a hardcover book, the pages are very heavy non-glossy cardstock.  The images are on both sides of the pages, so i would be cautious before using gel or markers. There are some gorgeous drawings, of forest scenes, complete with gnomes, fairies, etc.  But this is also another book heavy with repetitive pattern pages reminiscent of wall paper.  Some of the pages have good detail and some parts are lots of white space which would allow for a colorist's talent for shading.  The book is roughly 2 inches taller than most coloring books and is not one you would be tempted to carry around with you. I would reserve it for periods where you have a larger work surface.

I didn't see what year this was filmed but if the first 5 minutes of your show is about killing a possum for no good reason and the story isn't even funny,  clearly there is a reason you filmed in Texas. I didn't even smirk once and stopped watching after twenty minutes.
I too was fooled by the author and purchased this book.  Thank goodness it was less than five bucks.  It would of been a decent read, but it ended with a giant question mark for a short story.
MY favorite band ever.
the coloring books from Pictura are fantastic! I'm not sure about using heavy markers or gels, pencils are the best for this type of book. The paper is heavy porous cardstock.

Just like JOhanna Basford's first book "the Secret GArden" this is a beautifully drawn and detailed book.  They still chose to use the same thick art paper for the pages and they are images on both sides. Markers especially will bleed through and I think some of your more "liquid" gel markers would as well.  Best to leave this book for pencils, If I get the urge and want to use gels or markers I plan on getting a page copied on some quality paper stock and then coloring.

I like these types of books for adults vs the Intricate pattern or Tangled type books because the don't repeat a pattern ad nauseum. It is a lovely book, but not near as detailed as the Joanna Badsford books" Enchanted Forest: An Inky Quest & Coloring Book" and "Secret Garden".  In fact, one of the pictures looks very similar to another I've seen in a Dover Press book of a watercan full of flowers. So if you have as many books as I have you can get an idea of the detail in this one. Lots of white space that I wouldn't use anything but pencil or crayon on.The paper in this book is thick and not as porous as the other two I mentioned, and that is a good thing if you want to work with gels. I did try a few markers on the back pages and got bleed through. This is fine as the images are printed on one side and blank on the other, but if you work the pages IN the book I recommend placing something behind the piece you are working on as there is no guarantee the marker will bleed all the way to the next page.

I got this for raising baby bantam chicks and the zippered bottom is perfect for containing  mess. The zippered top helps keep them from flying out when the get older and are able to do so.  Very roomy. I plan on using this when I needed for containing a sick cat or for my guinea pigs to hang out in when I clean their cage I think it would work perfectly for very many applications of sick animals as long as they don't chew.

The story, is more about Mary B Cuddy than the "story" of taking three women who for various reasons have lost their hold on their sanity.  She agrees to take the three women East, to their families and in exchange for saving T.Jones, coerces him into helping her.  She has prospered on her own, yet she is lonely.  Apparently she is considered plain and "bossy" by the men, and so has yet to find a husband at the age of 31 and along the way she loses her reason to live.  The three women have a little of their stories told, one lost all her children to diptheria, one is abused and raped by her husband, and the other kills her latest child in what appears to be a result of the failure and future starvation of the family. Their crops and stock have all died.But it is not about them, it is about Cuddy and how the unrelenting cruelty of the west eventually breaks her will to live. It is then that Jones' hardened uncaring attitude evolves a bit during the final trip even when the world he knows as cruel, continues to beat down on him.The story isn't slow, but it is paced. Don't expect a shooting up fighting type western. I didn't find it depressing, but it certainly isn't a film with a happy ending for anyone.

I love Hank! and I am not an avid SF reader. The books were recommended because I like humorous tales of fiction with oddball characters. This one fits the bill.  I'm on my third book and still going strong.

Not a good book at all.  I haven't read any Jack Reacher novels in several years but I don't recall the paragraph-long descriptions of how and why he does some minor inconsequential task.  Good gawd, how are we expected to believe that someone like Jack Reacher who notices EVERYTHING down to the last minute boring detail wouldn't ask to see a photo of a woman he supposedly fathered a child with when he doesn't recall the name?  Or a photo of the child. Or upon being told he beat the crap out of someone years ago and that the file contains pictures of the injuries he doesn't ask to see THAT photo? Or his lawyer doesn't show it to him to help him recall?  What about being told he could be prosecuted for adultery, and no questions were asked about the husband of the woman he allegedly fathered a child with?  One would think that might help jog his memory.This book is going back to the library, I am at the part where they are on the plane headed to California and I can't take any more drivel and reactions of characters totally out of synch with the real world.The police are incompetent, the lawyers are all idiots, and we are subjected to unnecessary musings on three paragraph characters. It doesn't add anything to the story and only serves to add to the word count. Perhaps Mr Child has a quota on page numbers and word count now?

A story of one man's ruthless actions to get what he wants and the consequences, including his eventual comeuppance.  He doesn't plan most of his worst acts, but he takes advantage when the opportunity arises.  The setting for the story is a future where water is in short supply and the independent farmers who can't get the water channeled to their farms. The scenery and life depicted is brutal and unforgiving. Babies are bought and sold because apparently fertility is low.The father in the story is an alcoholic on the wagon after he caused the accident that left his wife a paraplegic. She's able to stand and walk if hooked up to "guide lines" in the hospital, or care facility where she lives. He tries to be good and help others as a result, and this leads to his downfall.  The story eventually follows the son and his choice of actions for revenge.It is not a fast-paced movie and has somber, dirty scenery for an atmospheric touch. The ending is neither happy nor sad.

The designs lend themselves more to a subtle blending of colors over the entire object. The examples in the book show graduations of color used on each animal. Take the elephant on the cover for example, the examples would color the animal in shades of gray in much the same manner if there weren't tiny swirls all over.  For lack of a better way to describe it, imagine the shades of a fish over a pattern of fish scales.The patterns are so busy, and mostly circular that I think using a really wild palette would overwhelm them.

While some of the pictures in this book are highly detailed, most of them resemble the same thing you can fine in a Dover Creative Haven coloring books, which in turn are just rehashes of their old coloring books in most cases.I had this book in my hand at Michael's and I am sorry I didnt' bother looking at the whole thing before coming home and ordering it off of Amazon. I was hoping for more art like can be found in the Pictura series or "Secret Garden: An Inky Treasure Hunt and Coloring Book" but was disappointed. The latter book btw, is a colorists dream but unfortunately it is printed on stock paper and using markers or gels would bleed through.If you like the Creative Haven books, or similar you won't be disappointed. I have so many similar books already that this one just doesn't do it for me.

In actuality the only part  I found tedious was the build up to meeting the witches, when the men are in the car and complaining about women.  It just went on too long, and I lost patience with that part. Otherwise, once they get into the witch's town and the action starts it is lots of fun.

The Expendables movies are supposed to be cheesy throw-backs to the old action movies. In this they succeed very well.  Not much face time as expected for the old crew, which was disappointing because Terry Crews is flat out fun to watch and Dolph makes an awesome grumpy big guy.  That's what I enjoyed about the first two movies, the larger than life actors I remember from my youth and the "catch phrases" that came with the action movies.They aren't suppose to be believable and the dialogue is tongue-in-cheek. Which is why the movies are fun.Best lines of the movie:Wesley Snipes' response to why he was locked up "tax evasion", said with an psychotic grin.Stallone's answer to Statham's query about "what was that?" during the first skirmish. "A large black man in a boat".although there were lots of others that made me chuckle.Mel Gibson still has the best "crazy eyes" in the business, evoking Lethal Weapon memories. He's not as fun to watch as Van Damme was, but pretty darn close.

The movie is more about his relationship with his daughter vs an action movie.  It has some action, enough to satisfy most people.  It was ok, I believe the flaw for me was I didn't care about the characters.

I've used these kinds of traps before and couldn't find any kind of humane mouse trap where I live. Walmart used to carry these, but they don't have any kind of live traps for mice anymore. I also tried Tractor Supply and Rural King with no luck.I don't think I will ever have a need for four of these traps, because the mouse I wanted to catch was actually brought into the house by me to "recuperate" after I saved her from my cat outdoors.  This mouse thanked me by escaping into my craft room for the two weeks I went searching for a live trap.I used to use peanut butter on a cracker in them, but this time I had some spinach dip so I scooped a bit into the lid of a 2-liter bottle and scooted it to the back of the trap.  I set the trap where the mouse had been leaving poops and caught her almost immediately.Miss Mouse, whom I named "Bambi" during her time on the lam, was then deposited back outdoors out of sight of the cat.  The trap is mouse sized, don't use them if you have bigger rodents. I don't even think it is big enough to catch a run-a-way syrian hamster. Maybe a dwarf though.
It has been awhile since I read the book so I don't know for sure if it followed it exactly, but the movie stands on its own fine.

Those of you who own Nexxus tablets are probably researching a wireless charger pad for the same reason I did, the power port becomes loose on them and eventually won't charge through a cord. Thank goodness I got the 2nd gen, because the 1st gens have the same problem but are not wireless charging capable.It did get a little hot one time when I left it charging on my bed, with a pillow over it to prevent my jerk cats from knocking it off while I was gone.  Otherwise, just sitting out with the tablet on the charger it doesn't get overly warm.Pricing is good, I followed other reviewers before I purchased and I am pleased with it. It saved me from plunking down more money on a tablet simply because the power port on the Nexxus' are crap.

Fun, lots of action, and an actual story.  First let me say that the reviewers that claimed this movie had no action or was boring are clearly children weaned on bloodbath video games and the attention spans of gnats.  It is a fun movie with plenty of action, absolutely no frontal nudity or sex scenes which is refreshing to be quite honest.  The blood and gore is minimized and Hercules' merry band of mercenaries are engaging and fun to watch.Hercules is still very strong, but mortal and the way the story illustrates that legends are born from stories exaggerated and spread.  And probably liberal uses of hallucinogens that are hinted at.Finally, you can't argue that watching Dwayne Johnson walking around in a loin cloth isn't an entertainment all on its own.

working good for me so far, using it in a chicken coop and I turn it on at night so I can hear if a predator tries to get in the coop. The chickens will put up a racket if that happens. My coop is located at the back of my yard, roughly 30 yards and my bedroom is located in the center of my home.  It is not directly in the elements, but so far humidity hasn't caused any issues.
using these to root succulents, perfect size.

perfect tiny little jars for holding Swarovski rhinestones. I used these to store the special rhinestones that I have less than 20 of. The lids screw on, which is important because Swarovski crystals are not cheap.  I can immediately see my stock and pick what I want.

I purchased one of these from Walmart, figuring it would be handy to have in the car or bag when I was thirsty and rather than purchase a bottle of water, fill this one up at the nearest water fountain just to be safe.  Save myself a little cash ya know? However, the flap on the lid snapped off when I first used it. It is still usable, I just can't let it tip or leave it partially full in a bag.  Water tastes fine in it, although to be honest I have filled it with already filtered water through Pur on my tap.

I don't think one of these reviewers watched the same movie as I did because the flashbacks were not confusing, the heat was mentioned every 15 minutes or so in the dialogue and there were clearly more than one leather bag during the robbery.The movie moved along at a  nice pace and had enough character development of the townspeople that you had some what of a connection to them. The underlying theme is about redemption and whether it is attainable for different characters.  It is also about a small dying town and the question of whether it is worth saving. There is a lot of killing but it is not really that gory. The acting was decent with exception of the woman playing the girlfriend.The bad guys were definitely bad, but quite stupid. They got caught because of this and then ten years later they go around brazenly gunning down anybody who gets in their way. The idea that these acts will most certainly get them caught again doesn't seem to enter their minds.In reference to another reviewer's comments, I didn't find the flashbacks confusing.  What was interesting was were the money ended up being, considering Pike was near dead when he was found, I doubt seriously there was anyway he could of placed it there.

Unless you are a bible-thumping Christian, do not waste your time. It would of been nice if the description for the movie had been "religious propaganda".  I should of known when I saw Stephen "Born-Again" Baldwin in it and it was produced during his time of re-awakening".  The movie itself has bad production values and horrible acting by some well-known guys who should of at least made this tolerable.
this is perfect for those small rims with tight spokes. MUCH easier to fill the tire now.
my only complaint is the white seams which make it unattractive to wear.

I used this to embellish fabric with vintage glass stones because of how well the original e6000 stuff works and this tube said "flexible".  It ended up adhering the foiling of the stones to the fabric and not the actual stone. The stones peeled off and left the foiling on the fabric. Not cool.

I enjoyed the movie for the action, but the whole concept of how this guys who worked so tightly together had three people in their ranks (including the commander) who would so freely kill or endanger their teammates for money didn't fit into the whole picture. Oh sure, the woman was crazy and there was the revenge thing, but a tight knit tactical group like that it doesn't come across as plausible.
I am not a fan of the type of comic that uses straight lines, a pause and then the punch line.  I wasn't finding it funny 20 minutes in so I stopped watching.

No other topical flea meds were effective on the vampire fleas in my yard and house (seriously, I swear they couldn't be killed).  It didn't seem to bother them as much as other topical flea meds did either.  It works. Period.

I used these to trim the nails of my rabbits, cats, and prairie dogs. It is super sharp and has come in handy for trimming the teeth of a pet rat with malocclusion (don't do this yourself unless you know what you are doing because you risk injuring your pet and/or getting severely bitten).

awesome for audio CDs. I wanted a cheap player to listen to my audio CDs from the library and to tuck into my stroller for walks. This works fine. I didn't subject it to any harsh terrain, so I can't say whether it is anti-skip but for my purposes with normal walking about it worked fine. No frills, just works.

I used this with a pet stroller, it held up fine until the end of my walk when the velcro unattached and dropped my water bottle, keys, music player and flashlight. Probably would work better if it had straps that didn't come undone with weight.

Used them to cut holes in cache pots that were ceramic on top of terracotta, and some that were all ceramic. I used water as a lubricant and they cut holes in a matter of a minute or two.  This afternoon I cut 12 pots with the two largest bits and they showed no signs of getting dull.  The thickness ranged from 20mm to 10mm. I was worried that when I tried to drill holes in the pots for drainage that I might break them, but not one even showed a crack.

I didn't find this movie to be anywhere close to as violent as most movies are nowadays, the violence when it was there was appropriate for the story line. The movie description says "two outlaw bikers" when in fact they meet during the beginning of the movie and become friends as the movie progresses. One is running from the law, the other is running from his life.  I like to think that the latter becomes a better person having made the trip with Jason Momoa's character and seeing the family and community he is a part of. It is a also a sad commentary on how the federal government still treats American Indians poorly.  The ending is sad, and some things are left for you to fill in your own answers as to the fate of the rest.
With nine cats, these save my wallet. They work and I can keep one step ahead of the problem.  The large quantity size is appreciated!!

I had the hardest time deciding whether to purchase these or the Derwent Tinted Charcoal Pencils to color The Art of Nature Coloring Book I purchased here on Amazon.  http://www.amazon.com/The-Nature-Coloring-Book-Illustrations/dp/1440570604/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1404595981&sr=8-1&keywords=the+art+of+nature+coloring+bookI am very glad I chose these first because they have a better variety of subtle colors and lend themselves well to landscape and nature art.  I color to meditate and because I have a hand tremble from medication that I wish to reduce. I am in no way what one would call even a slightly good artist. lol.  I may get the charcoal set later, but I've got my eyes set on the full box of Derwent Inktense colors. I have the twelve box and now I want moooore.

fantastic! Extremely detailed, although a few are quite repetitive patterns.  I prefer variety in the image, but this artist is a pattern specialist so that was expected.I will order other books I am sure.

The beginning was fun to read, but by 1/2 way through it became a repetitive gore fest and no one comes out okay.  Just blood guts and of course, the ever-present sexual sadism and deviance in extreme horror.  I like extreme horror, but I may be becoming a bit bored with it due to the repetitiveness in the stories. This book asks you to believe that there are hundreds of people in one town willing to commit extreme attrocities every year for three days.  Actually, supposedly all over the world and it really never explains the why behind it all.
The book was a bit slow and boring for my tastes so I gave up 1/3 of the way through.

I know what it is like to investigate a case, and to come across less than willing witnesses. The actors all do an amazing job, and they even show what it is like in the "good old boys" culture of law enforcement with the first detective not caring about the victim.  This is how police investigations work people, this is not an action movie.The movie is based on a true story, the young prostitute is NOT a cliche as someone wrote, she is a living breathing person subjected to sexual abuse as a child and then becomes just another girl selling herself to survive.  If the reviewers had bothered to realize she was 17 at the time of the incident, they would of had a bit more sympathy instead of labeling her as stupid, or a moron.

I enjoyed it and I am an adult. Granted, I am also partial to small rodents with cute noses. What was interesting was the squirrel was not really a bad guy in that he didn't need much prodding to help get food for the rest of the park.

I love that it has pictures of actual plants instead of drawings or just the part that is useful.  It is kind of hard to identify plants without a picture. Of course, I would never use just this book to identify plants before using but every usable resource helps. Plus it has some cool recipes in the second half.

I don't know when I am going to run out of this stuff, considering I use it just for my house but I am glad I spent the money and got the six bottles. I feel much better knowing my pet's cages and furniture are super clean.  I usually do a water wash down with bleach and soap, let dry in the sun, but now after washing I spray with the sanitizer and let dry. Perfect. I've used them for dishes that have set a little too long in the sink (ahem..) as well for the insides of ice chests and water cooler.s
There is a lot of repetition in the drawings, more like what you see in a wallpaper or fabric swatch. But they are cute.
the teeth on these headbands don't fit flat to your head, instead the whole thing pokes you from every direction.
I much prefer the elastic (very strong) to the plastic options out there. The buckle lies very flat. It does what you want these belts to do. Period.

I have this book and this one http://www.amazon.com/Concrete-Garden-Projects-Inexpensive-Containers/dp/1604692820/ref=tmm_pap_title_0.Both are full of cute ideas, but I personally liked this one better due to the small project ideas.
The Dunlop pick holder was easy to install on my guitar, and holds a great number of picks. I have had this model for more than two years, and it's still working well. Recommended.
These are decent guitar picks that I've used for playing my two guitars. They have lasted me more than two years, and haven't come apart, or chipped.

This Thermos Raya Lunch Bag is stylish. It is perfect for carrying in lunches in little LunchBot Kits. I've used it to carry in two meals (breakfast and lunch and a small drinks) with no problem. The lunch kit looks like a purse. I've gotten a lot of compliments about how cute this kit is. Even better, it is also easy to wash. I wouldn't say that this thermos kit will keep your meals hot or cold effectively, but it does provide enough space to carry in your meals.

This Fashion Sketchpad Kit is not worth the price. Yes, it provides designers with empty templates that you can use, but it lacks the rudimentary directions to use the templates effectively. The template drawings, themselves, are so light, there's no real way to photo copy them or even "reuse" them. There are no directions that teach you how to produce or create your own templates drawings from scratch either. It's just a book with templates and nothing more. Not recommended.

This guitar is a good starter kit for beginning guitarist starting out, but I wasn't impressed with the sound quality of this Fender. I've played other Fender guitars which outmatches any other brand that I've used as far as the mellow, deep, rich sound it produces. But, this starter guitar produces a tinny, cheap sound compared to other Fender's I've played, and also the strings seem to come out of tune after one playing session. I would pay the extra money to get a better quality Fender than this one.

This is one of the best skin moisturizers that I've used. I have eczema, and when I use the PCA products consistently, along with the Apres Peel Smoothing Balm, my skin issues are calmed down. I haven't used this in a while, since I've been trying out other products on my skin, but I get the most consistent results with the PCA.

I purchased this microphone to record some radio shows I do on a weekly basis, but I haven't really been impressed with the sound quality of this microphone. The Yeti has been inconsistent no matter what settings I use. The audio isn't rich, and sometimes sounds as if I recorded my voice on a regular stereo headset microphone. I'm really unhappy, because I spent a great deal of money to ensure I would get a superior sound quality, which I haven't gotten with this microphone.

I bought two Equal Exchange chocolate bars at my local store recently. Although I like that the company is socially responsible (making a fair exchange with local growers within the Dominican Republic, Peru and other locations) I still wasn't crazy about this chocolate. They even use superior ingredients including organic ingredients. I really wanted to support this company, because I'm behind their message and their use of quality ingredients, but to be honest, I probably won't be purchasing it again because the two chocolate bars I had tasted bitter to me. I know others will have a different experience, and I encourage them to support the company, if you like the chocolate, but I didn't like the taste much, so I won't be purchasing it again.

The Neutrogena Rapid Dark Circle Repair is a scentless moisturizer/repair cream that helps to lighten under eye dark circles. I have dark skin, and this light moisturizer seems to moderately lighten the dark circles underneath my eyes without the harshness of other chemicals I've used in the past. I appreciate it even more that it's been tested by ophthalmologists, because my eyes are sensitive to chemicals. This product works well.

This At-A-Glance meeting planner is nice and simulates leather, but it wasn't the portfolio I was looking for. Although the portfolio, itself, looks wonderful, it isn't study enough for my purposes (writing notes). I need something that has a hardback so I can write things down easily. This doesn't have a hardback, and its too soft. Even the notebook included with the portfolio slipped out easily. It looks beautiful (and has an inner stitched pocket), but it's still not durable enough for my everyday use.

Who has not been in the kitchen and made a mental note of groceries/household supplies you need and had nary a piece of paper to write it down on, or just plain forgot when it came to being inside a store?Who has not missed writing love notes just because?Who has not been in need of doodling a taco cat, or a penis while making dinner and found nothing to leave that inspiration on?ME that is who! In comes the Boogie Board (dumb name) a magnetic, doodling, list making, love note template that is easy to use, and easy to clear when another use comes about. It is lightweight, simple, and besides the stylus getting stuck in its holdy hold, its pretty well designed and stylish.

I have a 15 year old Assassin's Creed fanatic in my life now, who has an itch for anything he can wear, display or wield that has to do with the game.He did not get to dress up for Halloween this year (and no you are never too old to dress up) so when I saw this, I knew he would love it.Packaging is spot on, excited anticipation for what is inside.Its safely sandwiched between plastic and must be put together (the blade onto the glove) I know basically nothing about the game itself, but I can appreciate good quality design and it is an exact replica of Jacob Frye's , sturdy material throughout.He has not taken it off, even when he plays Fallout 4! any gamer would love this...heck I want to wear it.

I wanted to find a good hydrating lotion that was good also to protect against skin damage. SPF is needed nowadays. I have sensitive skin, looking at the product it says its good for sensitive skin, even "soothes" it. Allergy tested.First off it smelled, like old lady which I hate. I have people who love to kiss and hug on me, and the last thing they want to think of is "granny" getting past that, it felt oily on my skin, burned a little, made my eyes sting and I did not even get close to them! my sensitive skin broke out into redness and i instantly washed it off. It had to be the fragrance in it and the tocopheryl acetate which is so well known to cause an immune response( rash, redness burning)  in people with allergies/sensitive skin.when will companies realize that stinky lotions are out? and harmful ingredients?

dang this stuff is amazing. We have three cats, and I am a messy messy gal :) I needed a cleaner that could clean up after pet messes, and people messes.Liquid-Ate is not your everyday cleaning solution, no..i have tried those and they have failed me. Cats throw up, they drop poo bombs, they spit up hairballs and they create havoc...sometimes smelly havoc. It is an enzyme based solution, 100% biodegradable and safe for my pets and myself. It does not just use some heavy fragrance based cleaning liquid that masks the stain with flowers and fruit. It actually cleans, from the top to the bottom. I tested it out on couches, a sweater, my carpet, blankets and it got all stains out ...no smells left either (super important)so happy I found this.

I grew up with freeze dried fruit, my mom used to get it at health food stores to add your cereal,oatmeal,trailmix and lunch boxes. I always thought it was fruit that was left in the freezer too long!I was drawn to Brothers all Natural Fruit Clusters because they are sugar free, no preservatives, 100% real fruit, and they had two fruits! Fuji apples and Raspberries!The look? Giant easter bunny turds, the taste, tart..raspberry mostly with a finish of apple. I liked them!

I myself do not play video games, but my Girlfriends son does and he could not stop raving about how awesome these are!First, they ...to my eye...are just the coolest black and the blue ear pieces glow!! its so high tech.Second, they fit so comfortable on my head and I have a sensitive head for those kind of things, I cannot even wear a headband without an instant headache.Third, the sound THE SOUND that comes from withing, is gorgeous and full and can get so loud, but not distort at all. He loved the rich sounds of zombies, and creatures, and every other character he plays. The wireless feature, the rechargeable battery , the fact that it can hook up to his phone all of it was PLUS PLUS PLUS!

Can a product be too good? this one might just fit that saying!I wanted a water bottle that could keep my coffee hot, and my water cold. This bottle kept my hot coffee hot for up to 12 hours, and the cold? I cannot tell you the amount of time...just that it kept it so cold I wish it would have warmed up a bit!This is supposed to be hand washed, which is fine..I am not that lazy. Its easy to carry, love the black and blue, and fits inside my backpack easily.

We have three indoor kitties. young to old, in need of different nutrients. Solid Gold Nature's Harmony Holistic Dry cat food provides exactly what they all need regardless of how many of their nine lives they have left. It is tailored for ALL life stages.Its a bit ...smelly but that is how I know its for real. Its a dark brown, almost heart shaped. They sniffed it and just dove right in! I have a picky eater and he asked for more!It makes me happy to give them such healthy food, since I eat that way. Chicken, Peas, Potato and Cranberries...Cranberries? YES ...just like humans it promotes an healthy Urinary Tract.IT might be more expensive, but I believe in keeping your kitties happy and healthy and that is priceless

Wow. I needed some Kitchen dishcloths...and thought these were really beautiful (if dishcloths can be beautiful) I had no idea I would be getting such high quality, soft, sturdy towels!I Love these, they wash and dry so well and really go with any kitchen decor.

My momma always told me to go out into the sun at least 15-20 minutes a day. Well Momma, as much as I would like too, my life is mostly indoors on the weekdays and I am a night owl! This is why I need Vitamin D.Viva Labs Vitamin D3 5000 IU is an easy way to get Vitamin D without having to make sure you plant yourself in the sunlight, its especially hard in Florida cause Humidity and Rednecks are everywhere.

Hemp...its not just to make hideous pants and shirts out of anymore, and really ugly a$$ bracelets!!You can eat it! I know right? so weird.What is a hemp heart? well the hard outer shell of the hemp seed is removed mechanically leaving just a soft, creamy and nutty hemp heart.They are a super-food, but with no spandex or CGI. They contain 33 percent plant protein, 9 percent Omega-3 , Iron, vitamin E, and GLA ((gamma-linolenic acid)Manitoba Harvest Hemp Heart Protein Bars Apple Cinnamon (say that 3 times) only deserve such a long name if they taste good. and they DO!!!okay at first the texture was a bit strange, chewy like, but then I noticed that it was very moist, sweet, and tasted to me like apple cinnamon oatmeal. I really like them. I am most vegetarian and finding protein bars I like is a chore, these are a good source and I would love to try other flavors.

Ordered these to put my coconut oil in. I love using the oil on my lips, but every container I found leaked all over my purse! These seal up really nicely, they are big enough to put a lot of oil in and I love the swirly design on one of them! I plan to use regular patchouli in the other (diluted) for a perfume roller!

Seeds of Beauty? what a horrible name. I would have called this "You gals need this s***" and it would sell like hot cakes.Who doesn't want better hair, nails and skin? who among us that is over 40 would not want to help the war against time? I eat very healthy, I exercise regularly, I take multi-vitamins. I do not smoke, I do not drink cheap alcohol and I do not go in the sun. Regardless of the sainthood I am trying to reach, everyone's body ages and we need help.First of all this does not taste good, it might tell you its pineapple flavor, and you might read on the label that there is lemon and stevia added, but I have to choke this down. It tastes like diet kool aid.After a week of it though, my nails are stronger, my skin is not as dry and my hair is growing in softer. I know with time there will be even more positive changes.

I am a coconut oil fanatic, you could very well say I worship it with my whole body. I use it on my skin, hair, teeth. I use it for cooking, for personal bedroom purposes and to help tattoo's heal. I love it in my cereal, coffee, tea.On the go, its hard to corral the stuff since it can be solid then liquid in an instant. I find that most containers I put it in leak.These little packets are AMAZING! more than enough for multiple uses and purposes. I am glad I can stick them in my purse and not be worried. I will be taking these everywhere!This oil , and I have tried a few, is above and beyond the best tasting as well.

Cats get fleas, its a fact of darn life that I wish was not. I usually like to annihilate the little bastards naturally but sometimes you have to bite the bullet and use some chemicals. SAFE for pets though, which makes me happy.I have a hard time with my kitties putting this on them, because cats do not like wet things squirted on them. The packaging is hard to get into without a scissor, which is required so dont even try to rip the top off by hand.So far the fleas have vanished. the Armor works.

I had a very stinky couch. Living with 3 cats and a dog that rubs against it, this couch needed love.I thought that a stain remover, that bragged about being professional would do the trick. Not so much. It did not freshen the upholstery or clean it as well as I wanted. It did not even leave it that fresh smelling.

I had never had red lentil pasta before! I try to limit our intake of carbs and pasta is my weakness. I love lentils in any form, so I was excited to try these.They boil just like regular pasta,  I let them boil a few minutes under because I like to mix my pasta with sauce and the hot sauce cooks it a bit more. It tasted like regular pasta to me, with a teeny bit of lentil in there. The color of it is stunning though..makes for amazing presentation.

Ultra Strong, you know for those times when weak toilet paper makes you want to weep and curse the Gods who allowed cheap TP to be made in the first place!Charmin Ultra Strong TP, does what it is supposed to do PLUS some. I use it to help wipe off make up, it does not pill up and leave fluffy residue. I also use it in a pinch to get nail polish off because it holds up to the nail polish remover and major friction.Each roll is huge and with three people and three cats to clean up after , they really do last.

Am I supposed to put this in the fridge? Ha, that was my first question after receiving this.got milk? is a certified Organic Granola cereal, that you eat with milk of course! but I was naughty and tried it without at first. hee. I then got milk, and it was even better. It was crunchy, hearty, not too sweet, not too big of chunks where you scrape the roof of your mouth and a little tiny bowl filled me up so quickly. This is a perfect breakfast for anyone.

We live in florida and with that comes plenty of icky pests. Fleas and ticks being the biggest jerks of them all.Pet Armor plus is easy to use, crack open dose and put on neck so the dog cannot lick it off, and it is absorbed into the skin and spread throughout its body. Its waterproof which comes in handy, because Florida is also known for rainstorms all summer/fall long.Compared to frontline? its the same result.

I got this for our dog, because her vet recommended it due to her dry and itchy skin!I poke it with a pin and put it on her food, and she gobbles it right up. We all need Omega 3's and the canines are no exception to that rule.I trust this brand, having purchased other vitamins and supplements from them.

well I do not like it per se, cause I am not about to eat dog food unless the zombie apocalypse happens and yes, then I will gladly try some :)We have an older dog, who needs a grain free diet. Seeing that Salmon is the #1 listed ingredient made me very happy. I am not a fan of Rachael Ray and her nicknames for everything, in fact I refuse to call this food by its name "Nutrish" I would rather die under an avalanche of EVOO bottles.She loves this food (so do the cats) and it feels good to feed it to her.

First off the bottle is close to freaking impossible to handle in the shower. I almost dropped it 3 times, you have to hold it at the bottom carefully and pop open the top, do not pour with the skinny part at the top unless you wanna lose a toe.Second, this smells a bit ...strange. its not unpleasant and its not pleasant either.Third, it conditions very very well, my hair is thin and I dye it so it needs a lot of moisture and this did the trick. Left my hair very soft and smooth, no flyaways and I did not need any leave on conditioner after.

OH did I ever need these.The oven mitts I had were all cloth, and they never kept my hands from the heat AND they also caught on fire...and when I washed them they disintegrated. I really think they were one use mitts...because that is all the time that I ever wanted to use them for.These mitts are machine washable, gorgeous color, heat resistant up to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Easy to use, and I say that because I have tried on oven mitts that I said "how on earth am I supposed to pick up anything with these?"They are as fashionable as oven mitts can get really, I mean everyone looks kind of silly wearing these.

Boggle? or Scrabble? well its kinda both!First off....You must have a screwdriver to get the back off to put the batteries in. When you have done that, you will want to mute the thing. that takes a few minutes to figure out. After that you get to choose what kind of play you want. Solo, with 2-8 people, fast, slow, easy or hard. The display is brightly lit and easy to read, the game play is simple as finding words in the 5 tiles of letters and passing to the next person if you cannot find one. I believe this is a game for the car, for a picnic, when you have some time with people to kill. I do not see this as a "family game night" game because its not that stimulating.I do love the "twist" to get to the next word, and to enter what you have chosen. :)

We have all been there, you either wake up and do not have the energy for a shower...or you get home from working all day and have no energy to take a shower. Enter a hair refresher like this Axe white label.I wanted to try it out on my hair first, before I gave it to my man. I knew it was going to smell like "male" but PHEW its beyond male scent..and enters into "that guy you do NOT want to hug you cause his cologne is going to stick to you forever and make you smell like a skeevy bar vulture" Someone may like it, I do not. I especially do not want my man smelling like that.Now onto ...does it work? NO it does not. You are supposed to put some of the foam in your hands ...and then onto your dry hair, rub it in, than towel "dry" it. Then style. I get greasy hair, and this did nothing to refresh it or alleviate any of that "dirty". My hair looked the same as before, except now I smelled like a jerk.

Its been awhile.Its been awhile since any YA book blew me away, not since the first installment ofIn the After have I been so glued to a book and surprised at the ending.There are dystopian novels flying out of every tom dick and janes behind, its an epidemic...pun intended. I have started so many books only to be turned off by a poor plot line, poor writing, poor character development and lack of completed creativity.The Cage is the answer to this. A teen is taken, and ends up in what seems to be a completely manufactured habitat with other teens, where they learn that an alien race has them captured to study them. Sort of like The Truman Show, with an intergalactic audience.This book is sexy, intriguing, well written, exciting, smart and fun.

as of today, 8/4/15 I cannot properly review this due to the fact that I CANNOT understand the directions, or If i need a special tool to put this on. I tried...I tried...and I tried to figure it out BUT this is the rainy season in florida and I refuse to mess the one I have up on there now or I am screwed.I am going to take it into the Hyundai dealership and have them put it on.

I love when I go to the salon, get a haircut and they blow it dry....before they always put amazing smelling elixir onto it...which helps with the styling and to sleek my hair down (I get flyaways)Tresemme Balm, Get Sleek Blow Dry....It smells good, two pumps and massage from middle of hair to ends then style per usual. It does weigh the hair down so there is no flyaways, it does somewhat make my hair more manageable and shiny. It does not feel like when I go to my hairstylist, more like good enough for the in between time.I would not purchase this again, there are better products out there.

BLU = BOLD LIKE US (how clever)LIFE ONE 5.0 inch 4G LTE smartphone. Unlocked (which I had no idea what that meant, and now that I do...I love that I can still use my NET10 network on this) 4.4 KitKat upgrade-able to Lollipop (which is an operating system named after candy cause the tech nerds are obsessed with sweets for some reason) Qualcomm snapdragon 410 (a processor) 5.0 720P display HD (its bigger than my other phone, doesnt quite fit in my back pocket that great) 15 MP camera with flash 5 MP front camera (I do not take a whole lot of selfies, BUT I do use my phone as my main camera to upload to Facebook and Instagram...I love the camera and quality of pictures I get!) This phone is also compatible world wide so when I decide to travel, no worries there! Lookout Norway and the UK!IT also has Gorilla Glass which is a good feature if you like to beat the crap out of your phones, I am a very clumsy girl but for some reason my phones have all been safe from harm..it IS good knowing that if I happen to break that winning streak this phone is good for it. The phone did come with a screen protector, charger, headphones, and a plastic protective case.I use my phone mainly to text, take pictures, watch netflix/hulu/youtube, surf the web, and write emails. I do not play any games, or make a lot of phone calls. This phone with its speed, its vivid display, and memory/4GLTE I can watch/hear what I want too in clear detail. Send and receive data easily and it all looks and feels like a more expensive phone.The phone itself is really freaking light, thin, and not like one of those giant phones where people cannot decide if you have a notebook or laptop in your hand. The images, interface screen, is "crisp" and clear. It is Eye Candy for sure.I am not tech savvy but I was able to figure this phone out, use my NET10 easily, download and upload to any place I wanted too. I love the pictures this takes too! So very pleased. Bold Like Us- I feel this!

SOOOO SOOOOOOFTOkay that is not why you buy a planner, but IF you were looking for the softest planner ever, this is it!At-A-Glance Weekly Planner is the perfect size to carry in your pack, your work bag, with laptop case or just to have at home. Its super well made, durable, which it has to be if you are touching it and flipping through it daily, weekly, monthly. Reinforced tabs, pockets, notes, events, contacts, holidays. Its got all the usual.This is gender and species neutral.

I needed a new planner to carry in my workbag, maybe schedule things...keep track of what not. I thought this one would be big enough, and pretty enough for my girlie sensibilities.This planner is  8.5 x 11. pretty large. I like room to doodle and write a whole lot. The design is really colorful and classic. I like it, I dont love it...because its so floppy! its not easy to put in my lap if i need too..its hard to write in unless you have ample room. I am going to keep it at work and use it as a desk planner instead of one I carry around.

I have worries, even as an adult. I love anything whimsy that can help me get through any issue I have. I saw this Worry Eater and I fell in love. It is not just a doll, its a ritual you can do to clear your mind. You can write down any worry you have and stick it in its little mouth and zip it up. Spiritually its not any different than writing a worry on a piece of paper and burning it, sending it down a river, or handing it to someone you trust to help. I think this doll would be great therapy for any child who might be going through problems; parents divorcing, change in schools or house, sibling issues, body issues, anything really. You could even tell your kids to write down their worries and put them in there, and then the Worry eater could give them to mom and dad and they you could see what is on their mind, and discuss if they want too. A mediator if you will.This Eater, who I have named "Fingers" cause of the bumps on his head....is so soft and huggable. Made REALLY well, high quality for sure. NO worries here if your kid wants to fill its mouth a bunch!I am keeping mine at my office, where all my worries seem to live.

huge kitchen towel! So very well made, thick..not that Terry cloth nonsense that will not ever absorb any liquids when you dry dishes or wipe the counters. coffee design is classic and goes well with any kitchen decor/ theme. I know this one will last for a long time.

I love using sweet chili sauce in my cooking and for dipping. Its become more popular than ketchup in my house!Minor's Sauce is sweet and hot, perfect combination for a tofu stir fry, or to dip veggie pot-stickers into. I also like using it on salmon for an Asian glaze, and for baking chicken. It has so many uses and you get ALOT out of this 75 oz bottle.I like that its vegetarian/vegan friendly and has no sat/trans fat or cholesterol ..also no artificial flavors or colors.

it GLOWS!!!Essie Nail Color in Penny Talk, first of all do not go by what you see in the bottle. It is even more beautiful on your nails. Easy to apply, I did two coats. It dried quickly with no smears or lines. Hard as a rock and I am not lying about it glowing! I got a few compliments and I couldn't stop staring at my hands all night.

I love snack bars like this. Especially if they are somewhat healthy. I try to eat as many good grains as I can, but some days I just am so lazy.120 calories, 4 grams of fat, 24 carbs, 2 grams of protein. Gluten Free and non GMO. 5 Super Grains.BUT does it taste good? This is the Caramel Macchiato flavor, made with real coffee (which might have sealed the deal for me to try it, I will not pass up coffee) I did not like it. It was really too sweet for me. It had a strong taste of coffee, but not good coffee. More like some nasty starbucks prefab you buy at the gas station. It was really hard to chew, those 5 grains make your teeth work and it had a hard time going down without some liquids, and then I was picking this bar out of my teeth for an hour. The aftertaste is what really got to me, like burnt grains and sickly sweet sugar.I would not purchase these in the future, I like my mouth too much. .

I have always believed that a good nights sleep is as important to your health and well being as breathing is. I have had MANY nights of terrible sleep and a lot of those were because the sheets I was sleeping on and in between were crap. Whether it was a hotel, a relatives house, or a purchase made by me because I liked the pattern and ignored the thread count. I have made a few regretful sheet purchases into house cleaning rags.Impressions sheets ...how can I put this...like laying with the most beautiful curvy softest woman ever. I just folded them back and nestled into them, laid my head on the pillowcase, and moved all my limbs around to feel the silkiness.I never get white sheets because I always thought they were symbolic of boring, but I love the way I look on them, and the way they brightened up our room.

well, I personally don't "love" this cat food, I would not eat this unless it was after the apocalypse and I had already eaten all the canned beets and slim jims. BUT our cats do love this. We give this to them not as regular food, but as a treat at night. We go into the kitchen to get it and they freaking know, they know the sound of us opening the can, and scooping out onto individual plates. I hear plaintive meows, I feel bodies rubbing against my legs, the sounds get high pitched and pleading...its that good to them.They do not inhale it, but rather quickly chomp on it and lick it up in the most joyful of ways. I have to watch them, and make sure the quickest eaters do not finish their plates then got after the slower ones.The food itself is such great quality, I can tell that with my human senses. It looks fresh, it has a smell but its not offensive and nasty. the consistency is not that gummy cheapness that can come with the bargain cans. I feel really good giving our cats this on the regular, and I have noticed that it has made their coats softer. Our oldest cat seems to love this the most, and she is so super picky.

I am a grown woman, and I wanted this "kids" water bottle because I happen to like the cutesy flowers and pink bottle!Contigo always makes amazing durable products, and this is no different. Easy to use, easy to wash up. It will not leak no matter how clumsy I am with it. I love the button to pop up the spout.Durable as heck too, and I know because I will drop this a lot....

There are days, when we need to buy litter and we both look at each other in the store and go "ugh" cause we a) never get a cart and b) neither of us want to carry heavy litter to the cashier, out to the car, the car to the house and then to the closet.I have been a Tidy Cats fan for a long time, we usually use the multiple cat formula. The Lightweight litter is SUPER light, with a great handle on the side. That handle is a freaking lifesaver when I have to carry it AND when I pour it. Usually when I do pour the litter, there is a little cloud of dust, not with this stuff. That also helps when our three cats go crazy in the litterbox, this did not stick to them like a film.It clumped easily, and scooped easily and when I had to throw it out, again with the not heavy. I did not find the odor at all overwhelming and I have a sensitive nose.

Breakfast is the most important meal of the day right? so why cant our kitties have it at anytime!!Nutro Breakfast Scrambles. The first 7 ingredients should clue you in on how much better this is than the cheap wet food brands: Chicken, Chicken Broth, Pork Broth, Egg Product, Chicken Liver, Salmon....and minerals and vitamins and veggies!The true test is to see if our kitties like it. THEY DID...gobbled it right up and proceeded to go to the others plates to help them finish it off. Choplicking, meowing for more, and then a satisfactory purring.It actually looks appetizing to me, which never happens with wet cat food.

When I first saw this item I thought "the possibilities are endless" I have always wanted to have a "home theater" like experience. I have always wanted to be able to host an outdoor screening of horror movies and foreign films. Heck, what is stopping me from watching adult movies on my ceiling now? nothing!The Epson Home Cinema is first of all, very lightweight and compact. I remember having to haul around bulky projectors for school projects back in the day.Out of the box, the set up seems to be easy, even comes with a CD to help you with set up. I am not daunted! (which is a surprise since I have such an issue with electronics) It does not come with a HDMI cable, but those are easy to obtain. For first use purposes I am connecting to our laptop. It has the capabilities to plug into other devices such as a camera, phone, etc. Don't worry , I will not be showing my vacation photos to anyone who is reading this who knows us.We do watch a lot of Hulu plus, and have access to HBO/Showtime online. This is what I suspect I will be projecting the most! Its really easy to just plug in and follow the steps, You just choose what you are connecting too, and go from there. Mine recognized it was on my laptop right off. I am thinking we will have to find a screen to project onto since the walls in our apartment are not smooth and you can see all the imperfections.Even just a sheet might do for now!  it can project to any size you would want, that will come in handy when outside. The picture itself is beautiful, looks a lot better than my ancient TV does! You can adjust for vertical and horizontal. The speaker does fine on its own if you are inside and not in a big big room, but I will have to figure out how to hook up speakers for a more surround sound experience.It does not get too hot either, and it will quickly power off so you can pack it up and be on your way or put it up after you are done with it. I suspect I will be learning a lot more about this creature as I go, but for now I am confident I can use it without stress, and that it is going to be so much fun to have an actual bigger screen to watch than my 13 year old TV does.

I love penguins, the black and white tuxedo wearing waddlers are not graceful, but they are majestic in their curiosity and antics.This pendant is adorable. The black stones are all different sizes and shapes and that makes this very unique. You cannot tell right off its a penguin, til you look close but I like that. The chain itself is sturdy and well made.Its not a heavy pendent, which is always a bonus for me.as Joe Moore said "It's practically impossible to look at a penguin and feel angry."

I dye my hair, and am forever searching for a product that will help in between haircuts to sooth my damaged hair. Grabbed this, and went for it.It comes with 3 vials, in the most hugest of packaging. it also comes with a horrifyingly ugly plastic cap (more about that later)You wash your hair like normal, dry hair only to make it damp. shake vial and spray mid shaft to ends only (the directions will tell you how much given how much hair you have) I used half a vial since I have medium length hair. It smells like most Fekkai products...like vanilla.  you then take this plastic cap that has freaking ruffles on it and put it over your head for 10-15 minutes. Let me just say I avoided looking at myself in the mirror for fear of laughing too much, and my James was the sweetest man ever to say it looked fine.Took cap off after 15 minutes and styled as usual. I did notice a change, softer hair...less crunchy. Someone even asked if I got my hair cut that night because it was no longer frizzy.  I used this 3 days in a row and I am really happy with it, there is a difference. I would buy this again.

I have been using these for a few weeks now. I am a 41 year old who does not go in the sun, takes care of my skin, and does not have much in the wrinkle department. Are there a few faint lines? of course. I thought that using this would benefit my skin even more than the products I usually use.They are easy to apply, a bit gooey. I actually trimmed the forehead one because it was too big! I used the trimmed pieces to put on the outer corners of my eyes where the crows feet will one day live (well hopefully not, but one must never be too careful!)It was very cooling, a very pleasant feeling. after about 15 minutes I took them off and tossed them. After a few applications of this, 3 weeks...I have not notices any changes, no smoother skin. I did not notice any plumping, or more hydration. The lines I did have, did not get filled in.I have very sensitive skin and these did not irritate me in the slightest...but they also seemingly did nothing to improve any wrinkles.

Worst Detergent Ever.for me anyway. Used this and within days I had an allergic reaction. Broke out all over in hives/rash. Washed a TON of laundry in it, and have had to rewash everything, and every piece of clothing that THOSE clothes touched.I usually am fine with all detergents, even the cheap ones. I do have sensitive skin but have NEVER had an allergic reaction to a soap. This was supposed to be for babies! all organic and natural and NON allergenic. It wasn't and I was in so much pain for more than a week now.

I am convinced that no matter what I buy, be it the 12 dollar or 90 dollar concealer....in the end they never last all day and they will never match my skin.L'Oreal infallible, is fallible. Its okay as a concealer under my eyes and for the nose, and chin but as an all over your face one? it just does not stay all day, and the "matte" gets shiny after a few hours. It also needs to be reapplied after about 7 hours anyway. I found it cakes in the creases of my nose, and out in the sun its obvious I am wearing it.

Curel is a pretty trusted brand in our house. I needed a new lotion that would soak in to my skin quick, and be unscented so I could wear my perfume/body spray ad not make me smell like a whore house.This lotion goes on easy, and boy does it soak in quick. I do not need to reapply it all day. I have dry patchy skin sometimes, and have had to reapply lotion throughout the day. Curel makes it easier to leave all that stuff at home!

full disclosure, I never paid enough attention in school to really know all about Lewis and Clark. I picked this book because I really love post apocalyptic fiction.This one is very predictable and I found it boring. The writing is good/okay, but I could not get into it enough to enjoy it, barely finished it. a hundred years after a pandemic erases most of the world, a community...the "Sanctuary" exists as a haven/supposed safe place to live. I really hate it when a book starts off so strongly, in this case a freak birth and murders and a kidnapping, and then puts on the brakes never ever getting out of the driveway to begin. The settings? were the best part. But everything else was too "wordy" and I got lost.I cant give you the plot, its lewis and clark really...and the ending was flat as the pages I was attempting to read. I cannot remember most of it, its been a few weeks, because it really did not resonate and was just not worth my memory.

2:05 MinsThis cotton knit poncho is nicely designed and well made. The 100% cotton material seems strong and it is woven together nicely. The overall look of the poncho is pretty nice. This is a one size fits all product that I found to be just okay as far as size. I mean this is suited for a small built person. I am on the larger side and I found it not to hang well on me. I tried it on my daughter who is slim and has a smaller build and it looks good on her. The neck hole is also an issue. The neck hole is a bit tight and too small making it difficult to put on and take off. Overall, its a sturdy, nicely made product but it does run small on the neck and really does not look good on a heavier person.I received this to try for free in exchange for an honest, unbiased product review. All opinions are truly my own.

2:06 MinsThese are cute little shorts for lounging around the house in or for going out. They are sturdy, well made, and appear to be something that would hold up for a long time. I got an L/XL and I found them to be a bit small for an L/XL, which is why I gave these 4 out of 5 stars. The shorts are fine otherwise. They have bright colors, they stand out, and they are pretty. But I think these would be much more appealing to someone with a smaller build. Overall nice shorts, but not quite as big size wise as I expected.I received this to try for free in exchange for an honest, unbiased product review. All opinions are my own.

Well made, comfy, and roomy.I received this to try for free in exchange for an honest product review. All opinions are truly my own.

2:06 MinsThe Back to Bali Tunic Top is a nice light weight material that keeps me cool. It is on the the thin side. The top is built well as far as the overall material and make. But for a larger build like myself, the neck was a bit tight. Also the tunic was a bit short too. It is fine as a shirt. But it really doesn't flow down enough to use as a beach cover up for me. Super thin.....you can see right through these sheets. At this price I had a feeling they may be a bit thinner, but not as much as they are. I wanted to get these for my daughter's bed because she has a tendency to be a little rough on things, so I didn't want to spend a lot. Also I got the twin xl because her mattress is a thicker twin. They did fit it, but they are slightly loose, not too bad though. The are very soft however, I am impressed with the silky feel of the sheets. They look nice on the bed itself as well. Definitely far from a perfect sheet set, but ok considering the price I guess.

0:49 Mins I have really rough feet unfortunately and I have been looking for a great product like this one to make removing dead skin from my feet a snap. This really does it. Unlike the old style non electric foot files, this works with ease. You don't get tired hands from manually scraping back and forth with a file. This does all the work for you. Very simple and easy to use. Comes with 4 files, 2 coarse and 2 extra coarse, that are simple to change. This has 2 speed settings low and high. It is pretty powerful at getting off dead skin and removing calluses over time. It is a good quality foot file that works. It also comes with a little cleaning brush which comes in handy for removing excess shavings that build up on and around the file. Overall, an excellent product.I received this to try to for free in exchange for an honest product review. All opinions expressed in both the written review and the video review are truly my own.

Overall I am pretty happy with this supplement. I really was skeptical as to whether this would work to help boost my metabolism and energy level. I highly recommend them.I received this to try for free in exchange for an honest, unbiased product review. All opinions expressed are truly my own.

These are perfect for me. No distractions. I can zone right into my music and and enjoy very high quality vocals and each and every instrument. There is no static or pauses. I am really happy with them. Also they are comfortable in my ears. The sit in my ear perfectly and securely and are not irritating in any way. They are well-built and seem like they will last for awhile. I have been using them for several days and have had no issues. A nice set.I received these to try for free in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. All opinions expressed are truly my own.

Very nicely made and highly adjustable.  This belt fits my iphone 4 with otterbox defender perfectly.  Nice and sturdy elastic fabric with waist adjustment going from huge to tiny.  Very comfortable as well with no chaffing or pinch spots.

This seems like a great product but has confusing labeling.  It says 1 gram, but on the back says it has 394mg of sodium.  Does the 1 gram include binding agents?  If so, that is deceptive marketing.  If not, the back labeling is wrong.  Either way I can't give it a top rating.  Good price if it is in fact 1 gram of sodium.

Great fit for my 2004 Toyota Rav4.  Blends in perfectly with my dash and leaves no space between the receiver or the dash.  Easy install that did require a cut.  The included instructions let you know exactly where to cut and I did it easily with regular scissors.

Wire color guide included, connecters give a nice tight fit and wires are of a decent enough gauge that it will handle higher powered receivers.  Excellent!  I used this for my 2004 Toyota Rav4 with no issues.

Pioneer hit a home run with this one!  I have had countless receivers over the last 15 years and this one ranks as one of the better ones I have used.  Bluetooth function works perfectly and connects instantly, displays the track being played on the display and is easy to pair with your device.  The mic is clear for the caller on the other end and picks up talking in a normal voice.  No yelling necessary like with other mics.  The sound quality of the unit is excellent and pumps out plenty of volume even though it is rated for only 14 watts.  Far superior sound compared to my stock head unit.  The tuning options are EXCELLENT for a low cost product.  Low pass sub crossover includes output (gain) and slope level adjustments at each cutoff frequency.  The high pass filter works great.  There are adjustments for sound leveling, bass boost, loudness, custom EQ settings, and even a sound-retrieval compressed file adjustment.  This is usually associated with more expensive units.

This was a major let-down.  Despite having great experiences with Alpine in the past I'm not sure what they were thinking with this receiver.  The bluetooth functionality is terrible.  It's hard to pair, takes minutes to connect when getting in the car each time, and the display doesn't usually have the correct info on the screen for the track playing.  The unit has very few options in terms of EQ, crossovers, display, etc.  The device itself is not very visually appealing in terms of the overall design and display.  It looks cheap and awkward.  The sound is nothing great either and not really an improvement over stock.  Ended up going with the Pioneer FHX700BT, which is a far superior product for less money.

These are absolute beasts.  I use them with my Milwaukee M18 Hackzall and it absolutely destroys trees and branches.  I can saw through GREEN 4" trees from near the ground in about 10 seconds.
