Extremely sharp and nice deep teeth.  It's still razor sharp after using it a lot.  Is also nice and stiff so it does not flex much at all.  Highly recommend this blade.

Great scrub top!  This has high quality stitching and is a nice medium weight cotton fabric.  Super comfortable.  It's a little baggy on me though but scrubs usually are.  I am lean, 5'11" with a 31" waist and 40" chest.

I just had my pinning from nursing school and the supplier the school contracts with had pins from 40-200 dollars and this one is just as nice!  Nice quality metal and detailed craftsmanship.  You wont be disappointed.  Don't waste money on using your schools supplier!

This stuff is great and my vet said it should work as well as front line for way less expense.  The active ingredient in frontline just became available as generic and this stuff has it!  Works great!

Nice set of ring sizes in 1/4 size increments.  Easy to read sizes are imprinted on the rings and the metal weight feels very life-like compared to a real ring.  Also the main ring that holds all the sizing rings can be detached from the medallion so the individual sizers can be removed.  Great professional quality set, no complaints!

I have gone through 2 HP OEM cartridges in the last 7 years with my HP 1020P printer and recently thought I'd try a cheaper cartridge.  To my pleasant surprise there is no quality difference whatsoever and it works great.  We shall see if it lasts over 3 years with heavy usage though.  I'll update my review if it dies early but for now I see no reason to ever buy the HP branded cartridges again.

My 2 dogs play rough and bite at each others' necks.  This thing works great and keeps the tagg from popping off or getting chewed up or broken.  This guard also keeps the unit in place if my dogs are running through the brush in the woods.  Great buy!I agree with other reviews that the zipper does come unzipped frequently about 1" of the way.  This is not enough for it to fall off but it is annoying and I feel like I am zipping it back up every couple of days.  This is with a 3/4" collar that is made of thin material so I know it's not unzipping because the collar is too wide or thick.PS - My Tagg Tracker kit came with it included in the box!

I use this in a very humid terrarium, often in the 92-99% range and this has worked great.  I bought another acu-rite model and it died within a few hours from the humidity.  It fogged up then the screen went blank and it never turned back on.  I would highly recommend this unit for any use, but particularly for high humidity applications.

This works great!  The pumping action is very smooth and it only takes a few pumps to get it at maximum height.  It's easy to bleed and change the oil if needed.  Wheels roll smoothly and the face that the car rests on is large and grippy.  Beware the max height is not as high as more expensive, larger, heavier jacks.  You wont get your SUV up with this unless you put it on plywood or use some wood blocks on top of the jack face.

The pressure cookers are nice and sturdy aluminum and work perfectly, but I was really hoping to use them for canning.  It will only fit pint and half pint Ball jars.  Based on the measurements I thought that pint and a half and quart Ball jars would fit but they do not.  Also they do not have an actual pressure gauge so the pressure reached will be approximate and is only measurable by the intensity of the rocker's movement.

These tools are great!  The impact driver is rated at 1600 in/lbs which is the highest in it's class.  It also has 3 speeds to avoid over-torquing whatever you are driving.  Keyless chuck is great and super fast.  The 2 incredibly light XC 4.0 batteries that come with the kit last forever and add extra power to the tools.  The hammer drill is awesome.  Super powerful with 725 in/lbs of torque.  Has 3 modes for hammer, drive, and drill.  In hammer mode the hammer function automatically kicks in when pressure is applied to the bit.  Also has 2 speeds.  I see no reason to have a "normal" drill since this hammer drill weighs .1 lbs more than the fuel drill/driver, has the same torque rating, and also has hammer mode.

I like this razor a lot.  Finally I can trim my head and beard in the shower instead of making a huge mess in the sink and on the floor!  Great power and does not bog down in wet or dirty hair.  The battery also lasts for many haircuts and will operate plugged in while it is charging if it dies mid trim.  There are a couple of things I don't like about it though.  First the guards are very sharp and hurt my skin compared to other brands.  Second there are fewer teeth than other brands meaning that it leaves more stray hairs when buzzing my head.  I have to run it over many times to get them all.  My old cheapo conair clippers had many more teeth and did not leave so many strays.  The multiple runs required with painful guards make using this a rather unpleasant experience sometimes.

I really want to give this drill 5 stars but I just can't.  I probably got a lemon but the gear selector switch gets stuck a lot of the time switching from speed 1 to speed 2.  It gets stuck in-between the gears which leads to an unsettling grinding sound.  If I just leave it in gear 1 it works fine though.  This started right out of the box brand new and unfortunately has led to a general lack of confidence in the tool.  Otherwise it is great.  Nice bright LED light, tons of power and even the compact batteries last a long time.  Very comfortable grip and smooth trigger as well.

I really want to give this drill 5 stars but I just can't.  I probably got a lemon but the gear selector switch gets stuck a lot of the time switching from speed 1 to speed 2.  It gets stuck in-between the gears which leads to an unsettling grinding sound.  If I just leave it in gear 1 it works fine though.  This started right out of the box brand new and unfortunately has led to a general lack of confidence in the tool.  Otherwise it is great.  Nice bright LED light, tons of power and even the compact batteries last a long time.  Very comfortable grip and smooth trigger as well.

I don't know about all the other reviews saying it's fine or course on here, but this is a huge bag of very fine sand-like vermiculite.  It holds water very well and works just like vermiculite should - holds water and loosens soil.

This is a great product and incredibly easy to install.  Just remove the 6 tiny screws from the back panel (of the Mad Catz TE sticks at least) and it will expose the restrictor plate.  There are 4 tabs that you press to remove the installed plate, and this one just snaps right in no tools needed.  I found this gate to be very helpful in nailing very precise movements for Mortal Kombat 9.  It does not restrict range of motion but you can feel the slight notches that make it easy to make sure you are in the right spot.
This is not horticultural grade and the granules are quite large.  Works great but just be aware of this.  If you are looking for the finer kind you need horticultural grade.
Works as intended but I don't see anywhere in the description that the cable is only about 4 feet long!  Ended up returning it.

I use this mostly for annoying sticker residue left after peeling stickers off of metal or plastic and it works well. This wont handle everything though and If you are need of serious cleaner though you should get "Goof Off". That can damage finishing and materials though and Goo-Gone will not.

I use this mostly for annoying sticker residue left after peeling stickers off of metal or plastic and it works well. This wont handle everything though and If you are need of serious cleaner though you should get "Goof Off". That can damage finishing and materials though and Goo-Gone will not.

I use this mostly for annoying sticker residue left after peeling stickers off of metal or plastic and it works well. This wont handle everything though and If you are need of serious cleaner though you should get "Goof Off". That can damage finishing and materials though and Goo-Gone will not.

I use this mostly for annoying sticker residue left after peeling stickers off of metal or plastic and it works well. This wont handle everything though and If you are need of serious cleaner though you should get "Goof Off". That can damage finishing and materials though and Goo-Gone will not.

I use this mostly for annoying sticker residue left after peeling stickers off of metal or plastic and it works well. This wont handle everything though and If you are need of serious cleaner though you should get "Goof Off". That can damage finishing and materials though and Goo-Gone will not.

I use this mostly for annoying sticker residue left after peeling stickers off of metal or plastic and it works well.  This wont handle everything though and If you are need of serious cleaner though you should get "Goof Off".  That can damage finishing and materials though and Goo-Gone will not.

These are great, my girlfriend loves them and says they make everything much more sensitive and intense when I am touching her.  They are about 1" and pretty easy to get in and out.  The string is great and I don't know how someone would get these out without it.  Many models don't have them.  These are very firm but the pink outer cover is a little bit malleable.  Definitely would recommend!

I love this stuff!  I have used this a few times over the years and it works like a charm.  Both of my rear tires are bald and lose pressure slowly and I had to fill them every couple of weeks.  Now they don't leak at all!  The only downside is that it takes quite a while to put it in and a lot of squeezing effort.

Great product.  Nice and flexible but still quite firm and definitely nowhere near as soft as the jelly Doc Johnson models.  The medium is a pretty big unit and Is about 1.5" at the largest point.  I would recommend a 1-1.25" plug for beginners this one is very difficult to insert for my girlfriend.  Stays put once in though.

Fantastic guide! I am an avid player and this really gives in depth strategy for every character. The guide is very long and detailed, listing the characters' general strategies and techniques, all moves, and best combos. It includes resets, corner juggles, frame rate data, armor, advantages, etc. I have finally mastered Cyrax with the help of this guide and can pull off 100% net/bomb reset combos! I also didn't realize Jax was safe after his arm starts to go down on ground pound and that he can cancel ground pound midway with dash.  This is the type of info you will get with this guide as well as general character strategy, strengths, and weaknesses. This is so worth the price and will dramatically up your game for sure.  Ten times better than the crappy official Prima guide.

Fantastic guide! I am an avid player and this really gives in depth strategy for every character. The guide is very long and detailed, listing the characters' general strategies and techniques, all moves, and best combos. It includes resets, corner juggles, frame rate data, armor, advantages, etc. I have finally mastered Cyrax with the help of this guide and can pull off 100% net/bomb reset combos! I also didn't realize Jax was safe after his arm starts to go down on ground pound and that he can cancel ground pound midway with dash.  This is the type of info you will get with this guide as well as general character strategy, strengths, and weaknesses. This is so worth the price and will dramatically up your game for sure.  Ten times better than the crappy official Prima guide.
Nice clipboard but the top piece that extends to hang it up rattles around and makes an annoying noise when moved around much.

Great flywheel, identical to stock dual mass flywheel.  Luk is one of, if not the only, OEM manufacter for the 350z flywheels.  If you like the stock flywheel you will not be disappointed with this.  I tried a lightweight single mass flywheel and while it did rev up a little faster it lost way too may RPMs while the clutch was depressed during shifting.  It is hard to shift fast enough with the 350z shifter to keep the RPMs up during shifting.  The 350z is definitely designed with the stock dual mass flywheel in mind.

Just installed it in my 2006 Nissan 350z and works great so far.  Engages right off the floor firmly with no slipping at all.  Perfect replacement OEM, in fact Valeo is one of the OEM suppliers.  This clutch is identical to the stock clutch and is not a "stage" racing clutch or anything.  Great price on a great clutch.  It's worth the extra money vs some of the other cheapo clutches out there.  Much nicer feel than the stage 1 exedy clutch I had before.  The exedy had a very abrupt engagement that made it very difficult to shift smoothly.  It also had an extremely stiff clutch pedal.  Will update further as I put some more miles on it.
Very warm, medium is a good fit for a 5'11" male with a 31" waist and 38" chest.  Stylish, soft, and a great price!

This is a very high quality knife and is great for big hands. The blade is nice and wide and the locking mechanism is very secure. This, combined with the metal inner frame means no lateral flex at all. It is also razor sharp out of the box which is nice and it keeps it's edge for ages. The handle is quite large so if you have small hands it might feel too big. Large blade as well, about as big as you will find on any folder it's a full 4". It has a very strong spring for the closing assist so watch the fingers! Very thin and low profile as well so nice for carrying. Good grip with bi-directional serrations as well. Great full size folder!
One of the better sites to compare hotel prices, Love it

I came across this by chance looking for something for my wife and I to share. This is convenient for when we are not together but need to schedule appointments or arrange outing s for the family. No more double booking ourselves and running around like crazy
Love it, gets my son out the house for school on time to catch his bus. It's loud, we live in a townhouse, and his room is on the third floor. He says he has no problem hearing the alarm.
Item as described, fast delivery, dual alarm to wake up the boys at different times. Timex is always reliabe
Item as described, fast delivery, just what I needed for peace of mind. Keeps the cellphone safe for my accident prone son.
I use it primarily for my Gmail. Works awesome for me. That other gmail app for kindle just stopped working, it was just scrappy but this app has worked without issues. I love it.
Easy access to check on my family when I'm away from home. Great app if you have the service

I have a white and blue pair that I wear for the gym. I was going on trip Nd New this shoe would hold and be comfortable for all the walk I'll walking that I would do. I searched long and few days before my trip was able to find this pair for a decent price. I'm going to track down the other colors to add to my collection. These may be last year's model and discontinued but a great shoe.

A wonderful looking shoe, very comfortable to wear for an extended period of time. I couldn't tell by the picture that there was plastic on shoe. But once I received the shoe I didn't mind it at all made the shoe feel really secure on my feet especially at that size. Which is so hard to come by getting a shoe for evening wear.
Just as it was pictured. Was perfect for my elegant evening out. Complimented my gown and shoes perfectly. received so many compliments all night, I was the bell of the ball.
This is a Great app, always give up to date info and previews, and you can easily buy tixs through fandango.

I downloaded the app, cause I found setting the email up on the kindle frustrating with two different email based systems. I have my yahoo account set up for easy access on he kindle and use the app for quick access for my gmail. for some reason my gmail would load or connect when set up thru the kindle. I have not had any issues or glitches since seperating the two.
I love being able to get constant updates on the go about all my flights and hotel info. takes the mystery out of any last minute changes.

you never know what kids are surfing but skydog solves all of that. at least I know at home what the kids are using or looking at. I wish it was some way to track all their info even outside the house. Easy to set up and use, the videos are clear on instructions. I love being able to shut off internet access, when my three boys start acting like donkeys, lol.
I downloaded the app as an alternative to skype. it works when it wants to depending on the internet connection.
Luv this! Small and convient, use it in the car for any usb attachment. Charges multiple items without fail, no issues thus far and have used it many vehicle types.
I had a long dress and needed a large bag to my dress in. This was perfect to cover my entire dress. And wasnt see thru to keep it a surprise.

I brought this for my big wedding day. The theme was butterflys and colors creme and purple. This set fit in beautifully with my dress. The necklace was larger than expected but the perfect size for me. If u have a smaller or long neck then it will not lay right, not unless you get the chain shortened. The matching earrings were perfect and super cute. I may not wear it again but its a keepsake and momento i would on to forever, its something so unique you wont see everyday.

Nothing special about this screen protector really. Im pretty careful with my phone to begin with, so its good to have that extra protection for the screen. The one thing i dont like is that the screen is not clear in sunlight or outside, and that it smudges easily with fingerprints.
Just like the pic looked and description. Lightweight and didnt add any extra bulk to the phone,was able to fit in mybpocket without issues. Would definutely order this again in a different color.
I needed something purple and to go with my theme. This was the perfect size to go with my wedding dress. love it just enough bling for my wedding.
I no longer have this phone but the screen protector was ond of the better ones i came across.very clear and pratically smudge proof. I need to check if there is one for my htc one.
So far beyonce has not failed me. I luved the first fragrance and this one is just as lovely. Awesome seller with the quick shipping and great price.

Well I love mophie for coming up with something slim and lite to add extra battery life but the could have came up with more or better colors. I brought this one because according to the pic, it looks purple, which is my fav color. But when I received it turned out to be pink. So needless to say I wasnt thrilled with it but used it anyway. Also be aware how its plugged in and taken off the charger, if ur not careful the charging slot on the mophie will become loose and fail to charge the phone or case itself.

I love this pic, I have another pic by Laurie Cooper that is on my bedroom wall and its the perfect compliment. She is such a great artist, I would definitely recommend her artwork to anyone and everybody.

I actually bought this for my 8.5 year old son in 3rd grade.  He's had it with kid watches and wanted something grown up.  He saw it in the store and really liked it.  Given he likes dressing up, the gold and large numbers appealed to him.  He liked the blue leather too.  It fits him quite well!  It looks great on him and is highly readable. I also like the price, just in case something happens to it, we won't lose a fortune.  And if he ends up disliking it, I'll gladly take it! :-)

I first bought the 16x24" size and realized I needed the bigger size 16x32 for kitchen use.  The smaller size is good for little jobs but you really need the bigger size for fitting on your oven door and not falling off all the time.  The quality is A+.  The red towels did not bleed!  I was impressed.  The absorption is excellent.  I noticed we spill a bit in the kitchen and this takes care of it instantly.  No wasted paper towels either!  Don't use dryer sheets for best results.  I noticed when our in-the-door fridge water dispenser spills a little, this towel takes care of it in seconds and leaves a nice shine.  Very happy!

Very high quality!  I see why it's #1 in drawer organizers!  If this was at a high end store, it'd be at least $40, maybe more.  I love the expandable option.  I fully opened it and it fits perfectly in my extra wide kitchen drawer.  I use the expanded side for pens/pencils/and my letter opener.  I use one section for straws.  It gives lots of options and best of all the quality and price is A+!

Very poor product!  It looks good but it ended there for me!  I wanted to like it and wanted to quit buying PAM sprays.  It took too much force and work to pump it, then when it sprayed it sprayed with big blobs, nothing even close to a mist consistency.  It was like I intentionally dribbled olive oil over the surface of my pan.  I agree with the others now that I know - save your money and time.  Thankfully Amazon took it back without issue!

I had a no-name stick grater and I thought it was a little dull, as it turns out it was a LOT dull compared to a genuine Microplane.  This is a quality tool that is ultra sharp and well made.  I love the included protective safety cover.  It zests citrus and grates cheese far greater than anything I've ever used.  A+!

This is just a beautifully constructed case for my first ever Kindle - the Paperwhite.  It's effortless to use.  You close it and it puts your Kindle in standby, you open it and it activates the last page you read.  It's a quality leather and the color (fuchsia) is beautiful!  The first case I got as a gift, I unfortunately had to return because there was some sun or UV from lighting damage from the packaging leaving the leather exposed.  It annoyed me so Amazon made the return pretty effortless.  The second case was perfect.  It was an exceptional gift to my graduation gift of a Kindle from my husband! :-)

Excellent, simple and small add-on to your Pyrex for juicing!It's wonderful - it firmly fits onto your Pyrex and is a solid metal juicer that does a good job.  The silicone keeps it in place and the holes are big enough for juice to pass but not too large to allow the seeds to pass.  Rinse it when you're done and it's an easy cleanup.  I like how it's small so it doesn't take up a lot of space like other juicers!
It's a solid ruler, great 18" length, and the clear design makes it easier to use.  I use it for primarily measuring jewelry, chains, etc. and the print is easy to read!  It's great!

I really wanted to love this item, but I had to send it back. :(  It looks great, the idea is phenomenal, but in the end I went back to my manual opener after my traditional can opener died.  People talking about metal shards are correct.  The manual even mentions it - if you go around more than once, it will create these metal shards that can drop into your food.  That's not something I want to be micro-managing!  The fact is that it's difficult to hear, as the manual says, or see when you've gone around more than once.  I followed the directions and that lid just didn't want to come off.  PLUS, I found I had to go around more than once because the dang thing was so hard to use and the lid didn't come off!  Nope....sadly, I went back to a manual can opener.  No metal shards and doesn't take up counter space!!

Nice envelopes with easier-to-use sticky tab versus complicated clasp design.  When this item is a good price on Amazon, it's much cheaper than going to your office supply store (which is what I almost did).  It comes in a flimsy box that I already had to reinforce with tape, but the product is good!

I'm so pleased with this li-ion unit!  No cord to mess with, it has a long charge, and does just what I need for trimming my son's hair once a month.  Turn on his favorite show on the tablet, and I get a pretty easy experience with a great tool!  My old corded Wahl would vibrate my hands too much and got too hot, it was uncomfortable to use.  This unit stays cooler, vibrates far less, and is easy to use!  I am happy!

I've owned this slim vacuum over 1.5 years and I love it as much as day one!  It's slim, quick to charge, has a long enough charge to do what I need (500-700 sq. feet each time at least).  If you can get over the higher price tag, it's a wonderful investment.  The battery is still going strong and if I need to replace it, it's user-replaceable and somewhat affordable.  I leave this vacuum out all the time in a corner of my smaller kitchen.  The only thing it lacks is attachments so I kept my giant corded vacuum for that, once every few months.  I love the mostly touch-free dirt cup release!  The only improvement I think they could make would be to make the dirt cup attach easier to the unit.  It feels like it doesn't have a satisfactory "click" when it goes in.  A+!

My son is having his first science fair and I wanted to avoid a trip to the office store because an office store visit can quickly turn from a $10 trip to a $50 or worse trip.  I ordered and this board got here fast and in one piece.  It did come in a giant box as another reviewer said!  No damage except for a tiny crunch/squish on the middle section near the bottom, which no one will see.  I really like the green color, it's just as shown here and the quality of the board seems great.  This will be a very good presentation!  :)

My son (7.5 yrs) loves this race car.  I knew when he saw it, I'd be buying it as a special  reward for him, for Valentine's Day.  It's colorful and unique and I think it's worth the price.  He whisked away the mini figure and trophy before I could even see them, he loved it so much.  An easy build for a 7 year old.  Fun!

I bought a standard soap pump from a home store.  Eventually over time, the plastic fell apart, peeled, and I couldn't look at it anymore.  I'm glad I went with a stainless steel pump.  I've used it a few months and it has a satisfying quality when you press it.  I had to trim the long tube to fit in, but it works well.  For the price you pay of 2-3 of those plastic pumps, this one will outlive them all.

First off, steak knives are for more than steak.  You can cut anything with them: fish, chicken, pork, vegetarian stuffed peppers, whatever.Secondly, these are shockingly high quality.  Solid feel, just the right weight, and a perfect and simple, uncomplicated design that can go with practically any decor or setting style.  We bought them as a customer return for probably 60-75% off retail.  The box is just beautiful and a great long-term storage option.  For now, since we use them so often, we keep them in our daily knife block.  The only negative I have for them is that they are hand wash only and I am a big dishwasher person.  A superb purchase!

I knew when I saw it online that I loved it.  It's graphically beautiful and I was happy it wasn't made of plastic!  It's beautiful in person, the right size, and it is durable.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Every time I walk by it, I am happy about the fun pattern!  It's a good size for just enough cupcakes, fruit, cookies, or small pastries for most people.  Assembly was a tad more difficult and had more parts than my non-assembly brain is used to, but I got it done.  VERY PRETTY!  Definitely worth the money.  And it didn't say "Made in China"!  :)

I bought this red case to go along with my red Samsung WB800F, which is slightly bigger than the Canon SX260HS.  The Canon SX260 and Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 both fit in this case as I just tried it, but not the Samsung.  I don't know why people were saying the WB800F fit this case in Amazon reviews, as I checked reviews with the model # specifically before purchasing.  Believe me, if you can cram your Samsung in, I'd be worried about the zipper scratching the camera's finish, it's that tight.  It's just a very, very small case compared to others.  Even excluding my camera, I think this case doesn't give you enough flex space for batteries/spare memory cards for the Canon SX260 or the Panasonic named above.  It's just too small!  Pick something bigger.  I will give this red case to my son for his camera, but it's still a tight fit.  Too bad.

My son was about 5 when we got this, now he's 7.  He dislikes it completely.  It falls apart very quickly, was a total chore to build, and to top it off he never plays with it.  Maybe he'd prefer just simple K'Nex pieces to use freeform, but his true love lies with Lego.  He has no interest in this toy even if I put it away a while and bring it back out.  A huge waste of $ and effort!

We are absolutely thrilled with this case!  We have a 10.1" Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 and it fits just wonderfully.  We love the apple green color that is a little darker in person than the lime shown.  It is SO EASY to spot across the room versus that generic-fitting, black case we had.  This case has the speaker and camera cutouts perfectly aligned!  It stands securely and even has a Velcro tab that you attach once you put the tablet in, to keep it secure.  We had never bought this brand before and I was worried for only $15 it would not be high quality enough; it sure was.  The green is very attractive!  Enjoy...

This fountain was much bigger than I expected.  It's the first time I didn't measure something online so that was my only mistake.Besides that, it was too loud and splashy.  It was not pretty (like the photos) in the least - the copper looking tubes that the water passes through had some kind of very ugly joint glue applied.  It stuck out like a sore thumb.  The basin has a raised section that appeared to be cracking.  It looked more like an outdoor fountain, personally.  When I saw the raised crack in the basin, I emptied it and flipped the entire thing over and saw a massive crack on the bottom of the unit - even though it was packaged pretty well.Even if it wasn't cracked, I still think it was too outdoorsy and the ugly glue joints are unacceptable to me for indoors.  In addition, I think that it was too loud of a noise and too splashy, even though I wanted noise.  I returned it and it was a major hassle at an already busy Christmas time.  It goes to prove sometimes online photos are very deceiving in quality.I'm posting a photo of the ugly glue joints and crack.  Buyer beware.

I almost didn't buy this sound machine because of the negative reviews.  But then I thought it looks good, fits my needs, and most people go online to complain when they write reviews, so it was worth a chance.  We are thrilled with it.  It's a nice size, a nice form factor and style, it produces very good, clear sound effects, and my favorite feature is by far the day and date on the unit!  There's nothing like know what day it is when you wake up bleary eyed!  It has a very good selection of clear sounds to choose from.  Previously we were using a fan for white noise, but in cold Chicago winters it was getting way too cold to do that; and it used a lot more electricity.  We laugh every time we hear the fog horn sound noise and wonder who would want that one, but I found the ocean waves and another water one the best for me.  I accidentally had it on the real radio static for a few days and it sounded like one of the sound effects, haha.  It's my favorite alarm clock that I've ever owned and the fact it's a sound machine + day/date just makes it perfect for me!  Thank you, Sharper Image!

Believe it our not, finding latex free rubber bands in the real world is quite difficult.  A lot of people have a latex issue, me included, but not a lot of office supply stores carry them.  I found one that did but they wanted t-e-n+ dlrs for a box.  Rubber bands were not that important to me.  These rubber bands are strong, highly visible, and affordable.  Next time I may be the other variety (1/8") from the same manufacturer that's a little thinner; but I'm very happy!

My son was 5 when he got this, now he's almost 7 and he absolutely loves it still!  It's highly interesting and it's the most captivating LeapFrog electronic book he has.  It's more durable than most people were saying - maybe other kids are rougher.  It's dual sided and features an electronic game on the back.  I absolutely LOVE what this book has given us.  More than free time for Mom to get chores done around the house, it's given him wonderful knowledge of the solar system.  He'll come to me and excitedly say some amazing space fact regarding a moon I've never heard of, or tell me how many hours a day it is on this planet or moon.  This is an invaluable gift to your child.  It's entertaining and very educational.  Heck, you may learn something too!  I pretty much guarantee this is a "must" for your LeapFrog collection!

As someone who has fragrance and goodness-knows-what chemical allergies, I am so thankful I found this dish soap.  I am saved from allergic reactions and massive, painful headaches.  I use it in my entire home: at the kitchen pump for dishes and hand washing and in the bathroom soap pumps for hand washing.  I even squirt a few drops into the toilet and use it as a toilet bowl cleaner.  Regular toilet bowl cleaners with or without bleach are too rough on my lungs; and this cleans just as well so why not?  I use it with a sponge on my granite countertops and I use it on my bathroom vanity.  I also use it on my mop to wash my hardwood and tile floors.  I'm sure Murphy's would leave a better shine, but I can't tolerate the swoon-inducing headaches or allergic reaction I get with stinky Murphy's, so I use this and it makes the floors cleaner.  I honestly didn't know I used it for so much until I typed this whole paragraph.  It's truly amazing!For windows and other applications, I use 7th Gen. all purpose free & clear in a spray bottle!This is a great all around cleaner.  I highly suggest anyone with big fragrance and chemical sensitivities like me gives it a try!

Sitting on this cushion is really helping my pelvic floor disorder.  I have to keep the weight off my pelvic floor, and this really does the job.  It allows the weight to hit my sit bones versus the pelvic floor.  Normally I would not be able to sit very long, but this cushion allows me to.  It's especially helpful in the car with all the bumps and jolts.  FYI: It's best to put a small hair towel over it because if you're wearing shorts or a dress, your skin will stick and it's painful.  Plus, it leaves a funny design on your skin. :)  I have not re-inflated it yet, and it's been a month plus.  I also keep a towel over the cushion in the car so no one sees it, as much.  I find it's a great value and I just purchased another one.  Amazon's price is cheaper than in the store.  I can imagine it's good for hemorrhoids or post birth too.  It's a good investment.

We bought that expensive name brand (GE) caulk that claims not to mold.  It molds every time.  Anyway, I found that pouring plain bleach on the caulk does nothing (and makes me feel really sick).  One day I tried the thick tip of this bleach pen, I came back 30mins-1hr and it was like magic.  No scrubbing was needed, the thick gel made the resistant mold completely disappear!  Please try it, you'll be amazed and can thank me later. :)Plus it works well on white laundry but I haven't tried that recently.  I use it exclusively for the bathroom now!

It sounds like a common saying that these are the "best flannel" but to me it's true.  I've owned Target cheaper flannel and LLBean high end flannel ($90+).  To me, this set is the most comfortable and quickly induces relaxation and sleep.  It's super warm, soft, and just the best bedding experience I've had.  I use flannel all year round, in frigid Chicago winter and in summer when the central air conditioning is on.  I am tempted to buy another Pinzon flannel set here so I don't have to use my cotton sets anymore. :)Also these deep fitted sheets are great, I have a thick mattress plus waterproof topper, and it all fit perfectly.  No nail breaking making the bed!  The sage color is relaxing and beautiful!I will update if there's any excessive pilling or wear.The only thing is I wish this exact sheet set and gram weight came in a twin, my son really wanted one exactly like ours.  I ended up getting him Target flannel sheets and he's happy.

This gun has a very comfortable foam handle over the hard plastic one I was using.  My old tape gun got very gummy and the tape wouldn't release easily anymore when you pressed down. I thought about cleaning the 10 year old unit but decided to buy this one.  I'm so glad I did - it's cheaper than buying a single gun and role of tape at the store and it works wonderfully and most important, comfortably for my hands.  A+!

After using my PT's simple white foam roller, I searched around for one of my own for home use.  A well known sports store wanted $39.99 + tax, no thanks, so I went shopping on Amazon.  This J Fit one is very high quality and is actually better quality and firmer density than what my PT had!  It feels even more stable and solid than hers!  Since I sit on it and I am not a super lightweight, I am glad to have something quality to do my exercises on.  There's no use buying a cheap one to have it break and have to rebuy (as I saw with other reviews on Amazon).I'm using this for female pelvic floor therapy but I am glad to know it can be used for other exercises including readjusting and helping your back and legs.  Plus, my 6 year old *REALLY* wants to play with it.  So after all this is said and done, if I no longer use it, he will definitely find a bridge or something to construct out of it. :)

I love this product & it cleans my new stainless steel appliances beautifully, but the fragrance is so strong and over the top I have to have my husband use it instead of me.  For my large fridge, dishwasher, oven, and microwave, I end up using 3-4 wipes depending on how dirty the surfaces are.  I have found I've had to "coat" the entire surface quickly and then go back and work it in to avoid having a dried out wipe too early/streaks.  The streaks (overabundance of cleaner) go away once you coat the whole surface and come back to polish it in.  For me with my fragrance issues, it's less irritating than an aerosol can getting airborne would be and I don't have the scratchiness of  the paper towel to irritate my stainless surfaces.  This is more of a cloth.I called the company and they state all their stainless products have a mild fragrance.  If you were living in my body right now, you'd agree it's more than mild.  I get a headache for hours.  It's very perfumy & makes my tonsils ache as well.  I use gloves to keep the oils off my hands but I still react breathing wise of course.

I've been using this brand of workbooks since my son was in preschool.  I use them as a way to prepare him for the upcoming school year, challenge him during the year (as well as see what lies ahead for him), and finally we finish up the unused pages between that grade and the next.  So right now he's in first grade; when this school year ends, I will buy the 2nd grade workbook and the first grade book will be done before he enters 2nd grade.  There's always something for him to do even if homework is not assigned or during a long break from school.  For 302 pages of color activities, I think the price is an exceptional deal.  I like the perforated pages.He's advanced in math so the entire money section & most of the math section is done already!  This book also focuses on contractions, order of events, long I/short I for example, compound words, telling time, fractions, rhyming and more.

The Loratadine arrived perfectly through Amazon and was just as pictured.  The pill is an oval shape, whereas I am used to a circular shape from the pharmacy (just wanted to note).  I've noticed no difference in quality - just price!  I have a lot of severe food allergies (onion, garlic, chickpea, sesame, eggs, & tree nuts), perfume allergies, probable seasonal allergies, and can barely walk down the laundry aisle without getting a headache.  I buy unscented & fragrance free everything!  I take this daily antihistamine to be able to function.  Of course avoidance is always the #1 solution, but this helps and brings me back down from hyper reactivity to seasonal allergies/perfumes.  It does nothing, that I've noticed, for food allergies - when I'm having a reaction only Benadryl liquid works for me.  Pills state expiration Jan. 2014 and I purchased this July 9, 2012.  Highly recommended!

My mother was very pleased with this watch band replacement for her Coach watch.  It is high quality leather and a perfect patent leather white.  Not much to say, but she is happy!  And we thought it was a good value as well!  It looks just like the photo.Edit: This watch band cracked all over the place with little wear and my mother was not happy, in the end.

My son just turned 6 yesterday and he exclaimed, "It's just what I wanted!" when he opened the gift at his party.  I think he was more excited with this $5.99 speed boat than the $19.99 other Lego toy I bought him, just because of the ease & confidence a small set builds.  During the party he built the entire speedboat by himself and it really boosts his confidence - something we're working on.  He loves this little inexpensive set, Mommy loves the price and confidence building, and there will be more mini sets purchased for Christmas '12!  Thank you, Lego! :)

Thank you, Almay.  Without this product, I would have to go deodorant less.  I tried everything including Sure "unscented" which has a masking fragrance that is far from unscented; I kept getting headaches.  I tried Toms of Maine unscented which smells like moldy towel before even applying and I swear, I felt drier and less smelly wearing no deodorant at all.  This Almay product is *actually* unscented, no masking fragrance, no joking around.  I have really bad fragrance allergies and I don't even have to read the label to know if it's truly unscented - I can tell by smelling it.  I opened "Dry Idea" unscented deodorant and got a whiff, instant mini headache.  I opened this Almay and had no reaction.  I looked at the back of Dry Idea and it still stated "fragrance" in the ingredients.Somehow Almay works to control the odor and wetness without a masking fragrance and I am thankful.  It goes on a little wet but it takes less applying than the solid sticks, so I like it and it dries pretty fast.  It's available at W*lgr**ns, too.

This is a very easy-to-use, bright, clear LED monitor with a thin bezel.  I appreciate the fact it has VGA/DVI and HDMI inputs.  You do get a better image quality using the digital inputs versus VGA.  We love the 3 year warranty; given our Viewsonic lasted 1 YEAR and died shortly after the warranty (and is now in the garbage!)  The speakers could be better.  Some people prefer glossy screens, but this was a gift for my husband he prefers the matte screen.  The color reproduction is excellent and the refresh rate is more than acceptable.  With the 3 year warranty, this is a great buy!  But use external speakers!

Before purchasing, I called up the company and they told me it's not truly fragrance free - there's a natural scent to coconut oil.  I have fragrance and food allergies but decided to try it and see how scented fragrance free soap could be.  Well, it's very scented or at least to me it is!  I got a headache smelling and using it.  Once the soap touched my skin, I had an allergic reaction and found out I'm allergic to coconut oil.  Burning, hotness, itching, annoyed feeling.  I'm sure it's a good product and lasts a long time, but please note a) it does have a scent and b) make sure you're not allergic to coconut!  Thankfully, Amazon refunded my money.

I read a magazine article about how reusable gold tone filters are economical but coffee's unfiltered oils can raise your bad cholesterol.  So, we decided to use our French press occasionally and we purchased a nice coffee maker and switched to paper filters.  I bought unbleached filters in the store but saw these filters on Amazon in bigger quantity and at a much better price - shipped to my door no less!  The filters are just great and they don't affect the coffee's taste at all.  A+!  I'll repurchase if they're still for sale when I need them!

We bought this vacuum 2 years ago when it was necessary to suck up an giant puddle of water when a basement leaked.  By giant I mean about 10' x 5' wide.  It worked beautifully!  What I love most about this unit is its quietness.  After having a very old Shop Vac, this one seems no worse than the noise you get from turning on a regular household vacuum - it's even quieter than that.  I used to have to schedule when I would vacuum the cars so as not to annoy neighbors, but with this unit I can vacuum anytime!  My car interiors look great once again!We've used it in the workshop and again late last year when another water problem reared its ugly head!  We were getting our hot water heater preventatively replaced and what happens?  After turning off the water to the house, why the relief valve just broke off spewing 50 gallons of water all over my basement (DURING A FULL KITCHEN REMODEL NO LESS!).  At least it was the unfinished basement side, but it still got some carpet tile wet and risked getting some new drywall wet.  I used this vac with the "C" shaped crevice tool and it made an airtight seal against the cement and sucked up everything!  What a great tool!Advice: Read the manual.  We usually do but were in a rush with all these water incidents.  Be sure to take off the filter when sucking water, it will ruin it.  I just bought a new filter off Amazon for $10-11.  And one other thing, beware the clips when trying to remove the lid.  I pinched myself and had a blood blister for weeks.

I received this wallet for free in exchange for a fair and honest review.  I have used this now for two weeks to see how convenient it is and how it feels, because it is hard to judge a wallet based on one day of use.After two weeks, I am pretty happy to have gotten this wallet.  It is VERY well-constructed and it feels great.  It feels comfortable in my pocket and is engineered so as to make it easier for me to pull out my most important cards.  It holds paper money well so that I can easily see how much I have, and I can pull the bills out without a struggle.  Sometimes that can be easier said than done, but that is not the case here.  At first the RFID blocking shield made the wallet a bit awkward and stiff, but two weeks of use has broken it in nicely, and I couldn't really tell you that this was any different from a conventional wallet.  And, it looks great!  If you are in the market for a new wallet, this is definitely one to consider.

My wife enjoys reading mysteries, but hasn't had an opportunity to read anything by the Kellermans before, so I sent this book her way.  She hasn't read The Golem of Hollywood but says that reading the earlier book is not necessary to appreciate & enjoy this book.  She liked it enough that she is going to go back now and read the earlier book.Even though she doesn't know all of Lev's back story, the writing is such that it doesn't take long to develop sympathy for the character.  As the book progresses many of the characters become better & better developed by the narrative.  A number of loose ends from the first book will be tied up while the mystery of the 2nd book unfolds.My wife had no expectations of this book,  and although she comes across Kellerman in her job at the library, she was expecting to read a pretty basic whodunit.  "This is the strangest book I have ever read," she says, which blurs genres and almost barges into the realm of fantasy.  But she really enjoyed it, and will be recommending it to patrons at the library when they are looking for an out-of-the-ordinary mystery.

We recently started making the transition from Iams to The Nutro Company Grain Free Adult Cat Food with Duck and Potato Formula, 6.5-Pound, as a result of another free review sample, but I always like to try out the premium grain-free foods on our girls.  They certainly were interested in it, more so than any other dry foods we have tried on them.  It was the first time all three of them clustered around the food bowl filled with a new kind of food.  It looked promising.But the initial enthusiasm quickly dissipated, and they returned to the Nutro which seems now to reign supreme. If the Solid Gold only had to compete against the Iams, I think it would probably be no contest.  The list of ingredients looks good and is comparable to the Nutro.  While it sounds like I am damning with faint praise, I think that if you are trying to make the transition to a grain-free cat food, this will work quite nicely. But for our cats at least, it seems to have come up slightly short.

I don't generally have high expectations for headphones in this price range.  Generally, you get what you pay for.  And certainly these ear buds won't be taking the place of the more expensive ones I use on a regular basis.  But for 7 dollars, the quality here was quite surprising to me.  They leave a bit to be desired in the high & mid-range registers, but if you like lots of bass (I don't) then these ear buds deliver satisfactorily.  Interestingly, these fit better in my right ear than a lot of more expensive ear buds do, but in my left ear (rarely a problem) it is a less comfortable fit.  They also don't handle high volume music all that well, and if I were to push my luck in this regard, these ear buds would probably get fried sooner rather than later.  They appear to be well-constructed and sturdy, so I'm not too nervous about durability.  They come in a goofy square case which is more trouble than it is worth, and which I discarded immediately.  If you don't like your ear buds loose, keep this in mind.But in general, I am pretty impressed.  You could do a whole lot worse with something in this price range.This product was provided to me for free in exchange for a fair and honest review.

John Sedgwick is straightforward in his preface to his Author's Notes section, stating that he is not writing a scholarly tome, but assumes that most of the readers of this book will be the general public.  Everything at this book reflects that, from chapters which are 3 pages in length to the complete lack of citations.  More than anything else though, is the strictly linear narrative which takes the reader over some very familiar ground in rather McCullough-esque fashion.Sedgwick is a very good writer, and I am rather tempted to seek out In My Blood: Six Generations of Madness and Desire in an American Family at some future point.  However, even casual students of history who have studied this time period really are not going to find anything new here.  It isn't a bad book, but it's just a story I have already heard far too many times already, with more thorough analysis.  I can imagine only novice readers finding this book to be informative.

I enjoy some of the other IZZE products, but not these.  There is only the faintest hint of any fruit flavor.  Mostly I taste carbonation, and for me at least, this is a rather unpleasant taste.  I would rather take some slices/chunks of fruit, drop them in regular tap water, and drink that.  It would be more pleasing to the palate.  I was really looking forward to trying these, but they are a huge disappointment.

It's a fascinating treatment, so far as it goes.  But Arendt is such a polarizing and complicated figure that I don't think it is possible to do a worthwhile analysis of her, and her body of work, even in a book which is supposed to serve as something of an introductory biography.  While there are interesting moments, the narrative moves at such a rapid pace that any chance at an in-depth examination is immediately lost.  This is book which is unlikely to change the minds of anyone reading it, and it certainly won't be of much help to those who haven't formed an opinion on Arendt.

For me, the short story in literature is the equivalent of the string quartet in classical music.  Those who write them must have mastered their craft, or they risk having their weaknesses exposed.  Little wonder then that most of the great authors of the last century tried their hands at this genre.  And just as I loved playing string quartets (since they also leave the musician as exposed as the composer), so too am I drawn to the short story over any other genre in fiction.And there isn't a dud in the bunch.  This is a spectacular collection, both satisfying and provocative.  It is helpfully arranged by decade, but I found it more fun to skip back and forth between the more recent stories and those which are almost 100 years old now, as it is fascinating to juxtapose the different styles.There are some complaints that the older stories are given short shrift in this collection, but I feel that the emphasis on stories from 1980 onwards is what makes this anthology most worthwhile.  Everyone already knows that Hemingway & O'Connor were great short story writers, and there are collections aplenty available.  Fewer readers are likely to be familiar with Lahiri or Englander, and will now have the exposure & opportunity to seek out these contemporary authors.  Having said all that, this has also left me with the desire to re-read some older short story collections that have been gathering dust on my bookshelves for awhile.This is a hugely rewarding anthology and a wonderful overview of 100 years of "The Best American Short Stories." I just wish I could figure out a way to be alive in 2115, so that I could read the next retrospective anthology!

A foil cutter isn't an essential tool one needs for uncorking a bottle of wine, but it's nice to be able dispense with the foil quickly, and this cutter does that job well.  I have had maybe 6 different foil cutters in the house (as well as the pen knife at the end of the corkscrew), and this definitely is the one which is easiest and most comfortable to use.  I couldn't tell you why the four rolling blades work better than two stationary blades that many other models have, but they do, and it makes it more comfortable to hold & twist for some reason.  It looks to be durable and well-constructed.  Yes, it is a luxury, but then again, so is wine itself.  This will continue to be my first choice.This was a free product, provided in exchange for a fair review.

My first experience with rotary razors goes back about 30 years, and I wasn't especially impressed with them.  Blades were good enough for me.  However, 30 years have seen a lot of refinement in the basic technology, and it shows in this razor.  It is very comfortable to use & adapts easily to the contours of my face.  It is easy to clean.  It has a good display which shows when it needs to be cleaned or recharged.  It can be charged either through a direct connection or through the docking base.  I have tried both shaving dry & shaving wet, and both ways result in a close shave with minimal irritation.I haven't tried the beard trimmer.  I probably won't try it, since it involves removing the shaving heads and attaching the trimmer.  This is more trouble than it is worth.  Also the trimmer has only 5 settings with no actual measurements on them, which to me seems to be quite the crap shoot.  I already have a good beard trimmer with 19 settings; anyone with a fair amount of facial hair will not be looking to the Norelco for his trimming needs, as there are much better choices out there.The docking bay is ridiculously over-engineered.  It is enormous for what it actually does, and takes up some pretty valuable counter space in the bathroom.  It also will spill liquid if it gets bumped, even a little bit.  It is a nuisance.  I can't help but wonder how much this adds to the overall price of the product, and how many customers might be deterred from paying extra money for a docking base which ultimately will be discarded because it just isn't all that necessary.  I am using it at the moment, but I imagine that it won't be long before it gets tossed aside.  Hopefully, customers have the option of buying the docking base as an accessory only.But the razor itself delivers a good, comfortable shave.  If you are in the market for a new rotary shaver, this is definitely one to consider.

After a major rules correction from the 1st edition, Kosmos has released a new puzzle game in the American market which might appeal to people who enjoy playing Kosmos - Ubongo and other games requiring spatial reasoning.  One of the especially appealing aspects of this game is that you can scale the difficulty to your liking, placing down additional task cards if you find that a mere six cards is insufficiently challenging.  The only reason I take a star off is that, oftentimes, the task cards are inherently contradictory.  In the rule book, the designer suggest a house rule to get past this problem, but when a house rule has to be put in place to make for a fair game, it tends to annoy me.  However, it remains a game with a lot of challenges and considerable replay value.

Our cats usually enjoy the treats that are offered to them, but their reaction to Kittles is more enthusiastic than I normally see from them.  I don't know if I have ever seen blueberries as an ingredient in cat treats, but apparently they like blueberries.  I had to hide the package because they keep trying to tear it open.The list of ingredients looks pretty good --- not much in the way of filler at all.  The price is much more reasonable than I have come to expect of cat treats of this quality.  I definitely will be buying more of these once this package runs out!

This is another one of the Kosmos 2-player line (originally published in the late 1990's) which has seen a recent US reprint.  It has been around for a good long time, and players of board games are likely to love it or hate it, based on a couple of factors which are huge parts of the game.The card draw is totally random, and there isn't much you can do to mitigate this other than count cards.  Not everybody is a good card-counter however, and this can also slow the game to a crawl if someone is trying to do calculations.  As often as not, the final 2 rounds will devolve into a contest of wills, as the players draw one card after another, waiting to unleash a well-timed attack.  Because you can play as many cards as you choose, and because one removed bridge can trigger a domino effect, it is possible for one turn to lay waste to the board and give a player total dominance which will be unchallengeable.If you don't mind the huge, swinging changes in momentum and control, then this can be a pretty fun & decent game, albeit a pretty cutthroat slugfest.  However, it really isn't for everybody.  There is skill involved --- quite a bit actually, because you have to set up the bridges correctly in order to have any chance of achieving the domino effect against your opponent --- but you are still at the mercy of the random draw of the cards, especially in the 3rd round.  A player with a commanding position can simply grab the cards which are most dangerous to him and subsequently discard them (this is where card counting can be useful) while the other player can do nothing to prevent it.  This is a game which my wife and I will occasionally play, but it won't take the place of the many other excellent 2-player games which we already own.This definitely falls into the category of "your mileage may vary."

I have had the same problems that some of the other reviewers have experienced.  Our 3 cats are not stupid; they camp out in front of a single opening and wait for the feather to emerge.  Once it comes out, they grab on with claws or teeth and don't let go until I force them to release.  You can hear the wimpy motor inside struggling to function under the best of circumstances.  It has no chance against an adult cat with decent hunting skills.The "mouse" sound quit literally in the first minute of operation, and has never come back.  Each time we turn it on, the motor sounds weaker & weaker.  For a toy which has a $40 price tag, the engineering here simply is not up to snuff.  It is a great idea, but poorly executed.  It is probably a toy best left to kittens, who haven't yet acquired the hunting skills which will ultimately destroy this toy.  I fully expect this toy to be totally non-functional within a month at the rate things are going.

The best thing I can say about this slow cooker is that it is made by Black & Decker and will probably never wear out.  The other positive is that a 4-quart slow cooker probably will work well for people in smaller households who aren't needing to cook quite as much food.But that's about it.  Even compared to the other 4-quart slow cooker I have, it comes up short.  The traditional crock pot design (even the 4 quart models) have tended to be short and more broad at the base, so that the heating element covers are greater area.  This thing is taller and more narrow; the heating is more uneven, and you're liable to see more scorching at the bottom.On top of that, the dial for the heat settings is a little clunky and has no timed settings.  The metal walls for the cooker are very thin, and as a result, the whole thing can get VERY hot.  Since there is no indicator that the thing is even on, this can be more than a little hazardous.  The lid has no vents in it; it also has no latches to lock the lid in place."But this is a no-frills slow cooker, you dope!  You can't expect all of the amenities for this price!"  This would be a decent argument, were this a $20 item, but it costs $30.  A cursory glance of slow cookers available on Amazon shows a decent number with the same features (albeit with slightly smaller capacities) for under $20, and several with all the bells & whistles (such as the Hamilton Beach 33969A Set 'n Forget Programmable Slow Cooker, 6-Quart ) which sell for less than $20 more than the Black & Decker.  It is a crowded field, and programmable slow cookers are pretty commonplace now.  It hard to see the advantages that this model brings to the table.

I love Remini's work, even though I am no fan of Andrew Jackson.  His full-length biographies, for me at least, set the standard by which other biographies should be measured.  Even his shorter works are entertaining to read and are always informative.  So this book, Remini's final offering, comes as something of a disappointment.The narrative is much more straightforward and lacks the polish of earlier works, and the actual subject treatment is rather cursory.  A very complex subject is dealt with in less than 150 pages, and anyone with more than a passing knowledge of the antebellum era will be left none the wiser.  At best, this is an introductory work, probably suited for advanced high school students or non-specialist college students.  Anyone coming to this book hoping for a deep, thorough analysis will likely come away feeling less than satisfied.

It is difficult to write a biography when its subject has left almost no trace of his personal life.  This is the challenge Shane White faces with Jeremiah Hamilton.  There are no photos, no diaries, and no letters as far as White can discern.  The sources which are available are found in the court archives & in the contemporary newspapers.  The sources paint an interesting picture, but a rather incomplete one.  As a result, what emerges is more of a social history than a biography.Hamilton was clearly a controversial figure, but only in the short term.  White's biography focuses mostly on the years 1830-1845, because that is when Hamilton was engaging in his most dubious business practices (his career having started with a counterfeiting operation and apparently continuing on to wide-ranging insurance fraud), and as a result, was making enemies and finding himself in court quite frequently.  Once Hamilton had gotten his financial affairs in order, post-bankruptcy, he seems to have followed a less controversial path & was a broker respected for his financial acumen.  He wasn't being excoriated in the press, and he wasn't being sued, so there isn't much for White to write about (aside from the Draft Riots).  The last 30 years of Hamilton's life are covered in a relatively small portion of the book.But despite the paucity of personal details about Hamilton, this is a book worth reading.  At times it is more a history of race relations in New York, and a  history of the press in New York, than it is an actual biography.  For me, this wasn't a problem (I found myself looking the source material regarding the flash press as a result of this book), but for readers who are really looking for a straight-forward biography of a black millionaire, be advised that Hamilton oftentimes is nothing more than a supporting character in a book which is supposed to be his own story.

This cat condo required maybe 20 minutes to assemble, at most, and with minimal use of the instructions.  It's very easy.  As soon as I had it put together, our girls (3 sisters) were immediately inspecting it.  There hasn't been interest in the scratching post (they have a huge cat tree and seem pretty satisfied with that) and the dangly ball hasn't seen much use, but all three of the cats have spent time relaxing in both sections of the condo.  They look pretty happy with it, by and large.  I didn't know if it would be large enough to be comfortable for 3 fairly long-bodied cats, but it doesn't seem to bother them.  It's a good size, easy to tuck into a nook somewhere, and doesn't get in the way.  It's also reasonably attractive.  Overall, this is a nice product and your cats should enjoy it.

This was an immediate hit with our cats, three sisters who have all had the same diet since they were young.  2 of the 3 girls really love it, and the third seems pretty satisfied overall.  After one day, one of them was attacking the bag in an effort to force the issue --- and this was with a full bowl of their regular food (Iams) still available.A look at the bag shows an absence of the fillers that one so often sees in "healthy" or "gourmet" cat foods, which always concerns me.  My only worry would be over-eating; with three cats it becomes hard simply to put out a finite amount of food, because someone is bound to come up short after a point.  It is too early to see if the cats are gorging themselves or eating only what they need, like they do with the Iams.  If there is no gluttony going on, then this food looks like it could be a great option for the girls!

I enjoyed the series, although it got a bit sentimental at times, and made Douglas Jardine into such a villain that I half expected to see scenes of him kicking puppies and pulling the wings off butterflies.  Not surprisingly, this Australian production is pretty slanted towards one side, although it's hard to argue that the Australians weren't the wronged party in this Ashes series.I'll bet this miniseries got quite the reception back in 1984, when quite a number of the participants were still alive.  It isn't commercially available, but it is possible still to find this online at various sites, and cricket fans should greatly enjoy this production.

It becomes immediately apparent, from the very first page of the preface, that the target audience of the English edition is British, not American.  More precisely, the book targets Euroskeptics within the UK.  The earlier edition was very much aimed at a German audience and synthesizes a discussion of the recent turmoil with abstract musings about Buber, Heine, and other German philosophers of yore.What does this mean for an American audience?  A subject which, combined with Habermas' rather dense prose, which borders on the impenetrable.  Habermas presupposes the readers' knowledge of the events & controversies of recent years, and makes only passing reference to issues such as speculation against the Euro and Germany's exploitation of interest rates which favor German exports at the expense of debtor nations.  Don't know what any of this means?  This book will make you none the wiser.A thorough understanding of German schools of philosophy and political thought is helpful if you hope to negotiate Part III of the book.  Most my knowledge of Heine comes from Schubert lieder & Schumann's Dichterliebe, so I found myself floundering early and often.  In any case, it is hard to understand the complex nature of the German cultural legacy if one was not raised within it, so I imagine that even British readers will be struggling with this section.The 3-star rating reflects this book's usefulness as it pertains to the American audience.  Readers in the UK and Germany probably have a much different viewpoint.

Calling this a waffle weave is REALLY stretching it.  It is a not totally flat surface which gives the impression of a waffle weave, but that's about it.  It doesn't look terrible, but I would really hesitate to describe this as having a "luxury" appearance.  As another reviewer described it, it is "stark white," and there really is no better way to put it.  That color really isn't for everybody.It also is advertised as a "shower liner/curtain," but as has been pointed out by others, it is not in any way water resistant.  Using this as a liner would be a mistake in my opinion.If a really really white, waffle-esque shower curtain is what appeals to you, then by all means, consider this one.  I'm not sure something which really does not come up to snuff merits the price you would pay.

The double prong is probably the best feature about these skewers, as the 2nd prong helps keep both veggies and meat just a little bit more stable.  Not being able to put these over direct heat isn't a big deal, as long as you know how to cook properly with indirect heat.  People accustomed to slapping something on a grill over direct heat will need to adjust.  Getting the food off the skewers is very much a two-handed affair, with both hands needing protection against the heat, so be advised.  That having been said, the sliding component works easily.

I have been using Aurvana earphones for a number of years now.  The Creative Aurvana 2 In-Ear Headphones (Discontinued by Manufacturer) which I received for reviewing worked wonderfully until a co-worker knocked them off my desk and then stepped on them.  I liked them enough to purchase another set.  If this set wears out, I will probably replace it with Creative Aurvana In-Ear2 Plus Ultra-comfortable Noise-isolating In-ear Earphones with In-line Remote and Microphone, although I hope to keep my current set alive for many years to come.So I do like Aurvana products.  Or at least some of them.  When the Creative Aurvana 3 In-Ear Noise-Isolating Headphones became available, I tried those and really didn't care for them at all.  They are uncomfortable, difficult to place in your ears, and don't have the greatest fidelity.  This 3-Plus model is the updated version which has new features the compliment smart phones and other newer devices.So they are new.  Are they improved?  They are slightly more comfortable than the earlier model, but not by a lot.  Just like the earlier version, these earphones get crammed into your ears to the point that the seal they create can cause quite a bit of pressure to build up in your head.As far as fidelity is concerned, there is nothing about these headphones which represent any improvement over the previous model.  The same muted sound exists, same as before.  Another reviewer criticized these as being oriented towards the treble.  I could not disagree more.  I would be delighted if there was a bias towards the higher end of the register, but the truth is that both bass and treble get the same "blah" treatment.  Lovers of thumping bass will not be happy with these, but don't look at these as being treble-heavy by any means.Acoustic music is what I mostly listen to, and it is not well served by these headphones.  The sound is muffled and the purity of acoustic instruments is completely lost.  For me, this is a deal-breaker.  Amplified music fares perhaps a little better, but not much.On the positive side, the new cord is an improvement, and the volume adjustment feature (which now seems to be de rigueur on all new headphones) is quite nice.  And they do cancel out most of the background noise quite well.  If this set cost $80, and your main concern is noise cancellation, then it might be worth it.  But for the moment, they cost $150 and I cannot see anyone getting his money's worth at that price.  If you want Aurvana earphones, get the 2-plus model instead, which actually DOES cost around $80 and delivers better sound quality.

I knew to expect a smaller machine, but I wasn't really prepared for just how tiny & light it proved to be.  There are small cats which are heavier than this thing, and I do not exaggerate.But as small as it is, this vacuum is a beast.  The suction is astonishing.  I tried this on one of our runners, which is relatively low pile,  and really had to muscle it along because it grabbed so firmly.  I expect that this vacuum would be utterly impossible on a high pile carpet, so keep this in mind.  I expect that we will be using this mostly on our wood floors.  It cleans wood surfaces very thoroughly.Assembly is a piece of cake.  Everything snaps together without any work, and the manual really isn't all that necessary.  It includes a docking station which you can attach to your wall if you like, but I chose to disassemble the machine partially and put the motor on a shelf while it recharges.  It is so small that it does not get in the way, even on a bookshelf.Because it is so small and has such tremendous suction, the canister fills up almost immediately.  This makes anything more than the smallest of jobs a challenge, especially considering that the battery will run down after about 15 minutes of use.  Recharging it will require about 2-3 hours.  So if you have a large area to clean, you may find that using this vacuum would be a rather frustrating experience.But I doubt that this vacuum is intended for 10,000 square mansion.  If you live in a small apartment, where storage space is at a premium, then this vacuum could be a dream come true.  In any other situation, I have a hard time imagining that this would serve as the main vacuum.  But what it does, it does very well.

My wife loves this tea, both in terms of flavor and fragrance.  She already drinks green tea, so this was a welcome addition to our pantry.  I don't even particularly like tea, but it smelled wonderful and I simply couldn't resist trying a cup myself.  If this were a little less expensive, I could see myself making a habit out of this.  As it stands, I can see this being an occasional special treat for us.If your tastes run towards the luxurious, then this tea is something to consider.  If you aren't particularly fond of heavy floral notes, this tea may not be for you, and you'll want to avoid an expensive mistake.

Arthur Browne's writing style absolutely drives me crazy.  He shifts from the conventional past tense (when telling Battle's story as a policeman) into the present tense (and even the occasional future tense) as he tells the story of Battle and Langston Hughes.  He is inconsistent about it, and it is distracting to read.  There were points in the book where I had to resist the temptation to skip past the Hughes chapters because of the distracting writing style.I also feel that Browne is a little less objective about his subject than he should be.  Battle certainly was not corrupt, but he sometimes worked for superiors who were corrupt (or at least were brazenly pursuing political agenda), and he seemed not to be bothered by this.  While this is a minor issue overall, it certainly would have made for a more interesting & probing biography, in my opinion.  Browne seems content to present Battle as an uncomplicated hero, by and large, and leaves it at that.But nonetheless, it is a very interesting story which has been overlooked.  It captures, in microcosm,  the story of institutionalized racism in this country, and demonstrates just how many obstacles a talented, ambitious African-American might have to face in order to achieve even a modest degree of success.  I just find myself wishing that the writing could have been more well-crafted.

This is an engaging & compelling narrative, which provides a fascinating peek into the world of the hotshot.  To a certain degree, it also illustrates how the Granite Mountain Hotshots evolved into the unit they were going into the Yarnell Hill fire.But even as a reader with absolutely no expertise or experience in these matters, I found that the story seemed incredibly incomplete, with significant gaps in the narrative.  Some of the other critical Amazon reviews are much more specific when dealing with inaccuracies in the book.  Some cursory research on my part quickly revealed that the investigation into the Yarnell Hill fire is still ongoing, and that the deposition of Brendan McDonough still has not taken place.  How in the world, with so much still remaining to be investigated, can anyone write a book claiming to be "definitive?"I enjoy Dickman's writing, and I was moved by the stories being told, but this reminded me more of an expanded magazine article than a carefully-researched book.  The material draws overwhelmingly on interviews instead of any written documentation --- not surprising, considering that the documentation of this tragedy is very much a work in progress.  I also find it frustrating that Dickman doesn't use specific citations in his chapters, although this is a minor complaint compared to the incomplete nature of the book.The book is worth reading, but there is still a lot to be written on the subject.

Great stories don't necessarily have happy, tidy endings.  This is one of those, as Chatterton & Mattera now find themselves in a legal brawl over the rights to the wreck they discovered.  But the journey they took, which ultimately lead to the discovery of the Golden Fleece, is a compelling one.  These two treasure hunters have personal histories which could persuade me that they were created by a Hollywood scriptwriter, and contain so many defeats and reversals that I found myself shaking my head in amazement.  I certainly would have given up long before either of these guys did,The book also gives a good glimpse into just how tedious it is to do proper salvage work, and why sound research is the best way to yield good results.  While some hunches were played along the way, Chatterton & Mattera both repeatedly returned to the source material for clues as to what they had missed the first time around.Even knowing the outcome of the hunt doesn't detract from how interesting this story is.  Kurson knows how to weave the narratives of past & present together, and also presents some entertaining side stories of some of the treasure hunters of earlier generations.  This is good stuff.  It makes me want to go revisit Kurson's "Shadow Divers," which is just as interesting.

This is an attractive, colorful set, intended for casual gatherings and parties.  The bottle-opener on the case is a dead giveaway that this isn't a set intended for serious tournament play (although the 107mm balls are regulation size).  The balls have no engraving on them, which isn't a deal-breaker but which might bother some people who find the balls a little harder to grip.The balls (made in China) have a 90-day warrantee.  This is not a high-performance set intended for heavy use.
