Anybody thinking of playing bocce on a regular basis should consider getting the balls which are made by Perfetta, which are much more durable & have a 10-year warranty.  But for occasional casual get-togethers in the back yard, the Viva Sol set will do just fine.

I have used the Pop Robin planner from At-a-Glance (601-200A) for the last couple of years.  Next year, I'll definitely be getting this one.  It's just as sturdy as the Pop Robin, but without the decorative pages.  Ornamentation is just fine, but there is some space sacrificed because of it.  With this planner, you have none of that.  It's a straightforward design which gives you plenty of space on which to write, and gives you just as much space on the weekend dates as the rest of the week.  There is also a nice plastic insert (which the Pop Robin lacks) at the back the planner, handy for storing receipts or stamps.  The layout and neutral color choices make the pages extremely easy to read.It's a great little planner.  Love it!

I have used other At-a-Glance planners before.  I purchased the Pop Robin planner (601-200A) prior to this planner becoming available for review, and I also have a copy of the YP105A-07 planner  This planner and the YP105A-07 are identical in page layout, but I find that the stiff binding makes this one harder to use, as the pages will not easily sit flat on a surface for writing.  The overall stiffness makes me wonder how well this will hold together over a years' time.  The ribbon is an interesting feature, but since the planner already includes tabs, the ribbon seems redundant.I like the layout, but the binding guarantees that I will using the other planners which have the spiral binding.

After a very disappointing experience with the poor engineering of the Sony MDR-NC60 headphones, I have pretty much had a "once-bitten, twice shy" attitude towards standard-sized noise-cancelling headphones.  When it comes to noise-cancelling headphones, I have used the in-the-ear variety rather than the traditional cans, so I was curious to see how these would perform.So far, so good.  I have noticed very little distortion in either ear, and the noise cancellation works pretty much as advertised.  I have found that the battery has held up well after almost 2 weeks of continuous use, so I am guessing that Bose's claims of a 35-hour lifetime is fairly accurate.  For spoken word, I generally don't use the noise cancellation as it isn't all that necessary, but for acoustic music, if you don't use the noise cancellation the sound is just awful, as though the musicians were playing in a closet.For me, the balance is good; no overpowering bass, & the treble is serviceable.  If you are wanting booming bass, then these aren't the headphones for you.  Also, if you are looking for headphones for a stereo, it is worth noting that these are designed for handheld devices and computers only, and will not work well with a stereo amplifier.I do have some reservations, and I can see why there are as many 1-star reviews as there are.  The folding design makes me nervous, and the carrying case is just ridiculously small.  If I folded them up the way it is recommended, it wouldn't surprise me if something malfunctioned before too long.  I am using a larger carrying case and treating them carefully.  This is definitely something to consider.Obviously, it is too early to give a fair assessment of how well these headphones will hold up after extended use.  Only time will tell, but for now, I am quite pleased with the performance, which seems commensurate with the price.

I have used the smaller At-a-Glance monthly planners for a couple of years now.  They are invaluable, but the space for writing things can be limited.  If you have a family which has a varied, complicated schedule, the smaller planner might not be convenient enough.  This planner is full-sized, with plenty of space on each date for writing quite a few notes & reminders.  There is also tons of extra pages for contact information and miscellaneous notes.  There is also a handy plastic insert in the back, which is where we keep our stamps.The only drawback that I can see is that the spiral spine of the planner bends a lot more easily than it does in the smaller planners.  This one arrived already slight bent out of shape.  With the larger pages this can be a problem, as it makes it just that much more difficult to turn the pages.  I imagine that it could get bad enough that some pages might end up tearing, which could be annoying.But it is a minor inconvenience compared to the overall usefulness of the planner.  Recommended!

These are pretty thin towels, with an attractive design which looks like it will fade after a single washing.  No big deal, if this set of towels cost maybe $8-10 total, but at the time of this review, these towels cost $4.50 each, and their sturdiness should reflect that cost.  I can't see these towels handling a heavy workload in our kitchen, except maybe to cover bread dough while it is raising (the thin towel allows some air through, so that's good).For the price, I'm sure better towels can be found.

This is the water bottle that my daughter has been waiting for.  With a nice floral design & cute colors, this very much appeals to her sensibilities.  It helps that the spout is a one-touch, easy-to-use feature.  One press of a button, and the spout is immediately available for use.  Closing the spout is also just as simple.  My daughter's only complaint is that, should the water bottle be full, the spout can sometimes lightly splatter her with liquid when it pops open.So why only 4 stars?  In addition to the mild inconvenience of the splattering spout, the straw comes lose a little more easily than it should.  The straw is also attached by some plastic that looks a little too flimsy for my comfort, and I can see the straw tearing lose before long if we aren't careful.  It means that cleaning the insides of the water bottle requires a little more attention & care than might otherwise be necessary.Nonetheless, this certainly is one of the more convenient & attractive water bottles we have gotten from Contigo, so it comes highly recommended.

My daughter (now approaching the outside limits of this doll's target audience) liked this one a little better than the Fluttershy doll, which she rated at 3 stars.  While Pinkie Pie's hair also is not easy to style (Helen's biggest complaint), overall, the doll's presentation & accessories do a good job of capturing the essence of the cartoon character, which apparently is a big plus.  The only other complaint concerned the sleeping mask, which started coming apart almost immediately.  Overall, she was pretty pleased with Pinkie Pie.

My daughter is on the older end of the target demographic, so this is something to keep in mind.  There were a number of things she liked about the doll, particularly how much it resembles the cartoon character.  She also likes the accessories, although the earrings are a bit tough to keep on the doll.  She is also frustrated with the stiff nature of the hair, which makes styling more difficult than it should be.Overall, she thought the doll was OK.  My guess is that were she a couple of years younger, she might been less particular about the doll's shortcomings.

The results thus far have been pretty good, but a little inconsistent.  For some reason, some areas of the lawn that I reseeded have grown more slowly than others --- despite the same preparation, application & watering.  The sunlight is pretty much the same in all of the areas where I reseeded, so I don't think sunlight is the issue.  It has also taken longer than I expected to see seedlings appear, even though we have had a very warm spring here.  Time will tell if the resulting new grass has the strength & staying power to survive through until next year.  If it does, then the longer wait for germination will have been worth it.

My daughter was reaching the point where she simply had too much music to manage by carrying it by herself.  So I read the reviews and ordered this portfolio bag.  All I can say is, I wish that something like this had been available to me 30-plus years ago when I was lugging my music around, because life would have been a lot easier.The fact that it unzips fully, allowing the two halves to lie flat on a surface, is a godsend.  All of her orchestra folders fit inside the bag without any problems.  Out of curiosity, I loaded it up with 7 or 8 of my old etude books & a few other pieces of music, and it still felt pretty comfortable to carry.  It is sturdy and well-constructed, and should last easily for several years.  I highly recommend this!

If you are needing a stable, sturdy, dedicated stand for your practicing at home, this stand simply cannot be beat for the money.  It is VERY easy to assemble --- it has instructions on the inside of the box, but you'll hardly need to look at them.  It took me maybe 5 minutes to assemble it.  Once you have it assembled, I can't imagine that you would ever have to replace it.

These cutters are certainly strong, formidable beasts.  It cut through most every thing I put in front of it.  Unfortunately, the breadth of the handles is such that even people with larger hands (such as myself) will find using these to be more of a chore than should be necessary.  People with smaller hands, or people with arthritis, will find these cutters to be hopelessly inaccessible.  Some reviewers have taken off a star for this; personally, I think this merits a harsher rating.  If you can't actually USE the cutters, it really doesn't matter how strong the blades are.  It feels like the design was intended for 2-handed shears, except that the handles are too short for them be used comfortably with two hands.While the cutters work well enough, the awkward nature of the handles means that I would not be using these on a regular basis.  Definitely, this is one of those items which you shouldn't purchase sight unseen.

Basically, shock humor for its own sake.  It takes all of the forced "humor" of Apples to Apples and pastes on a gratuitously offensive & crass theme, the novelty of which will wear off very quickly (guaranteeing, of course, a seemingly endless number of expansions).If you asked a group of boys, aged probably 9-13, to design a game they thought was funny, the result would probably be very near to this.  Crude humor can be pretty funny & effective if the delivery is right.  The delivery in this game is so obvious, unsubtle & ham-fisted that what little humor there may be is instantly obliterated with a sledgehammer.And really, some topics are beyond the pale for a very good reason.  Let's just leave it at that.  There are plenty of better party games out there to be played.

Just be advised --- whatever this set may be it is NOT a pétanque set, nor is it even a proper bocce set.  Lacquered wooden balls are what you COULD use for bocce, but they are only 3 inches in diameter, and standard bocce balls are over 4 inches in diameter.But if these are not quite up to the standards for bocce, the balls are in no way whatsoever intended for pétanque and should not be used for it.  Proper pétanque boules are metal & hollow, as another reviewer has already pointed out.It mystifies me why this set would be marketed the way it is.  If you are looking for a decent starter set for pétanque, there are plenty of legitimate sets available.

For the most part, this mix has worked fairly well.  It hasn't worked as well in some of the shady areas, but this isn't totally surprising.  I have tried it with both the Lawn Repair Soil that Scotts recommends & also with some manure spread out on the ground.  For the most part, the results have been pretty much the same.  For repair on small parts of a lawn, it has definitely worked better for me than simply putting down regular seed.  So if you just have small patches in need of some help, this is a good way to go.

All three of our cats (three sisters) love these treats.  This is unusual for them, because usually there is at least one of them who ignores the treats that the others like.  The only problem they have, and this is relatively minor, is that the color of the treats is so dark that they sometimes can't spot the treats when I toss them on the floor, and they have to scout them out by scent.  Other than that, these treats have been a big hit, they are healthy, and they are not ruinously expensive.  After looking at the other reviews, I would have to say that our results have not been typical.  It is quite possible that our girls are just a bunch of weirdos --- your mileage may definitely vary.

It almost doesn't look like a women's watch, but it looks lovely on the wrists of both my wife & daughter.  It is just a little bigger than what my wife is used to, but she says that it feels very comfortable & not especially heavy.  The band is especially well-designed and feels quite nice.  The color scheme is quite striking --- even more so than the picture would indicate.  This is a watch which will get attention when you wear it.

This is a really attractive sofa which should fit nicely in most design schemes.  It is also VERY comfortable, with a leather-like fabric which feels very nice on the skin.  The weather is still cool enough that we noticed that the couch warmed to the touch; I will be interested to see how warm or cool the fabric is once the hot summer months come around.  But for now, we find comfort in this sofa, in every respect.The pillows come with the sofa, and are more of the flat, decorative variety (with a fair amount of embroidery).  If you are looking to take naps on the sofa, these pillows will work in a pinch but aren't ideal.  On the other hand, they aren't so bulky that they will get in the way of anybody.The short legs of the sofa arrive detached, and will need to be screwed in.  3 of the 4 legs were easily attached, but the 4th hole was not properly drilled & required a little extra work on our part.  The seat cushions detach, but the back cushions are attached to the main body of the sofa.  The sofa itself is light enough so that it is possible for a single man of average strength to maneuver it up front stairs, into the house, and into its desired location.  Obviously this isn't the optimal situation, but it can be done if there are no other alternatives.  In any case, getting it into a normal house is not going to be a massive problem for most people.  It is a sturdy couch; there was almost no packing material surrounding it in the cardboard box, but it arrived undamaged and in good condition.If you're looking for a couch, this is definitely one to consider.  It looks as good in person as on the internet, possibly better.  It enhances our living room wonderfully.

Scott's shade mixes have worked well for me in the past, better than some of the other shade mixes I have tried.  I have always been satisfied with their seed mixes in general.  This particular mix is going in one of the shadiest parts of our north-facing front yard (it gets the minimum amount of sunlight Scott's recommends for this mix, but not much more than that), so germination could be a challenge.  I will update as the season progresses.

Echoing other reviewers here, I immediately could tell that these bags are not airtight, nor do they hold liquid all that well.  I would never want to use these for freezing food or marinating anything.  They'll work well for storing non-perishable items, I suppose, but that really isn't the reason that I purchase storage bags in the first place.  They claim to be stronger than Ziploc, but I am unpersuaded.  Yes, the zipper is more convenient to use than Ziploc's conventional seal, but from my perspective, sacrificing effectiveness for convenience is not a reasonable tradeoff.

Every since I got this speaker, I instantly feel in love with it. The sound from the speaker is just amazing and it is perfect with the music that I listen to.The speaker is made really durable and feels great. I love the cylinder design of the speaker because I can have the speaker laying horizontally or I can have it standing vertically. Sound comes from one side of the speaker. The design of the speaker is really nice and it has IPX4 WaterProof, so that means it can handle splashes from any direction. In this case, the speaker can not be submerged under water.The controls of the speaker are really easy to use. The power button is on one side of the speaker and it is a huge button. The power button is also used for answer calls and hanging up calls. On the speaker you will find LED indicators that will tell you when the speaker is on and work. Next to the LED Lights you will find 3 buttons. You will find the Play/Pause button as well as the Volume buttons, you can press the +/- buttons to change the volume but if you want to change the track you will have to press and hold for a few seconds and your track will change.I love the grips on the speaker both horizontally and vertically. When I have this on my desk it will not move around at all. The rubber grips keep the speaker in place.The charging port of the speaker is covered on the side of the speaker. When you open the flap of the speaker, you will find the micro USB port as well as an AUX port so if you device does not have Bluetooth capabilities, you can simply just plug a AUX cable in and listen to music.Sound Quality from the speaker is amazing. With two powerful 6W speakers you get a total of 12W. The size of the speakers are 40mm. Sound coming from the speaker is nice and clear and crisp. Speaker has powerful bass and is perfect for all you needs. Treble from the speaker is nice and clear as well. With the speaker running via Bluetooth you can get about 10 meters away from the speaker which is about 33 feet. The speaker also has a built in microphone, I have tested it with a call and it is nice and clear and works like a charm with no problems.When you purchase the speaker, you have an option of either orange or blue, in my case I got the blue one and I love the color of the speaker. You will also get a micro USB cable and a AUX cable. A user manual is also included.If you are looking for a great speaker with amazing sound, this is the one to go for. It is powerful and durable. It is Splash Proof, not Water Proof. Speaker is great for outdoor activities like camping or fishing. Has a 18-month warranty, so if anything happens to the speaker you will be covered by the warranty. Highly recommend speaker for anyone.

I am just in love with this cable. I am able to play movies and music from a flash drive. I can also use a mouse or keyboard with this cable. I currently use this on my Nexus 6 and I have not had any problems at all yet. It is just simply amazing what it can do. It can also be used as a sync cable to transfer data.Nice and small and easy to carry around. Cable is nicely made and does not tangle up.Looking to watch movies but have no room on your phone? Just buy this and you will be able to watch movies from your flash drive or hard drive. Works on the Nexus 7 as well. All you need to do is just plug it in your phone/tablet and that's it.Highly Recommended
Perfect fit for my PS3 controller. It adds grip for better gaming. Installation wasn't too bad, once it was in, I would not be taking it off often. Feel Amazing in the hand!Highly Recommended

I have been using many case for my phone since I got the phone and I have to say that this case makes my phone stand out to others because of the Flash ring that goes around the phone when  I get a notification.The case is made out of a plastic material and in the inside of the case you will find a rubber bumper that will go around the phone and then it will go into the plastic part of the case. It protects my phone from drops and scratches. The cut outs of the case are perfect. I have not had any problems with them yet. Installing the case and removing it can be a bit hard at first but I got use to it.The flash on the back of the phone will be covered up so the flash will flash throughout the phone. So if you are looking to take pictures with flash the flash will not be as bright. Great to use the flash in the dark because you will be able to see. Instead of beaming the flash in one direction, with this case you can almost fill up the room.Really nice case overall, I really like the flash ring on the case. If you are looking for case for your phone, I recommend this case to anyone.

Really nice Bamboo Cutting board to have in the kitchen. It comes in 3 different sizes so you can use each cutting board with different types of food.The cutting boards are made with Natural Bamboo. The surface of the cutting boards are nice and smooth and made really well. I really like that there are different sizes because I can use it with different types of food and don't want to cross contaminate the bacteria from the food on the cutting board to the other types of food. For examples, you can use the big cutting board for meats and the medium size one just for vegetables.All of the cutting board have a handle to to them so it is a lot easier to store them away when you are not using them. I can simply just hand them some where and when I need to use them, I can just grab them and start cutting. The cutting boards are nice and thick. They have a 3/8 inch thickness which is really nice and durable.The bamboo cutting board has ANTI-MICROBIALS - Microbes can't live in bamboo like they do in other wooden cutting board. It's physically impossible. Therefore, your surface is always free from dangerous things like e. coli or salmonella poisoning.Since I am cooking everyday, it is nice to have more than one cutting board to use with different types of food. They are nice and solid cutting boards so if you are looking for new cutting boards, I highly recommend this set.

These cables are simply amazing. They hard made nice and durable and will last you a long time. I am currently using these cables and they have not ripped or anything else. The cables are nice and long so you can use them at a distance and not have to worry about the length of the cable.On each end of the cable you will find that they are protected with a metal housing so the connectors won't break down that easily.The cable is coated with a Nylon Braided cable and it is really durable and will not rip or anything compared to other cables that are out on the market. I have had cables that would easily get cut or ripped because of pulling on them, but these cables will last you a long time.The design of the cable looks really nice. They come with 3 cables in 3 different colors so you will be able to choose what you like and use it whenever you want.Currently I am using this with my phone and tablet. I use my Nexus 6 and 7. What I found out is that the micro USB on the cable fits in perfectly and has a nice and secure fit for my phone and tablet.With the braided nylon cable, the cable is tangle free.Overall, the cable is built nice and sturdy and it is very durable. If you are looking for replacement Micro USB Cables, don't go out and spending a fortune on brand name cables, just take a look at these and you will be satisfied!

This battery case is nice and slim and is perfect for those who need more power for their phone. I have used this case for a while now and I have to say this is an amazing case and it has revived my phone many times when the power was dead on the phone.The design of the case is rather simply, it is a hard plastic case and it is nice and slim compared to other ones that I have seen. The case comes in many different color. The cut out of the phone are perfect and I can easily press them with no problems at all. The Sleep/Wake button on the side of the phone is covered while the Volume Buttons are open. The Sleep/Wake button is not hard to press. The Camera cut out is just the perfect size and I have not had any problems with it yet. Comparing the camera cut out to other battery cases that I have seen or used, this one is different because it is cut out more that usual. With the open space on the camera port, you will more likely damaged the phone itself if anything was to drop into there.  I really like the finish of the case. It is a matte finish so it is nice and smooth. I am able to slide my phone in my pocket and remove it from my pocket with no problems at all. Though that the case is black and has a matte finish to it, it does not gather any dust at all.On the back of the case you will find that there is a stand that is built into the case. The stand clips onto the case and when it needs to be used you can just pull it out and use it for movies. The stand is the perfect angle for watching movies. Also located on the back of the case is the Power button and 4 LED Light indicators which tell you how much power is left on the battery of the case. Each LED Light indicator represents 25%.Usually on battery cases they have a Micro USB Port so you can charge the battery in the case but on this power case it does not have one of those but instead it uses the lightning cable. So you think you are getting away from using your lightning cable? Nope, it is still on there. Also the Audio Port for the phone will be harder to access because of the case. You will only be able to use the headphones that came with the phone or other headphones have a small enough jack.The case does not come with anything else at all. All it comes with is just the cases and a little slip of paper giving you instructions on how to use the case. That is the reason why this review is only receiving 4 stars because of the lack of accessories. It would be nice if they included a cable and a audio jack extender cable so you can use any kind of headphones with no problems at all.Overall, this power case is nice and slim and add life to your phone. With the 3500mah battery in the case you will be able to double your battery life. If you are looking for a battery case for your phone. I would recommend this one to anyone who is looking for one. But in my opinion I would get a battery case with a Micro USB Port because the cable is more easier to find instead of a lightning cable.

This is perfect for the night time or any time during the day when you want to go to sleep and want it to be dark. I currently use this during the night because in my room there is always little light that would bother me when I am sleeping. My alarm clock gives off a light that bothers me when I sleep but now with this Eye Mask I am able to sleep peacefully.The Eye Mask is nice and soft and it is adjustable to the size of your head. It is held together with a Velcro Strap and it stays on during the night. On the side of the Strap there are 2 sports for Ear Plugs. So this is the perfect thing to have when you are traveling or trying to get some nice sleep during the night. Currently I have used the Ear Plugs and they block out all the sound. When you are done with them in the morning or after your nap you can simply just push them back into the side of the Eye Mask for later.Overall, this Eye Mask is really comfortable and adjustable to your head. I was able to get better sleep because of the Eye Mask. I have used other Eye Mask in the past but this one is made a lot better and was able to stay on my head through out the night compared to other ones that I have used that simply go around the head but was not secure.If you are looking for better sleep during the night, I highly recommend this Eye Mask, it is nice and cheap and it will definitely help you get better sleep in the night.

Perfect to have in the kitchen. I have been using this for a while now and it works perfect for me. I was able to replace my pepper shaker with this one and with this one I am able to grind pepper and salt as well. So instead of having a single grinder for pepper and salt, now I have this one I can use for both and save up room.The Grinder is made out of Plastic when it looks like it is made out of glass but it is not. On each side of the grinder you will find that it is made out of Stainless Steel. When you need to refill each side, it is very easy, all you need to do is unscrew it and put more Salt or Pepper in. Grinding Pepper and Salt down into smaller pieces is really nice with this grinder, it makes it nice and small. It uses a Ceramic Mechanism to grind down the pepper and salt.Overall, this is a really nice grinder because you are able to save on space. You don't need 2 separate grinders when you can have just one that does 2 jobs. Really nice and durable. I highly recommend this grinder to anyone that is looking for one.

This is perfect for your outdoor needs. This comes with 2 bracelets and they are both different colors. One is Black and the other is like a Army Green. I personally have not untied the bracelet yet but it might come in handy in the future.The bracelets are tough and can carry up to 500 Pounds and it is guaranteed that it can carry 350 pounds for sure. On the bracelet you will find the Paracord, the main component of the bracelet. You will also find a Whistle, Flint Fire Starter and a Scarper. The Scarper can be used as a Knife as well. After removing the coating from the Flint Fire Starter I was able to get sparks with the scraper.With one of them around my wrist and the other one in my backpack, I was ready to go in case of an emergency or something were to happen.Overall, the 2 paracord are nice and durable and will help you out if you need them when you are out hiking or even camping. They are great for starting fires when you don't have a lighter.The Whistle on the bracelet is nice and loud when you blow into it, so it will help out when you are lost.Highly Recommended!

These headphones are just simply AMAZING! I have been using these headphones for a while now and they sound amazing. These headphones are my go to headphones for my everyday life now.Going over the design of the headphones, they are different from your ordinary headphones that you find in the store. The cable of the headphones can be removed and the headphones can be removed from the tip of the cable. So if the cable on your headphones gets damaged or gets ripped you can simply just take the cable off and put in a different cable. A Right Angle cable is included with the headphones and the straight cable is connected right out of the packaging of the headphones. The headphones are made out of metal and feel really nice and durable. They built really nice and is a solid pair of headphones. The headphones have a 2 tone color to them a dark grey and a silver to them. On each of the headphones you will find the SUR Name to them.The cable of the headphones is nice and long and it is compatible with any device with a 3.5mm port. In the cable you have a built in Microphone and button controls for the song that you are listening to. You are also able to change the Volume on the control piece as well. For the cable the control piece works on Android Devices. The cable is not supported for iOS Devices. On the end of the cable you will find a Gold Plated 3.5mm jack. It has 3 bands around the jack for the microphone as well.Sound Quality of the headphones are just simply amazing. The headphones have amazing bass to them and the treble on the headphones are just amazing as well. The sound is clear and crisp on the headphones. I have not had a problem with these headphones yet. When I am listening to music at a very high volume, the sound on the headphones do not distort at all, they just remain nice and clear. Here are some specs of the headphonesUnit diameter: 9mmFrequency range: 20-20000HzProducts impedance: 16ohmsSensitivity: 118dBRated Power: 15mWHeadphone Plug: 3.5mm(Gold Pin)The inline Microphone is nice and clear. When I have these headphones in and I am in a call, I am able to hear the other person clearly and they too are able to hear me nice and clear.The ear buds come in 3 different sizes so you can pick the right size and enjoy your music. Everything that comes with the pair of headphones is High Quality and all work Amazingly well. It also comes with a carrying case so you can store your headphones when you are not using them to prevent them from getting damaged or dusty. The carrying case is nice and sturdy and will protect your headphones.Overall, these headphones are just amazing in Sound and Quality. If you are looking for a nice pair of headphones that give off Super Bass, this is the pair to go for. It is different from other headphones because you are able to change the line of the headphones if it gets damaged. I Highly Recommend this pair of headphones to anyone who is looking for a great pair of headphones.

I've been using this speaker for a quite a while now and I have to say that is this speaker is tough and built really well. During the summer time I use the speaker when I am out fishing with some friends and I bring this speaker a long and it sits on rocks and occasionally falls over when I accidentally hit it. Even though it has hit the ground and rocks it stills works like a charm and no dents or scratches on the speaker at all.The design of the speaker has a camo finish to it, so it has a sporty look to it and many people when I go fishing ask where I got the speaker because they love the look of the little speaker. The speaker is built really well and made of a solid material. With it being nice and solid it does have some nice weight to it.Taking a look around the speaker, you will find all the controls for the speaker located on the top. You will find a total of 5 buttons on the top of the speaker. Each one is labeled nicely and really easy to use. On this speaker you able to play music being connected to your Device that has Bluetooth Capabilities as well as via a Micro SD Card. In order to do so you will need to change the settings by using the middle button on top of the speaker. Along the side of the speaker you will find a little place where you can clip a carbiner and hook it to your back pack when you are out camping or anything else. Located on the base of the speaker is a Anti Slip Rubber Ring so when you place the speaker on a flat surface it will not move around.The speaker has a powerful 3W speaker with Enchanted Bass. The sound from the speaker goes out of the speaker 360 degrees so everyone will be able to hear the music evenly and you don't have to change which way you place the speaker. Sound Quality of the speaker is amazing! With the Enhanced Bass I am able to play my music with a lot of bass and it will be able to handle my music with no problems at all. The treble of the speaker is nice and clear. When I have the speaker playing at the Max Volume, the sound remains nice and clear and it does not distort at all.The speaker comes protected in a plastic box where it was held securely when being shipped to me. All the accessories were located below the speaker. What you will find in the box is:*Arespark Speaker*Micro USB Cable*AUX Cable*Carbiner*User ManualTo charge the speaker, there is a Micro USB Port located on the side of the speaker, it is covered up to prevent any dust or anything else to get inside of the speaker.Using the speaker is really easy, when you press and hold the center button on the top of the speaker it will make a sound that indicates that it is on and working. Then it will go into pairing mode and all you have to do is connect to the speaker from you phone and you are good to go. When music is playing and you receive a call, the speaker will making a phone ringing sound to tell you that you have a call coming. There is a built in Microphone in the speaker so all you need to do is press the answer button and you can talk through the speaker instead of grabbing your phone.Overall, I love the looks and feel of the speaker. It is nice and smooth all around. Sound Quality of the speaker is amazing and does not let me down at all. If you are looking for a nice and small speaker but packs a punch, I recommend this speaker to anyone who is looking for a speaker. The battery life on the speaker is amazing, I could use the speaker all day and the power would still not be out. I've used this for a All Day Fishing Trip and it was just perfect!Highly Recommended!

This power bank is nice and stylish and looks amazing! First thing out of the box it was really nice looking with no finger prints on it at all but after a while of using it does gather finger prints because it has a glossy finish.Going over the design of the power. It has a box design to the power bank itself. It has some nice weight to the power bank which is really nice. On the front and the back of the power bank it has a glossy finish. Since I got the power bank in a black color it does gather a bit of finger prints compared to other colors. I have used many other power banks and none of them had a digital indicator to tell how much power is left on the battery like this one does. It is really nice to know exactly what percentage of power that I have left on the power bank. Located on the side of the power bank you will find a button you can press to see the digital indicator or battery left on the power bank. On the top of the power bank there are 2 USB Ports so you can charge 2 Devices at once. One of them gives off 1 Amp of Power while the other ones gives off 2.1 Amps of power for a faster charge, To charge the power bank the Micro USB Port is also located on the top of the power bank.Some nice things about the power bank:* 24-month warranty.Global product liability insurance, the max. amount of 2 million dollars.* Multi-protections making it safe to use,protect your devices from over voltage,overcharge,over discharge,over current, short circuit.* Auto Shut-Off feature. Shuts off when no device is connected or short circuit or overload output occurred while unit is charging.* High Performance 13000mAh Li-ion battery and Ultra reliable Grade A Lithium-Ion cells with 500+ recharging cycles lifeSo far I have been using the power bank for a few weeks now and I am truly impressed with the power bank. It was able to bring my phone back from the dead many times. I was able to bring my Nexus 6 from about 10% to 100% about 4 times before the battery died. You will be able to charge a iPhone 6 plus almost 3 times, iPhone 6 almost 5 times, iPhone 5S/5 almost 5.5 times, Sumsung Galaxy S5 3 times, Sumsung Galaxy S4 about 3.5 times, HTC one almost 4 times, One 2 (M8) almost 3.5 times, iPad Mini almost twicePackage Contents:*Power Bank*Micro USB Cable*User Manual*Warranty CardOverall, the power bank is small and portable and it will be able to bring your phone back from dead to alive many times. With the 13000 mAh Battery it will for surely last you the entire week depending on how you use the power bank and how often.Highly Recommended!

This is just perfect for all my needs, I have been using a normal power strip for my outlets and I would always need an adapter to plug a USB Cable  into the outlet. But now with the Elivebuy Power Center I am able to just plug my USB Cables directly into the power strip.The Power strip is quite small and it fits right under my bed when I need to charge my devices at night. The power strip has a nice matte finish to it and it feels really smooth. The length of the cable is perfect for my needs, I am able to plug it in the outlet in the wall under my bed and bring it all the way to the front of the bed with no problems at all.Comparing the power strip to my old on that I used this one splits the outlets in half instead of having them all in a row. With them being split it is easier to plug an adapter into the power strip without it bother any other adapter. On the end of the power strip there are USB Port so I can simply just plug my Micro USB Cable into the Power Strip and connect it to my phone and I am good to go. There are a total of 6 Outlets and 5 USB Ports. For the USB Ports. 3 of them give out 1 Amp of Power while the other 2 give out 2.4 Amps of Power for a faster Charging.When you are not using the power strip there is a switch on the top where you can use it to turn it off so none of the outlets or the USB Ports will work.Really Nice Power Strip over all because you are able to connect you USB Cable direct to the Port instead of having an adapter going into the outlet. I highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a Power Strip.

Just perfect for my needs! I am able to have NFC Tags on about everything and every where I need them.They are nice and easy to tag and works like a charm. I am able a NFC Tag in my bed room and all I need to tap it against my phone and it will change the settings on my phone to the way I set them for the night. When it is morning I can tap the same tag and it will turn all the settings on that I need for the day.Really Nice Pack to get if you are always changing your settings but want to make it easier.Though the NFC Tags are thin when they are not sticking to anything but once they are on something they will get damaged that easily.

This is a really nice Selfie Stick with a Bluetooth button on the handle of the Selfie stick so it makes it really easy to take selfies without having a timer or another person tapping the button for you.The selfie stick is made out of a steel material and weighs around 180 Grams so it is not too heavy. The Selfie stick extends quite a bit, it extends 97Cm which is equivalent to about 38 inches or 3 Feet 2 Inches. When I have my phone on the other end of the selfie stick and it is extended it does remain nice and sturdy. The Clap on the selfie stick is removable so if you want to use it on a Tri-Pod you can as well. The Bluetooth controller on the handle of the grip for the selfie stick can be charged using a Micro USB Cable. The Standby time for the Selfie Stick is 100 Hours!To store the Selfie stick and everything it comes with a nice soft bag to put everything it.This is a really great selfie stick to have because when you are trying to take a group photo you can just use a selfie stick instead of asking other to take the picture.

Amazingly Fast Solid State Drive! I've been using this for a while now and it works just as it is suppose to. Other reviewers say that it gets hot when it is running. I too have that problem. It just gets really hot. So instead of using this as my boot drive I just use it as a hard drive to store things, when I need something I will plug it in instead of leaving it plugged in all the time and letting it damaged the internals.Great but don't keep it in too long other wise it will damaged the internals of the Portable SSD.

This battery case is by far the best one that I have for my iPhone 6. It is durable and protects my iPhone 6 from getting damaged as well charge my phone at the same time.Going over the design of the case. It is made out of a Plastic material but has a piece of Aluminium on the back of the case to make it look stylish. Going around the battery case itself. Along the side of the case you will find hard pieces of plastic that will protect your phone from getting damaged when the phone drops to the ground. All the buttons are covered up. At first they do feel a bit hard to press but once you get use to it, it is rather easy to press. The Silent switch as well as the camera cut out are perfect. One the bottom of the case the headphone jack is there but it is quite deep so you will not be able to plug in your headphones. They have included an adapter that will fit and you will be able to use any headphones you wish.Installing the phone into the battery case is rather simply. All you need to do is un-clip the 2 locking pieces near the top of the case and remove the piece and slide you phone down into the case. Then attach the piece back to the top and lock it back into place. The locking mechanism on the case is a really nice to keep the phone secure into the case. When the case is installed it will protect your phone on the screen as well because it does have a lay on the table design so if you drop it on the screen it will be protected.This case for the iPhone 6 is really nice and works like a charm, It does add a little bit of bulk and weight to the phone but it does not bother me at all. On the bottom of the case you will find a Micro USB Port where you can charge the case and sync your phone with out removing the case. When I have this case on, it slides into my pocket quite nice, it has a matte finish to it so it feels great in the hand.The battery for this is a 3,500 mAh battery. With that amount of power I was able to get about 2 full charges. You can see how much power is left on the case by pressing the button on the back of the case. I noticed that when there is no phone in the case and you press the button the lights do not come on. In order to see the LED Lights you will need to press and hold the button for a few seconds. When you have your phone installed, you will need to press and hold the button to begin the charging. There are a total of 4 LED lights.1 LED Light - 0%-25% Charge2 LED Lights - 25%-50% Charge3 LED Lights - 50%-75% Charge4 LED Lights - 75%-100% ChargePackage Contents:*iPhone 6 Battery Case*Micro USB Cable*Headphone Extender*User ManualOverall, this is a great case that will charge your phone when you need to charge your phone. It is also a great case for protection as well. If you are looking to charge your phone with protection, this is the one to go with. While some people say it is hard to remove the case, I found it quite easy. If you have a screen protector on you iPhone and when you install the case the screen protector might cause it to have a tighter fit which means harder to remove.

This Card case is nice and sturdy and perfect for Cards, it was made for Cards Against Humanity, but I do not own that card game. But it does work with collectible cards as well such as Pokemon Cards or Magic the Gather Cards as well.The case is quite large and it is able to store up to 1500 cards. The case is nice and durable on the outside because it has a hard shell that will protect the cards. The Zipper on the case is really nice and easy to zip up with no problems at all.In the carrying case the dividers are removable so you can use the case to hold other things as well.The case is really durable overall, it will protect anything that is inside the case. Currently I am using the case for my old collection of Pokemon Cards as well as my Yu-Gi-Oh Cards.

All I have to say for this pair of headphone is Wow! These headphones are crazy good! They sound amazing and work like a charm. I have many pairs of headphones and when I heard the sound on these headphones I was Amazed on how amazing they sounded.Going over the design of the headphones. They are made out of a plastic material. The part on the headphones that extend to fit on your head has metal parts on it. The headphones are built really nice. They are nice and durable. I can bend them and they won't break. Going around the headphones them self. On both sides of the headphone there are controls for the headphones. Located on the right headphone you will find the Micro USB Port to charge the headphones. You will also find the Next/Previous buttons on the Right Side of the headphones. On the left side of the headphones you will find the power button as well as the Volume Up/Down buttons. The microphone is also located on the left side of the headphones. The Audio Port is also on the left side but it is positioned weird. Instead of it going straight down it is on the side of the headphone.The ear cushions on these headphones are really soft and comfortable. I could have these on all the time because they are so comfortable.It feels as if I had 2 pillows tied to my head. The head cushion feels the same as the ear cushion. These headphones are probably the most comfortable pair that I own.Sound Quality of the headphones is Simply the best that I heard so far. The headphones have a Deep Bass. The base on the headphones is just crazy amazing! I can use this pair of headphones all day! When I have the sound turned to the max on both the headphones as well as on my phone the sound is still nice and clear and it does not distort at all. Treble is nice and clear on these headphones as well.Battery life on the headphones is amazing. You can get 20 hours of music play back time, and when you are not using the headphones the standby time of the headphones is 250 hours.On each side of the headphones the design of the headphones is like a metallic finish. It is nice and smooth and feels really nice. I really like the looks of the design of the headphones.Package Contents:*M04 Headphones*Micro USB Cable*AUX Cable*User ManualOverall, if you are looking for a really nice and comfortable pair of headphones, I recommend this pair. If you are a person like me that enjoys music with a lot of bass, this is the pair for you. The bass on these headphones is amazing!

Perfect Peeler for anyone. The Size of the peeler is nice and fits in my hands perfectly. As I am a person with large hands, this peeler is perfect for me. It is made out of Stainless Steel and it is nice and solid. I've tested this on potatoes and other food and it is nice and sharp. I am able to peel the skin of a potato nice and thin, and not cut any of the good parts off.On a Potato there are some parts that are dark, so with this peeler I can use the side of it and dig them out and continue peeling the potatoes with no problems at all. When I use the peeler, the peeler leaves a wavy finish on the potatoes so when I peel them I can peel them nice and thin and make potato chips with no problems at all.Overall, this peeler is nice and solid and works like a charm. Anyone can use this peeler. It quite easy to use. It also nice and sharp so you will be able to get a nice peel each time.

With 10,000 mAh of power you will be able to charge your device up multiple amounts of times. With the Power Bank I was able to get about 3 full charges off my Nexus 6. As for an tablet, you will be able to get about a single full charge depending on the battery of the tablet.Going over the design of the power bank. It is made out of a plastic material and it has a nice feel to it. Going around the power bank itself. It is fully plastic. Around the power bank it has a normal plastic feel to it while on the top of the power bank where the USB ports are located, it has a glossy finish to it. The design of the power bank is curved just a little bit so it makes it a bit easier to plug the cable in. Along the left of the power bank you will find a Micro USB Port where you can charge the power bank itself. On the other side of the power bank you will find a power button, where you can press it to start charging your devices. One gives out only 1 Amp of Power while the other gives out 2.1 Amps. The Swiss Legend Neptune Force is probably a very capable watch.  Unfortunately, it's not just big but heavy, meaning that it's likely to stay in its case instead of on your wrist.  A star off for the weight and another for the wildly oversized band leave this at 3 stars.Oversized watches have become wildly fashionable, and the Neptune Force fits that category.  In this case, though, it's not just large but heavy, weighing in at over 11 ounces, or nearly 3/4 of a pound, when most competitors end up being about 2/3rds or less of that weight.  It's also far less elegant than the pictures imply, as the large bezel is backed up by an even larger rubber gasket.  In short, it's clunky, and not something you're likely to wear - at least for very long.The other problem here is that the wristband is far too large.  Even with an extremely large wrist you're going to need to remove links - this feels roughly like it's set for someone with 9" wrists - but the instruction manual doesn't provide instructions on how to do so for end users, and in fact threatens to void your warranty if you do.The one potential use of this is as a backup diving watch; the manual does indicate that it's certified for use except for dives at trimix depths (although since it's theoretically certified to 330m, that shouldn't be an issue).  Most dive watches, however, make sure to have stopwatches and glow in the dark bezels, so it wouldn't necessarily do that well.3 stars.  Bit too bulky for everyday use even with a replacement wristband, and not really what you'd want to use for diving.

L.E. Modesitt's "Solar Express" borrows a little bit from Rendezvous with Rama and a lot more from Modesitt's previous explorations of a post-ecological disaster Earth.  The combination works reasonably well, but it doesn't rise to the levels of his best science fiction as the underlying story takes too long to develop and the worldbuilding isn't as compelling as some of his other work.  3.5 stars rounded up to 4.While the prolific Modesitt is best known for his sweeping fantasy sagas, he also has written a substantial amount of science fiction.  It is generally set in a far distant future where the Earth has gone through a series of ecological disasters and wars, painfully come to a more sustainable society, and had survivors spread throughout the galaxy.  Much of it is informally linked with recurring aliens, governments, and cultures.  Solar Express is a little different and largely standalone.  Set only a century ahead, Earth has suffered the effects of global warming and a series of limited but devastating wars, but readers will recognize modern day political conflicts, culture, and science and technology.  The last shouldn't be surprising as this is the second entry in the Tor-NASA partnership of "NASA-Inspired Works of Fiction", meaning the science writing here was likely reviewed by Goddard Center staff as part of the project.Into this framework, Modesitt drops a Rama-like event: a probe heading towards the sun that ends up being humanity's first ever contact with aliens.  The entry point is an astronomer who first detects it, followed by a military pilot who ends up being assigned to investigate it.  In between, there are a number of crises involving the remaining superpowers on earth that spill over into space, dangers for the pilot investigating the probe, and a semi-repressed You've-Got-Mail-esque situation brewing between the pilot and the astronomer that's typical of Modesitt's teeth gnashing attempts at romance writing.In general, the plot tends to stutter a bit compared to his better scifi.  Part of this is that the story of the alien craft isn't at Rama-levels, or even Chindi ones. Overall, the stakes of finding the probe don't matter all that much; the world is a lot more focused on potential conflict between superpowers than in shock over proof that aliens exist.  The other issue is that Modesitt's usual strengths don't work as well as they normally do, probably because of the time frame.  The author is usually superb at building future societies, cultures, and militaries which are far more believable than most of his peers.  In this, though, the worldbuilding doesn't feel as solid, probably because modern-day structures still exist but also because some of the edges feel a bit frayed.  For instance, one subplot involving military monitoring of communication between the astronomer and pilot just doesn't feel particularly consistent.All this adds up to a fairly slow moving plot.  By the time Modesitt shows his cards and reveals a couple of true crises and their resolutions, most readers will not be reading for the conclusion to a compelling plot, but simply to finish the book.  This is far from Modesitt's worst effort and this isn't awful science fiction, but it's also not Modesitt's best.  Still worth a quick read, though, so 3.5 stars rounded up to 4.

Along with Lindt and Toblerone, Cailler is one of the three large export-oriented Swiss chocolate companies.  Their milk chocolate bar is thus about average Swiss chocolate - very good, certainly much better than the more sugary American equivalent, but nothing remarkable or exotic.Owned by Nestle since 1929, this is basically generic milk chocolate of the sort that you'd find if you walked into a European supermarket - except at about 2 times the price.  Even on Amazon with shipping built in, it's still a good 20% over the price of what you can order it for online over there.On the whole, you're probably better off going to Pier One or such and browsing their chocolate selection.  It's cheaper and removes the risk of bars melting in transit, which since this is shipped in a standard cardboard box is a possibility.

There's been a lot written about the DYMO 450 over the years, so just a couple of points.This includes the basic 450 Thermal printer that's capable of printing one roll at a time.  It does this quite well, but the process of changing rolls is so problematic that it's not recommended over the 450 Twin Turbo, which generally eliminates the need to do so.Second, the "free" part of the bundle is a bit misleading.  This includes about $50 worth of print rolls, so you're getting the printer for about $50.  You may be better off simply buying the Twin Turbo and spending the extra money for your first set of rolls if you plan on doing extensive printing.3 stars.  Not a bad deal, but not a great one either.

Robert Norrell's "Alex Haley: And the Books That Changed a Nation" provides a thorough accounting of the development and publishing of Malcolm X, Roots, and the Roots miniseries.  Unfortunately, it doesn’t provide nearly as deep a set of insights into the rest of Haley’s life, and Norrell’s choice not to pursue his own primary source research takes away from the overall richness of the book.  While it’s still worth reading, 3.5 stars rounded to 3 for the latter.Robert Norrell, a professor at Tennessee-Knoxville who has written extensively on race relations, the South, and Booker T. Washington, is the first established biographer to attempt to explain Haley.  It’s a more difficult challenge than most, partially because he’s competing directly with the several hours of sanitized autobiography Haley presented to audiences in Roots: the Next Generations.Unsurprisingly, Haley’s life was far more complex.  Norrell is on firmest ground when he describes the long process of how Haley produced The Autobiography of Malcolm X and Roots.  For the former, Haley established himself as a fairly proficient freelance writer, took on an incredibly difficult subject, and then spent far too much time writing the book while chasing many side projects thanks to financial difficulties generated from his divorce and the contract he signed for Malcolm X.  On the other hand, those difficulties led him to the lecture circuit, on which he not only survived for a number of years as a brilliant and lucrative speaker but also provided him with some of the insights and motivation to write Roots (and primed the market for its eventual release, having told the story of his history to a large audience for years before it came out.)Roots eventually produced almost as many problems for Haley as it did success; Haley was inclined to research – for which he was not trained, and in the process of which he was likely bamboozled – rather than write, eventually requiring a virtual co-author to finally finish the project.  Unfortunately, between his ever-firmer decision to market Roots as literal history rather than Herman Wouk-ish historical fiction along with accepting disastrous advice to settle questionable litigation (partially thanks to a vastly biased judge who probably would have had many of his rulings overturned on appeal), Haley’s reputation went to tatters following its release.  Norrell does a workman’s job in rehabilitating it; Haley made a lot of mistakes (“a likeable narcissist”), but they were generally not malicious and his overall contribution remains significant.Why 3 stars, then?  The biggest issue with the book is that it is mostly based off of a 6 year set of interviews with Haley that were intended for use in an authorized biography but never published due to the deaths of both the interviewer and subject.  An examination of the footnotes reveals that Norrell did very little primary source research of his own despite many of the principals still being alive.  Save for a handful of contacts surrounding the court cases, it does not appear that the author made any effort to reach out to those familiar with aspects of Haley's life; James Earl Jones, a close friend and one time tenant of Haley, would have been one prominent but obvious choice.This presents problems throughout the book, but where it becomes most noticeable is during the single short chapter on the quarter of Haley’s life that was spent in the Coast Guard.  Notwithstanding the publisher's carelessness on the blurb, “it was in the Navy that Haley discovered himself as a writer", there are a number of contextual misunderstandings.  Race relations in the Coast Guard during Haley’s era are generally regarded by military historians as better than the other services – the Coast Guard commissioned its first African American officers before the Navy, and further back had a legendary commander – and a little bit of research would have revealed that Haley’s mentor in the Coast Guard not only taught him journalistic writing but selected him as the first African American ever to be nominated to attend the Coast Guard academy.  Later, there’s a reference that in 1972 “(Haley found) a berth on a wooden ship Eagle…so that he might know the feeling of sailing…like Kunta Kinte.”  Even the tiniest bit of interviewing would have showed this as the steel hulled Coast Guard barque cutter Eagle, on which his former service granted a famous former chief a few weeks sojourn to write without distraction.  His picture from this time on board apparently remains in the wardroom, where he wrote several chapters of Roots.  While the former story might have been more difficult to track down, the latter almost certainly has a prominent paper trail, and both hint that the author leaned far too strongly on existing papers housed near his campus than doing even pedestrian original research of his own.All this leads to the feeling that there’s more to the story that could have been told had Norrell been more thorough, and that’s a shame as the people who could have enriched it will likely not be around if and when someone else tackles the topic.  3.5 stars rounded down to 3, but still worth a read.

The Woods 041456 surge protector is basically a cheap, generic 6 outlet power strip.  As such, it's priced appropriately.However, two things lead to three stars.  First, in general coaxial cable is something you don't want to attach to a surge protector, especially a cheap one.  It tends to cause all sorts of problems with digital signals with significant signal loss, most cable into a house is grounded, and in general unless you hook it up to a high end UPS with a line conditioner it's not going to do much good for protecting high end video equipment.Second, and more importantly, the attached picture shows the other problem with this.  The surge protector on the right is an older Belkin model which uses standard spacing between outlets.  On the left is the Woods 041456.  Like other Woods surge protectors, it uses much narrower than average spacing.  While you can actually plug two larger block units into the 6 outlets as the power switch is on the side, it's likely you won't be able to use all 6 with standard grounded plugs given the narrow spacing.3 stars.  Priced appropriately, but there are better units out there.

The Woods 041708 surge protector is a nice concept that gets slightly undermined by a few design flaws.  3 stars.The selling point on this unit is that you can use a master outlet that will turn off 4 other devices if the device attached to the master outlet is off.  It's a bit limited in practice.First, unless you have a reason to want all five devices to be turned on simultaneously, this isn't for you.  Second, for some bizarre reason the manufacturer decided to put the master control circuit on one of the six very narrow regular outlets.  (Basically, if you've got a device with a larger plug, you'll be losing one of the the 3 non-controlled outlets, and those are far slimmer than you'd ordinarily see.)  Furthermore, the warranty on this is a bit worrisome and the power switch is oddly on the side of the unit, rendering it vulnerable to feet and such despite being slightly recessed.The concept is far better executed by Belkin on one of their remote control 10 outlet adapters, where you can turn off 8 separate outlets and leave two others on at all times.  3 stars.

There's been a lot already written about the Trendnet TEW-805UB, so just two points.The upside is that the latest PC drivers (dated September 2015) seem to have fixed most compatibility issues.  The adapter installed relatively easily.  Granted, this does not solve any of the potential manufacturing issues that have been long noted, but in this batch at least the stick worked fine.  It's also worth noting that the utility download is supposed to include a user's guide and a few other items and it didn't.  (It did include a wireless monitoring program that shows RFID channels without attempting to take over your wireless connection like so many others do.)The downside is that the adapter is relatively meh in what it actually should be doing - increasing range and speed.  50 feet from router using an -ac connection showed 72 MB/s and three bars; that's weaker than all but one adapter I've tested, and it never got above 300 MB/s even when close up.As such, three stars.  It works ok if you just need a standard -n adapter, but there are better -ac adapters on the market for not much more.

As a biography, Harlow Unger’s “Henry Clay: America’s Greatest Statesman” doesn’t break much, if any, new ground on Clay.  However, where it proves unexpectedly superb is as a powerfully deep primer on pre-Civil War history and politics, with one of the clearest explanations of regional, partisan, and personal conflicts that ended up bringing the country to the brink.  3.5 stars for Clay and 5 for the primer place this at 4 stars.Unger’s writing on Clay is not particularly controversial; there is little revisionist grist.  Clay ended up being on the right side of history in most of his positions, and Unger doesn’t spend much time on the two most obvious areas in which he wasn’t, the War of 1812 and the strengthening of the Fugitive Slave Act.  Nor does Unger spend much time either praising or criticizing Clay; that is left to frequent quotes from Abraham Lincoln, who as a Clay supporter in his formative years waxes effusive.  Instead, Unger’s main focus is on integrating Clay and his positions into the political currents of the era, and in that he does a superb job.Unger presents Clay as a brilliant mediator, policy visionary, and proto-Beltway insider who often had the popular political instincts of a blind elephant charging into a china shop.  With this, Clay’s oft-quoted “I would rather be right than be President” takes on a different tone here, as many of his worst missteps were self-inflected.  From 1824, when his naive lack of comprehension of what becoming Secretary of State would do to both his reputation and to his relationship with Andrew Jackson, to 1839, when his failure to do any political groundwork prior to the Whig convention led to the eventual ascension of the utterly disastrous Tyler presidency, Clay’s political strategy often failed miserably.  While Unger doesn’t argue this and generally lauds his subject, there's enough here that a different writer might actually make a case that Clay’s ineptitude outside legislative chambers at times almost offset his contributions within them.As such, it’s hard to view this as a groundbreaking biography of Clay, since most of the material is neither new nor supports the title’s thesis.  Even with extensive coverage of the horrible tragedies to befall his children, Clay tends to fade into the page save for a few moments - the willingness to take on Aaron Burr as a pro bono client against Jefferson's crusade is one - and his repeated absences from Congress usually end with a sentence or two about the interregnum ending without any detail on what prompted him to accept a return.  However, this is more than offset by Unger’s integration of the entire political context of the pre-Civil War era by using Clay as the prism of it.  Clay’s fingers were on nearly every policy debate from the War of 1812 to the Compromise of 1850, and Unger’s simple and clear explanations of how history developed around this are very much worth reading even for those familiar with the time.  Anyone looking to understand how the United States evolved from the Revolutionary Era to the Civil War will benefit from this book.4 stars, and very much worth a read for anyone interested in the development of American democracy.Disclosure: This impartial review was made possible by the publisher providing a copy of the ARC of this book.

Bushnell's Rubicon Micro Lantern is a nifty niche product largely designed for camping.  However, its best use is likely reading maps or charts at night.  A few omissions leave this at 4 stars.There's been a lot already said about this, but to reiterate, this has about 2 hours of battery life at the highest intensity setting (close to a flashlight) and up to 18 hours at the lowest (roughly candlelight).  A USB rechargeable battery that's relatively low drain means a solar pack and this would get along pretty well.However, the most interesting aspect of this is the red mode, lasting 9 hours and using a separate set of 6 LEDs.  It's a very bright but authentic (not filtered) red, and should work fairly well for reading charts at night on a boat without losing night vision.A star off as the USB cable really should have a place to be stored under the unit, along with no ability to lock the unit out from being turned on.

Denon's AHGC20 Globe Cruiser headphones are essentially a jack of all trades piece of equipment; they are competent at most things you'd look for in a set of headphones, but nothing about them is spectacular.  With some curious decisions in sound balance, accessories, and a high end price tag, this warrants 3.5 stars, rounded up to 4 as overall, they're competent - just probably not worth what you're spending on them.Denon's entry into the high end active noise reduction category seems to have been designed by engineers with a checklist.  Good ANC without hiss?  Check.  Bluetooth functionality and fairly decent battery life (around 18 hours)?  Check.  Relatively lightweight and compact (10 oz for the headphones, 7 ounces for the case)?  Check.The result is a set of headphones that feels more like it's supposed to do a lot things fairly well than become best in class; in other words, it's kind of like most American cars in the 1990s, where they proved perfectly fine to drive - just not terribly exciting.  To begin, those with larger ears may find the ear coverings uncomfortable, as they're 4 cm by 6 cm.  While you can fit your ears between them and the speakers, after a few hours it tends to get a bit cramped.Frequency response is simply awful without ANC, with bass being so prevalent to outright distort any media to the point where it's not listenable.  With ANC, it's somewhat more balanced, but still very bass heavy.  This isn't uncommon on many noise reduced closed air units, but the AHGC20 takes this to new levels.  Compared to something like the Shure SRH1440, the difference is night and day.  It's not entirely a fair comparison given the open air/closed air headset, but it's extreme.As far as the ANC goes, it's very good.  Engine plane noise is down significantly, and you could theoretically wear these in any situation involving screaming children and come out somewhat sane at the end.  Unlike the first and second generation ANC sets, there is no hiss whatsoever.  However, that being said, in direct comparison to the Bose QC 25, the noise reduction on the latter is notably more significant.  For far superior sound quality with good passive noise reduction, the Etymotic Research ER4P-T's would be a better choice.Bluetooth functionality here is certainly useful, and a step ahead of the Beats Studio Wireless with several more functions and a much more robust integration with phone controls, including taking and speaking on calls.  However, in one of the more strange decisions made in this design, the included manual does not describe all Bluetooth functionality; you have to get to a website to learn such basic features as how to actually turn off both Bluetooth and the headphones.Finally, Denon makes a very strange decision to include only a 1 1/2' USB cable (most are 3') and a 4 1/2' wired cable (most are 7').All in all, these are decent enough headphones to haul around for everyday use, but if you're looking for a concert on a plane, try the Etymotics.  If you want true noise reduction, try the Boses.  4 stars.

About halfway through Joe Abercrombie's conclusion to the Shattered Sea trilogy, "Half a War," a chapter titled "Too Many Ministers" pops up.  It's neither a long nor an important one, but it inadvertently describes many of the problems Abercrombie has written himself into here.  Too many new main and supporting characters get introduced, previous ones who have been clearly defined and been the major focus are reduced to near cameos, and in general the narrative isn't compelling.  Some readers may be satisfied given Abercrombie's typical grit, but perhaps the most appropriate comparison is the controversial conclusion to Robert Jordan's Wheel of Time series, A Memory of Light.  3 stars.Abercrombie's first book of the series, Half a King, was one of the very best young hero journeys of recent years, with flawed characters making bad decisions and paying for them in a very brutal world.  The second, Half the World, took significant creative risks in bringing in an entirely new set of main characters but also ran into some problems, in part by following typical YA tropes and some questionable plot decisions.Half a War continues the same creative risks of Half the World as it introduces yet another set of new characters, but with only 400 pages left along with layering in characters from not one but two previous books, this turns out to be less risk and more mess.  Even if Abercrombie had done this perfectly, structural problems inherent in trying to introduce and grow a number of new characters while severely rationing stage time for others who have received hundreds of pages of development would make most writers and editors wary of this route.Abercrombie compounds this with his G.R.R. Martin-eqsue love of routinely killing off significant characters.  While this is usually a strong positive for his gritty and dark writing, here it backfires.  There's nothing at all wrong with killing off characters that readers have invested in, especially in a conclusion to a series, and Abercrombie does try to give some of the more significant ones a decent sendoff.  However, when their actions and deaths appear largely expedient to either swiftly wrap up inconvenient threads or create new, rushed ones for recently introduced characters, not just their deaths but their plot lines feel shortchanged.  There's an uncomfortable similarity to the conclusion of the Wheel of Time here; while the combination of frenetic mop ups and new characters don't quite reach the same bipolar pace that they do in A Memory of Light, it does have much the same feel.The final blow is that the main protagonist, Skara, sadly shares a lot more with Thorn than Yarvi.  She's incredibly talented for a teenager, she almost never makes a mistake, she's got few flaws, she's never in any real danger, and despite all her youth she's capable of outwitting almost everyone from the beginning of the novel.  She brings in allies, turns them to her cause, and in general runs over her problems rather than growing from her mistakes.  With Half a War largely consisting of battles, strategy, and their aftermath, her role is played largely from the sidelines - problematic for a main character.  Add in that the  largest movement in the plot comes from deus ex superweapons, and between the two, it's a bit frustrating.How does all of this add up to even a three star novel, then?  Two reasons.  First, the world and elf culture get revealed a bit more.  Second, Abercrombie is still good at moving the plot along with showing just a nasty world these folks live in, and that counts for something.  Still, it's a real shame that what was one of the most promising series in a while ends up with a whimper rather than a bang.  Three stars, and it's good that it's over.

Unlike most recent entries into the dystopian sweepstakes, Claire Vaye Watkins' debut novel, "Gold Fame Citrus", contains some of the more impressive prose of any genre in recent memory.  Unfortunately, Watkins appears far more intent on demonstrating her technical prowess than composing a readable novel, with characters, background, and plot lines seemingly far less important than attempting to overwhelm the reader with just how powerfully she can write a scene.  The result is a hot mess not dissimilar to that of the second season of True Detective.  5 stars for the prose and 1 star for the plot average this out at 3 stars.Watkins can write.  The author has has won all sorts of awards and plaudits for her short stories, and most relevantly for this novel, has a far better understanding of some of the underlying social factors of the West than most of today's authors.  Thus, a prolonged, cataclysmic drought that has destroyed California, good parts of the Southwest, and upended society should be a good starting point for her first novel.  On some levels it is: salt overwhelms the Central Valley, states refuse to help other states and refugees, government is impotent, a preacher appears in the desert, there's a dowser, and so forth.Watkins' inability to tie any of this together, though, proves a fatal flaw and starts from nearly the first page with the main character, Luz.  It's not just that her protagonist is not particularly sympathetic; it's that Watkins spends significant effort in establishing her as the incarnation of governmental impotence and futility (quite literally, the poster child of conservation gone wrong) and then never does anything with it for the rest of the book.  The poster child theme is just the first of a plethora of different ones which get duly started and then proceed to absolutely nowhere.  Watkins delights in creating background that never develops, and the effect is much like looking at a technically gorgeous tapestry, that, when viewed from a bit close up, has sloppy strands and loops sticking out all over the place.Luz and her boyfriend adopt a child, flee from LA, and don't really do very much while Watkins briefly brings various characters and scenarios in and out.  None of this matters much for where the book meanders, let alone concludes, and Watkins compounds her problems by throwing in all sorts of useless material - a government application for work, a fauna description, third person narratives - that just don't seem relevant while they're introduced.
